description: Srength in soybean prices continued yesterday in response to the record exports last week. The January contract jumped 173/4 cents a bushel to close at $5.763 3/4 a bushel on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Lawrence Kimpton, ExChancellor At Chicago University, Dies at 67
description: Lawrence A. Kimpton, who served as chancellor of the University of Chicago from 1951 to 1960 and was the chief administrator of the institution's metallurgical laboratory at the time it was engaged in the construction of the atomic bomb, died yesterday at his home in Melbourne, Fla. He was 67 years old.

title: City Plans New Strategy to Deal With Prostitutes  Under Age of 16
description: A new prosecution strategy for dealing with girls under the age of 16 who are picked up on prostitution charges in New York City was announced yesterday by the city's Corporation Counsel, W. Bernard Richland. Critics said, however, that the plan probably would fail.

title: I.L.A. Cancels Talks Set for Today
description: The International Longshoremen's Association called off a meeting that had been tentatively scheduled for today with North Atlantic shipping companies because a local issue had not been settled in the individual ports.

title: Eagle Clothes Files for Bankruptcy
description: Eagle Clothes Inc., whose cash balances were seized by three of its banks last week, yesterday filed for voluntary bankruptcy, claiming debts of $31.2 million and assets of $45 million.

title: Interference Booklet Offered
description: WASHINGTON (AP)  The Federal Communications Commission has prepared a booklet to help the average person figure out what is wrong when squiggles and snow appear on a television set and, at least in some cases, how to fix it. Entitled How to Identify and Resolve TV Interference, the booklet is available for $1.50 from the Consumer Informption Center, Dept. 051F, Pueblo, Colo., 81009.

title: Elementals Is Endless in C Sharp
description: PHILIP CORNER'S Elementals is the sort of music one checks into and out of, like a hotel. The first performance of the piece began at 8:30 Monday night and Mr. Corner plans to continue it around the clock through Saturday, with performers working in shifts. The musical materials are about as minimal as music gets; a C sharp unison is repeated in steady quarter notes.

title: BATEMAN PLANS CURB ON JOBS FOR AIDES
description: WEST ORANGE, Nov. 1State Senator Raymond H. Bateman said today that hewould restrict members of his administration from taking jobs with private companies that do business with the state for a reasonable time after they left office, and he criticized Governor Byrne for not making his intentions clear with respect to gambling casinos.

title: CARTER BACKS C.A.B. PACT ON SERVICE TO LONDON
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP)President Carter approved today a Civil Aeronautics Board decision designating New York and, on an interim basis, Boston, as the two United States cities with flight service to London by more than one airline.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES Horse Ilsted In order of Dost Positions

title: TOUGHER SOUTH AFRICA BAN SOUGHT IN U.N. BY BLACKS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 1African delegates sought today to toughen a Westernsponsored resolution, demanding a mandatory arms embargo against South Africa because of its repressive actions against blacks.

title: Putting Nutrition Into Hispanic Diets
description: In Puerto Rico, they snacked on papayas, acerola berries and guava. Now, mere often than not, it's Twinkies or doughnuts. Rice and beans is still staple, but meat, once reserved for holidays, has become a daily habit.

title: 2 Executives Acquitted Of a Conspiracy to Fix Prices of Consumer Bags
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 1 (UPI)  A Federal district judge acquitted two executives today of conspiring to fix the prices of consumer bags.

title: Bomb Threat Halts Byrne on Campaign
description: EAST HANOVER, Nov. 1 (AP) When Governor Byrne flew here today to make a campaign visit at the world headquarters of Nabisco, he found all 1,000 employees outside the building.

title: Events Today
description: Music

title: KLIENDIENST RECALLS AID IN TEAMSTER DEAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP)Former Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst said today that he had used his friendship with Frank E. Fitzsimmons. the teamaters union president, to help obtain a a $24 million insurance contract for one of his legal clients.

title: U.S. WARNING SOVIET 3 DISSIDENTS' TRIALS MAY HURT RELATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1  President Carter and Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance have urged the Soviet leaders not to go ahead with pending trials of dissidents, warning that such proceedings would inevitably stir up antiSoviet sentiment and imperil SovietAmerican relations.

title: Integration Question Is Ordered Off Ballot
description: ELIZABETH, N.J., Nov. 1 (AP)A Union County judge today ordered the removal from Roselle's generalelection ballot of a public referendum that asks residents if they approve of a statemandated desegregation order.

title: U.N. Panel Calls on All Nations to Fight Hijackings
description: UNITED NATIONS. N.Y., Nov. 1After days of debate, a General Assembly committee representing all 149 members of the United Nations today unanimously adopted a resolution condemning the hijacking of airliners and calling on ail countries to take steps to stop it.

title: GERMAN PARTIES FEUDING OVER ISSUE OF TERRORISM
description: BONN, Nov. 1  Charges by Franz Josef Strauss, the prominent conservative and former defense minister, that the federal authorities were inefficient in their efforts to track fugitive terrorists have caused new strains in West German politics, and in effect ended an eightweek truce between the Government and the conservative opposition.

title: Index of HelpWanted Advertising Off 2 Points to 120 in September
description: The HelpWanted Advertising Index, a sensitive barometer of employment trends, dropped 2 points in September to a seasonally adjusted index of 120 (1967100), from 122 in August, the Conference Board reported today, The September reading was up 26 points from the yearearlier level, however, the private research organization said.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Astor Fund Pledges $5 Million To the New York Public Library
description: The trustees of the Vincent Astor Foundation have voted to give $5 million as a twoforone challenge grant to spur the New York Public Library's capitalfund drive.

title: The Social Security Issue: How to Pay for the Escalating Costs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The Senate addresses itself tomorrow to the vexing question of how the country is to pay the steadily rising cost of Social Security benefits for the aged and disabled.

title: Market Place
description: It was true in 1974 and it is true again todayonly more so. There are myriad opportunities for small investors to invest in shares of companies that sell for less than book value and there is little competition for the shares as well.

title: NewarkLondon Flights Announced By TWA, Beginning Next April 30
description: NEWARK, Nov. 1Trans World Airlines announced today the first direct service to Europe from Newark International Aiiport, C. E. Meyer Jr., president of T.W.A., said at an airport news conference that the new service, one flight daily to London starting April 30, represented not only the airlines confidence in the future of Newark but also the fact that we expect it to be profitable for us.

title: Naked Mailer Novel Rises From the Dead
description: EMINENT AUTHORS are usually dead before scholars exhume artifacts and publish reproductions of typescripts, each change of art visible in scrawls and deletions.

title: Indian Leader Begins Jail Term
description: SIOUX FALLS, S.D., Nov. 1 (AP)Russell Means, the Indian leader, turned himself in tonight to be imprisoned for violating the terms of his bail by continuing his involvement in the American Indian Movement. He had been free on bail pend ing an appeal of a 1974 riot conviction.

title: Yonkers Racing
description: HRST$8,000, trot, Class B3, mile.

title: Tapestry Stolen From St. John the Divine
description: A valuable 17thcentury tapestry was stolen and two others were damaged between Monday night and yesterday morning in the Cathedral of St. John the Divine.

title: U.S. Entry Captures Jumping
description: The first horse show ever held in the United States was at the original Madison Square Garden on East 27th Street. By the felicitous continuity of history, the 1977 National Horse Show, still the premier event of its kind in this country, opened yesterday at the fourth and current Madison Square Garden.

title: Ghastly Ideas
description: This week, in songs, plays and stories, children learned about Halloween in school and on television. Most young children did not learn that was originated as a religious holiday by the ancient Celts to celebrate the beginning of autumn, long before it became the Hallow (holy) elen (evening) before All Saints Day.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Runway Fashions Are Already in the Streets of Paris
description: PARIS The big, floppy clothes that designers are showing here for spring are already turning up on fashion followers. The weather has been mild enough to make coats and wraps unnecessary so it is easy to spot the smocklike dresses, wide tunics and even the petticoats showing beneath the full skirts that are characteristic of the next season. Though the temperature climbs to the lower 60's, this has not, of course, affected the wearing of boots, which have a fashion existence quite independent of weather conditions.

title: Bridge:
description: There is one position in defense in which an inexperienced player is likely to cheat, quite inadvertently. Suppose your partner leads a king and dummy produces a long suit headed by the queen. Should you play highlow with a doubleton even if you judge that declarer is short in the suit?

title: Around the Nation
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., Nov. 1 (AP)The ?ennsylvania Senate voted today, 32 to 16, to allow Phil'delphia schools to borrow $50 million so that classes can con?inue. The House is expected to act on the proposal tomorrow.

title: Fair Plan Fire Insurance Rates Put Heavy Burden on Landlords
description: Rudy Dalessandro was working late in his office last Thursday night when the telephone rang. It was bad news. The caller told him that a building he owned, a fourfamily frame structure at 38 Pine Street in New Brighton, S.I., was on fire.

title: A Variety of Companies Issue Reports Disclosing Their Sales and Earnings Figures
description: For periods ended Sept. 30 unless otherwise indicated. (N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock exchange, (A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) OveritneLounler.

title: Music: StandIn Conductor
description: SINGERS SING AND instrumentalists play, but a conductor does something a good deal more mystical. Thus when one conductor steps in for another at short notice, taking over a program that the first conductor has chosen and prepared. it is next to impossible to ascertain who is responsible for the resulting performance's virtues and flaws.

title: People and Business
description: The increasing interdependence of the world's nations and the power and wealth of the United States magnify the effects of an American President's actions and public utterance far beyond America's shores, says Chauncey E. Schmidt, chairman of the Bank of California.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 2, 1977

title: Poll Finds Most Informed in U.S. Favor Strongest Support to Israel
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1Slightly more than half the Americans who follow Middle East developments endorse the Carter Administration's policy in that area, and a similar number feel that the United States should give its strongest support to Israel, even if it means risking an Arab oil boycott.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: Letters
description: Politics of Endowments

title: Judgment on Bhutto Pending
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, Nov. 1, Reuters)Pakistan's Supreme Court reserved judgment today on a petition challenging the right of the military regime to arrest former Prime Minister Zulfikar Ali Bhutto and 10 other leaders of his party. After a sixweek hearing, the court said it would issue a short order on the case next week, with a longer judgment to follow. Mr. Bhutto, toppled in a July military coup, was arrested under martial law Sept. 17 on a murder charge relating to an ambush on a political opponent.

title: Senate Votes $80 Million For Clinch River Reactor That President Opposes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP)The Senate joined the House today in voting to require President Carter to spend $80 million on a nuclear breeder reactor program that he wants to scrap.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: There are cat likers and cat lovers and cat nuts, and anyone of them (you?) would probably be delighted with a needlepoint kit that will end up with a very close likeness of his, her or your cat. There is a choice of four poses each of shorthaired, longhaired and Siamese cats, and the kit comes with handprinted 12gauge canvas, yarns, canvas markers and instructions on how to individualize the pattern of the cat. The kit, which ends up in a 14inch square, suitable for a pillow or picture, is $18.50 plus tax and $1.50 for postage and handling. Or one can get a free CATalogue by sending a selfaddressed stamped envelope. The address is Canterbury Designs, Box 302, Florham Park, N.J. 07932.

title: Article 2  No Title
Arthur C. Hardy, Optics Specialist
description: Arthur C. Hardy, inventor of the recording spectrophotometer, died Monday at his home of a heart attack. He was 81 years old and lived in Wellesley, Mass. Mr. Hardy, a physicist and specialist in the field of optics and photography, developed the spectrophotometer in 1927. It is used to measure and record the color of any substance rapidly and with precision, making it possible to transmit the numebr code of the color to distant locations and have the color itself reproduced exactly.

title: In  Memoriam
description: JACKSONEssle L. Nov 2, 1975. Betoyed wife, mother, and grandmother. We miss you.

title: Jackson Cleared in Court Case
description: Reggie Jackson was found not guilty yesterday of charges of harassing I4yearold Chris Howe of the Bronx in a parking lot at Yankee Stadium following the July 19 AllStar Game.

title: Papers Link Bank to K.C.I.A. Aide in Stock Disposal
description: WASIINGTON, Nov. 1The Diplomat National Bank, which is under Congressional investigation as part of a covert South Korean lobby, turned to a purchasing agent of the Korean Central Intelligence Agency in New York to dispose of bank stock after adverse publicity last rear, according to documents made available today by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

title: Open Interest
description: Tuesday, Nov. 1, 1977

title: SENATE PANEL VOTES HIGHER EMPLOYER TAX FOR SOCIAL SECURITY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The Senate Finance Committee approved and sent to the Senate floor today a bill that would for the first time require employers to pay heavier Social Security payroll taxes than are levied on employees.

title: Teachers Rally Backs Lakeland Strikers
description: CORTLANDT, N.Y., Nov. 1  Nearly 1,000 teachers and union officials from Long Island, Connecticut, New York City and Westchester County joined striking teachers in the Lakeland School District today in an evening rally marking the 36th day of the Lakeland strikethe longest teacher strike in the state's history.

title: Excerpts From Debate by Four Major Candidates in Race for Mayor of New York
description: Following are excerpts from a debate yesterday by the four major mayoral candidates at The New York Times. The questioners were reporters and editors of The Times.

title: Chrysler Recalls 1.2 Million Cars
description: DETROIT, Nov. 1 (AP)All Plymout Volares, Dedec Aspans. Chrysler ??ebarons and Dodge Diplomats built before Sept. 23, in all 1.2 million ?? are ?? recalled by the Chrysler Corporation to correct potential brake defects. The auto maker said yesterday that there has been no injuries or accident in 20 reported incidents in which cars lost their front brakes.

title: It Coup. Have Been a Disaster. But...
description: ONE OF THE MOST remarkable feats of its kind in recent year is the triple bill of art exhibitions that is on view through Nov. 27 at the New York State Museum in Albany. The State Museum is not as yet an art museum in the usual sense, but in no time at all it has put together three major exhibitions, every one of which would have done credit to a major city.

title: Advertising
description: Joe Stone is a mildmannered guy who lets his advertising do his tough talking. This is especially true when the advertising is for his Chevrolet dealer cliente.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: CBS Tennis Series Is Called Deceptive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1Top officials of CBS Sports sought to mislead the public as to the nature of the Heavyweight Championship of Tennis series, according to a staff report by the House communications subcommittee.

title: ACCORD HELD THE KEY TO QUITTING WESTWAY
description: Federal officials said yesterday that New York City's new Mayor and Governor Carey would have to present a specific plan before the Westway project could be abandoned in favor of mass transit for the city to trade in $1.1 billion in Federal highway funds for $750 million for subways.

title: House Bill Outlaws Bribes to Foreigners
description: WASHINGTON. Nov 1. (Reuters)The House of Representatives today passed a bill to outlaw bribes and other improper payments by United States companies and their foreign subsidiaries.

title: SATE DEPARTMENT ISSUES A WARNING ON OIL PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (UPI)With oilproducing nations scheduled to consider another price increase next month, the State Department warned today that any increase could upset world stability aijd have a strong negative effect on currencies.

title: Watergate Burglar Arrested on Charge of Coercion
description: Frank A. Sturgis, one of the five bur glare caught in the Watergate breakin, has been arrested by the New York City police on charges of threatening a woman to prevent her from testifying before the House Committee on Assassinations.

title: HARLEM POLICE TIED TO PAYOFF SCHEME
description: The police in Harlem's 28th Precinct regularly collected approximately $5,000 a month in payoffs from gamblers who sought to avoid prosecution, according to testimony presented yesterday at the start of the perjury trial of a former Deputy Inspector, Adam Butcher.

title: STARKEY IS REPLACED AS SON OF SAM JUDGE
description: Justice John R. Starkey of New York State Supreme Court withdrew yesterday as trial judge in the case of David R. Berkowitz, accused of being the Son of Sam killer.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: JUST IN CASE no one is looking, this happens to be All Souls Day, which seems to warrant even in a section called Livinga little attention to the funereal.

title: Blackout Hits Los Angeles Hospital
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 1 (AP)A power failure struck a portion of downtown Log Angeles today, leaving a hospital and several large industrial buildings without electricity for several hours. Lifesupport units at the 325bed California Hospital were operated manually and three opera tions continued under batterypowered lights.

title: U.S. Quits I.L.O. And Touches Off A Furor in U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 1President Carter withdrew the United States from the International Labor Organization today, touching off bitter criticism of the action here.

title: Last of the Soldiers on Horseback
description: When the 94th National Horse Show opened in Madison Square Garden yesterday, Gordon Wright was idling in the working press lounge cutting up old touches. Gordon Wright, 75, last of the cavalry officers to represent the United States in international competition, grew up riding bulls and saddle broncs, played polo with TwoGun Georgie Patton, helped organize the United States Equestrian Team, competed as a oneman team for the United States in the National of 1949, and gave basic instruction to such cele

title: Trail Blazers Beat Knicks
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Nov. 1 (AP)Bill Walton scored 4 points and Dave Twardzik 2 in the final minute tonight as the Portland Trail Blazers gained a 113104 National Basketball Association victory over the New York Knicks.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: I NOTED RECENTLY that there are some foods whose success at table depends to a great extent on how rapidly they are cooked. These are foods that must be seared quickly, over very high heat, and tossed and stirred simultaneously so they cook evenly all over.

title: Television
description: 7:30 P.M. That's Hollywood (7)

title: More Than A Mayor
description: With New York City's mayoralty election only a week away, the most persistent question isn't the most obvious one: Who is going to win? The answer to that seems to be a foregone conclusion. The more frequent, and more cynical, question is, Does it make any difference anyway who is Mayor of this town?

title: Personal Health
description: THE 17YEAR history of oral contraceptives has been marred by an intermittent stream of unsettling reports describing newly discovered health hazards assciciated with the pill. For the 10 million American women taking the pill, and for their families and friends, these reports have created mounting concern about the safety and wisdom of using these synthetic hormones to prevent pregnancy.

title: Suffolk Legislature Adds $2.3 Million to Budget, Much of It for the Police
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., Nov. 1The Suffolk County Legislature voted unanimously today to add $2.3 million to the budget that had been submitted to it by the County Executive, John V. N. Klein, bringing the total to $660 million.

title: Upstate Farmers Tell of Crops and Hopes Washed Out by Rain
description: FLINT, N.Y.The rains came on Sept. 13 and for the next six weeks the sun was a stranger in central and western New York State. By some measurements, the rain reached 18 inches in that period, about four times normal.

title: Suffolk Prosecutor's Race Holds Key.. to Republican Fate in County
description: For the once powerful Suffolk County Republican Party, this year's race for District Attorney is providing a crucial test of. strength. The party has seen its fortunes wane in recent years, and Republicans believe that if they do not oust the incumbent Democrat, Henry F. O'Brien, this time, rising Democratic power may keep the office out of Republican hands for many year $ to come.

title: Multiple Death Fires Killed 1,261
description: BOSTON, Nov. 1 (UPI)The National Fire Protection Association reports that 1,261 people died last year in 293 multipledeath fires. The association defines a multipledeath fire as one where three or more persons were killed. It also reported 719 largeloss fires in 1976, causing more than $631 million in property damage. Such a fire is one in which there is more than $250,000 in property damage.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Private Lives
description: THEY ARE COMING from all over, by cab and helicopter And rubber duck, for the opera and for professional meetings and for Thanksgiving and for the hell of it. This is the season; New York is Oz. We need, in the hallway or on the roof, one of those carrousels for luggage. We also need an espresso bar and a liquor license. One of the many advantages of living in New York, as of living in Paris, is that your friends will find you. You are on their map.

description: AT GARDEN

title: Soviet SST Takes Off in Moscow  And You Almost Hear It in Queens
description: DOMODEDOVO, U.S.S.R., Nov. 1With an earshattering roar that could almost have been heard in Queens, the Soviet TU144 supersonic airliner flew its first passengers 2,025 miles from Moscow to AlmaAta in exactly two hours.

title: Giants Bemoan Critical Call on Fumble
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 1John Mendenhall tried to hide in his lockerroom cubicle, Jack Gregory cried and other Giants bellowed about the officiating last night after having been reminded that they were not ready to be considered National Footall League playoff contenders.

title: Notes on People
description: THE first annual $10,000 Jan Mitchell Prize for the author of an outstanding book on art history was presented yesterday to Francis J. H. Haskell of Oxford University. An art historian who is a fellow of Trinity College, Professor Haskell wrote Rediscoveries in Art, an examination of changes in tastes, fashion and collecting in England and France. Mr. Mitchell, the former owner of Luchow's and the Langchamps restaurants, said at the presentation at the Museum of Modern Art that he created the Mitchell Prize to acknowledge original contributions to the study and understanding of the visual arts.

title: MOVES BY FED SPUR BURNSCARTER FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The Federal Reserve System's further tightening of interest rates, an unexpected move that sent the stock market tumbling today, has also heightened the conflict between Arthur F. Burns, the Federal Reserve's chairman, and President Carter.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: The Standings

title: CONFEREES IN ACCORD ON FUEL RESTRICTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (UPI)A House Senate conference committee on energy legislation agreed today on noncontroversial parts of a bill restricting use of oil and natural gas in new electric power plants, but it postponed a decision on how to deal with poormileage cars.

title: Putting on the Ritz at the Ritz
description: PARIS

title: Chess:
description: There are many positional battles that would degenerate into peaceful draws were it not for an extraordinary second effort on the part of one or both Mayers.

description: LONDONTongsun Park, the central figure in the sweeping investigation of South Korea's alleged influence buying in Washington, gave $190,000 to Otto Passuran, one of the most powerful members of the House of Representatives until his defeat for a 16th term last year, according to sources here who are close to Mr. Park.

title: TaxCredit Bill to Bus Industry For $200 Million Meets Defeat
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1When Senator Russell Long's $40 billion tax credit program swept through the Senate yesterday it was not without casualties.

title: SNAG IN ARMS TALKS: MISSILE MODRNIZING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The question of whether the Soviet Union would be allowed to improve significantly its new landbased ballistic missiles under the proposed SovietAmerican strategicarms accord has emerged as a key stumbling block in negotiations in Geneva, Administration officials said today.

title: 6 SCHOOL CUSTODIANS INDICTED ON PAYROLL
description: Six school custodians and a custodial aide were indicted yesterday on charges of cheating New York City of almost $29,000 through a scheme of illegal kickbacks for no show jobs.

title: Guatemala, Heedful of the U.S., Seems Intent on Honest Election
description: GUATEMALA, Oct. 26Having come to power through a widely publicized electoral fraud three years ago, President Kjell Laugerud Garcia of Guatemala is apparently eager that the general elections here in March should be honest.

title: Strikes Caused Fewer Lost Days Of Work, Labor Department Say:
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP)Strikes caused fewer lost work days in the first nine months of this year than they did in the comparable period of 1976, the Labor Department said.

title: Vintage Gathering Spot For Home Winemakers
description: PATERSON, N.J.

title: 1,603 Interviewed On Phone in Survey
description: The latest New York TimesCBS News survey is based on telephone interviews conducted from Oct. 23 to Oct. 26 with 1,603 adult men and women around the United States.

title: 2 More Suspect Ringers Held
description: Two more South Ativerican horses suspected of being ringers were put under guard at Belmont Park yesterday as investigators searched for new clues in their inquiry into alleged racetrack fraud.

title: Asturias Hails Son of Juan Carlos As Its Prince and the Future King
description: COVADONGA, Spain, Nov. 1Felipe Juan Pablo Alfonso de Borb6n y SonderburgGluckberg, the blond 9yearold son of King Juan Carlos and Queen Sofia, was warmly welcomed today to this ancient shrine as Prince of Asturias, heir to the Spanish throne.

title: Chinese Scientists Seek to Regain AgeOld Eminence in Astronomy
description: After a hiatus of many centuries. China appears determined to regain a place in the forefront of celestial observation.

title: WILLIAM PROKOS
description: William Prokos, a painter and illustrator, died Monday of cancer at Martha's Vineyard (Mass.) Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived on the island.

title: Suspect in HostageRobbery Case Is Arrested by Allendale Police
description: ALLENDALE, N. J., Nov. 1A 39yearold bulldozer operator was arrested tonight and charged with breaking into two suburban homes here last Friday and holding five robbery victims hostage briefly at gunpoint.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: RUNNING ON TIME What is sure to be one of the genuine Christmas treats for the family in midtown has just quietly opened at the Kodak Photo Gellery. The exhibition, The Fun and Fascination of Trains, on view through Jan. 7, is the latest visual treat at this modern, admissionfree showcase at the corner of the Avenue of the Americas and 43d Street.

title: Runaway, 13, Tells of Rape by Pimp
description: It was, the police said, a typical story of what happens to many teenaged runaway girls in New York City. A story of rape and enforced prost'tution.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: In a book review of Daniel Schorr's Clearing the Air in The Times on Oct. 24, it was incorrectly suggested that The Village Voice paid money to the Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press in exchange for the Pilo Committee report on the Central Intelligence Agency. Although Mr. Schorr had recommended such a transaction, it did not take place.

title: Actors Chapel Dedicated as Club for Aged
description: The altar where Fred Allen and Portland Hoffa were married is gone, along with the alter was a gift from George M. Cohan. Two confessional booths have been combined to form a bloodpressure testing center; another confessional is phone booth, and the organ loft is library and reading room. The marblecolumned Actors Chapel, in the basement of St. Malachy's Roman Catholic Churchthe church made famous by the movie Going My Way"is now center for the neighborhood's elderly, many of then retired show people living alone and afraid in S.R.O. (single room occupancy) hotels. The church is on West 49th Street, in the heart of the theater distric.

title: U.S. SEEKS TO CUT AMOUNT OF UNNECESSARY SURGERY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP)Federal health officials announced today a program to encourage the American public to get second medical opinions before elective surgery to reduce what they described as an increasing amount of unnecessary surgery.

title: RICHARD J. BLITZ
description: Richard J. Blitz, president of K&B Industries of New York, international dealers in precious and semiprecious stones, died Sunday while on vacation in Mexico. He was 42 years old and lived in East Rockaway, L.I.

title: Raising Dividends at Record
description: The Standard & Poor's Corporation said today that more companies increased dividends last month than in any October since it began keeping monthly tallies of corporate dividend actions in 1955. S.&P. said that 237 companies had increased dividends last month compared with 214the previous highin October 1976.

title: Theater: Horizons Are High and Low
description: LAST SUMMER the Williamstown Theater Festival presented a special season of new American plays. Three of those plays have been brought to New York by Robert Moss's Playwrights Horizons, where they are running in repertory through Saturday. Next week they will transfer to Playwrights Horizons Queens Festival Theater.

title: Accord on Abortion Collapses Again
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1A HouseSenate conference on the financing of abortions by Medicaid, which made some tentative progress yesterday after a fourmonth deadlock, collapsed again today in a brief, acrimonious session.

title: Quebec Premier Makes Pilgrimage to de Gaulle Tomb
description: COLOMBEY  LES  DEUX  EGLISES, Nov. 1Premier Ren Lvesque of Quebec, who is seeking sympathy in France and elsewhere in Europe for his fight to make the Frenchspeaking Canadian province an independent nation, paid grateful visit today to the tomb of Charles de Gaulle, who 10 years ago gave Quebec worldwide publicity.

title: 2 L. I. Doctors Reported Indicted; Salesman Allegedly Aided Surgery
description: Two Suffolk County surgeons and the hospital in which they practice have reportedly been indicted on charges stemming from the alleged use of a medical supply salesman to help perform a major bone surgery.

title: U.S WARNING SOVIET 3 DISSIDENTS' TRIALS MAY HURT RELATIONS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1  President Carter and Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance have urged the Soviet leaders not to go ahead with pending trials of dissidents, warning that such proceedings would inevitably stir up antiSoviet sentiment and imperil SovietAmerican relations.

title: Deaths
description: ALTMANEdith. Hillcrest Chapter of Hadassah and its 5 Groups mourn with deep sorrow the great loss of our beloved Chapter President. Her devotion and commitment to Hadassah and Israel will always be remembered. Our heartfelt sympathy to the entire family.

title: Meadowlands Results
description: FIRST  ??

title: Eating Through Dijon's Fair
description: DIION, France, Nov. 1For once, it seemed, I would be in the right place at the right time: France in November when the Burgundian city of Dijon holds its famed annual Foire Gastronomique. Visiting this fair was an idea I had cherished since reading about it years ago in an early work by M. F. K. Fisher, if memory serves correctly, where it was described as a simple and joyous debauch.

title: UpdatingThe Drink Date
description: When I entered the New York media world, some 20 years ago, the drink date was a sacrosanct institution that involved real drinking. In publishing, advertising, television, journalism and public relations, the price of success was more often than not a rosy glow to the cheeks and nose, a pronounced trembling of the hands around 5 o'clock and an occasional visit to some expensive place in Connecticut to dry out for those whose minds and livers fell casualty to the twomartini lunch and the threemartini happy hour.

title: CITY'S ILLS STRESSED IN MAYORAL DEBATE
description: In a debate that repeatedly underscored New York City's serious problems, the four major mayoral candidates yesterday favored maintenance of the 50cent transit fare, but all declined to pledge its continuation.

title: Books of The Times
description: IS IT REALLY SO AWFUL. to be fat? It isn't great. As Anne Scott Beller reminds us in her lucid and comprehensive Fa & Thin: A Natural History of Obesity, it's unhealthy, unfashionable, and sometimes even uncomfortable to be overweight. The obese are likely to die sooner, get hired later, and be poorer, according to actuarial statistics and surveys of the rich and successful. Moreover, it's not only unfortunate to be fat, it's also downright naughty, or so the moralists among us have led people to believe with their not altogether unreasonable assumption that people get fat simply because they eat too much. still there was a time in human history when it was fashionable to be fat. I am resolved to grow fat, and look young till 40, said John Dryden's Maiden Queen, reflecting the 17century wisdom that being young entails a certain degree of fleshiness.

title: 2d Nuclear Test in Nevada in Week
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov. 1 (UPI)The second nuclear test in a week was exploded today in southern Nevada. The test, codenamed Hybla Gold, was exploded at 1:06 P.M., Eastern standard time, 1,300 feet beneath Rainier Mesa 100 miles north of Las Vegas. Dave Jackson, a Government spokesman, said the purpose of the test was to see what effect the radiation would have on a groap of components placed in a tunnel next to the blast.

title: Suspect Is Arrested In Jersey Robberies As Police Act on Tip
description: ALLEXDALE, N. J., Nov. 1A 39yearold bulldozer operator was arrested tonight and charged with breaking into two suburban homes here last Friday end holding five robbery victims hostage bricfly at gunpoint.

title: Books: The Zola Muni Didn't Play
description: FOR MANY AMERICANS, Emile Zela is perceived, I suspect, as Paul, Muni portrays him on the screen: an aging French writer who virtually singlehandedly obtains justice for Capt. Alfred Dreyfus against overwhelming odds. Although a longer biographical view of the novelist's life does not diminish his role in the Dreyfuss affair, it does open the way to explore the man and the creative literary artist in fuller perspective than the dramatic conventions of film permit.

title: China Is Lowering Imports and Expanding Exports
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 1Despite widespread speculation that China's developmentminded new leaders intend to start on a major program of buying Western technology, the nation's foreign trade this year is running lower than in 1976 and Peking has yet to place any sizable orders abroad.

title: SENATE PANEL VOTES HIGHER EMPLOYER TAX FOR SOCIAL SECURITY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The Senate Finance Committee approved and sent to the Senate floor today a bill that would for the first time require employers to pay heavier Social Security payroll taxes than are levied on employees.

title: President Rejected Diplomats Advice On I.L.O. Decision
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1  President Carter rejected the advice of his European allies and foreignpolicy advisers in withdrawing the United States from the International Labor Organization, an agency associated with the United Nations that monitors labor conditions worldwide.

title: 2 L.I. Doctors Reported Indicted; Salesman Allegedly Aided Surgery
description: Two Suffolk County surgeons and the hospital in which they practice have reportedly been indicted on charges stemming from the alleged use of a medical supply salesman to help perform a major bone surgery.

title: Morton M. Rosenfeld, Developer Of Real Estate in New York City, 60
description: Morton M. Rosenfeld, a widely known real estate developer and investor and president of the R. & H. Management Company, 488 Madison Avenue, died Sunday night in his sleep in his home at 315 East 68th Street. He was 60 years old.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: California Slaying Case Involves ExMafia Figures and Krishnas
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., Nov. 1The police In this pleasant coastal community are trying to unravel a mystery involving murder, kidnapping, narcotics, a Hare Krishna religious cult, former Mafia members from New York and New Jersey and huge amounts of money from mysterious sources.

description: LONDONTongsun Park, the central figure in the sweeping investigation of South Korea's alleged influence buying in Washington, gave $190,000 to Otto Passman, one of the most powerful members of the House of Representatives until his defeat for a 16th term last year, according to sources here who are close to Mr. Park.

title: Cabaret: Israeli Goes Nashville
description: FOR SEVERAL YEARS, Ron Eliran has been a consistent favorite at El Avram, the Greenwich Village nightclub and restaurant, where he is known for his Israeli songs. With Nightsong, which opened at the Village Gate last night, Mr. Eliran is trying to break out of that somewhat limited image, and to show himself as a composer and singer of a more varied repertory.

title: Soy Sauce Made in England? Great Scot!
description: LONDON (Reuters)A Scottish scientist has found a way of ferfenting soy sauce, a favorite flavoring in the Orient, in onetwelfth the time of the traditional process.

title: When Curiosity Can Save The Cat
description: CATS HAVE a remarkable sense of balance and never fall. Right? Wrong. A piece of string is a perfect plaything for a cat. Right? Wrong again.

title: Hearings Open on Chowchilla Kidnappers Sentencing
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 1  The three young men who have admitted kidnapping 26 young children and their summer school bus driver in July 1976 from the rural town of Chowchilla returned to court here today for key hearings that will determine their sentences.

title: U.S IS FIRST TO OFFER DEMANDS AT GENEVA TO SPUR TRADE TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The United States sought today to generate fresh momentum in the Geneva negotiations on liberalization of trade as the first country to present its formal list of demands for tariff reductions and other concessions to the other 96 participating countries.

title: Stolen Pipes of Organ May Produce Illicit Air
description: MIAMI, Nov. 1 (UPI)Officials at the University of Miami think that student is stealing pipes from the organ at the Episcopal chapel to use as marijvanasmoking bongs.

title: Congress Chiefs Hold Fate of Energy Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1With the passage by the Senate yesterday of the last of five energy bills, the rough outlines of the legislation that might ultimately emerge from Congress have begun to take shape, and it is quite possible that President

title: Israeli Unions Continue Strikes Over Price Increases
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 1Organized labor shut down Haifa Harbor today and paralyzed the stateowned railways for four hours in a third day of strikes to protest price increases resulting from the Government's economic changes.

title: A.C.L.U. to Press Political Fight On Searching LongHair Drivers
description: Following a setback Monday in the United States Supreme Court, the American Civil Liberties Union said yesterday that it had no immediate plans to pursue in state courts its lawsuit charging the New Jersey state police with making illegal drug searches of cars driven by young longhaired men.

title: Decision on Colombian Bags
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP)  The Treasury Department said today that it had made a preliminary decision that handbag imports from Colombia are being subsidized by the Colombian Government and are subject to a special tariff. A final decision is due April 22. The Treasury is required to impose an additional duty equal to the amount of a subsidy on imported merchandise, if its finding is upheld.

title: DR. JOHN V. TURNER
description: Dr. John V. Turner, former professor of philosophy at St. John's University, died yesterday of cancer at Memorial Hospital in Port Jefferson, L.I. He was 78 years old and live dat 283 Artist Lake Drive. Middle Island, L.I.

title: Careers
description: Job seekers, especially those with college degrees or some professional training, often overlook opportunities in governmentFederal, state and local. For years a belief has prevailed that government pay levels are low. The truth is just the opposite, accordina to some recent statistics.

title: O.J. Faces Surgery, Will Be Out for Year
description: That's a subject I can't deal with right now, O.J. Simpson said yesterday regarding his future in pro football. The 30yearold allpro running back for the Buffalo Bills learned that surgery would be required on his left knee and that he would be out for the remainder of the season.

title: NE YORK CITY INLINE FOR NEW RELIEF AID
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1Joseph A. Califano Jr., Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, agreed today to a threeyear, $1.35 billion plan of extra Federal welfare assistance to state and local governments, including as much as $190 million more for New York State.

title: BELL STRONGLY BACKS HELMS PLEA BARGAIN
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 1  Attorney General Griffin B. Bell strongly defended today the plea bargain that his department negotiated with Richard Helms, the former Director of Central Intelligence, saying that it put the intelligence community on notice that it was subject to the rule of law.

title: Vance Denies Doubts About Carter's Trip
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance denied today a report in The New York Times that he regarded President Carter's scheduled trip to nine countries as a waste of time in terms of foreign policy substance.

description: BASKETBALL

title: MOVES BY FED SPUR BURNCARTER FIGHT
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1The Federal Reserve System's further tightening of interest rates, an unexpected move that sent the stock market tumbling today, has also heightened the conflict between Arthur F. Burns, the Federal Reserve's chairman, and President Carter.

title: The Delusion Of Liberty
description: WASHINGTONThe use of fake pseudoscience fer purpose of political persecution in the Soviet Union is amply confirmed in an analysis of a book by two Soviet academicians, The analysis was prepared by Prof. Stevan Dedijer of Sweden's Lund University.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: Smith International, which recently acquired 641,000 shares of Vetco Inc., an 8.3 percent interest, has notified the Securities and Exchange Commission that it is no longer considering the possibility of seeking control of Vetco and should be considered as holding the Vetco shares for investment. The move followed an announcement last Friday by Combustion Engineering Inc. that it planned to make a cash tender offer for any and all common stock of Vetco at $23 a share that it did not already own. Combustion Engineering, a maker of steam generating equipment, presently holds 8.3 percent of Vetco's common shares. Smith International told the S.E.C. that it sold about 81,000 shares of Vetco on Oct. 31 and expected to dispose of its remaining 560,000  share investment through open market or private sales or by tender. Smith International and Vetco make drilling equipment.

title: 8 Democratic Assemblymen Back Wagner In Manhattan Borough Presidency Race
description: Eight of Manhattan's 13 Democratic Assemblymen yesterday endorsed Robert F. Wagner Jr., the LiberalRepublican candidate for Borough President, against their colleague, Assemblyman Andrew J. Stein the Democratic nominee.

title: Over 60,000 Claims Were Filed in 1976 For Product Injury
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (AP)More than 60,000 businesses and consumers filed lawsuits and other claims last year alleging they suffered injuries from products, a Federal task force reported today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Lawyers and staff workers of New York City's Community Action for Legal Services struck yesterday, demanding higher wages, better working conditions and the scuttling of a proposed bookkeeping system that they said would interfere with their clients privacy.

title: Article 1  No Title
Best Buys
description: THIS seems to tie one of those weeks when the recipe for food shopping begins with the in struction: First, buy a calculator.

title: FED ACTS TO LIMIT INTEREST RATE RISE
description: The Federal Reserve yesterday acted to limit the upward trend in interest rates that it touched off Monday, with fixedincome prices rebounding.

title: Islanders Rout Flames by 90; 4 for Trottier
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 1The Atlanta Flames outweigh the Islanders, they're taller on the average than the Islanders, and they're even younger than the Islanders.

title: New Bond Issues
description: UTILITY BONDS

title: Stores Say Generic Labeling Cuts Customers' Grocery Bills
description: CHICAGO

title: Value of New Construction Up 1.6%
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 1 (UPI)  New construction during September was estimated at a seasonally adjusted, annual rate of $173.7 billion. A rise of 1.6 percent from the revised August level, the Commerce Department said today. During the first nine months of 1977, new construction was valued at $124 billion, up 15 percent from $107.8 billion in that yearago level. the department said.

title: Money
description: NEW YORK (AP)  Money rates for Tuesday.

title: Lyn Revson Writes About StyleHer Own
description: One day last week, a woman who might be Alice in Wonderland's older sister was in her splendid kitchen making cookies. She was wearing a $7 pair of jeans, worn sneakers, and enough $115anounce Bal a Versasailles perfume to sink a bank.

title: Star and Agent Form FilmProduction Unit
description: Don Murray, currently starring on Broadway in Same Time, Next Year, and Saul Richman, a longtime press agent, have formed their own company, Donrich Productions, to produce films. Mr. Murray will write and direct their first project, Exit for a Dame, adapted from a suspense novel by Richard Ellington.

title: San Francisco Feels 3 Temblors
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 1 (UPI)Three small temblors were felt by residents but caused no damage last night in the San Francisco Bay area. Two tiny offshore quakes, measuring 2.9 and 2.1 on the Richter scale at the University of California seismographic station, occurred within seven minutes of each other and could be felt in downtown San Francisco.

title: Princeton Once Again Cast in Spoiler's Role
description: Two weeks ago, Princeton stunned Harvard, 207, in Cambridge and knocked the Crimson out of sole possession of first place in the Ivy League. On Saturday, the Tigers will have an opportunity to knock Yale out of its firstplace tie with DartIvy mouth and clinch the Big Three football championship.

title: The U.N. Today
Pentagon Aides Say Moscow Has Mobile Missiles Able to Reach U.S
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The Soviet Union, in a potentially disturbing strategic advance, is producing mobile missiles capable of reaching the United States, according to Pentagon sources.

title: COVICTION IS UPHELD IN MlSS HEARST CASE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 2Patricia Hearst's conviction for robbing a bank in company with a group of terrorists who had kidnapped her was upheld here today by a threejudge panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.

title: Charge of Surgery by Outsider Surprises Medical Authorities
description: While it is not unusual for salesmen of medical equipment to be present during surgery and perhaps give advice to the surgeon. spokesmen for the nation's leading medical organizations said yesterday that until the Smithtown General Hospital case, they had never heard of salesmen actually participating directly in operations.

title: Stage: Craig Russell Rolls His Eyes
description: CRAIG RUSSELL, the female impersonator, comes on stage looking like a bar of pink soap left too long in the bath water. He wears a blond wig and a peachcolored dress with ruffles. His lips are painted so thickly that they resemble two frankfurters overdosed with sodium nitrite. He makes vague, swimming gestures, rolls his eyes and sings indistinctly, as if through rising steam.

title: American League's Vote On Red Sox Sale Put Off
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7 (AP)An American League vote on the proposed sale of the Boston Red Sox was postponed indefinitely today because of a pending court suit by an Ohiobased conglomerate that wants to buy the baseball team.

title: Carlton Is Cy Young Award Winner for 2d Time
description: Somewhere in the untracked wilds of British Columbia in western Canada yesterday, a 32yearold hunter was climbing a mountain or drawing a bead on a moose when the vote was announced 3.000 miles away: He was the best pitcher in the National League in the summer of 1977.

title: Thinking Big: The Oversized Accessory Page C6
Hers
description: ONE OF THE glaring blanks that the women's movement has never filled in the battle cries for equality between mates, parity in malefemale salary scales and the option to exchange crib for career is what to do with children. There is talk and pressure for childcare centers where surrogate parents could nurture a crowd, and there is no doubt that the sensitivity of most fathers has been raised to more than a helpinghand degree, but when all is rhetoricked and done, there still isn't anyone to take care of the children.

title: Around the Nation
description: Frank A. Sturgis was freed from Jail yesterday, ending 24 hours of custody, after a State Supreme Court justice in New York, reduced his bail to $10,000. He was being held on charges that he threatened a woman to keep her from testifying before the House Committee on Assassinations.

title: Dollar Makes Modest Recovery Despite 12Month Low in Italy
description: The dollar made a modest recovery in foreign exchange trading against most foreign currencies yesterday, but fell to a 12month low against the Italian lira and was mixed against the French franc, The Associated Press reported.

title: CANDIDATE SPENDING NEARING $3.5 MILLION
description: TRENTON, Nov. 2The cost of the gubernatorial elections this year may run as high as $3.5 million, party officials said, despite a campaign spending limit of $1.5 million imposed on each candidate by the state's election law.

title: Spanish Plan to Buy U.S. Bank Approved
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP)The Federal Reserve Board agreed today to let a bank owned by the Spanish Government become a bank holding company by acquiring the Century National Bank and Trust Company of New York.

title: DAISY S. MOSIMAN
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 2 (AP)Daisy S. Mosiman, a founder of the American Cancer Society and a national leader of the sodety for many years, has died at the age of 91.

title: FED ADDS RESERVES TO BANKING SYSTEM
description: The Federal Reserve twice yesterday pumped some temporary reserves into the banking system, indicating that, for the moment at least, it does not want shortterm rates to move higher.

title: Senate Votes Fund To Keep Rail Lines Operating in State
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2The ??te voted today to provide $60 million more in Federal assistance to assure continuation of Conrail commuter rail services through 1980. including $19.6 million for New Jersey lines.

title: Judge Gives the Press A Berkowitz Transcript Of Talks With Doctors
description: A transcript of taperecorded conversations between two psychiatrists and David R. Berkowitz, accused of being the 44 killer, has been made available by Brooklyn Justice John R. Starkey of State Supreme Court in Brooklyn for copying by the press, au aide to District Attorney Eugene Gold of Brooklyn said last night.

title: Bridge:
description: The discovey of a suit fit normally justifies optimism in the bidding, and the discovery of a double suit fit justifies an optimism mthat might seem to border on rashness. A striking example of the power of the double fit is the deal shown in the diagram. It was played recently at the Cavendish Club in New York, and Herb Lavine, as South, showed good judgment in the bidding and considerable skill in the play.

title: Lakers' Edwards Excels In 107102 Defeat of Nets
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Nov. 2There is no doubt that the Los Angeles Lakers miss Kareem AbdulJabbar, but Jerry West is quite happy to have James Edwards, a rookie, to fill in for the former University of California, Los Angeles standout.

title: Futures Prices Rise In Wheat, Soybean And Corn Trading;
description: Commodity traders rushed to buy wheat, corn and soybean futures yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade after Soviet President Leonid I. Brezhnev, in a speech in Moscow, estimated that the 1977 Soviet grain crop would total only 194 million metric tons.

title: Backgammon:
description: ATHENS  From ancient times until the present, backgammon has been a national pastime in Greece. Indeed, the game as we know it today was handed down to the Greeks from the Egyptians and reached Western Europe through the Mediterranean. Three thousand years ago, patrician Greeks amused themselves playing backgammon. Plato, Sophodes and Homer referred to it in their writings. Like contemporary players, the ancient ??reeks reacted emotionaily to favorable and unfavorable rolls of the dice: sixes were known as Aphrodite, ones were known as dog.

title: Barwick Pleads Guilty to Charge Of Lying to S.E.C. Investigators
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2 (AP)Eugene T. Barwick, former hoard chairman of E. T. Barwick Industries Inc. of Atlanta, pleaded guilty today to a onecount charge of making a false statement to the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Justice Department said.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Historic Designs

title: ByrneBateman Contest Is Suddenly a ReaiRace
description: It's neck and neck in New Jersey. With five days to go, Brendan T. Byrne, the Democrat they called OneTerm Byrne not so very long ago, has pulled dead even in the polls with Senator Raymond H. Bateman, the Republican Mister Nice Guy from the State Legislature who, just as recently, seemed a shooin to be the Garden State's next chief executive.

title: Scientists Discover a Form of Life That Predates Higher Organisms
description: URBANA, Ill., Nov. 2  Scientists studying the evolution of primitive organisms reported today the existence of a separate form of life that is hard to find in nature. They described it as a third kingdom of living material, composed of ancestral cells that abhor oxygen, digest carbon dioxide and produce methane.

title: Torren:$2 MillionIs Price
description: Mike Torrez, who last month played three games on which the Yankees championship rested, has begun playing another game on which his future wealth rests. The games are not totally unrelated.

title: A (Muffled) Voice for Consumers
description: The bill to create a consumer protection agency is dead for this session of Congress, but the idea lives. Thanks to an intensive lobbying effort by the business community, the House leadership did not bring the issue to vote. Consumer advocates, however, intend to press their case in the next session, and we wish them well.

title: Customs Law Firm Halts Ad Campaign
description: A rather ambitious advertising campaign by Serko & Simon, law firm specializing in customs and trade law, has been halted because it appears to conflict with the State Bar Association's advertising guidelines expected to go into effect Saturday.

title: Vance Welcomes Offer by Soviet As Major Step
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that Leonid I. Brezhnev's proposal for a moratorium on all underground nuclear detonations  for peaceful uses as well as weapons testsmarked a major step forward toward a comprehensive test ban, but that differences persisted on the duration of such an accord.

title: LEONARD HOBBS DIES; JETENGINE PIONEER
description: Leonard S. Hobbs, who headed the development of the engines that powered this country's first jet airliners and the first B52 intercontinental bombers, died Tuesday of a cerebral hemorrhage at Hartford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 80 years old.

title: Medicaid's Rates For Reimbursement Expected to Rise 8%
description: A nearly 8 percent increase in daily hospital and nursing home Medicaid reimbursement rateswhich were frozen in the last two state budgetsis scheduled to be promulgated today by the Carey administration.

title: Business Records

title: Lakeland Referendum Set on School Dispute
description: CORTLANDT, Nov. 2  The eightmember Lakeland School Board, apparently unwilling to reject categorically Governor Carey's proposal that the issues that setoff a 37day strike by Lakeland teachers, go to binding arbitration decided to submit the question to district voters in a referendum Friday. The referendum would be an advisory message to the hoard and not binding.

title: DR. DAVID P. BARR, 88, A LEADING PHYSICIAN
description: Dr. David Preswick Barr, professor emeritus of medicine at Cornell University Medical College and former physicianinchief at the New York Hospital, died yesterday in his home at 179 East 70th Street. He was 88 years old.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Anita Bryant, in New York City to promote her new book, The Anita Bryant Storybased on her experience as an activist against homosexual rightssaid yesterday that militant homosexuals had repeatedly threatened her life, forced her family to turn their Miami Beach home into a virtual fortress and made it all but impossible for her to obtain television appearances.

description: Saul Jaffe, a prominent lawyer in the entertainment industry and early entrepreneur in television programming, died Tuesday in Mount Sinai Hospital. His age was 63.

title: Mr. Helms and the Law
description: BOSTON, Nov. 2The bargain between the Justice Department and Richard Helms aroused understandable uneasiness when it was disclosed. Here again, it seemed a lawbreaker of rank was getting away with a tap on the wrist: A plea of no contest to a misdemeanor, with a suspended sentence recommended and his pension assured, all in a quick proceeding with no notice to public or press.

title: U.N. Development Program Given Pledges of $455 Million in Aid
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 2 (AP)Led by the United States, 105 nations today pledged S455 million to the United Nations Development Program in its annual fundraising conference.

title: Events Today
description: Theater

title: New Police Task Force to Fight Rising Harlem Narcotics Crimes
description: A task force of some 60 police officers and detectives has been set up to combat the rising number of murders and other violent crimes in a section of Harlem that has become a battleground for rival gangs seeking to dominate the narcotics market.

title: Variety of Companies Issue Reports on Their Sales and Earnings'
GARDENING
description: ONE OF the many childhood memories I recall with pleasure is leaves. Huge piles of them. Dry and crunchy by the curb, just waiting for my swift kick to launch them skyward into a phantasmagoric comet's tail. Piles large enough to burrow into, there to remain hidden until some unsuspecting neighbor passed by, preferably one carrying the day's groceries. The idea was to erupt just then in a sudden crackling shower to chase a nonexistent ball down the street.

title: ROWLAND F. KIRKS, 62, WAS HEAD OF U.S. COURTS OFFICE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2Rowland F. Kirks, director of the Administrative Office of the United States Courts, died this morning in Walter Reed Hospital. He was 62 years old and had been ill for a long time.

title: Notes on People
description: THE award of a $7,500 National Endowment for the Acts grant to a convicted murderer has two cultural organizations in Maine mildly up in arms. The grant went to James E. Lewishohn, a former English professor who is serving a life sentence for the 1974 slaying of his wife. Mr. Lewisohn is a poet of some repute, but members of the Maine Bureau of Arts and Humanities are unhappy about his grant, said Alden C. Wilson, the bureau's executive director, who added: We have no control over the grant. Also upset are some members of the state Commission on the Arts and Humanities, it was reported in Augusta. Although the commission is allied with and funded in part by the National Endowment of the Arts, it was not consulted on Mr. Lewisohn's grant. The only other endowment grant in Maine went to Louis Coxe, a Bowdoin College professor and poet and playwright.

title: Met's Godunov: New Voices
description: THE performance of Boris Godenov at the Mctropo itan Opera on Tuesday night had two new faces. John Cheek, a bass From Wilmington, N. C., who had made his debut earlier this season as the Physician in Debussy's Pellas et Mlisande, took on the much larger assigumen: of Piman in the Mussorgsky work.

title: Alice Faye and Lassie To Return to Films
description: Alice Faye, musical star of the 1930's and 40's, will return to the screen in a singing role for the first time since 1962 in Lassie, My Lassie. Miss Faye, who last sang in State Fair, will appear in the film with James Stewart, Mickey Rooney, Stephanie Zimbalist, Pernell Roberts and the collie Lassie.

description: European jumpers often have to concede a bit to Americans in speed but a German horse named Sarto beat the Yankees on their own turf last night, and with something to spare.

title: Levesque, Visiting Paris, Pleads for a Free Quebec
description: PARIS, Nov. 2Premier Ren Lvesque of Quebec, at the start of a threeday official visit to France, wasted no time', today in affirming his province's desire to be independent.

title: Personal Beauty
description: MOST OF the time, Mark Traynor works behind the scenes, making pretty models look even prettier for photography. He teaches courses for professional makeup artists. And he also does realies"the magazine word for real people, as opposed to professional models. The expression amuses him.

title: Cuomo Backed by State A. F.L.C.I.O. Leader for Favoring Westway
description: Mario M. Cuomo's stand in favor of the controversial Westway project earned him the endorsement yesterday of Raymond R. Corbett, the titular leader of organized labor in New York State.

title: Farm Report
description: ST. PAULThe year we moved to the farm, the neighbors knew us only as the ones what rented the old Haggstrom place. And it is. an old placeat least by contemporary standards. The floor boards, scarred and warped, roll together in bulgy symmetry, and the ancient varnish, beaded on the oaken doors and window trim, has long ago formed itself into something of an alligator pattern. Many of the door jambs have settled out of plumb, creating sizable wedges of black space when the doors swing shut, their ornamental brass door knobs carrying yet the wear of hands turned them.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 2The most active of the 14 independent and minorparty candidates for Governor, Dr. John F. Donato, today conceded defeat, a week before the election.

title: SENATE GETS REVISION IN U.S. CRIMiNAL CODE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2A liberalconservative coalition in the Senate Judiciary Committee approved today the first comprehensive revision of the Federal criminal code in the nation's history, voting to allow parole only in exceptional circumstances.

title: Investigators Fly to Uruguay For Clues to Racing Mystery
description: A fiveman task force, armed with photographs and paternitytesting gear, flew to Uruguay last night in an attempt to unravel the bizarre horse racing affair that may come to be known as the Case of the Dead Ringer.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2A dispute has arisen over the disclosure of classified information dealing with negotiations for a new treaty limiting Soviet and American strategic weapons.

title: News Summary
description: Suspension of nuclear explosions came one step closer when the Soviet Union dropped its insistence that any agreed halt exclude relatively lowyield blasts for peaceful puposes. The shift came in a spoech by President Brezhnev before a joint session of the Communist Party's Central Committee, the Supreme Soviet and the Russian Republic's Supreme Soviet. The Kremlin meeting marked the 60th anniversary of the Bolshevik Revolution next Monday. [Page A1. Column 6.]

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 2A transCanada pipeline to carry Alaskan natural gas to the continental United States received final Congressional approval today.

description: Oil imports can be held to as little s 9.6 million barrels a day in 1985, acdording to a study to he released today ??y the Petroleum Industry Research onundation, an oil economical consulting arm based in New York.

title: Dr. Salo Rosenbaum, 57, Professor At Cornell and a Psychoanalyst
description: Dr. Salo Rosenbaum, a psychoanalyst, died yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital of a heart attack. He was 57 years old and lived at 50 East 72d Street in Manhattan.

title: Rise in Arab Crime Is Laid to Oil Wealth Influences
description: CAIRO, Nov. 2 (AP)Social changes caused by new wealth from oil and influences from Western movies and television, accompanied by an erosion of tribal custom and traditions, have brought an upsurge of crime in the Arab wend, according to specialists.

title: Home Beat
description: IP YOUR company is having a corporate identity crisis, Moatstand, the office furniture manufacturer (150 East 58th Street) has just introduced customorder monogrammed upholstery fabric that could do for your company's initial what Gucci did for the letter G.

title: Sound
description: IF TWO HEADS are supposedly better than one, three should be better still. And they areat least when its comes to tape recorders. While less expensive home recorders usually have two headsone to erase old recordings from the tape and one that serves alternately for recording and for playbackprofessional recorders nearly always have individual heads for each of these three functions. And lately, even a few home cassette decks have them.

title: The Artist's Studio: Its Ambiance Has Changed
description: ONE OF THE CASUALTIES of social evolution is the artist's studio as it existed at the turn of our century. It had an international currency, that studio. Whether in New York or London, Paris or St. Petersburg, it looked much the same. There were stepladders and potted palms, red velvet and a model's throne. tall windows that faced north and a very big stove to keep the model warm.

title: Dave Anderson
description: LAS VEGAS, Nov. 2Even now his name is murmured in a whisper, or punctuated with a raised eyebrow. Actually his nickname is enough, Blinky. In boxing there is only one BlinkyFrancis (Blinky) Palermo, now 69 years old, once the numbers racketeer cynically canonized as St. Francis of Palermo about 25 years ago when he was doing business for Philadelphia fighters (Ike Williams, Johnny Saxton and Blackjack Billy Fox, to name three) and invoking the Fifth Amendment before Congressional committees investigating

title: Calender of Events For the Horne
description: Christie, Manson & Woods International Inc., 502 Park Avenue.

title: TV: Tour of Rome With I, Claudius
description: THIS SUNDAY AT 9, Masterpiece Theater, public television's acclimed showcase for British imports, begins a 13episode series that once again set new standards for superb quality in popular entertainment. I, Claudius is a fiendishly sophisticated concoction of Roman history, political intrigues, murderous ambitions and consuming passions. In this BBC/London Film Productions venture, they hadd up to fascinating spectacle and perhaps, with fitting perversity, great fun.

title: Bandleader Guy Lombardo Listed In Critical Condition at Hospital
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 2 (Reuters)Guy Lombardo was reported in critical condition tonight at Methodist Hospital here where he was being treated for complications that developed after heart surgery in September.

description: Baseball's second annual open market on talent will be conducted tomorrow in the ballroom of the Plaza Hotel, with the 2G teams in the two major leagues bidding for the right to pursue 89 free agents.
