title: Thais Report 2 Dead, 8 Injured In Repulsing Cambodian Attack
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 5(AP)About 50 Cambodian soldiers firing small arms and rockets attacked a Thai military base on the ThaiCambodian border, killing two soldiers and wounding eight, border police headquarters reported today.

title: U.S.C. Routs Stanford In Pacific8 Test, 490
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 5 (AP)Southern California shot down Stanford's berial circus and surged over the Cardinals as Rob Hertel threw for two touchdowns and Charles White ran for pair in a 490 victory today.

title: Gottfried 3Set Victor
description: PARIS, Nov.5 (AP)Brian Gott???ed and Corrado Barazzutti reached the final of the $50,000 Grand Prix tennis tournament today. The Italian won in their last meeting at Forest Hills. Mark Cox of Britain, 64, 76, 61, and Barazzutti downed a mistakeprone Jeff Borowiak of Berkeley, Calif, 64, 76, 61.

title: Wilhelmina Bolling To Be Wed May 13
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Hart Bolling Jr. of Greenville, Del., have announced the engagement of their daughter Wilhelmina Ross Bolling, to Timothy Bell Moyer. Mr. Moyer is a son of Mrs. Milton S. Dillon Jr. of Bernardsville, N. J., and the late David Baxter Moyer.

title: Rutgers: Kinetics, Not Gym
description: NEW BRUNSWICK WHEN Dawn Cantor enrolled in the Department of Physical Education at Rutgers University two years ago, she was enthusiastic about teaching people the mechanics of motion but unexcited about the prospect of teaching gym in a primary or secondary school.

title: IN AMERICA
description: BURBANK, Calif. If you want to traipse through the American psyche, you should start in a TV studio near here. Burbank manipulates the mental energies of the land the way Houston manipulates its fossil fuels. So let's talk about the deregulation of the collective unconscious. It didn't start in the current TV season; it didn't even start on TV. Obviously, there was transsexualism and rape in the world before there was transsexualism and rape in a sitcom. But

title: Penn State Needs Rally To Win, 2147
description: RALEIGH., N.C., Nov. 5Penn State, which has just about packed its bags for a major bowl trip again this season, almost had to make new plans for the New Year today until Chuck Fusing saved the day.The Penn State quarter back, who has improver so rapidly this season, tossed an 11yard touchdown pass to Scott Fitzkee with 58 seconds remaining to give the Nittany Licins a 2117 victory over North Carolina State.

title: A Trinidadian Playwright Looks At His Roots
description: In 1961, the year before Trinidad achieved its independence, Mustapha Matura left his home in Port of Spain and shipped off to England. He was leaving the New World much as some of his ancestors had come to it, in steerage. His mother's people had arrived in the West Indies from Africa as slaves, his Hindu father's grandparents were indentured servants from India. Though Mr. Matura himself was free of chains or masters, he chafed under the Dutch sailors contempt. And thus another black militant was born.

title: Food
description: 1 pound calves liver, sliced (see note)

title: Hungarians Told About Crown
description: BUDAPEST, Nov. 5 (AP)The official Hungarian news agency MTI reported briefly today that the. United States planned to return the Crown of St. Ste phen and other crown jewels to Hungary The Budapest Government has not corn mented on the Carter Administration's decision to return the 1,000yearold crown, Hungary's national symbol. It wag conveyed to the United States at the end of World War II for safekeeping as Soviet troops advanced through Hungary.

title: Connecticut/This Week
description: AVONExhibition of Central Asian Ikhats (unique dyeprocess silk tapestries) through Nov. 27. Farmington Valley Arts Center, Avon Park North. 6781867.

title: S. S. Corda Is Fiance Of Carole Brundage
description: Mr. and Mrs. William A. Brundage of Wellesley, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Carole Lynn Brundage, to Stephen S. Corda, a senior at the University of Massachusetts in Amherst.

title: THE ECONOMIC SCENE
description: WASHINGTONGovernment economists, like everyone else, have shaded their expectations for the American economy's performance for next year after looking at the numbers for the most recent quarter, which one high Administration official conceded did not particularly please him.

title: Rivalry Among Atlantic and Gulf Ports Slows Efforts to End Dock Strike
description: The rivalry among Atlantic and Gulf Ports and their determination to protect their cost advantages have been major hurdles in efforts to settle the coastwide dock strike, which enters its 37th day today.

title: A Glass of Friendship
description: ANYONE growing up in New York City knew the intrinsic value of the neighborhood saloon. It had a social and a sociological importance that now is remembered with much nostalgia. There neighborhood folk (usually men) gathered sporadically to catch up on the personal news of individuals and families.

title: Huff Hits 1,000Yard Mark As Hofstra Beats Wagner
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 5Kevin Huff Huff became the first runner in Hofstra's history to crack the 1,000yard barrier running as he led the Dutchmen to a 277 victory over Wagner College today.

title: Louisville: Underlying Issue Remains Race
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky.Voters in Louisville and Jefferson County, Kentucky;, the largest municipality and county in the state respectively, will be called upon to resolve some unfinished business when they go to the polls Nov. 8.

title: The Best of Streisand Is in Her Records
description: Streisand Superman ranks among the finest of Barbra Streisand's 30plus LP's, counting TV and movie spinoffs, that have come out in the past 14 years. As such it presents an opportunity to consider her whole career as a recording artist. Miss Streisand's voice is in amazing shape todaystronger, more controlled and more confident than ever. The range of material she handles comfortably now includes the entire pop spectrum, short of country, most rhythm and blues and hard rock.

title: The World
description: Le Grand Charles could not have staged a reception more grand or symbolic. When Premier Rene Levesque of Quebec arrived in Paris last week, he was greeted at Orly Airport by Prime Minister Raymond Barre. He was invested as a Grand Officer of the Legion of Honor by President Valry Giscard d'Estaing. On a visit to the French Parliament he was ??????? up Napoleon's Stairway, unused since the reign of King Louis XVII.

title: Police Officer Ryan Is Convicted Of Killing a Suspect in Custody
description: A police officer was convicted yesterday of criminally negligent homicide in the beating death of a suspect in a South Bronx station house, the first conviction on record in a slaying by an onduty New York City police officer.

title: Plainfield Wins, Giving Rahway 20 Total Yards
description: Plainfield, which features one of the strongest defenses in New Jersey, posted it sixth shutout in seven victories yesterday in an SO triumph over Rahway.

title: Motor Sports Calendar
description: TodayLong Island Sports Car Association touring school and time trials at Bridgehampton (Li.) Race Circuit. Registration: 10 A.M.; drivers meeting and class session at noon: ontrack practice 1 P.M.; timed solo runs 2:30. Helmets, metaltometal seat belts and longsleeved clothing required.

title: Choate Spoils Lawrenceville'sVisit, 2822
description: If there's one game Lawrenceville really likes to win, it's against Choate. Yesterday the Larries went to Wallingford, Conn., to do just that and instead had a long ride back to New Jersey with the fresh memory of a 2822 defeat.

title: Turning Back the Asphalt Tide
description: HARTFORD

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: There is a certain offbeat charm in Philippe Dumas's story of Edward, a donkey with a hankering to be human. Donning a derby hat, frock coat and trousers, Edward disguises himself and tends tables at a small cafe. But his life incognito is singularly unhappy until he meets a member of his own species whom he marries and with whom he shares a blissful life of donkey domesticity. Dumas's art workdelicate pen sketches alternate with sundrenched watercolors are lovely with a distinct Gallic flavor; however, this sort of adult whimsy is an acquired taste and one that is not likely to please the palate of everyone n the audience.

title: Does M1 Deserve All That Attention?
description: The weekly reports from the Federal Reserve Board on the nation's basic money supplyM1, as it is knownhave generally not stirred great interest beyond the business and financial community. But in recent months, M1 has begun earning headlines as a central factor in the mounting disagreement between President Carter and Arthur F,, Burns, chairman of the Fed.

title: Just How Far Is Too Far For Women Runners Now
description: Is a running race 240 yards less than two miles really too strenuous for women?

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME, Nov. 5(Reuters)Roman Catholicism would cease to be the official religion in Italy under proposals for a new treaty governing relations between the Vatican and the Government that were published today.

title: Jersey City Hotel Is Up for Auction
description: JERSEY CITY

title: Trumbull Gains Berth in Playoff
description: Trumbull clinched a berth in the Fairfield County championship game and Stamford Catholic moved one game closer to that goal as both remained undefeated yesterday.

title: Carla Louise Roth Is Bride of John Moreton
description: In St. Peter's Episcopal Church weston, mass, yesterday afternoon. Carla Louise Roth. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Herbert Roth Jr. of Sherborn. Mass.. become the bride of John Philip Moreton of Dover, Mass. The bridegroom is the on of Dr. John R. Moreton of Weston and Singer Island, Flaand the late Mrs. Moreton.

title: Susan K. Krell Wed To Robert P. Wax
description: Temple Beth Israel in West Hartford, Conn., was the setting yesterday evening for the marriage of Susan K. Krell. daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Stanley Krell of Forest Hills, Queens, to Robert P. Wax, son of Mr. and Mrs. Bernard M. Wax of Norwood and Centerville, Mass. Rabbi Harold Silver performed the ceremony.

title: 2d Term for Governors Stirs Scant Carolina Interest
description: DURHAM, N. C., Nov. 5Tuesday's statewide referendum on gubernatorial succession, which politicians on both sides of the issue feel involves one of the most important structural changes in the North Carolina government since the turn of the century, is arousing little voter interest.

title: Questions /Answers
description: The best control of powdery mildew on phlox, lilac, zinnia, melons, squash, etc. is prevention. If the spray is on the foliage before the mildew spores, there is less chance of infection from the fungus disease. A good time of year would be late July as mildew is usually at its height in August. Clean up around phlox now, cut stems to the ground but leave the roots to winter over. Next year, spray earlier in the season.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: people talk a great deal about the dance explosion which has occurred during the last decade or so in this country and abroad. In the United States, for example, it has been said that for every person who bought a ticket for a professional dance event across the country in 1965, 16 bought one in 1975. There is every reason to believe that this number has even increased during the past couple of years. European countries are seeing something or the same upward curve, alti1011gn perhaps not to the same extent as in this country. This new demand for dance does, of course, mean that existing dance companies are, by and large, better attended than in the past. But it also means that there is a greater need for new companiesusually for companies, both here and abroad, in communities where dance troupes did not previously exist.

title: Passionate Composer
description: NOWADAYS it would be difficult if not downright boring to study an artist's life by way of documents. Instead of voluminous and revelatory letters, we would have only a sheaf of telephone bills, detailing time and charge. Instead of intimate evidence of how the artist handled friendships and loves, business dealings and struggles with the muses, we would have a few guarded notes to and from lawyers, agents and investment counselors. The Artist's life, that is to say, may be no different now than it was in Verdi's day, but the records of living have become thin and dry. Instead of belleslettres we have Ma Bell.

title: Member of Revolutionary Group Arrested by the F.B.I. in Seattle
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 5 (UPI)Rita Darlene Brown, an alleged member of the revolutionary George Jackson Brigade, was arrested yesterdy in a parking lot in the city's North End, agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation reported.

title: ARCHITECTURE VIEW
description: Forty Second Street is still the street of dreams. Considering its current squalor, that's hard to believe. But there are people as nostalgic about its glamorous past as they are concerned with its current condition, for whom this street is the city's heart, even in its state of accelerated decay.

title: Where the Ins and the Visitors Eat in the Nation's Capital
description: Compassion impels me to share with the footweary sightseer my inside advice on the best places to eat in the area around Washington's Mall. Between the White House and Capitol Hill are not only the thickly touristed Smithsonian museums but also an alphabet soup of Government agencies, commissions and departments, the I.C.C., the F.A.A., H.E.W., H.U.D., I.R.S.

title: Catherine W. Montgomery, a Bank Aide, Is Married to Alexius Charles Conroy
description: Catherine Walsh Montgomery, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. John D. Montgomery of Cid Brookville, L. I., was married yesterday to Alexius Charles Conroy, son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Ambrose P. Conroy of Oakland Park, Ill. The Rev. Daniel Sexton performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Saviour in New York.

title: A $30 Million Urban Renewal Project Is Rising in Roslyn, L.I., With 208 ModerateIncome Housing Units
description: Special to The New York Times

title: TV Networks Now Know Congress Is Watching
description: For two days, Representative Edward J. Markey listened to network television sports executives explain under oath how they could not recall conversatons or meetings, how they read only cover pages of important memos and contracts and how they disregarded warnings from staff members. It boggled his mind, Markey said, Another member of Congress, Louis Frey Jr., termed it an infectious virus.

title: Thomas B. Fleeter And Joanne Stern Plan May Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Paul R. Stern of Westbury, L. I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Joanne Susan Stern, to Thomas B. Fleeter, son of Mr. and Mrs. Gerald M. Fleeter of University Heights, Ohio.

title: The Amateur Among Professionals
description: THE disconcerting fact is that George Plimpton looks like an athlete. Tall and spare, he is scarcely the bumbler that he'd have you think he is in his books. He is a powerful figure of a man, and if he moves with less than fluid grace, it is easy to imagine the stiffness truly earned, just last Saturday, battering his opponent to the dust. But then one recalls that bumblers rarely put on masks of humor so wonderfully selfdeprecating as his. This interview took place in the back seat of a rented car which carried us from LaGuardia Airport to Greenwich, Conn., where Plimpton was engaged to speak to a ladies' group, and from Greenwich to Kennedy Airport, whence Plimpton would return to Florida to set off an 800pound firework in an attempt to break a Guinness World Record, This day being not untypical of many Plimpton days, I asked him how he managed to get any writing done.

title: For the Schools, Bilingualism Si!
description: THERE were never any official surveys or highpriced analyses by consultants, but for a long time school officials and teachers were all too aware of a disturbing trend among a large number of students in the state. Children with Portuguese or French or Greek, but particularly Spanish, surnames were dropping out of school in extraordinary numbers.

title: Priest Says She Held Illegal Service in England to Help W omen. Clerics.
description: AMITYVILLE, L.IJust days before, the Rev. Alison Palmer, garbed in ecclesiastical robes she had sewn herself, had administered holy communion in public services in Manchester and Newcastle, Inland. In defiance of the Church of England, the was the first woman to do loin Britain, upsetting much of the Anglican hisrarchy end putting the controversial se ices on the front pages of newspapersithere.

title: Lois Shapiro Wed
description: Lois E. Shapiro, daughter of the late Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Shapiro of Waterbury, Conn., was married yesterday afternoon to Joel I. Belsky. Rabbi Richard Margolis performed the ceremony in Norwich at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Martin C. Shapiro, brother and sisterinlaw of the bride. The bride is director of advertising and promotion with E. P. Dutton, book publishers.

title: West Germany Tightens Security Near Its Airports
description: BONN, Nov. 6The West German police adopted special measures near airports over the weekend to foil possible terrorist missile attacks on airliners just after takeoff or during landing approach.

title: Arafat Rejects Pullout
description: SAIDA, Lebanon, Nov. 6Palestinian leader Yasir Arafat declared today that the joint PalestinianLebanese leftist forces would not pull out of southern Lebanon, because to do so would mean surrender to Israel.

title: JAMES WORK, AN ENGINEER AND COLLEGE PRESIDENT
description: James Work, an aeronautical engineer who headed the Brewster Aeronautical Corporation in World War II and in 1946 became president of what is now Delaware. Valley College of Science and Agriculture in Doylestown, Pa., died yesterday in Doylestown. He was 84 years old.

title: Wilson Brigham Young, Passes 571 Yards, Sets N.C.A.A. Record
description: Wilson Brigham Young, Passes 571 Yards, Sets N.C.A.A. Record

title: Jazz: Paris Returns to His Guitar
description: When Jackie Paris was first heard on 52d Street 30 years ago, he was primarily a jazz guitarist who also sang. His singing, however, soon took precedence and, particularly since he has been teamed with his wife, Anne Marie Moss, during the last decade, his guitar has been merely an accompanying instrument. But at Jimmy Weston's, 131 East 54th Street, where Mr. Paris and Miss Moss are appearing for the next four weeks, Mr. Paris is reverting to his early jazz days, featuring his guitar playing for as much as half of the three hourlong sets they do each night.

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of post positions. Copyright 1977 by Daily Racing Forms, Inc.

title: Chess:
description: Blunder's Thunder Outclassed By Lightning That Came First

title: Ancient Sport of Falconry Lives Again in New York
description: SAUGERTIES, N.Y.,With a hawk perched on a leather gauntlet on his outstretched left hand, William H. Robinson, a young college teacher, stood in an open field here the other day as the sun peeked out of the gray clouds scudding across the Catskill Mountains to his rear.

title: Building Toward a Test Ban
description: Leonid Brezhnev's offer to suspend civilian as well as military nuclear explosions is a breakthrough for a comprehensive test ban and for SovietAmerican relations in general. It is the outcome not only of diplomatic negotiations, important as that has been, but of years of discussion between scientists of the two countries. It was by convincing a handful of Soviet scientists, then others, that there are few safe or sound uses for peaceful nuclear explosions that American scientists and diplomats appear to have contributed to the reversal in Soviet policy. That is a rare phenomenon but it provides justification for the great effort to expand private and semiofficial Soviet contacts with the West in a wide variety of fields.

title: Old Army Man Fights Taxation of V.A. Benefit
description: WASHINGTON,Nov. 6Col. Zebulon L. Strickland Jr., a retired Army artillery officer, won his personal battle with the Internal Revenue Service in 1976 but is still losing the war. At issue are the disability payments he and hundreds of other retired veterans have been awarded by the Veterans Administration.

title: U.S. Allies Afraid They Might Be Denied Cruise Missiles
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 4The SovietAmerican talks on strategic arms, which are nearing completion, have created a difficult problem for Washington's NATO allies because of their eagerness to keep open the option of acquiring cruise missiles.

title: Saturday's College Football Results
Amnesty Group Is Investigating The Cases of 18 U.S. Prisoners
description: LONDON, Nov. 6 (UPI)Amnesty International, winner of the 1977 Nobel Peace Prize, says it is investigating the cases of 18 prisoners in the United States because it believes they may have been jailed for their beliefs, origin or involvement with unpopular political groups.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TOMORROW

title: Byrne and Bateman Hold Final Debate
description: Governor Byrne and State Senator Raymond H. Bateman, in their 11th and final debate yesterday, engaged in the type of hostile exchanges that have marked the New Jersey gubernatorial campaign.

title: The Arrogance Of Secrecy
description: BOSTON,Nov. 6Attorney General Bell made his plea bargain with Richard Helms for practical reasons: the likely obstacles to a jury conviction for perjury. He hoped that the misdemeanor plea, even with a suspended sentence, would deter official lying in the future. Judge Barrington Parker strengthened that hope when he said Mr. Helms stood before the court in d is erace.

title: Woman's Ouster by Medical School Reaches Supreme Court
description: Charlotte Horowitz will sit before the United States Supreme Court this morning for the final stage of her fouryearold legal battle against the medical school where she had a top academ?e record but was expelled on the verge of graduation.

title: Malta Chief Ends China Visit
description: PEKING, Nov. 6 (Agence FrancePresse) The visit to Peking by Prime Minister Dom Mintoff of Malta ended today with the signing of an agreement for continued Chinese economic and technical aid to the Mideterranean nation. No details, of the accord were disclosed.

title: Byrne and Bateman Hold Final Debate
description: Governor Byrne and State Senator Raymond H. Bateman, in their 11th and final debate yesterday, engaged in the type of hostile exchanges that have marked the New Jersey gubernatorial campaign.

title: State's Congressional Bloc Expecting Byrne to Win
description: WASHINGTON,Nov. 6New Jersey's election tomorrow, according to predictions by the state's Congressional delegation here, will show that Governor Byrne, with a superior campaign, has come from far behind to defeat Senator Raymond H. Bateman, his Republican opponent, who blundered.

title: U.S. Report Urges Larger Commitment To Cities and Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A broad series of recommendations that would strongly influence Federal programs in favor of distressed cities and the poor they house has been made by Government officials concerned with devising a national urban strategy.

title: Make a Tax Cut Fruitful, Not Futile
description: President Carter cannot have it both ways next year. If he tries to cut taxes at the same time that he tries to reform them, he may fail at both objectives. The tax cut deserves priority. Without it, the nation may sink again into recession. Tax reform, which we strongly endorse, can wait until 1979 and a new Congress. The President's political energy will be needed in 1978 for passage of any innovative, antiinflation tax cut.

title: Cara Lebowitz Bride of Dr. Leonard M. Kagan
description: The marriage of Cara Lebowitz, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Abraham J. Lebowitz of Valley Stream, L.I., to Dr. Leonard Michael Kagan, son of Mr. and Mrs. Elias R. Kagan of Elmont,L.I. took place yesterday afternoon. Rabbi Morris S. Friedman and Cantor Rudolph Dresdner officiated at the service in Temple Hillel in North Woodmere, L.I.

title: Cornell Soccer Victor
description: ITHACA, N. Y., Nov. 6The Cornell soccer team, retained first place in the Ivy League by beating Columbia, 31, in overtime today. Kurt Bettger scored two goals for the victors.

title: Smithsonian Receives Diamond, Most Valuable Since Hope Gift
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 6 (UPI)The Smithsonian Institution, which owns the world's largest public collection of gems, has been given a big new diamond.

title: Dowell Dances Splendidly as Guest in Dream
description: For 21 years the Joffrev Ballet has clung to a rigid nonstar system its dancers are even listed aphabetically and Robert Juffney is not going to change the habit of a lifetime. However, on Saturday night at the City Center 55th Street Theater, a star, an indisputable star turned up as if by accident, and the audience accorded him the star treatment.

title: U.S. Inquiry Into Bias Is Opposed At Prestigious New York Schools
description: An investigation by the Federal Government into possible discrimination against girls and members of minority groups at New York City's three most prestigous high schoolsthe Bronx High School of Science, Stuyvesant and Brooklyn Techhas generated impassioned opposition from administrators, alumni, teachers, students and parents who do not want to sacrifice academic merit for a quota system.

title: Cool, Elegant Mr. Klein Is a Metaphorical Movie
description: If a movie could be said to be immaculately groomed, Joseph Losey's work would qualify. No matter what it's about or where it's set or even whether it's any good (and Mr. Losey has made some that weren't), a Losey film is as much fun to wander through as the lobby of a great, stylish hotel, say the Ritz in Paris. One is aware of order, caste, manners and, very often, the power of money, which has as much to do with the way his films look subiect matter.

title: First Victim
description: Last month, a 27yearold MexicanAmerican, the unwed mother of a 4yearold child, died in a hospital McAllen, Tex., from complications caused by a cheap abortion in a nearby Mexican border town. The dead woman carried a Medicaid card, but it did her little good. On Aug. 4, the Federal Government had stopped paying for abortions for the poor unless the life of the mother is endangered. The woman's life presumably was not in dangernot until she went across the border and paid $40 to terminate an unwanted pregnancy. Legal abortions performed in McAllen, Tex., are a lot more expensive than that.

title: Auto Racing
description: AT HAMPTON, GA. DIXIE 500

title: Concert
description: The spirit of Leopold Stokowski was very much in the air yesterday afternoon in Carnegie Hall, where the American Symphony, the orchestra he founded in 1962, played an allRussian program. Stokowski was always particularly identified with Russian musicin fact, he introduced the principal work of this concert, Prokofiev's Symphony No. 6, to American audiences in 1949.

title: Barry Jupiter, Surgeon, Weds Wendy Hausman
description: The marriage of Wendy Robin Hausman, daughter of Marjorie Hausman of Woodmere, L.I., and Eugene Hausman of New York, to Dr. Barry Jupiter took place yesterday at Temple Israel in Lawrence, L. I. Rabbi Joel Zion performed the ceremony. The bridegroom is a son of Mr. and Mrs. William Jupiter of Oceanside. L.I.

title: OUTSIDERS RUNNING FOR SEATTLE MAYOR
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 6Early Friday morning, Charles Royer, a political novice, sat in a cold, dank room here talking about his grassroots campaign, his populiststyle efforts as an outsider to be elected the next mayor of Seattle on Tuesday.

title: Rail Pension Fund Said to Face Possibility of Depletion by 1986
description: Like its younger sister, the Social Security system, the nation's railroad retirement system appears to be in danger of going broke in the next decade. It has been running up increasing deficits since 1970.

title: Gas Storage Takes On Critical Role
description: WASHINGTON, La.Here, in the heart of Cajun country, the Transcontinental Gas Pipe Line Company is hoarding enough gas to satisfy the entire city of New York all winter long.

title: National Horse Show
description: MORNING EVENTS

title: Dr. Coffin Has a Lively First Service at Riverside
description: In a sermon interrupted by laughter, applause and impromptu singing, the Rev. Dr. William Sloane Coffin yesterday officated at his first. service at the Riverside Church, where he became senior minister on Nov. 1.

title: Defector From China Bothered By Some Aspects of Taipei Life
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 5Wherever he goes, the Chinese Air Force pilot who defected to Taiwan last July is pursued by autograph seekers. When he goes shopping, store owners often decline to take his money.

title: CORRECTION
description: A photograph in yesterday's Connecticut Weekly identified as that of Gerald M. Fox, a candidate for Mayor of Stamford, was actually a picture of Mr. Fox's father, who Is not a candidate.

title: Rock: Shakti Blends East and West
description: Shakti seemed to be an experimental gambit in 1975, when John McLaughlin, the guitarist, and three Indian musiclang formed the group. Its approach to music was basically Eastern, with Mr. McLaughlin choosing to use Indian materials rather than to draw the other players into his own musical orbit.

title: The Standings
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: New Zealander to Meet Carter
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Nov.6 (Reuters)Prime Minister Robert Muldoon of New Zealand is scheduled to leave tomorrow for a threeweek visit to the United States and his first meeting with President Carter. Mr. Muldoon told reporters today that the major topics he would raise with the President were trade and the impact of changes in the South Pacific on American policy.

title: Japan Giving Palestinians Food
description: TOKYO, Nov 6 (Reuters)Japan will give Palestinian refugees $2.5 million in food through the United Nations Relief and Works Agency, the Foreign Ministry has announced and will pay up to $500,000 for transporting it.

title: CORRECTION
description: A photograph in yesterday's Connecticut Weekly identified as that of Gerald M. Fox, a candidate for Mayor of Stamford, was actually a picture of 11r, Fox's father, who is not a candidate.

title: Barazzutti Overcomes Gottfried
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 (AP)Corrado Barazzutti of Italy overcame topseeded Brian Gottfried of the United States, 76, 76, 67, 36, 64, today in the final of the $50,000 Paris indoor tennis open.

title: School Results
description: FOOTBALL

title: 2 LI. Churches Hold Christian and Jewish Services
description: EAST MEADOW, LI., Nov. 6Christian services were held this morning, as usual, at the two Long Island churches suspended last week by the American Lutheran Church on charges of subordinating the Christian gospel to Jewish customs, and tonightalso as usualthe two congregations got together for a Hebrew service.

title: HAZEL PERPER
description: Hazel Perper, who wrote The Avocado Pit Grower's Indoor Howto Book, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital. The widow of Mark Perper, an artist, she was 69 years old and lived at 27 West 96th Street in Manhattan.

title: Health Czar Appointed by Carey Finds City a Shoestring Empire
description: Morton P. Hyman will probably not become the city's Health Services Administrator or chairman of The New York City Health and Hospital Corporation, or hold any of the high city health positions that were originally designated for him by Governor Carey and Mayor Beame.

title: Dolphins Mar Return Of Jets Domres, 1410
description: Through the Shea Stadium overcast yesterday, a Jets fan kept pleading with Marty Domres: Marty, make believe they're Cornell.

title: Around the Nation
description: CANTON, Ohio, Nov. 6 (AP)The entire third shift of the Canton police force called in sick today as a wage dispute between the safety forces and city officials in this northeastern Ohio city of 100,000 continued.

title: Deaths
description: AIGUIERJames Edward D.D.S.. of Lutherville. Md., formerly of Philadelphia, Pa. on Thursday, November 3, 1977. Father of Antoinette A. Pearman and Eugenie A. Havemever. Afso survived by 10 grandchildren. Memorial Service Monday, November 7, at 11:30 AM St. James Church. Madison Ave. & 71st St., NYC. Please omit flowers.

title: Prospectus for New York City Awaits RatingService Decisions
description: New York City officials were at the printers last night putting the final touches on the preliminary official statement or prospectus that must he issued in connection with a planned sale of at least $200 million in shortterm notes.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: A quarterback from a school in Utah throwing against the University of Utah football team is a combination that has led to a major National Collegiate passing record twice in five years. Marc Wilson, Brigham Young University's fine sophomore passer who started this season in reserve to Gifford Nielsen, established a national mark of 571 yards passing in a game Saturday night, when he completed 26 of 41 passes against Utah.

title: Met by P.L.O. in Rome
description: ROME,Nov. 4 (AP)Archbishop Haarion Capucci was met at Rome's Leonardo da Vinci Airport by a Palestine Liberation Organization delegation led by Shafiq alHut, a representative sent by Yasir Arafat, the head of the P.L.O.

title: STUDY CALCULATES IMPACT OF JOBLESS RATE ON G.N.P.
description: A new economic study of the societal costs of unemployment concludes that if during the latest two decades, the United States had kept the unemployment rate at about 4 percent, instead of at an average of more than 5 percent, Americans would have enjoyed 17 percent more goods and services last year than they actually had.

title: RHODESIA PEACE PLAN MEETS NEW SETBACK
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 6Prospects for a settlement in Rhodesia crumbled further today as talks between Prime Minister Ian D. Smith and the British official designated as administrator ended after an hour and a half without agreement on key issues.

title: Theater: Chez Nous Is Not the Best Peter Nichols A Shavian Play
description: The most cogent linee in the production of Peter Nichols's Chez Nous, which opened yesterday at the Manhattan Theater Club, belong to the Swingle Singers. Dibble dibble they go, or something like that, in a recording of their version of Bach that precedes each of the two acts.

title: The Library and the Bureaucrats
description: The people of Rudd, Iowa (population 429) are upset about their recent brush with Federal and state bureaucrats. When their library sought outside funds to repair its basement, they were told to make structural changes in the building to accommodate the handicappedor else suffer a loss of Federal assistance that could force the library to close. The cost for wheelchair ramps and other amenities. some feared, might exceed $6,500. That seemed rather much for a library whose total expenditures last year were only $3,600especially since there is not a single wheelchair patient in the tiny farming community.

title: Knicks Top Lakers by 106 to 102
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Nov. 6Jim McMillian scored 12 points in the first quarter and 10 in the fourth, in his best performance this season, and made possible a 106102 victory for the New York Knicks over the Los Angeles Lakers tonight before a crowd of 12,550 at the Forum, where KnickLaker games used to be automatic sellouts of 17.505.

title: Islanders Beaten by. Bruins, 53
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6Just when Boston Garden was contemplating changing its name to Boston Parlor, as in funeral parlor, because fans hadn't been witness to a single victory by a home team this season, the Bruins finally won one tonight. The victims, by a 53 score, were the New York Islanders.

title: Roswell Garst, 79, Khrasitchev's Farm Host in 1959
description: Roswell Garst, the Iowa farmer and seed expert who was host to Nikita S. Khrushchev when the Soviet leader toured this country in 1959 and wanted to see a model Corn Belt farm, died Satur. day in a hospital in Carroll, Iowa, near his hometown of Coon Rapids. He was 79 years old.

title: N.F.L. Standings
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: New York Sues Ring Promoters For Tax Money
description: Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz has asked the promoters of five heavyweight boxing bouts in New York last year to pay the state nearly $400,000 due in taxes on gross receipts. Lefkowitz said yesterday that he had brought three separate actions in Manhattan's Supreme Court

title: Hudson Democrats Report a Breakin
description: JERSEY CITY,Nov. 6 (AP)Telephone and electrical wires were cut at the Hudson County Democratic headquarters at Pavonia Avenue and Kennedy Boulevard here during a breakin early today, the police said. The breakin was discovered when campaign workers arrived at the office this morning, the police said. It was not known whether anything was stolen.

title: British Soldier WithBigTask
description: LONDON, Nov. 6Field Marshal Lord Carver, designated as Britain's peacekeeping resident commissioner in Rhodesia, is believed by many here to be the only person with a chance of succeeding in this difficult, delicate job.

title: Renata Scotto Returns to Her Butterfly Role
description: Madama Butterfly was Renata Scotto's calling card during the first few years of her Metropolitan Opera career, She made her Met debut in the title role in 1966 and virtually became identified with the part. The opera has been absent from her repertory over the last several seasons. but on Saturday afternoon she returned to the scenes of her initial New York success and proved she has lost none of her ability to bring Puccini's little geisha to life.

title: Rene Goscinny Dies In Paris; Created Noted Comic Strip
description: PARIS, Nov. 6 (AP)Ren Goscinny creator of the French comic strip character Asterix the Gaul, died here yesterday of a heart attack. He was 51 years old

title: Women Reported Making Gains In Owning and Operating Farms
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)The role of the farm woman is no longer restricted to tending the chickens and canning vegetables, for more women own and operate their own farms, business reports showed today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MANHATTAN IMAGES Some of the less publicized art displays in town are in unexpected places, like Little Italy: a Special District by Roland G. Antonelli. The photographer has tinted his blackandwhite photographs in subtle pastels in documenting the local ethnic community. The display runs through Nov. 30 during regular business hours at the Bowery Savings Bank, 130 Bowery at Grand Street.

title: Conservationists Take a Course on Saving Oily Birds
description: MADISON,Nov. 6The threat of oil spills from offshore drilling and supertankers has so alarmed some New Jersey birdwatchers and conservationists that they spent more than six hours yesterday learning how to clean and care for wildfowl that land in oil slicks.

title: STRIKE IS CRIPPLING IRON MINING REGION
description: VIRGINIA, Minn., Nov. 6The deer season opened here yesterday, giving residents of this ironrange mining town of 12,450 something to talk about besides the miners strike that has devasted some businesses, caused heavy losses to others and put hundreds of other workers out of jobs.

title: Becomes Opera That Succeeds
description: On the face of it. the notion of turning one of George Bernard Shaw's witty, wordy plays into an opera sounds fairly calamitous. but Joyce Barthelson has tried it. The result is no calamity.

title: 37 KILLED AS A DAM BREAKS IN GEORGIA AFTER HEAVY RAINS
description: TOCCOA, Ga., Nov. 6  An earthen darn on the outskirts of this north Georgia town collapsed early this morning during torrential rains, loosing a 35footwall of water that killed at least 37 persons as it surged through a trailer park on the campus of Toccoa Falls Bible college.

title: Golf
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, FLA.

title: DENMARK SUPPLANTS U.S. AS WORLD SALARY LEADER
description: Denmark, one of the smallest countries in Europe, supplanted the United States as the world's salary leader during the first half of this decade.

title: BROWN SAYS U.S. WILL CUT PROPOSED DEFENSE BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)Defense Secretary Harold Brown said today that he expected the military's budget for the fiscal year 1979 to be at least $5 billion less than the $135 billion to $140 billion that President Ford projected before he left office. Mr. Brown also said the defense budget for the fiscal year 1978, which started Oct. 1, should be about $117 billion.

title: Scoring and Statistics in N.F.L. Yesterday
description: AT CLEVELAND

title: Lillian Carter to Visit Ireland
description: DUBLIN, Nov. 6 (Reuters)A ceremonial airport welcome isbeing prepared here for Lillian Carter, President Carter's mother, who is scheduled to arrive on Tuesday as part of a goodwill exchange visit. She is coming for 10 days in a 242member group of Americans who will stay with Irish families of comparable employment and interests while about the same number of Irish people visit the United States.

title: 2 Found Guilty in 76 Bomb Killing Of Phoenix Investigative Reporter
description: PHOENIX, Nov. 6Max Dunlap, a Phoenix contractor, and James Robison, a plumber, were found guilty today of murder and conspiracy in the 1976 bomb killing of Don Bolles, a reporter investigating organized crime for The Arizona Republic.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Strike Grounds Aeromexico
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 6 (AP)The governmentowned airline Aeromexico suspended all flights yesterday after groundworkers struck for higher wages. Four other airlinesEastern, Nicaraguan, Pan American and Varigalready were shut down by the strike. Flights to and from the United States continued on Braniff, American, Western and Texas International airlines.

title: European Soccer
description: ITALIAN LEAGUE

title: HUGH A. DOYLE, 78, LEADER IN GOVERNMENTAL AFFAIRS
description: Hugh A. Doyle, a longtime civic and Roman Catholic lay leader and a former councilman in New Rochelle, N.Y., died Friday at the New Rochelle Hospital Medical Center after a short illness. He was 78 years old and lived at 87 Walnut Street in New Rochelle.

title: 2 Found Guilty in 76 Bomb Killing Of Phoenix Investigative Reporter
description: PHOENIX, Nov. 6Max Dunlap, a Phoenix contractor, and James Robison, a plumber, were found guilty today of murder and conspiracy in the 1976 bomb killing of Don Bolles, a reporter investigating organized crime for The Arizona Republic.

title: Quebec Issue: A New Phase
description: PARIS, Nov. 6Premier Rne Levesque of Quebec has just completed a second major stage in what he sees as the inevitable evolution of his province toward independence.

title: NEIGHBORS PROTEST EXMENTAL PATIENTS
description: LYNDHURST, N.J., Nov. 6  Twelve women carrying picket signs marched around the front of a house here the other day protesting the presence inside of three former mental patients.

title: Young Calls Death Of Biko Unplanned
description: LONDON, Nov. 6 (Reuters)Andrew Young, the chief United States delegate to the United Nations, told Britons today that the prison death of the South African black student leader Stephen Biko was totally unplanned.

title: Advertising
description: It was a sight indeed. William Bernbach, George Gallup, David Ogilvy and Rosser Reeves, advertising giants all, in one small room. And for a change they weren't being honored, they were doing the honoring.

title: Rising Number Of Emigrants: Asset for Japan
description: TOKYO, Nov. 6Tomoyoshi Nakajima is a member of an unusual, growing, yet littleknown group of Japanese. He wants to leave his cauntry permanently.

title: Other Contests in State Drawing Interest, Too
description: The four major candidates for Mayor of New York City made the best of a dreary Sunday in their campaign for an election tomorrow that will highlight races throughout the state.

title: Diane Kamino Married to John Yochelson
description: Diane Kamino, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney Kamino of Fayetteville, N.Y., was married yesterday to John Yochelson, son of Mrs. Samuel Yochelson of Chevy Chase, Md., and the late Dr. Yochelson. The ceremony was performed at the Syracuse Hotel in upstate New York by Rabbi Theodore Levy and Cantor Harold Lerner.

title: News Summary
description: Talks between Prime Minister Ian D Smith and the British official designated as administrator during the transition to black rule in Rhodesia ended without agreement on the key issue of the composition of the security forces during the transition period. There was also no agreement on other key issues. Field ????????? ? ??? ????????, the Britishdesignated administrator, sought to minimize the disagreements at an airport news conference before he left for Botswana. He said he had found a very wide measure of agreement on the basic principles, of the British and American proposals on the blackrule issue. [Page 1, Column 3.]

title: Desai Hails Airmen Who Died in Crash
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 6 (AP)Five Indian Air Force officers who were killed in the crash of a military jet plane carrying Prime Minister Morarji R. Desai died probably to save our lives, Mr. Desai said today.

title: Canadian Football
description: YESTERDAY'S GAMES

title: The Palestinian Reality
description: JERUSALEMThe United StatesIsraeli working paper means that we shall talk to the Palestinians in Geneva, if the conference is not torpedoed at the last moment. And we shall talk about what is to happen to them in part of that country which Gentiles call Palestine, and Jews call Eretz Yisrael.

title: 2 Israelis Killed as Rockets Fired From Lebanon Hit Seacoast Town
description: JERUSALEM. Nov. 6Two Israelis were killed today when Sovietmade Katyusha rockets fired from southern Lebanon landed in the Israeli seacoast town of Nahariya a few miles south of the frontier.

description: Article 4  No Title

title: The U.N. Today
Youth Is Found Hanged in His Cell In Rikers Island Detention Center
description: A 19yearold inmate at the Rikers Island detention center was found hanged in his cell last night, a spokesman for the City Department of Corrections said.

title: Waltrip Takes Dixie 500; Allison, Yarborough Crash
description: HAMPTON. Ga., Nov. 6 (AP)Darrell Waltrip, in a Chevrolet, held on for victory as Donnie Allison and Cale Yarborough crashed fighting for second in the raintroubled Dixie 500 Grand National stockcar race today.

title: The Brahman Priests of Pushkar Say Outsiders Hurt Reputation
description: PUSHKAR, IndiaIn Pushkar there is a group of priests who are a class apart They claim to be the original Brahmans.

title: Other Contests in State Drawing Interest, Too
description: The four major candidates for Mayor of New York City made the best of a dreary Sunday in their campaign for an election tomorrow that will highlight races throughout the state.

title: Bahamas Plane Crash Kills Six
description: FREEPORT, Bahamas (UPI)A twinengine plane bound for Fort Lauderdale, Fla., crashed in the mud flats north of Freeport International Airport within minutes of takeoff last night, killing all six persons aboard, the police reported. The pilot was reported to be from Canton, Ohio. His five passengers were all believed to he Americans. The authorities withheld the identities of the victims pending notification of the next of kin.

title: Sparkle Aplenty in Atlanta
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 6 There was a charity that wanted to raise money, a hotel that wanted to be better known and a cosmetic company that was launching a new look. And things being how they are in the nation's capital, Georgia is now fashionable.

title: For Those Who Don't Like Byrne Or Bateman, There Are 14 Others
description: The estimated 70 percent of the 3.6 million New Jersey registered voters expected to cast ballots tomorrow will have a choice not of two, but of 16 candidates for Governor.

title: New Corporate Bonds
description: For week ended Nov. 4, 1977

title: Credit Markets Seek to Explain Confusing Rate Moves by the Fed
description: The credit markets worked overtime late last week to dispel the fog thatfiguratively at leastspread from Chicago's O'Hare Airport to cloak the Federal Reserve System and what it had actually intended with its frequent moves during the past week and a half.

title: World Hockey Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Stefan Sommerfield Weds Jean Strumpf
description: Jean Sarah Strumpf, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jerome C. Strumpf of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to Stefan Ellis Sommerfield, son of Mrs. Alvan B. Sommerfield. also of New York, and the late Mr. Sommerfield. Rabbi Sheldon Zimmerman performed the ceremony at the Carlyle.

title: Roosevelt
EDWARD SCHOWALTER, 65, EXA. T. &
description: Dr. Edward J. Schowalter, retired medical director of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, died Saturday at his home in Summit, N. J. He was 63 years old.

title: Tips Gopher
description: WASHINGTONElection reformers, worried about the great power they were putting in the hands of a Federal Election Commission, thought they made certain of bipartisanship by requiring the commission to be made up of three Democrats and three Republicans.

title: 2 L.I. Churches Hold Christian and Jewish Services
description: EAST MEADOW, L.I.,Nov. 6Christian services were held this morning, as usual, at the two Long Island churches suspended last week by the American Lutheran Church on charges of subordinating the Christian gospel to Jewish customs, and tonightalso as usualthe two congregations got together for a Hebrew service.

title: STUDY OF PUBLIC TV FINDS IMPORTS LOW
description: Although to many observers public television in the United States appears to be heavily dependent on foreign fareparticularly programs purchased from the British television systems  the imports actually made up only 7.6 percent of the new programs presented on noncommercial channels last year, according to an annual status report on the industry by the Corporation for Public Broadcasting.

title: U.S. Inquiry Into Bias Is Opposed At Prestigious New York Schools
description: An investigation by the Federal Government into possible discrimination against girls and members of minority groups at New York City's three most prestigous high schoolsthe Bronx High School of Science, Stuyvesant and Brooklyn Techhas generated impassioned opposition from administrators, alumni, teachers, students and parents who do not want to sacrifice academic merit for a quota system.

title: Bills Forget Their Woes And Turn Back Patriots
description: The Buffalo Bills did not figure to be ready for the New England Patriots. The Buffalo Bills figured to be ready for an autopsy. They had lost six of seven games. They had lost to Seattle last week. 5617. They had lost O.J. Simpson during the week to a knee injury.

title: Tony Dorsett, the SuperSub, Bides His Time
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 6 Not since O. J. Simpson came into the National Football League in 1969 has a rookie running back caused such a commotion as has Anthony Drew Dorsett. In college they called him Touchdown Tony. T.D. for short. And for sure.

title: Wild Explores Chopin Genius
description: Earl Wild devoted all of his considerable energies to Chopin during his recital Saturday night at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A. If the evening was not quite of marathon length, it still offered a generous two full hours of music and touched almost every facet of the composer's keyboard style.

title: News Summary
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 7, 1977

title: A List of Recently Published Books
description: A Theory of Education, by Joseph D. Novak (Cornell University Press, $15).

title: DR. JOSEPH S. GOULD DIES; ECONOMIST SERVED ABROAD
description: Dr. Joseph S Gould, an economist who served as consultant in many posts in the Far East, died Thursday at the University of Pennsylvania Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 78 years old and lived in Newark, Del., where he headed the department of economics and business administration of the University of Delaware from 1929 to 1946.

title: Market Place
description: One of the more notable Wall Street developments in recent years is the concentration of research effort on relatively few companies, a development that leaves many potentially profitable investments to individuals willing to spend time seeking out these hidden values.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: Israel Frees Archbishop Jailed for Smuggling Arms
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 6In response to a request from the Vatican, the Israeli Government tonight commuted the sentence of Archbishop Hilarion Capucci, who was serving a 12year term in an Israeli prison for smuggling arms into the Israelioccupied West Bank for Palestinian guerrillas.

title: Dissident Catholics Dedicate Headquarters on L.I.
description: OYSTER BAY COVE, L. I., Nov. 6Archbishop Marcel Lefebvre, the dissident French prelate, today dedicated the new American headquarters of his Society of St. Pius X, promising 600 supporters he would follow traditional Roman Catholicism even though he has been suspended from his priestly duties by Pope Paul VI.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: RANGOON, Burma, Nov. 6 (Reuters)A drugrunning rebel leader, Lo Hsinghan, has lost his appeal to Burma's highest court to quash the death penalty passed on him for treason.

title: Prudential Contract is Ratified
description: BOSTON, Nov. 6 (AP)More than 15,000 agents of the Prudentidi Insurance Company of America have ratified a twoyear contract. Joseph Pollack, the president of the International Insurance Workers Union, said the contract provides pay increases of $33.44 a week the first year, and $27.44 a week the second year. He said there also were improvements in pension, medical, dental and major disability plans.

title: Guy Lombardo of the Royal Canadians Dies in Houston at Age of
description: Guy Lombardo, the band leader known for a half century of New Year's Eve celebrations with the sweetest music this side of heaven, died Saturday night at Methodist Hospital in Houston. He was 75 years old.

title: 25 Blocks Begin to Rise From Ashes In Central Bronx Area Near the Zoo
description: The sounds of hammers, the flash of welding torches and the bustle of people moving into new and better apartments signal the first results of a significant but unheralded neighborhoodreconstruction effort in the Bronx.

title: BLUMENTHAL VOICES SOME RESERVATIONS ON BURNS'S POLICIES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6W. Michael Blumenthal, Secretary of the Treasury, expressed mild reservations today about the way the Federal Reserve system has been pushing up shortterm interest rates, but he seemed to imply that Arthur F. Burns might yet win reappointment as chairman of the Federal Reserve board.

title: How the Ballot Will Look to Voters in Some Manhattan Polling Places Tomorrow
description: PROPOSITION NUMBER ONE.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Horses listed in order of Post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Baptists Polld on Women's Role
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI) Most. Southern Baptists are opposed to the ordination of pastors, but they would accept women in other forms of service, according to a survey by Clay Price of the Home Mission Board. Three of every four Baptists who responded said that they would approve ordaining woman for the ministry in religious education, youth work and social service.

title: Reforms of Nuclear Plant Licensing Held Irrelevant in a Senate Study
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6(AP)President Carter's proposals to streamline nuclear power plant licensing will do little to meet his goal of increasing nuclear energy by 1985, according to a Congressional study.

title: Nov. 7, 1917
description: On the evening of Nov. 6, 1917, Vladimir Lenin walked back and forth, back and forth, in the roomy apartment of a woman named Fofanova in the Viborg section of Petrograd where he was living in deep conspiratorial cover. He was angry and frustrated.

title: Cowboys Vanquish Giants
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 6Bring on the Buccaneers.

title: Soprano Sings Mimi In Her Debut at Met
description: Elena MautiNunziata, an Italian soprano who has sung in major Europeon houses as well as appearing in Chicago and Dallas, made her Metropolitan Opera debut Saturday right as Mimi in Puccini's La Boheme.

title: Mideast Arms: Israel' s Edge Seems Decisive
description: Israel's military power is considered so strong today and that of the Arabs so weak that the prospect that the United Nations Security Council or an individual member could influence Israeli military policy in a crisis seems increasingly remote.

title: Northwest Calls Its Tender Offer For L.A. Coke Bottler a Success
description: Having received tenders for about 93 percent of the outstanding shares of the Coca Cola Bottling Company of Los Angeles, Northwest Industries is calling the offer a success and is extending it to 7 P.M. central standard time Nov. 22. The original deadline was last Friday.

title: U.S. Broadcast to Brazil Appears To Add to the Strains in Relations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6Relations between the United States and Brazil, already strained, appear to have worsened with the broadcast to Brazil by the Voice of America of an interview with an exiled Brazilian political leader.

title: Use of Trap Is Ohio's Hottest Ballot Issue
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 5The trap lies with its steel jaws open. A fat, cuddly teddy bear drops onto the trigger. The jaws snap shut. Yes, we know this is just a stuffed animal, says an offcamera voice. We thought the real thing was too horrible. Then the voice asks the viewer to destroy this torture device by voting to ban the use of the trap.

title: Soviet Visitors to 4 U.S. Cities Are Awed but Critical
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 5 (AP)American department stores were wonderful, the subways dangerous and dirty. The people were friendly but ignorant of the Soviet Union. Pornography seemed to be everywhere.

title: U.S. SCIENCE ADVISER TO TRY NEW APPROACH
description: The White House, according to its chief science adviser, is planning to apply a new method of review and analysis, previously reserved for matters of national security, to resolve questions affecting a number of Government agencies.

title: Elitist Concept of Performing Arts Endorsed by American Assembly
description: HARRIMAN, N.Y., Nov. 6More than 50 persons prominent in the performing artsdirectors, writers, trustees, government administrators and performers endorsed an elitist concept of the arts at the conclusion of the 53d American Assembly here today. But they stressed that the arts were elitist in the best sense of the word, as a nation's best which can be shared by all.

title: Meeting on Black Families Issues A Sharp Message to Government
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 6A national conference on the problems of black families ended here last night with a sharp warning to the Carter Administration and Congress that it's later than you think.

title: RHODESIA PEACE PLAN MEETS NEW SETBACK
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 6Prospects for a settlement in Rhodesia crumbled further today as talks between Prime Minister Ian D. Smith and the British official designated as administrator ended after an hour and a half without agreement on key issues.

title: Television
Golda Meir in Morosco Audience Applauds Her Life Enacted on Stage
description: Surrounded by friends, relatives and Israeli officials who have played a part in her remarkable career, Golda Meir watched from a center seat at the Morosco Theater last night as Anne Bancroft and a supporting cast portrayed the former Israeli Prime Minister and the friends, relatives and officials.

title: Two Women Take Top Riding Awards
description: Two horsewomen, one an experienced campaigner from Britain and the other a teenage stylist from California's San Gabriel valley, helped close the National Horse Show at Madison Square Garden on heartwarming note.

title: Balzac Wins $262,050 Race
description: ARCADIA. Calif., Nov. 6 (UPI)Bill Shoemaker guided Balzac to a head victory over Misrepresentation in the $262.050 Norfolk Stakes at Santa Anita today. The Norfolk is the richest race in the country for 2yearolds.

title: Voters Can Telephone To Find Polling Place
description: The Board of Elections has set up A special telephone number that voters may call if they are unsure of where they are to vote in Tuesday's election.

title: U.S. Report Urges LargerCommitment To Cities and Poor
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6A broad series of recommendations that would strongly influence Federal programs in favor of distressed cities and the poor they house has been made by Government officials concerned with devising a national urban strategy.

title: Eleanor Heinbockel Wed
description: Eleanor Elizabeth Heinbockel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry Heinbockel of New York and Kent Cliffs. N.Y., was married yesterday to Martin Weiss, son of Mrs. Samuel Weiss of New York. The ceremony was performed at the Fifth Avenue Hotel by Rabbis Mervin Eyler and Philip Schechter. The bride is a teacher in New York. Her husband is a lawyer in Brooklyn.

title: Dividend Meetings Announced
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: German Fear About Dollar Cloud on Blumenthal Trip
description: BONNFears about the sinking dollar and suspicions that the United States had deliberately set out to knock it down dogged Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal's trail through the Middle East and Western Europe.

title: Dobrynin Suggests Arms Curb For Mideast After Peace Pact
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (AP)  The Soviet Union is prepared to seek an agreement with the United States drastically limiting the arms flow to the Middle East after a peace settlement is reached, according to Soviet Ambassador Anatoly F. Dobrynin.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT PORTLAND.

title: Commodities
description: It was exactly three years ago today that world sugar futures prices reached their historic high of 66 cents a pound, following a season of uncommonly poor cane and beet crops around the globe.

title: 7 Tourists Killed in Israel
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 5 (AP)Seven Dutch tourists were killed Saturday when the bus in which they were riding collided with another bus on the winding road to Elath in southern Israel, the police reported. They said eight passengers on the other but had been injured. A police spokesman declined to identify the dead until positive identification had been made.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: 316 Government Employees Told They Defaulted on U.S. Loans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (UPI)Letters have been sent to more than 300 Government employees, advising them that they are listed as having defaulted on Governmentguaranteed student loans.

title: Gerard's Wife Focus of Inquiry In Ringer Case
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 6The investigation of the switch of the Uruguayan race horses. Cinzano and Lebon, in the United States this summer is focusing on the activities here in May of Luis Donamari, a small, nervous horse dealer, and Mrs. Alice Gerard, the wife of the Muttontown, L.I., veterinarian who was the buyer of record of both thoroughbreds.

title: 'Mr. New Year's Eve for Nearly Half a Century
description: Guy Lombardo's longtime image as Mr. New Year's Eve and the fact that his successful career as a band leader continued for more than 40 years after he had ceased to be an innovative tastemaker in popular music have obscured the fact that he brought as fresh and distinctive an approach to popular dance music in the late 20's as Benny Goodman did in the mid30's.

title: Rhodesian Students Assail Their Course At Pittsburgh School
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 6Black Rhodesian students enrolled at CarnegieMellon University have contended that they are being trained as political administrators for government positions when the black majority takes over in their country.

title: JonesGilbert Wins Team Golf by Shot
description: LAKE BUENA VISTA, Fla., Nov. 6(AP)Grier Jones, with his partner, Gibby Gilbert, watching nervously, rolled in a fourfoot, tiebreaking birdie putt on the final hole for a betterball 66 and a onestroke victory today in the Walt Disney World national team golf tournament.

title: Holy Cross Eleven Wins Title by Routing Xavier
description: Holy Cross clinched the title in the Catholic High School Football League yesterday with a 280 victory over Xavier at Memorial Field in Flushing.

title: 10,000 in Montreal Welcome Levesque
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 6 (AP)Pre??? Rene Levesque of Quebec received an enthusiastic welcome today from about 10,000 people who came to Mirabel International Airport to see his return from an official visit to France.

title: Knicks Win, Islanders Lose
description: The Knicks defeated the Lakers, 106102, on the Coast last night, while the Islanders lost to the Bruins, 53, in Boston. Details on Page 52.

title: BURMESE COURT DECISION DOOMS A REBEL CHIEFTAIN
description: BURMESE COURT DECISION DOOMS A REBEL CHIEFTAIN

title: Ali's Not Really Bigger Than Boxing
description: LAS VEGAS, Nov. 6Muhammad Ali brags, I'm bigger than boxing. He's not, of course. But his listeners are about to learn if that boast is merely another gag line in his monologues or if he really believes it. If it's a joke, the world heavyweight champion will surrender to the World Boxing Council's ultimatum that he sign by Jan. 5

title: Black Judge Typifies New Breed
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov, 6When Robert F. Collins, now a black magistrate judge, was growing up in New Orleans, there was only one black lawyer in Louisiana, and the lawyer happened to live in his neighborhood.

title: Kentucky Vote Focuses on Louisville Judgeship Race
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Nov. 6Kentucky voters will choose city and county officials and members of the state's Legislature Tuesday, and will decide whether to authorize a convention to rewrite the state's 86yearold Constitution.

title: Houston Mayor Candidates Avoid Mudslinging in a Quiet, 12Way Race
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 6Every two years, when it is time to elect a mayor, concerned citizens here revive their hope that Houston's rampant boosterism will be supplanted, temporarily and intramurally, by a thorough airing of the city's mounting problems. Every two years, that I hope is largely dashed.

description: Bidding and the First TricTell All About the Suit ??

title: Disaster Aid for Arizona
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 6 (Reuters)President Carter yesterday declared the state of Arizona a major disaster area as a result of severe storms and flooding last month. The President's order allows Federal funds to be used to repair damaged or destroyed roads, bridges and buildings.

title: Israeli Unions Halt Strike Wave, Prepare for Talks With Cabinet
description: TELAVIV, Nov. 6Israeli trade unions announced a truce today in their weeklong campaign of strikes, demonstrations and protests against Government economic measures that they charge threaten workers' living standards.

title: World News Briefs
description: VIENNA, Nov. 6 (Reuters)Tatyana Khodorovich said on arrival here from Moscow today that Western pressure was the only way to improve human rights in the Soviet Union.

title: OSCAR CARR JR. DIES; ACTIVE IN CIVIL RIGHTS
description: Oscar Clark Carr Jr., a Mississippiborn cotton planter who became one of the first white Southern Episcopalians to combat what he described as racism in religious institutions, died Saturday of cancer at his home, 1158 Fifth Avenue. He was 54 years old.

description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Verd?'s Rigoletto, 8.

description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 6Israel today rejected an Egyptian proposal for preliminary talks to agree on an agenda for a new Geneva conference on the Middle East.

title: DE GUSTIBUS
description: After receiving a letter from a reader with a request for a Scottish baps recipe, we quoted a somewhat vague one that had appeared in Andr Simon's A Concise Encyclopedia of Gastronomy.

title: Roosevelt Track Opens Tonight
description: WESTBURY, L.1., Nov. 6  Roosevelt Raceway will open its winter harnessracing meeting tomorrow night, with Echo Brook Phil installed as the early 31 favorite in the sixthrace feature. The 5yearold pacer will head a $27,000 claiming field. Post time for the first race is 8 P.M.

title: Moynihan's Flamboyance and Quick Wit Draw Attention to Washington Freshman
description: WASHINGTON,Nov. 6Like John Wayne walking into a Wild West saloon Daniel Patrick Moynihan, New York's flamboyant freshman Senator, attracts immediate attention whe he rises to address the Senate or a public gathering.

title: Books of The Times
description: On page 21 of Jerzy Kosinski's sixth novel, George Levanterworldly small investor, migrphotographer, ski bum, amateur diplomat, parttime assassin, sexual athlete (if we think of Attila the Hun as a sexual athlete)experiences qualm. Then,we are told, he felt ashamed and somehow unnerved by his deception. Levanter has fooled and frightened a group of Soviet minor burueacrats. He feels bad because he thought he had rid himself of the enjoyment of having certifiable power.

title: Can Photos Return Gloss to Times Square?
description: Once the block on 42d Street between Broadway and Eighth Avenue embodied the spirit of a glittering and elegant Times Square.

title: 37 KILLED AS A DAM BREAKS IN GEORGIA AFTER HEAVY RAINS
description: TOCCOA, Ga., Nov. 6  An earthen dam on the outskirts of this north Georgia town collapsed early this morning during torrential rains, loosing a 35Footwall of water that killed at least 37 persons as it surged through a trailer park on the campus of Toccoa Falls Bible College.

title: Broncos Go to 71, Defeating Troubled Steelers
description: DENVER, Nov. 6What's new in Denver? Seven and one is what's new in Denver. The local football team, the Broncos, achieved a 71 wonlost record for the first time in the 17year history of the franchise today after easily defeating the ragged Pittsburgh Steelers, 217, before the 54th consecutive capacity crowd in Mile High Stadium. The Bronco fans are a mile high, too

title: Algeria and Libya Respond to Bonn on Air Security
description: BONN, Nov. 7The West German Government said today that Algeria and Libya had responded with understanding to its demands that they tighten airport security to try to prevent the hijacking of airliners and other terrorist attacks on aircraft.

title: Earle Bradford Avery , 83; Standout in Harness Racing
description: WOODSTOCK. New Brunswick, Nov. 7 (AP)Earle Bradford Avery, a wellknown harnessracing driver and trainer for 53 yeurs, died at a nursing home here yesterday. He was 83 years old.

title: Rain, High Winds Cause Flooding and Train Delays
description: Two inches of rain and gale force winds battered the metropolitan area yesterday, and the National Weather Service said the storm would last until the early morning hours today.

title: GOING OUT Guider
description: STAR TREK Here they come again the regular seasonal presentation of promising, classical talents in the program series by Young Concert Artists, an organization commended by The New York Times for its sponsorship of new musicians. The nonprofit organization holds its own auditions for final winners among on international array of musicians, most of them previous nrizewinners.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: 10 WOMEN IN JOURNALISM TO GET AWARDS FOR WORK
description: Reports on last winter's snowstorm in Buffalo, the selling of sexual warfare, the dangers of a growth hormone used on cattle and a commentary on child pornography were among the journalistic achievements by 10 New York area women selected for Front Page Awards by the Newswomen's Club of New York Inc.

title: 12 Ugandan Police Airmen in U.S. For Training as Helicopter Pilots
description: FORT WORTH, Tex. Nov. 7 (UPI)Twelve members of Idi Amin's Ugandan police gir wing currently are being trained in helicopter piloting and maintenance at Bell Helicopter's Textron plant, Bell officials confirmed today.

title: AntiDefamation League Opens Bid To Plug AntiBoycott Loopholes
description: The AntiDefamation League, the key Jewish group that worked behind the scenes to avoid a headon clash with business interests over the antiboycott law, said yesterday that it was mounting an allout effort to plug what it considers serious loopholes in the draft regulations the Commerce Department recently promulgated under the statute.

title: Nona Hendryx, a Strong, Punching Singer
description: Nona Hendryx, the third member of the nowdisbanded trio Labelle to perform in New York in recent weeks, was at the Bottom Line on Sunday night. As the group's most prolific songwriter and, by her own reckoning, most progressive mind in terms of staging and musical direction, Miss Hendryx was bound to clash with the other singers, Patti LaBelle and Sarah Dash. In contrast to the soul and black cabaret stylings purveyed by the other two in their solo debuts, Miss Hendryx opted for crunching hard rock with a disco tinge.

title: GLENDON ALL1fINE AT 84; PUBLICITY MAN FOR FILMS
description: Glendon Allvine, a theatrical and film publicity agent, playwright, writer and movie producer, died Saturday in his home at 2 Malone Avenue in East Atlantic Beach, L.I.

title: Dow Up by 6.50 to 816.44 Close; Baker Soars on BorgWarner Bid
description: Increasing hopes that the Federal Reserve has not again tightened its credit policies enabled the stock market to advance sharply yesterday.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TTENTON, Nov. 7 The Federal Environmental Protection Agency has scheduled final public hearings Monday for waterpollution control permits sought by 10 major oil companies that hold leases in the Baltimore Canyon tract off Atlantic City.

title: Boeing Earnings Show 76.2% Rise On Sales Gain of 11.6% in Quarter
description: The Boeing Company, the nation's largest producer of commercial jet aircraft with about 60 percent of that market, reported yesterday a 76.2 percent jump in thirdquartet earnings on a sales gain of 11.6 percent.

title: China's Trade With Partners Off 11%
description: TOKYO, Nov. 9(UPI)China's trade with its principal partners totaled $4.64 billion for the JanuaryJune period of this year, down 11 percent from a year ago, the Japan External Trade Organization (JETRO), said today. However, JETRO estimated that China's trade with its major partners for the whole of this year would be about $14 billion, up from $13.2 billion in 1976.

title: Bomb Blast in Israeli Market
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 7 (UPI)A small, homemade bomb apparently set by Arab guerrillas exploded in a trash can inside the Petah Tikva central bus station today, shattering windows but injuring no one, the police'said. It was the fifth such explosion in the Tel Aviv suburb this year. The Petah Tikva marketplace is used by residents of the occupied West Bank to buy and sell agricultural produce.

title: High Above Cayuga's Waters There's a Fuss About Faculty Writing
description: ITHACAThe Big Red at Cornell these days is a collective blush, a perfectly natural reaction to charges that the dean of writing can't write.

title: Roosevelt Opens Meeting
description: WESTBURY, L.I., Nov. 7Roosevelt aceway opened a 48night meeting tonight in high winds and rain and drew a crowd of 8,924. The track introduced the $6 box triple betting (the first $1 ontrack bet in New York State racing history) and first returns were encouraging.

title: About the Jets ...
description: The New York Jets quarterback was admitted to the hospital yesterday suffering from a sprained right knee. No one, however, appeared to be close to hysterics, because the quarterback now is Richard Todd and he is not going to undergo surgery.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 7The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether financial limit on the liability of power companies for a nuclear explosion could be imposed by Congress without violating the constitutional rights of victims and survivors.

title: Scott Hamilton Quartet on Move
description: When Scott Hamilton, the young tenor saxophonist whose playing is evoking memories of such preWorld War II saxophone stars as Ben Webster, Coleman Hawkins and Lester Young, came to New York from Providence, R.I., 18 months ago, he was soon followed by the other members of a quartet that he had led in Rhode Island Chris Flory, guitarist; Phil Flanagan, bassist, and Chuck Riggs, drummer. Like most young jazz musicians newly arrived in New York, they have been scuffling for a living, taking freelance jobs wherever they could get them.

title: NOTICE TO BIDDERS
MINE BLASTS FATAL TO 26 TIED TO SAFETY VIOLATIONS
description: WASHINGON, Nov. 7(AP)A Federal agency says that faulty ventilation, safety violations and missed inspections preceded two coal mine explosions in Kentucky that killed 26 men, according to a published report.

description: LAST NIGHT'S GAME Hall of Fame Game Cleveland 106, Phoenix 94.

title: The Stage: Love Letters to Life
description: SYRACUSE, N. Y.Arnold Wesker's Love Letters on Blue Paper is having its world premiere engagement at Syracuse Stagea definite coup for this enterprising company. In January the work is scheduled to be presented at Britain's National Theater. Love Letters chronicles the last three months in the life of a ruggedly independent, retired labor leader. He is man with a gift for order and organization. Even as he awaits his death from leukemia, watching himself slowly disintegrate, he continues to make neat hospital corners on his bed and to work diligently on a book of art criticism.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7  With his scheduled foreign trip officially postponed, President Carter turned his attention today to preparations for a televised speech on energy tomorrow night, the third time in 10 months that he has used the national networks to appeal for public support of his beleaguered energy programs.

description: The Bulova Watch Company has named Sol E. Flick, vice chairman and general counsel as chairman of the executive. committee. Mr. Flick succeed,: C. P. Wiring, who after 16 months as chairman resigned to resume his fulltime corporate responsibilities at Stelux Manufacturing Ltd., Hong Kong.
