description: LONDON, Nov. 7 (Reuters)Powerstation workers today called off a slowdown that disrupted Britain's electricity supplies for a week.

title: About New York
description: It's not the Manichaean heresy but, as a problem, it ranks with theadmission of his friend, Governor Carey, that the days of wine and roses are over. It's what we call a cash deficiency, says Francis J. Mugavero, bishop of 1.5 million Roman Catholics in Brooklyn and Queens, as he begins an extraordinary campaign of costcutting and begging to try to shore up his diocesan budget.

title: France Reported to Halt Work On a Warship for South Africa
description: LORIENT, France, Nov. 6 (AP)The French Government has ordered a halt to construction and trial runs of a cor vette being built here for South Africa, maritime officials said today.

title: Argentine Weekly Confiscated
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 7Argentina's military Government confiscated today the edition for this week of Correo de la Semana, which devoted a frontpage editorial to labor strikes and economic policy. A Ministry of Interior decree said an article exaggerated the importance of strikes that have paralyzed railroads and subways. The workers are demanding pay increases. Strikes are illegal under the military regime.

title: Phoebe Snow Is a Relaxed Yet Exuberant Singer
description: It is time to stop calling Phoebe Snow and Linda Ronstadt eclectics. Eclectic they may be, in that they draw on a variety of musical styles for source material. But they are more than synthesizers. At this point, they are setting standards and directions in American popular music. They do not belong to an experimental wing of pop, they belong to its mainstream.

description: Question: Are you really the Wizard of Oz?

title: Court May Seek C.I.A. Kennedy File
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7(AP)Federal District Judge John J. Sirica indicated today that he might appoint a court official to read Central Intelligence Agency documents on the assassination of John F. Kennedy that the agency is trying to keep secret.

description: Racing Fans at Aqueduct Undaunted by Rain

title: ExRep. Passman Enters Hospital; Assails Articles on Tongsun Park

title: Italy and the Vatican Agree on Text of New Concordat
description: ROME, Nov. 7  Italian and Vatican negotiators have reached agreement on what the Italian Government regards as the final version of a new text to replace the concordat that has governed relations between the Roman Catholic Church and the Italian state since 1929.

title: BORGWARNER SEEKS BAKER INDUSTRIES
description: An offer to pay $118 million in cash for Baker Industries, the protectiveservices company. came yesterday from the BorgWarner Corporation, a widely diversified industrial company.

description: Because of an editing error, an article in The Times yesterday on new White House decision  making procedures stated erroneously that Dr. Frank Press, the President's science adviser, was a Nobel laureate in physics. The reference was to Dr. I. I. Rabi of Columbia University.

description: When Irene Freely became a nun in 1959, her habit displayed this much of my face, she says, cupping her hands in the shape of a softball.

title: Meadowlands Cancels Card: Bad Weather
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Nov. 7The Meadowlands canceled thoroughbred racing tonight after the third race when the jockeys refused to ride because of gusty winds and heavy rain.

title: WHITE HOUSE PLAN FOR STEEL INCLUDES IMPORT MONITORING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Carter Administration is developing as the centerpiece of its emerging program to aid the domestic steel industry a system of fair prices against which the Treasury would monitor steel imports. The reference prices would be worked out in consultation with foreign steelmakers.

title: Israel Warns of Retaliation for Firing From Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 7  Israel warned today that its forces would act intensively and quickly to restore quiet in the Lebanese border area if Palestinian guerrillas in southern Lebanon continued to shell northern Israeli communities.

title: About the Giants...
description: It is unlikely that Gordon Gravelle, who pulled a calf muscle in last Sunday's 2420 loss to the undefeated Dallas Cowboys, and Tom Mullen, who suffered another separation to his right shoulder, will be able to play against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers next Sunday. Coach John McVay said Bill Ellenbogen, a reserve guard, probably would start at left tackle. . . With Al Dixon out for the season with torn knee cartilage, and with the offensive tackles hurting (Ron Mikolajczyk, the right tackle, has two bad knees), it is expected a player or two will be added to the roster this week. Tight ends cut recently by other teams include Garry Butler (Tampa Bay). John McMakin (Seattle), Orlando Nelson (Detroit) and Fred Coleman (Buffalo) . McVay would not say so, but the coach might pe planning to start Jerry Golsteyn at quarterback against the Buccanneers, who have yet to win in 22 National Football League contests. The coach has been looking for a soft spot to use his other starting quarterback, and Joe Pisarcik was bloodied and bruised after suffering eight sacks against Cowboys.

title: The Economic Scene
description: Thomas E. Mullaney reports that the focus of economic attention is on the monetary actions of the Federal Reserve, with questions raised over the appropriateness of current monetary policy, the advisability of having an independent monetary body and whether the Fed should have new leadership. Page 49.

title: After 5 Years, Dam Inspections For Safety Still Have Not Started
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 President Carter expects to receive some time this month recommendations for starting a $15 million Federalstate inspection of privately built dams such as the one at Toccoa, Ga., that burst early yesterday, drowning dozens of persons.

title: PRICES UP SHARPLY IN GRAINS, SOYBEANS
description: Futures prices of soybeans and grains rose sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, mostly as a result of harvestdelaying rains and a belief by traders that a record amount of soybeans was exported last week.

title: Companies List Earnings Reports
Lost da Vinci Believed Under Florence Fresco
description: FLORENCE, Nov. 7(AP)An American financed research team, using sound and heat for the first time to look for art, has concluded that a lost masterpiece by Leonardo da Vinci is probably under another fresco in Florence's Great Council Hall.

title: Newark May Lease Health Centers at Night to Doctors
description: NEWARK, Nov. 7This city's acting health director said today that he was considering leasing neighborhood health centers to private physicians at night and on weekends in the hope of ,persuading them to practice medicine here rather than i' the state' more lucrative sub urhs.

title: Mrs. Carter Opens Fair
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7(AP)Rosalynn Carter, the wife of the President, opened the 28th Y.W.C.A. International Fair today and toured some of its displays of foods, handcrafts and toys from 32 countries. The booths were staffed by wives of ambassadors and diplomatic personnel from the embassies in Washington. The oneday fair, held at the Sheraton Park Hotel, also Included folk dances and an international fashion show,

description: The United States Attorneys in Manhattan and Brooklyn said yesterday that a special telephone number had been set up to receive complaints of possible violations of Federal election laws in today's election.

title: Victims in Bergen Fail to Identify Suspect Held in Rapes and Thefts
description: HACKENSACK, N.J.,Nov. 7Ten people, including two rape victims, who have been attacked or robbed by a lone gunman who has terrorized three Bergen County towns since last March were unable tonight to identify a 39yearold suspect arrested last Tuesday, lawenforcement sources said.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 8, 1977

title: ELECTION DAY
description: Public schools and libraries in New York City will be closed today for Election Day, a legal holiday in New York State. Municipal and state offices will also be closed. Alternatesideofthestreet parking regulations will be suspended for the day, and there will be no collections by the Sanitation Department.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Supreme Court left standing today a decision upholding in full the 1974 Commodity Exchange Act through which Congress moved to regulate option trading in many commodities for the first time.

description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has acknowledged that gave advance bidding information to the Hilton International Company in the competition to operate the many restaurants in the World Trade Center.

title: Investigator For N.C.A.A. Under Fire
description: An investigator for the National Collegiate Athletic Association has been accused by an Oklahoma bank president of misrepresenting himself as a Federal agent in October 1975 while he was seeking evidence in a case involving charges of improper recruiting by Oklahoma State University.

title: C.C.C.'s Export Rules Relaxed On Ships Stopping at Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7(UPI)  The Agriculture Department announced today a change in regulations of the Commodity Credit Corporation to permit the C.C.C. to finance exports of United Slates agricultural commodities loaded on foreign vessels that have stopped at ports in Cuba.

title: Mayoral Races End in 37 Big Cities With Focus on Young Candidates
description: After months of debate over everything from personalities to potholes, after final blaze of promises both extravagant and sincere, the mayoral campaigns in 37 of the nation's largest cities outside New York came to a close yesterday.

title: G.M. Declares Record $3.25 Payout
description: Directors of the General Motors Corporation declared a record yearend dividend of $3.25 a share on the common stock yesterday and, in the process, raised the regular quarterly payment rate to $1 from 85 cents a share.

title: Role of Joint Chiefs Under Study; Overhaul of Command Is Possible
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Defense Department has quietly undertaken major study involving the Joint Chiefs of Staff that could lead to a significant overhaul of the nation's military command structure.

title: Byrne and Bateman End Drives With a Day of Hard Campaigning
description: MURRAY HILL, Nov. 7Governor Byrne and State Senator Raymond H. Bateman ended their campaign for Governor today in blustery winds and a driving rain.

title: Election Day
description: It is time for the voters to utter the last word in the long process of choosing a mayor of New York City, governor of New Jersey, county executives of Nassau and Westchester and a legion of other officials. The complicity of the citizen in this process is crucial. The relatively large primary turnouts were an important signal to Washington and the rest of the nation, whose help needed to revive the depressed economies of the New York area. A display of voter interest today could well tighten our load tomorrow.

title: Once Upon a Time, Yiddish Spirit
description: ONCE UPON A TIME, a Yiddish musical. Dramatized and directed by Ben Bonus and Mina Bern; musical director, Renee Solomon; setting by Jerry Rothman; choreography by Tony Masullo; lighting by Mallory Perry; costumes by Sylvia Friedlander. Presented by Lively and Yiddish Productions Inc., in association with David Carey. At the Norman Thomas Auditorium, 33d Street and Park Avenue.

description: MOSCOW, Nov. 7With the rattle of tank treads and the tramping of boots on Red Square, the Soviet Union celebrated the 60th anniversary of the Bolshevik Revolution with a parade this gray, snowy morning.

title: Administration Heads Meet Carey On State's Budget After 10 Months
description: ALBANY. Nov. 7Governor Carey met for the first time in 10 months today with the leaders of his administration. The talk at the meeting, according to sources, concerned the election .vvr budget the Governor will recommend in January to the 1978 session of the Legislature.

title: Hospitals Turning to Advertising To Explain Service and High Costs
description: BOSTON, Nov. 7American hospitals, which rarely advertised in the past though there were no ethical canons against it, have begun to advertise in newspapers and periodicals in recent months.

title: NEW YORK CITY'S SALE OF NOTES DELAYED AGAIN
description: The longawaited start of New York City's sale of shortterm notes was put off again yesterday because of a disagreementnot resolved until late in the dayover whether the Emergency Financial Control Board should certify the accuracy of the city's prospectus.

title: Market Place
description: Raising new money through the sale of common stock is a big and growing problem for many companies in the United States. The problem is particularly acute for smaller corporations or those that enjoy less than giltedge credit status.

title: In Delhi, NY., Liquor Is Issue
description: DELHI, N.Y., Nov, 7The big issue in the election here tomorrow whether to go dry.

title: Ryan's Lawyer to Move for Mistrial, Citing Jury Confusion on Verdict
description: The lawyer for Thomas Ryan, a New York City police officer convicted last Saturday of criminally negligent homicide in the fatal beating of a prisoner, said yesterday he would move for a mistrial on the ground that the jury had misunderstood the law in reaching its verdict and had not been allowed to arrive at a different decision.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A fourweek postponement of legislative hearings into alleged abuses in surigal procedures was announced yesterday by Assemblyman Alan G.Hevesi of Queens, Chairman of the Assembly Health Committee.The hearings will be held Dec.8,15 and 22 int the State Office Buildings,250 Broadway.

title: Seventeen to Break Tradition on Cover
description: Readers of the November Seventeen magazine will discover via a fullpage ad that the publication for teenage girls will break a 33year tradition by running a boy on the cover of its March issue.

title: 67 Percent Turnout of Voters Is Expected in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Nov. 7State election officials said today they expected 67 percent of New Jersey's 3.6 million registered voters to go to th epolls tomorrow to select a Governor and new 120member legislature. Two bond referendums totaling $150 million, along with county and municipal elections, will also be decided.

title: Times Expands Tables
description: The New York Times today expanded its daily New York and American Stock Exchange composite tables to include dividend yields.

title: Lisa Forestiere, Who Ran Seating At Restaurant Near City Hall
description: . Lisa Forestiere, who for years ran the seating of City Hall figures lunching at the nearby Longchamps Restaurant on Broadway, died of cancer Sunday in New York Hospital: She was in her late 50's and lived at 251 East 50th Street.

title: Role of Joint Chiefs Under Study; Overhaul of Command Is Possible
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Defense Department has quietly undertaken a major study involving the Joint Chiefs of Staff that could lead to a significant overhaul of'the nation's military command structure.

title: Governor of Hong Kong Seeks New Curb on Police
description: HONG KONG, Nov. 7As Hong Kong remained embroiled in an angry controversy over investigating police corruption, the Governor, Sir Murray MacLehose, introduced emergency legislation today to dismiss police officers summarily if they disobeyed orders.

title: Eight Republican Senators Appeal For an End to Party Cannibalism
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7Eight Republican senators have appealed to their party's national chairman to help stop what they called cannibalism by fellow Republicans seeking to oust Republican members of Congress with whom they disagree.

title: Barge Explosion Kills Man
description: NEWPORT, R.I. Nov. 7 (UPI)An explosion in a 380foot barge loaded with asphalt killed one man and tossed two others into Narragansett Bay yesterday. The Coast Guard Marine Safety Office in Providence said that the barge, Interstate 71, was owned by Interstate Oil Transport of Philadelphia. The barge was carrying 67,000 barrels of asphalt to the J. J. Hudson Company in Providence.

title: New York City Hotels Hanging Up No Vacancy Signs
description: These are happy days for New York City's innkeepers.

title: British Official, in Zambia, Indicates Little Progress On Settlement in Rhodesia
description: LUSAKA, Zambia, Nov. 7 (Reuters)Field Marshal Lord Carver, Britain's administratordesignate for Rhodesia, indicated tonight that little progress had been made in his weekold effort to achieve a ceasefire in Rhodesia's guerrilla war.

title: 3 Minnelli Bits Dubbed in Ace
description: Reports by musicians who have seen The Act that Liza Minnelli was lipsynching many of her songs in the musical were denied yesterday by the show's producers.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: For the moment at. least, the focus of economic attention in the nation on the monetary actions of the Federal Reserve System and not so much on the state of the economy itself. What the central bank does in the next few weeks would have a profound impact on the tense financial markets in the Economic near term and on the Scene course of the economy next year. That uncertainty has again raised questions over the appropriateness of current monetary policy, the advisability of having an independent monetary body and whether there should be new Fed leadership.

title: ExPoliceman Says He Took No Bribes as a Captain
description: Adam Butcher, a retired New York City deputy police inspector on trial for perjury, yesterday testified that he had stopped accepting money from gamblers by the time he became a captainthe period investigated by the grand jury that indicted him.

title: AN APPEAL TO GIRLS  ON 'MINNESOTA STRIP'
description: Two Minneapolis police officers, in an unusual mission, were prevented yesterday by heavy rains from beginning search along Eighth Avenue's notorious Minnesota Strip for Midwestern teenagers who have become prostitutes in New York.

title: Hussein Confers With Assad
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 7 (Reuters)King Hussein of Jordan arrived here today from Cairo and went straight into talks with President Hafez alAssad on prospects for reconvening the Middle East peace conference in. Geneva. The King had visited Syria last Thursday before visiting Saudia Arabia and Egypt.

title: No article title
Carr Funeral Today
description: The funeral of Oscar Clark Carr Jr., president of the National Council on Philanthropy, who died on Saturday, will be held at 4 P.M. today at the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest. Fifth Avenue and 90th Street.

title: TV: Experiment With Longer News Feature Paying Off for NBC
description: Contrary to the lofty pronouncements of certain media specialists, the average television viewer may have an attention span of more than 60 or 90 seconds. That is the key conclusion to be drawn from the example of Segment 3, part of a revised format adopted by the NBC Nightly News.

title: Records of College Football Teams and the Schedules of Their Remaining Games
Soviet, at Age 60, Displays More Prudence Than Revolutionary Zeal in Its World Role
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 7As the Russians celebrate the 60th anniversary of the Bolshevik Revolution this week, they find themselves not at the vanguard of movement to overthrow the world order but at a height of global power where the perspective has long been more prudent and cautious than revolutionary. Their desire and capacity for influence has spread geographically through the years until now their warships sail the seas from Sakhalin to Mauritius, their military aid goes to more than 40 countries, and their economic help and trade relations extend into continent.

title: Crime Down 7.9%, Arrests Up 4.4%, New York Reports
description: A decrease in the number of known major crimes and an increase in the number of felony arrests were reported yesterday by the New York City Police Department for the first nine months of this year.

title: John Anthony and Calvin Klein in Top Form
description: John Anthony and Calvin Klein are the stars of the moment. Their clothes represent a goal to which other designers aspire. There is nothing complicated or tricky in either of their collections, which simply emphasize beautiful clothes.

title: Dam Break Toll at 38 as the Search for Dead Goes On
description: TOCCOA, Ga., Nov. 7 (UPI)Hundreds of rescue workers, aided by construction equipment, began an exhaustive search today through tons of smashed mobile homes, cars, mud and debris for more victims from yesterday's break of an earthen dam above this northeast Georgia town.

title: Bible School Dean Sees God's Plan in Disaster
description: TOCCOA, Ga., Nov. 7The rain falls on the just and the unjust, David Eby said, tugging idly at a piece of mudspattered rug, part of the debris left from yesterday's dam disaster that killed at least 38 persons on the campus of Toccoa Falls Bible College.

title: Memorial Services
description: MILLSTONEDorothy Loeo. Memor lal Meeting 2pm Sunday, November 13 at Church Center of The United Nations, 777 UN Plaza, entrance on 44 St.

title: Restoring Hope To the City
description: Restoring Hope To the City

title: Television
description: Election Coverage

title: An Operatic Evening Goes Well Despite Illness of 2 of 3 Singers
description: We know that winter is in the wings when people begin to come out on the stage, especially at the opera, and break it to the audience: Mr. or Miss SoandSo is suffering from a sore throat but will try to perform anyhow, with our kind indulgence. That task of diplomacy fell to Armen Boyajian, the program's pianist, at An Operatic Evening on Sunday night in Alice Tully Hall.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE MAKING OF THE WIZARD OF OZ.

title: Man Is Released on $50,000 Bond In Miami Trial on Export Charges
description: MIAMI, Nov. 7 (AP)A West German businessman charged with attempting to export defense materials to Communist countries has been freed on $50,000 bond, according to Federal officials.

title: S.E.C. Penalizes Cockrell for Fox Film Statements
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The Securities and Exchange Commission has charged Claude Cockrell Jr., the Nashville businessman who announced last May that he planned to take control of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation, with violating the antifraud provisions of Federal securities laws.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: LAST NIGHTS GAME Minnesota 5, Montreal 3. SUNDAY NIGHT'S GAMES Boston 5, Islanders 3. Mantis 3, Chicago 3. Buffalo 7, St. Louis 4. Detroit 4, Cleveland i. Philadelphia 3, Vancouver 2.

title: Profit Margin Rise Is Called Insufficient For Boom in Outlays
description: i Corporate profit margins rose in the first half this year but were insufficient to support a muchneeded boom in capital spending, Edgar R. Fiedler, vice president of economic research at the Conference Board, said in an analysis issued yesterday.

title: New Orleans Worker Is Arrested In Shooting of Wife and 9 Others
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 7 (UPI)An Internal Revenue Service worker shot his estranged wife and fatherinlaw in their home today and then began an hourlong series of shootings in the downtown area that wounded eight more persons, the police said.

title: Ex Deputy Police Inspector Says  He Took No Bribes as a Captain
description: Adam Butcher, a retired New York City deputy police inspector on trial for perjury, yesterday testified that he had stopped accepting money from gamblers by the time he became a captainthe period investigated by the grand jury that indicted him.

title: SENATOR SEEKS INQUIRY ON ARMSTALKS LEAKS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7(UPI)Senator Jchn C. Culver, Democrat of Iowa, called today for a full investigation of newspaper leaks of the United States negotiating position at the strategic arms negotiations.

title: In Memoriam
description: ?URGATCHAnna sladon. Mother grandmotherIn loving memory.

title: J. Hart Rosdail, 63, School teacher Who Held Record for World Travel
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 7 (Reuters)J. Hart for world travel223 countries and more than 1.5 million milesdied here yesterday at the age of 63.

title: Taxes &Accounting
description: The record thirdquarter loss recently reported by the Bethlehem Steel Corporation includes a $750 million pretax writeoff for plant shutdowns that raises some interesting accounting issues.

title: Notes on People
description: The Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra has named Thomas Schippers, now its music director, Conductor Laureate, lifetime post. Mr. Schippers, who is 47 years old and has led the symphony since 1970, has been ill with lung cancer for many months and has been unable to conduct. However, he expects to direct a minimum of four subscription programs a season in the future, and will be an adviser on artistic matters. Although retaining his title as music director, Mr. Schippers has indicated that the orchestra management should go ahead with a search for new conductor.

title: Some Prospective Jurors Excused As Trial on Hughes Will Opens
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Nov 7 (AP)Several prospective jurors were questioned and excused today on the first day of a trial to decide whether Howard R. Hughes wrote the socalled Mormon will.

title: Britain's National Theater in Red Because of Cost of Its New Home
description: LONDON, Nov. 7Britain's National Theater is in deep financial trouble, less than two years after it moved into its handsome modern building on the south bank of the Thames.

title: Violence Slowly Eases in Ulster, But Political Frustration Mounts
description: BELFAST, Northern IrelandAlmost every day brings new evidence of a return to normal life in scarred, weary Northern Ireland. Many are saying cautiously that the end of the troubles may be in sight. if not this year, maybe next.

title: Sears Picks Telling as Its New Chief
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 7Edward R. Telling Jr., senior executive vice president in change of field operations for Sears, Roebuck & Company, was elected today as chairman and chief executive officer.

title: Last Chance to Buy the Pennant?
description: If I ran my hamburger business like this, I'd go broke, Ray Kroc was saying the other day while the baseball clans were running their second annual revolution through the otherwise sedate ballroom of New York's Plaza Hotel.

title: Bridge:
description: The world's biggest team contest will get under way for the sixth time at the end of this month. The Grand National Team Championship, which attracted some 6,000 teams last season, will begin at the club level with a twosession qualifying stage. Contestants can choose between the following:

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, Nov. 7, 1977

title: Joffrey Revives As Time Goes By
description: What is the matter with Twyla Tha'p's As Time Goes By? Just as a clich can be a home truth that people do not wish to have brought home, in the same way a mannerism can be a style that people have tired of. There is no doubt that Miss Tharp's recent balletsto take her three for the Joffrey company simply as an examplebear such a strong, if superficial, family resemblance, that their individual differences of shape and mood may easily be missed.

title: Court Decision in Libel Suit Bars Inquiry Into Journalist's Thoughts
description: Journalists cannot be compelled to disclose the thoughts and opinions that they held when they were preparing a news story, even if the story is attacked in a libel suit, according to a landmark decision yesterday by a Federal appeals court in Manhattan.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 8, 1977

title: Address by Carter On TV at 9 To night
description: President Carter's address to the nation tonight will be telecast live by the three networks and their local stations Channels 2, 4 and 7and on Channel 13. The speech, which is scheduled to begin at 9 P.M., will be broadcast on radio over WCBSAM, WGBB, WINS, WNBC and WNYCAM.

title: BIG BOARD'S REVENUES  UP SHARPLY IN QUARTER
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that its thirdquarter net revenues from operations rose sharply, to $1.3 million from $225,000 in the yearago period. However, a spokesman noted, the 1976 third quarter was depressed by a $3.5 million charge for the purchase of the oddlot automation system from Carlyle & DeCoppet.

title: ELECTION DAY
description: Public schools and libraries in New York City will be closed today for Election Day, a legal holiday in New York State. Municipal and state offices will also be closed. Alternatesideofthestreet parking rgulations will be suspended for the day, and there will be no collections by the Sanitation Department.

title: Newark Mal, Lease Health Centers to Doctors at Night and Weekends
description: NEWARK, Nov, 7This city's acting health director said today that he was considering leasing neighborhood health centers to private physicians at night and on weekends in the hope of persuading them to practice medicine here rather than in the state's more lucrative suburbs.

title: Sears, Roebuck's New Chief
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 7As the board of directors of Sears, Roebuck & Company met today in a 66thfloor conference room of the Sears Tower, the 110story building was shrouded in fog and mist. If the scene had been shot for a movie, it could have Man been symbolic. For Sears has been dealing with a In the closely guarded business News secretits choice to succeed Arthur M. Wood, active in Sears management for 32 years and chairman and chief executive officer since Feb. 1, 1973.

title: STRIKING IRON MINERS REJECT BONUS OFFER
description: Striking iron ore miners of the United Steelworkers of America rejected yesterday an industry offer to end a 98dayold strike in Minnescla and Michigan. However, the union bargaining Committee in Duluth. Minn., is preparing a counterproposal.

title: Labor Plans Push in Congress for New Protectionist Trade Legislation
description: Organized labor, worried by heavy job losses in importsqueezed industries, plans a major push in Congress next year for an updated version of the BurkeHartke bill of 197174, the most controversial of all protectionist trade initiatives.

title: CONGRESS MAY NOT TRY TO UPSET REACTOR VETO
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP)Congress will probably not try to override President Carter's veto of a bill authorizing $80 million for a breeder reactor project that he wants halted, Congressional sources said today.

title: DOCK NEGOTIATORS AWAIT ANNUAL PAY AGREEMENTS
description: Negotiators in the ports of Boston, Baltimore and Philadelphia are still attempting to work out local pacts on the guaranteed annual income issue with striking longshoremen before resuming toplevel negotiations on a master contract, an industry spokesman said yesterday

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Some Investigators Leave Uruguay
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay Nov. 7The horsemen Investigating the CinzanoLebon switch that had its roots here in May have been satisfied and returned today to the United States, but the prosecutors stayed on to squeeze out further evidence.

title: Knicks Lineup
description: AT GARDEN, 7:30 P.M. TELEVISIONCHANNEL E (CABLE) RADIOWNEW, 7:30 P.M. KNICKS SAN ANTONIO

title: Venezuela Sees `Some Increase In OPEC Prices
90% of a Town Posted Against Deer Hunters
description: TYRINGHAM, Mass., Nov. 7(AP)Some of the finest deerhunting country in Massachusetts is offlimits today because angry residents have posted more than 90 percent of the town against hunters for the start of the bowandarrow season.

title: Latvian Accused of War Crimes Gets Deportation Hearing Delayed
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 7(AP)The Federal deportation hearing of Karlis Detlavs, a 66yearold Baltimore resident accused of Nazi war crimes, that was scheduled to begin today. has been postponed until next Monday because of the illness of a Government lawyer, according to offi: vials of the Immigration and Naturalization Service here.

title: SEX BIAS IN SCHOOLS PERSISTS, GROUP SAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (AP)The Government's lackadaisical enforcement of a 1972 law barring sex discrimination in schools has allowed unfair treatment of female students and teachers to persist, a women's rights group charged today.

title: Nurses in Poison Case Released
description: DETROIT,Nov. 7 (AP)Two nurses convicted of poisoning patients at a veterans hospital in Michigan have been freed from a Federal prison while lawyers try to win a new trial. Filipino Narciso, 31 years old, of Ypsilanti, and Leonora Perez, 33, of Ann Arbor. were released Saturday from the Alderson Federal Reformatory for Women in Alderson, W. Va. They had undergone six weeks cit courtordered psychiatric tests while in the prison.

title: Knicks Sue Nets for $3.2 Million; Al Skinner Is Dealt to Pistons
description: The New York Knicks sued the financially troubled New Jersey Nets yesterday for $3.2 million and interest, money owed under an indemnification agreement that allowed the Nets to join the National Basketball Association last year.

title: 67 Percent Turnout of Voters Is Expected in State With Gubernatorial and Legislative Races on Ballot
description: TRENTON, Nov.7State election officials said today they expected 67 percent' of New Jersey's 3.6 million registered voters to go to the polls tomorrow to select a Governor and new 120member legislature. Two bond referendums totaling $150 million, along with county and municipal elections, will also be decided.

title: In Praise of Zero.
description: Newsweek magazine, rather cleverly in my opinion, has seized upon the term . `zerobase' as it applies to starting from scratch and looking at alternative media approaches... Newsweek and magazines in general have everything to gain and very little to lose in fostering this approach:

title: Amtrak Is Stalled By Many Problems, Physical and Fiscal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The headquar ters of Amtrak stand at the modern L'Enfant Plaza opposite the United State: Postal Service, and even if they were not so close they would still invite compari, son.

title: Advertising
description: In recent weeks a lot seems to have been said about the 24hour recall method of advertising copy testing. Not that it's all that new. Burke Marketing Research, Cincinnati,. a leading practitioner, has been at it since the early 1950's.

title: Amtrak Is Stalled By Many Problems, Physical and Fiscal
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7The headquarters of Amtrak stand at the modern L'Enfant Plaza opposite the United States Postal Service, and even if they were not so close they would still invite comparison.

title: 2 Socialist Candidates Left Off List in Error
description: The names of two candidates who will be on the ballot today were inadvertently omitted from the list published in The New York Times on Monday. The two candidates are David M. Corry, Socialist Party candidate for Brooklyn Borough President, and Kenneth Boss, Socialist Party candidate for Councilman at Large in Brooklyn.

title: Wood, Field & Stream: A Sporting Collector's Handbook
description: Even the most casual observer of the sporting scene must be aware of the enormous increase in value of old waterfowl decoys, sporting art prints and originals, and books on fishing and hunting in the decades since World War II.

title: More Nuclear Debate
description: President Carter says his first veto, which killed $80 million appropriated for the Clinch River breeder reactor, was intended to preserve his policy to curb proliferation of nuclear weapons technology. Symbolically, it may be more than thata first step back from the Government's undeviating postwar commitment to the development of nuclear power plants, at whatever cost.

title: RAIN CUTS ESTIMATE OF ELECTION TURNOUT AS CAMPAIGN CLOSES
description: New York City's four major mayoral candidates completed their campaigns yesterday amid drenching, wind  blown rain that chased politicians indoors and trimmed the forecasts of the likely turnout.

title: The Mist In Economics
description: WATERLOO, OntarioFifty years ego, Wesley Clair Mitchell, longtime professor .of economics at Columbia University, remarked that it was not economic theory that deserved attention, but rather the mental state of the theorists.

title: Veterinarian in Ringer Case Remains a Man of Mystery
description: Two weeks after being suspended for .possible racing fraud, Dr. Mark Gerard remains almost as much mystery as the ringer case that caused his troubles.

title: ISRAELI PLEDGES EMBARGO ON ARMS TO SOUTH AFRICA
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 7 (AP)Israel will adhere to a United Nations Security Council resolution calling for a wordwide arms embargo against South Africa, reported to be one of Israel's major markets for small weapons, a Foreign Ministry spokesman said today.

title: Nuns in Casual Clothes Fight Poverty in Bronx
description: When Irene Freely became a nun in 1959, her habit displayed this much of my face, she says, cupping her hands in the shape a softball.

title: Jazz: Dexter Gordon in Regal Jam
description: If the last week can be taken as an indication, a bebop resurgence is on the way. On Thursday, Birdland,. the Broadway nightclub named for the seminal bebopper, Charlie (Bird) Parker, and the most celebrated home of bop during the 50's, was revived for a night as a recordcompany promotion. And, Sunday evening, Dexter Gordon, who a year ago made a triumphant return to the United States from Europe after being heard infreequently here since the 50's, gave his first concert at Avery Fisher Hall, a concert that transported its enthusiastic audience back to the bebop era.

title: Judy Carter: TroubleShooter for the Equal Rights Amendment
description: WASHINGTONJudy Carter, the President's daughterinlaw, who likes to describe herself as a housewife from Calhoun, Georgia, has emerged as one of the leading spokesmen for the stalled equal rights amendment.

title: Stock Tables Explained
Free Bulb Plan Dims in Detroit Following Suit
description: DETROIT, Nov. 7It had become as much an institution in this city as the automobile production line. And people had come to depend on it. Now, however, it appears that the free light bulb program, is over.

title: Ted Snyder, Suburban Tragedy
description: HUNTINGTON STATION, L.I.Archimedes claimed to be able to raise the world with a lever, given some extraterrestrial bench or bump to rest the lever upon. Likewise, a play that seeks to detonate the tragedy in everyday life needs some device, condition or character outside the ordinary terms of this life.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: A BREED APART: Horse lovers were not fazed by yesterday's rain as they found various ways to stay reasonably dry at Aqueduct. At right, Line Slippers, Jacinto Vasquez up, won sixth race.

title: New Attack Made in Nevada on an Old Profession
description: PIOCHE, Nev.Like nocturnal mirages glowing inexplicably in the desert's night sky, three clusters of lights provide incongruous beacons for motorists driving along a lonely strip of State Highway 93 north of Las Vegas. Signs read: Kitten Creek, Shari's Ranch, and Judy's Coyote Spring Ranch. They are legal houses of prostitution.

title: Pavarotti Ticket Sale Sunday
description: Single tickets for Luciano Pavarotti's recital at the Metropolitan Opera House on Feb. 12 will he placed on sale at the box office next Sunday at noon. The tenor's recital, the first from the Met stage by a classical singer, will be broadcast in the Live from Lincoln Center series.

title: Western Nations at Belgrade Talks Assail Communists Again on Rights
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 7 (Reuters)Western nations at the European security conference today launched fresh attack against alleged violations of human rights by Sovietbloc countries.

title: Around the Nation
description: MIAMI, Nov. 7A Circuit Judge today sentenced 16yearold Ronald Zamora to life imprisonment for the murder of an elderly Miami Beach neighbor.

title: Jail Is Upheld in Teacher Strike
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 7The jail sentences and fines imposed on the Lakeland Federation of Teachers and its members, who are engaged in what is now the state's longest teachers strike, were upheld today by a fourjudge panel of the Appellate Division of New York State Supreme Court. At the same time, the court criticize' the union' members for continuing disrespect of the law and the court.

title: Colts Struggle to a 103 Victory Over Redskins on Pass by Jones
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 7(AP)Bert Jones drilled two key thirddown passes to Freddie Scott early in the fourth quarter, including a 12yard touchdown toss, to give the Baltimore Colts a 103 victory over the Washington Redskins in a National Football League game tonight.

title: Rain and High Winds Lash Area, Causing Floods and Train Delays
description: Two inches of rain and galeforce winds battered the metropolitan area yesterday, and the National Weather Service said the storm would last at least until the early morning hours today.

title: Violence Slowly Eases in Ulster, But Political Frustration Mounts
description: BELFAST, Northern IrelandAlmost every day brings new evidence of a return to normal life in scarred, weary Northern Ireland. Many are saying cautiously that the end of the troubles may be in sightif not this year, maybe next.

title: Family in Belfast Learning to Live With Terrorism
description: BELFAST, Northern IrelandOn a holiday abroad a few months ago, Anne McLaughlin went into a department store for a few small purchases.

title: Chinese Report a Possible Comet
description: PEKING, Nov. 7(Agence FrancePresse)  Chinese astronomers have spotted celestial body that could be a new comet, the press agency Hsinhua reported today. the fast moving, blurred form was picked up on the night of Nov. 3 by the Nanking observatory, the agency said.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: Article 2  No Title

title: Carter Signs E.P.A. Funds Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Oct. 8 (UPI)President Carter signed today a bill authorizing nearly $254 million for the Environmental Protection Agency, including $35 million for energyrelated research and development. The funds go toward the agency's air, water, toxics, isecticides, resource conservation and research and devopmnt programs.

title: Argentine Implicates Horse Case's Gerard
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 8With an agonized mixture of loyalty and feelings of betrayal, an Argentine veterinarian acknowledged tonight that his friend and sometime employer, Dr. Mark Gerard of Muttontown, LI., had once asked him to find a cheap horse with markings similar to those of a good horse Gerard had already decided to buy.

title: Trust The Russians?;
description: NEW HAVEN  The other day 1 went to a meeting at one of those august foundations where men and women of earnest mien and weighty credentials sit around to discuss the public dilemmas of the moment. In this case, the topic was arms control, and howindeed whether to negotiate an accord with the Russians to limit nuclear weapons.

title: 24 Killed in Southern India
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 8 (Reuters)At least 24 people were killed and three injured in flash floods and landslides in Palghat in the southern coastal state of Kerala, Samachar news agency reported today. Quoting an official spokesman, it said that most of the bodies had been recovered and the injured admitted to a hospital.

title: U.N. PANEL ISRAEL BARRED ASSAILS RULE OVER ARABS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y.,Nov. 8A threemember committee that was not permitted to visit Israelioccupied Arab territories has reported that life there is marked by demonstrations and riots attributable to the fact of occupation.

title: DEMOCRAT IS MAYOR
description: Representative Edward I. Koch was elected New York City's 105th Mayor yesterday, but fell short of the clear majority he had hoped for and expected.

title: Carter Adds to Sugar Import Fees
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  President Carter today imposed a fee of 3.3 cents pound on all imported sugar and increased the tarif on it by 0.9 cents to 2.81 cents a pound, the Agriculture Department announced.

title: HIGH COURT MAKES SUING NATIONAL BANK SIMPLER
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 8 (AP)The Supreme Court ruled today that national !banks could be sued in state courts any county where they have a branch. The thTicion may make it easier for cidzens to bring civil suits against banks.

title: Illinois Gets Bill to Ban Concorde
description: SPRINGFIELD, III., Nov 8 (Reuters)A bill to ban the Concorde supersonic jeliner from landing at Chicago's O'Hare nternatinal Airport, the world's busiest, was introduced today in the Illinois General Assembly. The people who live near airports that are potential SST landing sites deserve this kind of protection until the impact of noise pollution generated by large aircraft is determined, said Representative John Porter. the bill's chief sponsor.

title: Soviet Air Force Reported Testing 3 New Jets, Including Swift Bomber
description: The Soviet Union, according to United States Government sources, is carrying out flight development trials for three new combat aircraftthe MIG29 fighter, a closesupport plane and a supersonic bomber apparently based on the TU144 passenger transport.

title: Wine Talk
description: ONE OF the newest and most promising wine regions in California is Monterey County with its vast Salinas Valley made famous in the novels of John Steinbeck. Many experts predict that Monterey, once known as the salad bowl of the world because of its enormous lettuce and celery production, may one day become the most important of all California wine districts.

title: Arafat and Sadat Meet to Discuss Plans for Geneva Peace Talks
description: CAIRO, Nov. 8 (UPI)Yasir Arafat, the head of the Palestinian Liberation Organzation, met for two hours today with President Anwar elSadat of Egpt for talks on the United Statesled initiative to reconvene the Geneva Middle East peace conference.

title: Jackson, Critical of Arms Pact, Rejects Leak Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Senator Henry M. Jackson, an influential voice on arms control in Congress, said today that he was dissatisfied with the outline of anagreement on strategicarms limitation being worked out with the Soviet Union. He said he would not be deterred in his criticism by charges from other senators that his subcommittee was responsible for unauthorized disclosures to the press.

title: Harland Manchester, 79; A Former Roving Editor For The Reader's Digest
description: Harland Manchester, an author who was also a roving editor for The Reader's Digest for 30 years, until his retirement several years ago, died Sunday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived at 50 Commerce Street.

title: The U.N. Today
Loews Lifts Quarter Profit 17.8%; J. Ray McDermott Shows 17% Drop
description: The Loews Corporation reported yesterday a 17.8 percent increase in net income for the third quarter.

title: Malaysia's Islamic Party Quitting Governing Coalition in a Protest
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Nov.8 (Reuters)The Islamic Party's Cabinet. ministers and parliamentary secretaries resigned from Malaysia's coalition Government today as a protest against a bill to impose federal rule in the troubled state of Kelantan. where the party has its power base.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: DURING A RECENT discussion about beef Stroganoffone of the longtime, classic dishes in quick cookeryI had to admit I had never heard of the dish's origin. Someone recalled one of the rare books on Russian food to have been printed in this country, The Best of Russian Cookery, by Princess Alexandra Kropotkin (Charles Scribner's Sons, 1964).

title: Jerseyans Pass Medical School and Shore Bond Issues
description: New Jersey's voters yesterday approved two bond issues that would finance a $30 million improvement of the state's shoreline from Cape May to New York Harbor and a $120 million program for stepping up the state's medical education program.

title: Around the Nation
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 8 (AP)A study of three American cities says that massive busing to achieve a racial balance in the schools will work only if the white suburbs are included.

title: Recital: Interpretive Cellist
description: Aaron Shapinsky's rather iconoclastic renditions of the Brahms cello sonatas Sunday afternoon at Carnegie Recital Hall may not have been performances to live with, but they were more than worth hearing one time around.

title: How to Keep a Promise to the Poor
description: One of the political problems of being poor in America is promises. Congress made one promise in 1974 when it tied up a bundle of Federal'urban aid programs into Community Development Revenue Sharing. It directed that billions be spent, principally for persons of low and moderate income, in decaying cities. But the promise has not been kept. Much of the money has been diverted to other, sometimes unworthy purposes. Now, the Department of Housing and Urban Development has proposed a new way to insure that the Federal beneficence goes where it is supposed to go. Among municipal officials around the country, it is not a popular proposal; but it deserves support.

title: Memorial Services
description: LEVITTSaul. Memorial services for Saul Levitt will be held at the Auditorium of the Lincoln Center Performing Arts Library, 111 Amsterdam Ave, on Wednesday, November 9, 1977 at 6 p.m.

title: New F.C.C Chief Meets Resistance
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8In one of his first offficial acts last week as the new chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, Charles D. Ferris issued an order to his employees. What happened was not what he wanted to happenjust as Harry S. Truman could have told him.

title: Mysterious Object Beyond Saturn May Be Solar System's 10th Planet
description: Astronomers have discovered an object between Saturn and Uranus that is orbiting the sun. They say the object could represent a new class of asteroid or perhaps be the solar system's 10th and smallest planet.

title: Jersey Is Hardest Hit 1 Death Reported
description: Thousands of homes were flooded and roads were clogged with stalled vehicles all over the metropolitan suburbsparticularly New Jerseyas a heavy rainstorm moved north along the coast yesterday.

title: U.S. Juniors In Soccer At Monaco
description: The United States youth soccer team left Air Monte Carlo, Monaco, last night to play against the best squads in the world in a tournament previously restricted to European nations.

title: Radio
description: 79:50 A.M., WKCR. Double BassConcerto, Koussevitzky; Pasrtita for Chamber Orchestra, Koechlin; Quatro Forme per Archi, Kubelik; Concerto Grosso, Kraft; String Quartet No. 2, Koch; String Quartet No. 2, Kodaly.

title: 2 Young Democrats Are Easy Winners In Assembly Races
description: Two young Democrats won sweeping victories in offyear Assembly races in the Bronx and Brooklyn yesterday. The victories, for 27yearold Sean P. Walsh and 29yearold Samuel Hirsch, were not surprises in either of their overwhelmingly Democratic districts.

title: At Japanese School, Food Is for Thought
description: TOKYO

title: Offering Tunes Other Than the Pied Piper's
description: At 17, Cora had left school and home to devote her life to God's Army. She was 19 when I met her and was glad to discuss the benefits of her conversion. Her religion had taken away the anxiety that had once made all contacts with people acutely painful.

title: Carter Tells Nation Energy Bills Must Meet His Criteria of Equity
description: WASHINGTON.Nov. 8  President Carter said tonight that he would sign energy legislation only if it meets the basic criteria for equity and effectiveness on which he based his initial energy Proposals to Congress last April.

title: Purcell Leads G.O.P. in Nassau, Taking County Executive's Post
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Wednesday, Nov. 9Nassau County Republicans scored major victory yesterday when they elected their candidates for the County Executive, County Comptroller and town posts.

title: Beene: Becoming a Milestone in American Fashion
description: Geoffrey Beene is the only designer on Seventh Avenue whose collections have an outoftown tryout. The test run isn't in Philadelphia or Boston. It's in Milan, which is hardly the boon. docks. Buyers from all over the world stop off there on the way to Paris.

title: ITALY IS FRUSTRATED BY SIEGE OF VIOLENCE
description: ROME, Nov. 8An executive of the Alfa Romeo automobile company was shot and wounded as he went to work in Turin this morning, and a rich and titled landowner was kidnapped last night in a Rome suburb in the latest of a series of attacks that have become almost daily occurrences in Italy.

title: Stein Defeats Wagner by 3 to 2 To Take Manhattan Borough Post
description: Andrew J. Stein was elected Borough President of Manhattan last night in a lavishly financed, politicallyscrambled race between the young sons of politically powerful fathers.

title: S.I. Floods Leave a Sad Residue
description: When the fireman came for Evelyn Mastronardi in a rowboat, the main thing she was worried about was her cat.

title: Dole Doubts Republican Backing Canal Treaties Can Win 80 Nomination
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Senator Robert Dole, Republican of Kansas, said today that it would be difficult for anyone to win the izeoubliean Presidential nomination in 1980 unless he opposed the Panama Canal treaties.

title: CYRIL R. TOBIN
description: HILLSBOROUGH, Calif.,Nov. 8(UPI)Cyril R. Tobin, a San Francisco Bay area lawyer and a director of the Hibernia Bank, died yesterday at his home. He was 97 years old.

title: Byrne, Shy Yet Tough, Survived Loss of Popularity on Tax Issue
description: Brendan Thomas Byrne's mixture of shyness and toughmindedness have made him one of the leastunderstood, most controversial New Jersey Governors in recent state history. And, until a few months before his stunning reelection victory yesterday, he was also one of the most unpopular Governors the state ever had.

title: One Dutch Sextuplet Dies
description: ROTTERDAM, the Netherlands, Nov. 8 (AP)Dennis Nijssen, the youngest of the Dutch sextuplets born Sept. 18, died early today in the Sophia Children's Clinic, hospital authorities announced. The 7weekold infant underwent an operation a month ago for a perforated intestine. His condition improved following the surgery, but he suffered a relapse on Thursday. The five other children, boy and four girls, were reported in good condition at the Leiden University Hospital.

title: Korean in U.S. Tells About Holding $400,000 for an Official of K. I. A.
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. SAbout two years ago a Korean businessman. Choi Che Yung. was called into the office of a senior official of the South Korean Central Intelligence Agency and asked to do a personal favor for the officer.

title: Stage: Poe Facsimile
description: THERE IS A double challenge, one to the performer and one to the audience, that is implicit in a oneman show, the ultimate venture in theatrical selfconfidence short of hanging by your teeth from a thread in the ceiling.

title: Sketches of Three Winners in Citywide Elections
description: His political career has taken unusual twists philosophically and politically.... Almost a symbol of ultraliberal reformer when he first attracted public attention in 1963 by defeating Carmine G. DeSapio for the Greenwich Village Democratic leadership. . . . Angered many liberals by what they perceived as a pragmatic shift toward right with his positions on Forest Hills lowincome housing and death penalty. . . . Elected to City Council in 1966 in what had been a Republican district on East Side. . . . Two years later, was elected to House of Representatives, first Democrat in 31 years to represent Silk Stocking district. . . . Dropped mayoral bid in 1973 for lack of funds. . . . A prodigious worker, a bachelor, will he 53 next month, . Studied at City College, law degree from New York University in 1948. . . . World War 11 Army veteran.

title: U.S. AND CUBAN SCHOLARS HOLD A QUIET CONFERENCE
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn., Nov. 8 (UPI)For the first time since Cuba and the United States broke off relations in 1961, scholars from both countries met last month at an unpublicized conference.

title: BATEMAN IS ROUTED
description: Governor Byrne completed one of the most dramatic comebacks in New Jersey political history yesterday, winning reelection by defeating a popular Republican legislator while defending an unpopular state income tax.

title: Money
description: Tuesday, November 8, 1977

title: Mayoral Races In 6 Major Cities
description: The incumbent Mayor, Ralph J. Perk, a Republican, ran third in the primary election. Seeking to succeed him in the officially nonpartisan contest are two young Democrats, Dennis J. Kucinich and Edward F. Feighan. The winner will be the youngest mayor of a major American city. Mr. Kucinich, 31, of CroatianIrish extraction, is the city's Clerk of Courts. Hellas taken an antiestablishment position. Mr. Feighan, 30, whose background is IrishGerman, is a state legislator backed by the city's Democratic organization.

title: STRIKES BY TEACHERS ISSUE IN LEGISLATURE
description: TRENTON,Nov. 8Two bitter strikes by teachers figure to present the State Legislature with its first major headache when it reconvenes Nov. 21.

title: Toledo Votes Funds To Reopen Schools
description: TOLEDO. Ohio, Nov. 6Toledo voters approved an increase in their municipal school levy today, assuring the reopening of schools tomorrow. The vote was 56,054 to 44,710.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 9, 1977

title: Bakke Case: Many Moderates Near Consensus on College Admissions
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8  The Bakke case has provoked a great deal of angry rhetoric about affirmative action programs that favor racial minorities in university admissions. As the Supreme Court debates its decision, however, a growing number of moderates on both sides seem to be reaching a consensus on the best way to deal with this emotional issue. This consensus was expressed by President Carter, in a letter he wrote recently to the American Jewish Committee about the Government's brief as a friend of the court. The brief, he wrote, firmly supported affirmative action programs as a way to overcome the effects of prior discrimination. By contrast the brief recognized that programs using rigid racial quotas, are exclusionary and therefore unconstitutional.

title: NEW FINANCING GAINS IN CORPORATE ISSUES
description: The corporate bond market showed surprising amount of new financing activity yesterday while much of the credit markets, led by many commercial banks on the East Coast, were closed for Election Day.

title: MARTHA B. L. SLATER
description: Martha Byers Lyon Slater, a former chairman of the women's division of the National Heart Association and an active fundraiser for charities in the New York area, died yesterday at her home in Locust Valley, L.I. She was 77 years old.

title: Higher Value Put on Westway Shift
description: The amount of money available to New York City for masstransit projects if the city decides to trade in the Federal funds allotted to the Westway project would be about $798 million, not the $735 million mentioned earlier by those in favor of the tradein, according to the Department of Transportation.

title: Bigger Banks Are Cutting Rates in Drive for Loans
description: The nation's larger banks, reacting to sluggish loan demand from their biggest corporate borrowers, are competing fiercely with one another in the breadandbutter business of making loans to companies.

title: A Clear Victory for Briton
description: LONDON, Nov. 8 (Agence FrancePresse)A 32yearold Briton today won the title of world's fastest window washer, beating the previous record by 10 seconds. Dick Baterip washed three British standardsize windows5 feet 3 inches by 4 feet 3 inchesin 48 seconds.

title: Credit Act Findings By Fed Denounced
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8The Federal Reserve has come under fire for two recent actions ?? it critics say wile undermine the equal lending laws.

title: Bomb Sniffing Dogs Assigned
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8 (UPI)Trained teams of bombsniffing dogs and their handlers have been assigned to the police departments of 29 cities, and are situated within 30 minutes flying time of almost any airport, the Law Enforcement Assistance Administration reports.

title: Film: A Vanished Tribe
description: AT THE END of the 19th century, there were between 3,500 and 4,000 Selk'nam Indians in Tierra del Fuego, at the southernost tip of South America. This year, after a history of decimation by the white man and disease, there is only one. The Ona People: Life and Death in Tierra Del Fuego shows her wandering rather dazedly through the streets of Buenos Aires on her first trip to that city, peering into store windows and marveling at strange animals in the zoo.

title: Father Defeats Son In Upstate Election
description: In the unusual race for the post of Town Justice of upstate Rose, N. Y., William Wilson, the Republican incumbent, defeated the Democratic challenger, his son, Robert Wilson.

title: Jersey Is Hardest Hit 1 Death Reported
description: Thousands of homes were flooded and roads were clogged with stalled vehicles all over the metropolitan suburbsparticularly New Jerseyas a heavy rainstorm moved north along the coast yesterday.

title: Ed Koch Has It
description: Ed Koch has won a handsome victory. He is the clear choice of the electorate to lead New York City through a dismal time. He triumphed over formidable opposition and, in the general election, over men of quality and promise, Mario Cuomo and Roy Goodman. So as the Mayorelect sets out to instruct us in the predicaments of the city's public and private economies and to enlist the people's help and sacrifice, he will speak with authority and a claim on their loyalty. We extend to him our warmest coneratulations.

title: Reports on Inspection of Georgia Dam Are Conflicting
description: TOCCOA, pa., Nov. 8 (AP)The last inspection of the dam above Toccoa Falls Bible College was a subject of confusion today, but apparently students and staff members were the only persons who regularly checked it.

title: GRIFFIN WINS EASILY IN BUFFALO VOTING
description: State Senator James D. Griffin, a hardEigtting maverick Democrat for most of his political life, easily defeated five other candidates yesterday in the hotly contested race for Mayor of Buffalo, the state's second largest city.

title: Couturiers Dabble
description: PARIS  FOOD IS NO longer simply a matter of gastronomy. It is now a matter of fashion, said Edmond Bory, theguiding light behind Fauchon, Paris's most elegant grocery store. If food is fashion, then what do some of the leading French designers think about fashions in food? The answers, gleaned during meals and conversations with five designers, indicated interesting consistencies. The avowed themes were, for the most part, quality and simplicity, an absence of intricate garnishes and complicated sauces that brcak the line of the dish and mask the basic characteristics of the food itself.

title: Health Snacks Snap, Pop...Fizzle
description: If 1975 was the year of the Pringle, then 1977 is the year of the all new, old fashioned natural  style potato chip. The same public that two years ago embraced the chemicalladen Pringle now demands, and gets, potato chips, corn chips, pretzels and caramel corn without additives, preservatives or artificial flavors.

title: Miss Evert Takes Opener In Wightman Cup Matches
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 8The most notable current rivalry in women's tennis, between Chris Evert and Virginia Wade, marked the opening of the 49th annual Wightman Cup competition between the United States and Britain tonight at the Oakland Coliseum.

title: Vorster Says Whites Can Withstand U.N. Pressure
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 8  Prime Minister John Vorster said tonight that neither the mandatory arms embargo imposed by the United Nations nor a possible oil boycott would force whites in South Africa to cede power to the numerically preponderant blacks.

description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 8, 1977
