title: Technology
description: The war of the plastic bottlesacrylonitrile against polyesteris not completely over even though a ban on acrylonitrile bottles is scheduled to take effect Dec. 22.

title: Private Lives
description: WERE we to look at the living room with the same sharp eye for symbols that we bring, say, to a Russian triptych, we might find something of iconographic significance. Then again, we might not. On the left is a daguerreotype; on the right, an ashtray and a bottle; to the north, books; to the south, sound.

title: Santucci Easily Defeats Nadjari For District Attorney of Queens
description: District Attorney John J. Santucci of Queens easily defeated his challenger, Maurice H. Nadjari, last night, taking a lead shortly after the polls closed and increasing it steadily.

title: Court Says Connecticut Must Let ExFelons Be Private Detectives
description: NEW HAVEN,Nov. 8Connecticut may not deny a convicted felon licensing as a private detective or security officer, a threejudge panel has ruled.

title: Israel Attacks Sites in Southern Lebanon With Jet and Artillery
description: TEL AVIV,Nov. 8Israeli gunners bombarded Palestinian guerrilla concentrations in southern Lebanon today with heavy artillery fire, the military command here announced. It said the action was in retaliation for new rocket attacks on northern Israel.

title: Music: Ensemble Magic
description: EVERY FALL, for the last 13 years, Music from Marlboro has sent out on tour a select number of musicians who have participted in the summer classes and concerts at Rudolf Serkin's celebrated Vermont festival. This year one group consists entirely of woodwind players and nine of them gathered on the stage of Alice Tully Hall Monday night to demonstrate the benefits gained from long months of polishing ensemble technique.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Best Buys: Chuck Steaks, Chickens, Chops
description: THIS being the first full week of the new month, many of the people who keep an eye on the food supply are taking a leaf from the almanacs and busying themselves with longrange forecasts.

title: Personal Health
description: THE DOCTOR called it honeymoon cystitis. To the 26yearold bride of six months, it was no honeymoon. As she described her distress to the doctor, she said If this doesn't get cleared up, it will soon be divorce cystitis.

title: Bridge:
description: MANILA, Nov. 8An international title will go to India, for the first time in bridge history, unless there are some very surprising results during the last two days of play at the Far East bridge championships.

title: Pennsylvania Town Mourns 10
description: ST. MARY'S, Pa., Nov. 8What was planned as a joyous occasion last Sunday by the St. Mary's Christian and Missionary Alliance Church turned into one of mixed emotions instead.

title: U.S. Is Said to Finish Moscow Blood Tests
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 8 (AP)Medical tests have shown that one of every 29 adults at the United States Embassy in Moscow suffers from a mysterious blood condition resulting in abnormally high levels of white blood cells, embassy sources said today.

title: An Outsider, 31 ,Wins in Cleveland; Young Reelected Detroit Mayor
description: Dennis J. Kucinich, a 31yearold polit ical maverick, defeated the regular Democratic organization in Cleveland yesterday to become the youngest mayor of a major American city.

title: Elections in Connecticut Produce a Few Surprises
description: In Connecticut elections sprinkled with a few big surprises, Mayor Jennie Cave of Norwalk appeared in early returns to have lost on two countsshe was defeated in her bid for reelection and also in her wish to have the new courthouse that had been her favorite project in her two years in office named after her.

title: Soybean Prices Decline Sharply
description: Soybean futures declined sharply yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: CHARLES ERICKSON
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.,Nov. 8(UPI)Charles (Chuck) Erickson, athletic director at the University of North Carolina from 1952 until 1968, died tonight in a hospital at the age of 70.

title: Deaths
description: ADDISCary. On November 6, 1977. Cherished daughter of Bertha and Aaron, dear sister of Dennis and loved friend of all who knew her. Memorial service for friends and family Thursday, November 10, 2PM, University Chapel, Columbia University, 117 Street and Amsterdam Avenue.

title: Advertising
description: At 8:30 yesterday morning, having braved the rain and voted for his favorite mayoral candidate, John C. Savage, head of Mario M. Cuomo's ad agency, said he's ready to handle another political candidate.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Talk about shoppingthere's a really dandy item around for those of us who are forever ending up carrying packages and bags that seem to weigh only slightly less than a ton. It's called PurseCart and what it is is a goodlooking shopping cart that folds up in a jiffy and can be carried like a big handbag15 by 10 inches, in factover the arm. The cart comes in a red or blue plaid (you have to take what they send you) waterproof vinyl, has a chrome  plated steel frame and wide rubber wheels. It comes with instructions, but even without them, it's easy enough to figure out. The cart holds about 40 pounds, is guaranteed and costs $19.95 plus $3 handling and mailing. The address is PurseCart, P.O. Box 7080, Westbury, LI., 11594, Dept. NYT.

title: Construction of Alcan Approved by Carter
description: WASHINGTON.Nov. 8(UPI)Presi. dent Carter today gave final United States approval for construction of a 4,700mile pipeline to carry Alaskan natural gas through Canada to the lower 48 states.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: BELLRINGER By Strouse, a salute to Charles Strouse, the Tony award winning composer of Bye, Bye Birdie, Applause and Annie, willopen the cabaret season tonight at the Manhattan Theater Club (4720600) with a singing quartet including Kim Fedena, Judy Gibson, Laurence Guittard and Maureen Moore. Tickets are $3 to the performances Wednesday through Sunday at 8:15 P.M.

title: Into Each Life Some Must Fall, But Really.
description: And the rains came. In drizzles and torrents, gales and buckets, the rains came, bringing hardship and loss to hundreds and soggy, sodden inconvenience to almost everyone else.It rained cats and dogs, lizards and frogs. Into each life some must fall. Lovely for ducks. Etc.

title: Constitutional Convention Beaten
description: New York State voters answered a resounding no yesterday to the question of whether a convention should he held to overhaul the state's 200yearold Constitution.

title: Lufthansa Halts Algeria Flight After Security Rebuff
description: COLOGNE, West Germany, Nov. 8 (AP) Lufthansa canceled its roundtrip FrankfurtAlgeria flight today because the Algerian Government had refused to let West German guards conduct security checks of passengers boarding at Algiers.

title: I.A.T.A.'S HEAD URGES YEAR'S MORATORIUM ON AIRFARE PACTS
description: The head of the International Air Transport Association intensified his criticism of United States airfare policy yesterday and suggested the airlines consider a year's moratorium on fare agreements to test American theories in the real world.

title: Conservative Republican Is Victor In Virginia Race for Governor
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 8Lieut. Gov. John N. Daton, a conservative Republican backed by oldline Democrats, was elected Governor of Virginia today, defeating Henry H. Howell Jr., a populiststyle liberal Democrat who was strongly backed by President Carter in a third race for the statehouse.

title: RUMORS ON SAUDIS LIFT POUND 2 CENTS
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 8(Reuters)The British pound rose nearly 2 cents against the dollar today on an unconfirmed report that Saudi Arabia would accept sterling for oil payments.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: Article 5  No Title

title: Some Good News On School Lunches
description: THE nation's school children are fed too much junk food, too much sugar, too many fried foods, too much starch and receive virtually no nutrition education. These were the complaints and concerns reiterated by parents and educators throughout the country during the last two weeks, as the Government held hearings in eight major cities to discuss the state of child nutrition.

title: Mrs. Hicks Defeated For Boston Council
description: BOSTON, Nov. 8 (AP)In an upset, Louise Day Hicks, the oncepowerful leader of the city's antibusing movement, was narrowly defeated today in her bid for reelection to the City Council.

title: Annie Dillard, Far From Tinker Creek
description: BELLINGHAM, Wash. AT the northwestern tip of the United States, where rain, fog and gloom are often as much a part of the landscape as mountains and trees, an migr from Pittsburgh is trying to come to terms at once with her success and a new challengefiction.

title: Letters
description: To THE LIVING SECTION:

title: Plans for Big Water Desalting Plant Stalled by Court Fight on Contracts
description: Plans for building the world's largest water desalting plant at Yuma, Ariz., have become stalled by a court dispute over the method of awarding contracts for the plant's equipment.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Council Gets New Look: More W omen and Minorities
description: The city's voters elected a 43member Council yesterday whose political makeup will be almost identical to the outgoing body but whose composition will be markedly changed with the presence of more women and increased minoritygroup representation.

title: Lillian Carter Leads Iowa Group to Dublin
description: DUBLIN, Ireland, Nov. 8 (UPI)Lillian Carter, the 79yearold mother of President Carter, arrived in Ireland today at the head of a Friendship Force from Des Moines. Iowa.

title: Closed End Funds
description: Tuesday, Nov. 8, 1977

title: Notes on People
description: THE first member of a new generation of the Kennedy family was born yesterday. Kathleen Townsend, a daughter of Ethel Kennedy and the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy, gave birth to a girl weighing 8 pounds 9 ounces in a hospital in Santa Fe, N.M. Mrs. ownsend, who is 26 years old, is married to David Townsend, a teacher at St. John's Academy in Santa Fe. She is a law student at the University of New Mexico. The birth was announced in Washington by the office of Senator Edward M. Kennedy. The baby, not yet named, is the first greatgrandchild forRose Kennedy.

title: Changing the Face of a Jersey City Neighborhood
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 8Peggy Sheehan, a Jersey City planning official, walked down a littered and deteriorating block of Martin Luther King Drive the other day and told a prospective merchant about plans for rehabilitating the neighborhood.

title: Appointment of Judges Winning
description: With twothirds of the election districts reporting, it appeared early this morning that an amendment providing for he appointment of judges by the Governor to the New York State Court of Appeals was winning a narrow margin of approval.

title: Movement on Micronesia
description: Understandably sensitive to possible charges of colonialism, the Carter Administration has moved energetically this year to try to end this country's strategic trust over Micronesia, the last of the postWorld War United Nations trust territories. Micronesia stretches over more than 2,000 islands strung out over an area the Pacific Ocean as large as the United States. Its 120,000 people know very little of each other and for the most part lived in traditional subsistence economies until the Kennedy Administration and its successors made them the beneficiaries, or victims, of a resolute campaign of education and modernization.

title: Uniting Mothers of Twins
description: The mother of twins, or more is likely to encounter problems not fully experienced by the mother of a single child. From postpartum depression to overseeing adolescent identity crises, the situations are the same but the nuances differ, and the mother of multiples might want to talk to someone who is able to empathize.

title: DEMOCRATS VICTORS
description: Representative Edward 1. Koch was elected New York City's 105th Mayor yesterday in the climax of an uphill campaign he began 10 months ago.

title: The Day We Sold Our Flotsam and Jetsam
description: After the movers had come and gone, we looked over our apartment and discovered it was still half filled with the flotsam and jetsam of 14 years in New York. The sort of things that didn't justify the cost and trouble of moving, but just couldn't be thrown out. Let's have an apartment sale, I said.

title: Joan Ingpen of Paris To Join Met Plan Staff
description: Joan Ingpen, a specialist in opera planning who has worked at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden, in London, and at the Paris Opera. will join the staff of the Metropolitan Opera next January. She will work with James Levine, the Met's music director, and others on the artistic staff to plan future seasons.

title: HOWARD B. GRANT
description: Howard B. Grant, publisher of Dairy and Ice Cream Field Magazine from 1937 to 1970, died yesterday in the New Rochelle (N.Y.) Medical Center after suffering a heart attack Oct. 14. He was 68 years old and lived at 16 North Chatsworth Avenue, in Larchmont.

title: Suspect Held in Carter Threat
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 8 (UPI)Benjam?? AAwad Makkar, 41 years old, a citizenof Egypt living in Cleveland, was held today in lieu of $50,000 bond on a charge of threatening the life of President Car ter. Secret Service agents said that Mr. Makkar's brother, Joseph, had told them that his brother had threatened the President's life on Oct. 28. They said that Joseph Makkar had characterized his brother as being frustrated because he had little money and was unable to finda job.

title: Delhi Voters Can Drink to Defeat of Dry Law
description: DELHI, N. Y., Nov. 8By a vote of 814 to 552a heavy turnoutthe citizens of this little Catskill mountain town decided today to keep their five bars open. They also voted to keep op'n the town's three package liquor stores and to permit the sale of alcohol in its motel.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Natomas Company said it plans to acquire the Brown Badgett Coal Mining group for about $51 million. The Badgett group is a privately owned mining operation in western Kentucky.

title: Customs Workers Stage Strike in Britain As Protests Over Pay Restraints Grow
description: LONDON, Nov. 8 (Reuters)British Customs and immigration workers went on strike for four hours today as industrial unrest over national pay restraints spread.

title: Feld Ballet Revels In BrandNew Home
description: AHOUSE IS NOT A HOMEbut, for a ballet company, a studio in which to put its feet up, or occasionally forward, is certainly a great comfort. For years New York's fourth major classic dance company, the Eliot Feld Ballet, has been, if not homeless, at least vaguely vagrant. Now, or at least after Friday's official opening, it will have a place to call its own. And what a place!

title: The Fed: Policies and Effects
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 8Following are questions about Federal Reserve policies and the way they affect consumers and the general economic life of the country. The answers are based on what are sometimes conflicting explanations by Administration and Federal Reserve officials and outside economists.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Nov. 8The jaialai season will begin tomorrow at the renovated Bridgeport Fronton with a doubleheader, the first session starting at noon and the second at 7:15 P.M. After opening day, the 12game programs will operate on the following schedule:

title: Mrs. Lambert Wins Manhattan Election To Surrogate Post
description: Marie M. Lambert, whose unexpectedly victorious primary campaign drew the opposition of the New York City Bar As sociation and a number of civic groups, won overwhelmingly the race for Manhattan Surrogate yesterday.

title: Kluckman Is Elected President of Zenith
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 8 (UPI)The Zenith Radio Corporation announced today the election of Revone W. Kluckman as president and chief operating officer.

title: Ban on Spectators at Alleged Nazi's Hearing Upset
description: GOSLAR, West Germany, Nov. 8 (AP)Two trains crashed on a rural line in this northcentral region of West Germany today, derailing three cars and injuring eight persons. railroad authorities said. A onecar coach rammed into the rear of a local train, derailing the coach and two passenger cars, the authorities said.

title: Missile Firing C;alled Success
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 8 (UPI)  A British Polaris A3 missile was fired down the United States Air Force's Eastern Test Range from Cape Canaveral today in a test of improvements made by the British to the Americanbuilt rocket. Navy officials, who aided in the test firing, said it was a complete success.

title: Tony Kornheiser
description: The American Basketball Association would have been 11 seasons old, had it survived.

title: Flexible Work Hours a Success, Study Says
description: WASHINGTON

title: Judge Sets Sept. 78 Date for Start Of Wilmington Desegregation Plan
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Nov. 8(AP)A Federal district judge ordered today that a desegregation plan for Wilmington area public schools begin next September.

title: Ivy Competition Fierce; 4 Teams May Split Title
description: In the Big Ten, Ohio State and Michigan go one forever and the eight other teams serve as cannon fodder in the championship race. Ditto for Oklahoma and Nebraska (or Missouri) in the Big Eight. Year in and year out Alabama wins the Southeastern Conference crown, Texas the Southwest and Southern California or the University of California, Los Angeles, the Pac8.

title: From Annie Dillard's Holy the Firm
description: One night a moth flew into the candle, was caught, burnt dry, and held. I must have been staring at the candle, or maybe I looked up when a shadow crossed my page; at any rate, I saw it all. A golden female moth, a biggish one with twoinch wingspan, flapped into the fire, dropped her abdomen into the wet wax, stuck, flamed, frazzled and fried in a second. Her moving wings ignited like tissue paper, enlarging the circle of light in the clearing and creating out of the darkness the sadden blue sleeves of my sweater, the green leaves of jewelweed by my side, the ragged red trunk of a pine. At once the light contracted again and the moth's wings vanished in a fine, foul smoke. At the same time her six legs clawed, curled, blackened, and ceased, disappearing utterly. And her head jerked in spasms, making a spattering of noise; her antennae crisped and burned away and her heaving mouth parts crackled like pistol fire. When it was all over, her head was, so far as I could determine, gone, gone the long way of her wings and legs. Had she been new, or old? Had she mated and laid her eggs, had she done her work? All that was left was the glowing horn shell of her abdomen and thoraxa fraying, partially collapsed gold tube jammed upright in the candle's round pool.

title: REPUBLICANS MAKING INROADS IN ROCKLAND
description: POMONA, N. Y. Nov. 8A RepublicanConservative coalition slate appeared to be cutting sharply into Democratic power in the Rockland County Legislature on the basis of stillincomplete returns tonight.

title: Metropolitan Diary

Sometimes the only result is a laugh. Some years ago, when I was a clerk in a Fifth Avenue book shop, writes Lee Weber, I had a customer who was very pleasant woman and who said she needed help finding a book or books by an author who seemed to be very elusive.

title: About Real Estate

The idea, in period of economic slump, was to pare prices and stimulate sales by offering certain appliances or amenities as optional instead of standard features. In some instances builders would offer unfinished space or little or no landscaping, suggesting that the buyer could in time do the finishing or landscaping himself.

KaufmanEdna Ferber play about a family of actors, bearing a calculated resemblance to the then  reigning Barrymores. has been taken under WNET/ 13's Great Performances umbrella as the first in a series of Off Stage dramas about the lives of theater people.

Panama and U.S. Policy

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: AMAN who had never met Clare Boothe Luce until he was seated next to her at a dinner party the other night says that she asked him what he thought about the NixonBrezhnev agreement of 1971 as soon as he sat down. Since he scarcely had thought about it at all, the man says, he was at a disadvantage. Then, he says, Mrs. Luce went on to ask him if he recalled the second and third points of the agreement, and he was at a loss. The man knew that Mrs. Luce was not being uppity. only provocative, and that she was among the best of the conversationalists in New York. Women at dinner parties are always drawing out the men they sit next to, and usually they do it by asking, Did you read about this?, or, What do you think about that? Ordinarily, any dummy can answer the questions. Mrs. Luce, however, is tough on dummies. This is one reason she is highly regarded at dinner parties.

title: Television

title: At the Polls They Come and Go Speaking of Inclement Weather

Koch arrived just after 9 A.M. to cast his ballot at New York University's Loeb Student Center. The media crush there was so tight that, for a moment, it appeared there would be an answer to a riddle: How many photographers can a voting booth hold? The Democratic mayoral candidate was eventually allowed his privacy to pull the curtain, however, but his exchanges with reporters brought an apparently nonpolitical plea from an election official: Will you keep the noise down, please? It's very distracting.

title: Piano: de Groote In Impressive Debut
description: MAKE no mistake: Steven de Groote is a superior pianist. The question posed by his New York debut last night is far more complicated than that: What sort of superior pianist is Steven de Groote? Well, it could safely be said long before he was half through with Beethoven's Sonata in Eflat (Op. 81a) that the 24yearold South African is no fumblefingers. He plays the instrument with masterly control and with nothing if not the utmost precision.

It is the International Baccalaureate program, begun almost a decade ago in Geneva to ensure that students attending schools outside their native countries pursue common courses of study, regardless of the language of instruction. The approach is that of a high schoollevel liberal arts education.

title: 5 Guilty in $1.2 Million Bribe Plot Over Public Contracts in Chicago

Marinaro was not signed due to physical ccndition, said the Seahawks spokesman. He was released by the Jets before the regular season began.

description: As one of his last official acts, Mayor Beanie is planning to appoint Deputy Mayor Stanley M. Friedman to a $20,000ayear lifetime job as a Commissioner of the Board of Water Supply, mayoral aides said yesterday. The job involves almost no official duties, but comes with a car. a driver and a secretary.

title: Flood Damages in New York Area Put in Millions And Weather Service Sees Chance for More Rain
description: As the dirty flood waters receded in the city and suburbs yesterday, homeowners and municipal officials began to clean up damages whose costs will run into many millions of dollars.

title: Family Money: Bankruptcy
description: DEBTRIDDEN consumers, unable to keep ahead of their creditors, are heading for the sanctuary of the bankruptcy courts in huge numbers. The rate of increase over the last three years, said Mort Dicker, who heads a Legal Aid Society office in New York City, has been geometric.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Predawn raids led to the arrest of four men and a woman and the seizure of 1.300 to 1.500 pounds of marijuana with an estimated street value of $650.000, according to the Connecticut state police.

description: BOSTON, Nov. 9 (AP)Larry Kenon and George Gervin combined for 47 points to lead the San Antonio Spurs to a 129114 victory over the Boston Celtics in a National Basketball Association game tonight.

title: Eaton Officially Offers $47 a Share for Carborundum
description: The Eaton Corporation, pursuing its contested takeover bid for the Carhorundum Company, said yesterday that it had filed its official proposal with the Securities and Exchange Commission, proposing to offer $47 in cash for each Carborundum shareor a total of some $376 million.

title: New Board Chairman To Be Named by Amex
description: The board of governors of the American Stock Exchange is expected to name a new chairman to succeed Paul Kolton at its regular monthly meeting today.

title: Hers
description: I USED to think that some women, though precious few, were genetically ordered to be doers, while the rest of us were doomed to be don'ters. It seemed to have very little to do with what we wanted or did not want out of our lives, but instead was engraved on our heredity stones. The few who were ordained to spring out of the crowdMargaret Mead, Marie Curie, Golda Meirwere singular oddities, and while we admired them tremendously. we did not really relate to them. Our life hands were dealt to us, I reasoned, and we had little or no recourse to reshuffle the cards.

title: TeenAge Use Of Angel Dust Stirs Concern
description: Angel dust, an inexpensive additive that can induce violence and psychosis, has found its way into the marijuana cigarettes of thousands of adolescents in New York City over the last six to eight months, according to city and Federal health officials.

title: Vote in City Largely Ratified Democratic Primary
description: Except for Edward I. Koch and Carol Bellamy, the cast of characters at City Hall and in the city's borough halls will be largely unchanged after Jan. 1, but some roles will be shifted.

title: Pollsters Win Some and Lose Some
description: Pollsters turned in a mixed performance in their efforts to predict the outcomes of Tuesday's elections in the New York Metropolitan area.

title: Germans Sentence Two Croatians
description: DUSSELDORF, West Germany, Nov. 9 (Reuters)A court sentenced two Croatian nationalists today to long jail terms for attempting to murder Yugoslavia's vice consul here in June 1976. Marko Krpan, 26 years old, was given 12 years, and Pavle Perovic, 25, who drove the getaway car, received 10 and a half years. The vice consul, Vladimir Topic, was unhurt in the attack.

title: Miss Evert and Mrs. King Give U.S. a 20 Lead in Wightman Cup
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 9In another of their wonderful close matches, Chris Evert defeated Virginia Wade last night, 75, 76, and put the United States ahead in the 49th annual Wightman Cup tennis competition against Britain.

title: South American Breeders Stung
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 9In the backwash of the horseswitching scandal in the United States, breeders and exporters here are concerned about the suddenly weak market for their products.

title: A REPORT SAYS BIKO MADE NO COMPLAINTS
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 9The South African Government's defense of the polite in the Stephen Biko case may have been strengthened by a doctor's report saying that Mr. Biko had made no complaints during repeated medical examinations in the last week of his life, other than those that related to his deteriorating physical condition.

title: SecondHalf Rally by Braves Downs Knicks, 124113
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 9  The Buffalo Braves gave the New York Knicks a bit of the Jersey Bounce tonight as a pair of New Jersey basketball products played major roles in the 124113 Buffalo triumph.

title: FEDERAL EMPLOYEES SAID TO GET WELFARE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov.. 9Joseph A. Califano Jr., Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, disclosed today that a Government check had turned up some 13,000 Federal workers in 21 regions of the nation who were receiving welfare payments in addition to their salaries. Some of these people may be receiving subsidies to which they are not entitled, he said.

title: Events Today
description: BERT HOULE AND SOPHIE WIBAUX MIME THEATER, presented by Roundabout Theater, Gene Feisb producing director, by arrangement with Harold Shaw, at Stage Two, 307 West 26th Street, 7.

description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 9 (AP)Bond has been set at $1.3 million for Carlos Poree, accused of wounding 10 persons in a shooting rampage.

title: Oh, for A Clever Garden

For 15 years, I've been simply taking my garden for granted, shambling around with a blade of grass in my mouth, indiscriminately smelling the flowers and generally behaving like a bumpkin.

title: Appelate Court Backs Removal Of Gerard Ban

title: Notes on People
description: SUSAN FORD, a photographer and the daughter of former President Gerald R. Ford, has been signed as a regular on The Jim Nabors Show, a nationally syndicated onehour variety program that is to be seen five days a week starting in early January. Miss Ford, who has appeared on LaughIn, the Mery Griffin and Tonight shows, is to report to work on completion of her current assignment as still photographer for the film Jaws II. Susan's 'charm and will help everyone feel right at home with us, Mr. Nabors said. That welcome feeling is what we want most of all for our guests in the studio and at home. Miss Ford will conduct audience and guest celebrity interviews and will present occasional photography features. Taping begins later this month in Los Angeles.

title: Dock Strike Leader Calls Aides Amid Signs Talks May Resume
description: The leader of the striking longshoremen yesterday summoned the union's 125member wagescale committee to New York for a possible resumption of toplevel bargaining with ocean carriers and shipping associations tomorrow.

title: Results of Votes on New York State Amendments
Loser in Virginia Governor Election Declines to Felicitate G.O.P. Victor
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 9As tarttongued in defeat as he was in his third and what he says was his last bid for Governor of Virginia, Henry E. Howell Jr. bitterly refused today to telephone or send a message of concession or congratulations to the Republican who crushed him in yesterday's election.

title: Rangers Wallop Sabres, 84
description: Don Murdoch shook his head at the memory of titanic Ranger losses in Buffalo and the Sabre fans counting up the goals. I hate hearing that One! Two! Three! Four!  said Murdoch. Tonight it was reverse psychology. I'm glad our fans remembered.

title: The Program
description: PHILHARMONIA HUNGARIA, Reinhard Peters. con ductor; Baiint Vazsonyi, pianist. At Carnegie Hall.

title: Banco di Roma Chief Under Arrest in Italy
description: MULAN, Italy, Nov. 9, (Reuters)The chief executive of the Banco di Roma was arrested here today in connection with the collapse of a private bank run by the ItalianAmerican financier, Michele Sindona, the police said.

title: Boy Manager of the 1920's
description: Stanley R. (Bucky) Harris was an expert in the comings and goings of baseball managers, having been named manager eight times. He even repeated the job, having managed the Washington Senators three different times (Only Franklin D. Roosevelt had more terms than I did in Washington, he said.) and the Detroit Tigers twice.

title: Gullikson Upsets Orantes
description: HONG KONG. Nov. 9(AP)Tom Gullikson, a 26yearold unseeded player from Wisconsin, upset topseeded Manual Orantes of Spain, 76, 61, tonight in the first round of a $75,000 Grand Prix tennis tournament. Gullikson, with a servevolley attack, did not permit Orantes to settle down.

title: Voters Approve Higher Percentage Of Bonds in 1977 Than Last Year
description: American voters gave their approval this year to more state and local bond financing than they did a year ago, according to an analysis yesterday, although the two largest issues on the ballot in New York State were rejected.

title: Fred Haney, Baseball Executive; Managed 3 Major League Teams
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., Nov. 9 (AP)Fred Haney, the California Angels first general manager who began his baseball career as an infielder with Portland, Ore., in 1918, died today at the age of 79. Mr. Haney, who played for 17 years in the major and minor leagues, suffered a heart attack at his home, said his daughter, Patricia Franklin.

title: Unchecked Development Closes In on the Appalachian Trail
description: HARPERS FERRY, W.Va.The hikers trudging the Appalachian Trail as it snaked along the top of the Blue Ridge paused a few minutes for a look at the long valley spreading far beneath them. Bathed in the late morning sunlight, the treetops glowed warmly in red, yellow and russet tints as far as the eye could see.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 9(AP)  Seven spectators suffered minor injuries tonight when a light bulb fell from the ceiling at the Omni during a National Hockey League game between the Atlanta names and the Toronto Maple Leafs.

title: Valentino and Bobby Deerfield Where Did They Go Wrong?
description: SUCCESS MAY HAVE many parents, and failure may generally be an orphan, but an unsuccessful movie is almost invariably its director's baby. Both Sydney Pollack's Bobby Deerfield and Ken Russell's Valentino opened to largely unfavorable notices this season, and both films have been faring less than triumphantly at the box office. Each director acknowledges specific problems that might explain his movie's critical and commercial fate.

title: Halloween Fed Move No Treat for Burns
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Arthur F. Burns said today that the open market desk of the New York Federal Reserve Bank had goofed on Halloween. The Federal Reserve Board's chairman was referring to the signaling of a significant change in interest rate policies at the time of a major financing operation by the Treasury Department.

title: SLIGHT GAINS SHOWN IN PRICES OF BONDS
description: The credit markets held their ground yesterday as they assessed the testimony of Arthur F. Burns before the Senate Banking Committee. Prices slipped and then recovered to close with slight gains as bond traders and money market analysts said the Federal Reserve Board chairman's performance had no pronounced impact.

title: MAN IN CIVIC GROUP CHARGED IN LOOTING
description: A member of a Bushwick civic association dedicated to halting arson, abandonment and wholesale thievery that have plagued the Brooklyn neighborhood was arrested yesterday on charges of trying to loot an apartment house there, The police said he and a companion had removed a water pipe from the building to drive the tenants out so the building could be looted.

title: Kitchens Designed For More Than Cooking
description: THE problem with many kitchens is that they're designed exclusively for cooking. That's fine for the person who wants to whip up multicourse meals in seclusion. But what about the nowandthen cook who needs a place to prepare food but also wants that same space to function as a dining room, a place to entertainor just a place to play?

title: Backgammon:
description: The 1977 Autumn Backgammon Tournament, sponsored by the Children's Cancer Fund of America, was recently held at New York City's Regency Whist Club. This distinguished event, limited to 64 contestants, always attracts some of the finest players in the country. In one semifinals match, Andrew Rosacki overcame Judson Stuker; in the other, Jack Furey beat Joan Aul?,. In the finals. Furey took first prize, defeatRogacki 25 to 23. Joe Pasternak won Irs; place in the consolation tournament.

title: CONVERSION TO OIL SET FOR GAS PIPELINE LINK
description: WASHINGTON, Nov 9 (AP)The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission today approved plans to convert a natural gas pipeline into an oil line to take Alaskan production to Texas from California.

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Washington Post President Named
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (AP)Mark J. Meagher has been elected president and chief operating officer of the Washington Post Company, Katharine Graham, chairman and chief executive officer, announced today. Mr. Meagher has been since December 1976 head of business operations of the company's newspaper division. Mrs. Graham has been serving as president as well as chairman since Larry H. Israel left in February

title: Dow, in Rebound, Advances 2.16 To 818.43 as Gains Lead Declines
description: The stock market advanced moderately yesterday despite continued investor uncertainty over the Federal Reserve's future policies.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Conrail Reports 3dQuarter Loss of $54.7 Million
description: After 19 months of operations the Consolidated Rail Corporation is running into heightened financial trouble, according to assessments by Conrail executives and Federal agencies.

title: F.D.A. WARNS DIETERS ABOUT LIQUID PROTEIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 The Food and Drug Administration warned dieters today that the use of liquid protein food supplements could be extremely dangerous. It cited the deaths of 16 women in recent months who had been taking the compounds to lose weight.

title: About New york
description: At the end of it all, as he walked off into the night drizzie on Queens Boulevard, Maurice Nadiari may have made it easier for politicians to continue business as usual, however tainted or not the business is. He presented the ethical corruption issue antiquely, more in the thundering verses of Paradise Lost when maybe some earthier attitude of the sort in Guys and Dolls would have been more believable.

title: PostElection Reflections
description: Transformed by his election victory into one of the most powerful politicians in the state, Mayorelect Edward I. Koch is already signaling that he will end the open warfare between Albany and City Hall and work closely with the other Democratic power center in the state, Governor Carey, who initially had rejected his candidacy. Mr. Koch invited the Governor to his electionnight celebration and praised him even though the crowd there was more of a mind to hoot at Mr. Carey. The Mayorelect told friends recently that he did not anticipte any problems with Albany because Carey needs mehe's unpopular now, in case you hadn't noticed.

title: Bergen Rape Suspect Out on Bail;Officials Now Doubt Strength of Case
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 8Bergen County law enforcement officials expressed doubt today about the strength of a rape case against a 39yearold bulldozer operator arrested last week after a young woodsman helped the police apprehend him.

title: Don Redlich's Dances: A New Awareness
description: IN A MODERNDANCER or even more specifically, a moderndance choreographer. what is it we term style? In the world of classic ballet the concept or style is quite narrowly contained; it is usually a pleasing personal variant within the bounds of a historically established classic tradition, a personal variation, for example, upon the basic Russian style.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I have recently noticed water spots on the top of my dresser (front combing wet hair over the surface). I have used a liquid furniture polish on this for years, but the polish will not remove these spots. Is there any method you know of that will?P.D., Brooklyn, N. Y.

title: French Curb on Inflation Provokes Croissant War
description: PARIS, Nov. 9Many bakeries stayed dosed here this morning and most cafes put their shutters down this afternoon to protest a freeze on some food prices.

title: Washington Chooses its Christmas Tree
description: ST. PAUL, Nov. 9 (UPI).A 50foot white spruce from Minnesota will be the nation's Christmas tree.

title: Jersey Leaders Think Income Tax Will Fade as Issue in Legislature
description: New Jersey legislative leaders expressed confidence yesterday that the newly elected, heavily Democratic Assembly and Senate will not have to grapple with the emotional issue that so divided the present sessionthe state income tax.

title: Surgery on Simpson Called Successful
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 9(AP)Surgery on the left knee of O.J. Simpson was successful, according to a spokesman for the Buffalo Bills. The operation was performed today by the Bills physician, Joseph Godfrey, who called it a straightforward cartilage operation with ligament involvement.

title: L.I. Physician Charged With Selling Drugs to 1,000 Patients Every Week
description: A Long Island physician who allegedly used two aides posing as doctors to help him prescribe and dispense amphetamines illegally to about 1,000 patients a week was ordered yesterday to go on trial Jan. 9 for violating Federal drug laws.

title: In Memoriam
description: HOROWITZ, Max. Nov. 10, 1972. With loving memories your family.

title: Washington & Business
description: WASHINGTONWilliam J. Jones, vice president of the Wilson Trucking Corporation, is proud these days that his business is doing well after two years in the doldrums. But he's worried too, concerned that it will not last. The reason for his fear can be summed up in a phrasetrucking deregulation which is being heard with increasing frequency in this city and around the nation.

title: U.N. Assembly Calls for Renewal of Cyprus Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 9The General Assembly approved a resolution today calling for a resumption of talks between the Greek and Turkish communities in Cyprus. The vote was 116 to 6, with 20 abstentions.

title: Jersey Leaders Think Income Tax Will Fade as Issue in Legislature
description: New Jersey legislative leaders expressed confidence yesterday that the newly elected, heavily Democratic Assembly and Senate will not have to grapple with the emotional issue that so divided the present sessionthe state income tax.

title: Carter Authorizes Study of Heroin as Aid to Patients
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9  President Carter has authorized consideration of whether the use of heroin and marijuana should be permitted in suppressing pain and nausea in cancer patients. the White House said today.

title: Giving You a Hand On How to Applaud
description: THE ETIQUETTE of applause is a delicate thing, and I have noticed some audiences looking just a wee bit sheepish lately for having given their all  or blistered their palms, as the quote ads used to say  at inappropriate times. I don't like to see audiences, who are being so kind to the theater these days, caught out in this way and, for future reference, I offer a few tips on when, and how much, handclapping is really in order. Actually, it'll be easier to say when it's not in order, so let's play it that

title: Advertising
description: Oil of Olay beauty lotion, which went from $2.5 million in sales and a 5 percent share of the market to more than $50 million in sales and 26 percent of the market while its advertising was handled by Norman, Craig & Kummel, is switching agencies.

title: Returns in Suffolk
description: Coutywide Offices

title: BURNS SAYS RESERVE PLANS TO KEEP BRAKE ON GROWTH IN MONEY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 Reaffirming his tightmoney, antiinflationary policies, Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, told a Senate committee today that the Federal Reserve System intends to keep the brakes on growth in the nation's money supply.

title: The Limits of Libel
description: In a case that bears our paper's name, and that of a certain Sullivan, the Supreme Court decided 13 years ago that a public official who charges libel by the press must prove not merely inaccuracy or negligence but malicedisseminaton of a known falsehood or a reckless disregard of truth. The decision left many people uncomfortable, because they thought public officials, too, have rights. But the Court held, wisely, that freedom of the press would be dangerously limited if every displeasing story could become the basis of a libel suit either for damages or just for harassment. So malice became the crucial factor.

title: JOBS BILL SPONSORS SEE CARTER BACKING
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Administration and Congressional sponsors of the HumphreyHawkins full employment bill have agreed on the main issues, and an announcement by President Carter is expected next week, the sponsors reported today.

title: Television
description: 4:55(2)Jeanne Parr in the Morning (R)

title: Hisle Rejects Ranger Bid
description: Larry Hisle, one of the premier players still available in baseball's freeagent market, turned down a sixyear, $3 million offer from the Texas Rangers yesterday.

title: Woolworth Appoints Gibbons as Chairman
description: The F.W. Woolworth Company, one of the world's largest retail store chains, yesterday announced the appointment of Edward F. Gibbons as chairman to succeed Lester A. Burcham who will be 65 years old in April and who plans to retire Dec. 31. Mr. Gibbons remains chief executive officer

title: Italian Design Comes Home To Little Italy See Page C10
description: See Page C10

title: Stage: Storm of Complex Currents
description: THUNDERSTORM is so clogged with the traffic of plot that, in comparison, the port of Hong Kong would seem like a swiftly flowing river. This is an English version of a 1933 play by Tsao Yu, written when the author was 23, and, according to Tisa Chang, it is the first major mainland Chinese play using Western dramatic conventions. At La Mama, Miss Chang is offering the American premiere as a production of her Pan Asian Repertory Theater.

title: Knicks Box Score
description: RefereesPaul Mihalak and Mike Mathis. Technical foulsSmith, Buffalo coach Fitzsimmons. Attendance10,114.

title: How Westchester Democrats Won
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 9 Widespread ticketsplitting by Westchester County voters in yesterday's election helped the Democrats score a major victory by reelecting Alfred B. DelBello as County executive while losing other county offices and failing to win control of the Board of Legislators.

title: Federal Agency Acts to Prohibit Redlining in Move Praised by Mondale
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9The Carter Administration announced today new regulations designed to ban redlining, the denial of mortgage credit to homes in declining neighborhoods.

title: Station Ownership by Blacks Lags
description: ALTHOUGH the Federal Communications Commission has been seeking for about seven years to increase minoritygroup participation in radio and television ownership, broadcasting remains an industry overwhelmingly dominated by whites.

title: Toledo Students Back in School After Tax Is Approved
description: TOLEDO, Ohio, Nov. 9Just after sunrise this morning, a small group of students at Start High School here resurrected their school symbol, a statue of a Spartan warrior.

title: Sports Today
description: HARNESS RACING

title: The Design Trade Votes for Its Winners
description: SOME PEOPLE live, eat and sleep home furnishings. While pictures of chairs and lamps and wallpaper flashed on a screen, members of the Resources Council, a national association of manufacturers and suppliers serving the interior design trade, ate, drank and danced their way recently through a design awards dinner at the Essex House. For entertainment, a highkicking chorus sang, Hello, Roscoe! Well, hello Roscoe! Nobody fell asleep.

title: Eleventh Victim of Flood Is Found In North Carolina Mountain Area
description: BURNSVILLE, N.C., Nov. 9 (UPI)Receding waters yielded their 11th victim yesterday as hundreds of mountain residents went back to homes shattered by weekend flash flooding.

title: Air Cargo Deregulation Bill Signed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 President Carter signed into law today legislation that lifts most regulations from the air cargo industry and urged Congress to enact a pending bill to do the same for

title: Boston Black Wins in School Vote; 3 Opponents of Busing Defeated
description: BOSTON, Nov. 9Boston voters elected a black to this city's School Committee yesterday for the first time in more than 75 years in an upset election in which three of the city's most vocal opponents of courtordered school busing were defeated.

title: Noguchi's Lamps: Not Just for Light But Floating
description: LIGHTING is an old concern to Isamu Noguchi, dating back, in fact, to 1928. But after the artist had designed his first plugin sculpturea neon fantasy bent, in part, as wittily as a pretzelit was more than 20 years before he devised the glorious array of crinkly papershaded lamps that go on view tomorrow in a retrospective at the Museum of Modern Art.

title: TV: Lincoln Center Proving PBS Asset
description: WNETHER it's called Live From Lincoln Center, which is partially underwritten by one oil company, or Live From the Met, underwritten by another company, the series of music, dance and opera performances being transmitted from the various stages of Manhattan's Lincoln Center complex has been solidly established as a valuable asset for the nation's publictelevision system.

title: N.Y. Assembly
description: 48th District, Brooklyn

title: Books of The Times
description: ILONG, QUITE SUDDENLY, to write my autobiograhy, wrote Agatha Christie one April day in 1950, while on a dig in Nimrud, Iraq with her archeologist husband, Max Mallowan. And true to her longing she set to work, and completed this book 15 years later, at the age of 75, when she decided that enough was enough. Everything in its time and place, she might have added. For hers was a life of resourceful practicality.

title: Leonard Silk
description: STOCKHOLM  A prophecy that troubled economists and political leaders here three decades ago has finally come to pass. The warning was that the national goals of full employment, improved social programs, more equality in the distribution of income and rising living standards would all be undermined unless Swedish industry remained competitive in world markets.

title: Soybean Futures Prices Rise Following Storm Reports;Cocoa Also Up
description: Soybean prices closed higher yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade after sharp early gains were trimmed later in the day.

title: Corn Sales to Japan Announced
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 (UPI)  The Agriculture Department today announced sales of 4.5 million bushels of corn to Japan by private United States exporters. The department said the corn, which amounts to 114,300 metric tons, is for export during the 197778 marketing year ending Sept. 30, 1978.

title: Canada Says the Mounted Police Illegally Opened Mail From' 54 On
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 9 The Royal Canadian Mounted Police have opened and copied personal mail illegally since 1954, the Government said today.

title: BUFFALO IS SURPRISED BY GRIFFIN'S MARGIN
description: State Senator James D. Griffin, the Mayor  elect of Buffalo, confounded everyone in that city by the margin of his victory over Arthur O. Eve, the Assemblyman who had hoped to become the first black Mayor of a major city in New York State.

title: WASHINGTON NEWSMAN, 85,  MISSING IN NEW HAMPSHIRE
description: WARNER, N.H., Nov. 8The state and local police here are searching for an 85yearold Washington news correspondent, Lawrence Fernsworth, who has been missing since he went for a walk 16 days ago.

title: Fire Damages Des Moines Church
description: DES MOINES, lowa, Nov. 9 (UPI)Fire swept through the sanctuary of St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church yesterday where about 100 children were attending an afterschool religion class. None of the children were hurt. Fire officials said that damage to the church and its contents could exceed $1 million.

title: World News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9(AP)President Carter gave a warm White House welcome today to Prime Minister Robert D. Muldoon of New Zealand and reaffirmed United States defense commitments to that country.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post Positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Nassau G.O.P. Shows New Strength
description: MINEOLA, L.L, Nov. 9The Nassau County Republican organization, which had been troubled by internal problems in the selection of its candidate for County Executive, emerged today stronger than ever after having won virtually every major contest in yesterday's elections.

title: WRANGLING FOLLOWS BOND ISSUE DEFEAT
description: With the proposal to float $750 million in bonds for economic development soundly walloped by the electorate, Governor Carey and the Senate majority leader, Warren M. Anderson, Repubiican of Binghamton, engaged in some partisan wrangling yesterday over who was to blame.

title: U.S. Deplores Loss of Life
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9(Reuters)The United States said today it deplored the loss of life and injuries to innocent people on both sides of the border between Israel and Lebanon and was urging all concerned to act with restraint.

title: Macy's Dino the Dinosaur Retires
description: Dino the Dinosaur is over the hill, as far as balloons go.

title: Meadowlands Results
description: Time 1:12 15. ScratchedNative Bend, Sound Idea. Trifecta (471)Paid $184,20. Attendance, 18,556. Handle, $2,171,870. Hano?e, $2,171,870. Weather cloudy, track good.

title: Schoolboy Wrestler, 17, Dies
description: CORYDON, Iowa, Nov. 9 (UPI)John Gustafson, a high school wrestler, collapsed and died yesterday during the second practice of the season at Wayne Community High School. Coach Bill McClymonds said the 17yearold youth, president of the student council and an allconference football center, had no apparent health problems. A preliminary autopsy indicated no cause of death.

title: Lawyer for 5 Youths Calls Georgia Judges Biased
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 9The chief defense lawyer for the socalled Dawson Five, five illiterate young black men accused of firstdegree murder in the slaying of a white man in south Georgia, assailed the Georgia judiciary today for what he called racial bias and covering up the wrongs of other judges.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Rosemary, Eiger; Salvator mundi Domine, Tails; Suite In G, Pachelbel; Souvenir de Paganini, Chopin; Bburee from Partite No. 1 for Solo Violin, liach/SaintSaens; Alborada del gracioso, Ravel; Coronation March from La Prophete, Meyerbeer; Sinfortia from Jephtha, Handel.

title: HEAD OF GATT WARNS ABOUT PROTECTIONISM
description: GENEVA, Nov. 9Olivier Long, the executive head of the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade, warned today that a further retreat toward protectionism by the trading nations would cause profound damage to national economies, to individual living standards and to the whole structure of international relations.

title: The Courts
description: SURROGATE

title: New Jersey Questions
DISPUTE DEVELOPING ON F16'S FOR EUROPE
description: BRUSSELS  A political dispute between the United States and Europe is developing over an agreement by Belgium, the Netherlands and Denmark two years ago to reequip their air forces with a new American fighter, the F16, at a total cost of some $2 billion.

title: Design Notebook
description: DONATO SAVOIE and Antonio Morello have an architectural and design partnership, and they specialize in Italian design. Moreover, they specialize in bringing Italian design to the cite place in New York where, until recently at least, it had gained the least acceptanceLittle Italy.

title: Results of Voting in Elections Tuesday in New York City and Rockland County
Saying No to the Breeder and Meaning It
description: Repeatedly during its freshman year, the Carter Administration has taken positions that started out as heroic and ended up as, well, flexible. When the President proposed abolishing the Electoral College, he described it as an issue of overriding governmental significance. Congress yawned and the issue has been put over till next year. Likewise, a bill to hold down hospital costs, which Mr. Carter called one of my most important priorities, has foundered. But when the President announced a major change in nuclear policyrenouncing American use of plutonium as a fuelhe meant it. Congress, again, did not go along. It voted continued funding for an experimental plutonium breeder reactor at Clinch River, Tenn. But now Mr. Carter has stuck to his guns and fired off his first veto. He was right, memorably right, to do so.

title: The U.N Today
District Attorney
description: Brooklyn

title: Coast Murder Victim Left New York City After Wife's Slaying
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 9 (Reuters)A young father was beaten to death by a gang of youths here over the weekend. almost a year to the day after the slaying of his wife in New York caused him to flee here seeking a safe home for their infant daughter.

title: At 31, Cleveland's MayorElect
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 9At 9:15 last night, Dennis Kucinich visited the city room of The Cleveland Plain Dealer, where he used to be a copy boy. With a broad grin, he sent an edited article through a pneumatic tube to the composing room, as he had done countless times before. The article said he was on his way to being elected the youngest Mayor of a major American city. At 31 years old, the 5foot7inch, 135  pounds Mr. Kucinich, with his shortcut darkbrown hair and wiry build, looks perhaps 10 years younger. Somebody holler, Copy! and watch him jump, said an old newsroom hand.

title: Rockland Democrats Keep Power
description: NEW CITY, Nov. 9Democrats retained control of the ISseat Rockland County Legislature, but by a reduced margin, in yesterday's races, in which a countywide coalition of Republicans and Conservatives had hoped to restore the Democrats to their minority role of four years ago.

title: Home Beat
description: CANNON MILLS GAVE a $20,000 check for the American Ballet Theater to Jacqueline Onassis at lunch at Bloomingdale's yesterday, and in a supreme effort not to be too commercial, the store refrained from using sheets as tablecloths. However, the florist, John Opedu. was able to work a new Cannon pillowcase, designed by Jackie Ayer, into the decor as a slipcover for a vase of flowers. After all, although Cannon was donating as much to the dance company as the State Department did for the company's European tour last year, Cannon was also launching a new sneet collection by a new designer.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: RICHMOND, Nov. 9 (AP)  The Federal Judge hearing a uranium lawsuit involving a number of electric utilities and the Westinghouse Electric Corporation pressed today for negotiated settlements.

title: Much Involvement
Carter News Parley On TV This Morning
description: President Carter's news conference, which is scheduled to begin at 10:30 this morning, will be televised live by the three networks and their local stationsChannels 2, 4 and 7. The following radio stations have also scheduled a live broadcast: WCBSAM, WINS, WMCA and WNYCAM.

title: Homosexual on Board Cites Role as Pioneer
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 9 (AP) The first avowed homosexual to be elected to the Board of Supervisors compared his task today to the one Jackie Robinson faced as the first black to play major league baseball when he came up with the Brooklyn Dodgers in 1947.

title: Lakeland Teachers Accept Pact, Ending State's Longest School Strike
description: SHRUB OAK, Nov. 9The state's longest teacher strike ended today when members of the Lakeland Federation of Teachers in this northern Westchester community accepted a contract calling for a 13 percent wage increase over the next three years and prepared to return to their classrooms tomorrow.

title: New Product Work The Thrill of It All
description: One thing that seemed to come through from the speakers at the New Product Marketing Workshop sponsored at the Plaza yesterday by the Association of National Advertisers was the exciting challenge of new product work.

title: Ghana and Bahia Cocoa Removed
description: The Cocoa Merchants Association of America reported yesterday that it would no longer publish spot prices for Ghana and Bahia cocoa. The cash or spot price is the lowest bid price for the physical commodity in a wholesale facility.

title: ADMINISTRATION WINS VICTORY IN CONGRESS ON COAL CONVERSION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9While energy tax conferees began their debates with arguments about elderly women in raggedy old coats. the Carter Administration scored a major victory on coal conversion today.

title: Williams Is for Inflation Accounting
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Harold M. Williams, the chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, came out strongly today in favour of the development of an accounting system aimed at accurately disclosing the impact of inflation on corporate earnings.

title: KOCH STARTS BUILDING STAFF, WITH COSTIKYAN AS FIRST DEPUTY MAYOR
description: Mayorelect Edward I. Koch said yesterday that his immediate concerns in preparing to govern New York City would be labor negotiations, Federal loans and the assembling of a staff. Work on the last task got under way when Edward N. Costikyan agreed to become First Deputy Mayor.

title: Black Journal Is Syndicated
description: BLACK JOURNAL, one of public television's major national blackoriented programs, has left the public network and moved to commercial television with a new name, Tony Brown's Journal, and sponsorship by Pepsico Inc.

title: SOVIET TRADE AIDE SEES CARTER TODAY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9 President Carter will meet tomorrow with the Soviet Foreign Trade Minister, Nikolai S. Patolichev, at a time when the United States is underscoring its interest in repairing economic ties with Moscow and in providing added incentive for an overall improvement in relations, American officials said today.

title: Against the Grain
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9Adm. Stansfield Turner's first public failure as Director of Central Intelligence saved the Soviet Union hundreds of millions of dollars in hard currency, and cost the United States what might have been a useful negotiating point.

title: Decision Barring Jobless Pay Benefits for Strikers Is Overturned by the U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals
description: A major court ruling that barred New York State from paying unemployment benefits to strikers was overturned yesterday by a Federal appeals court, which restored a payment practice that the state had followed for more than 40 years.

title: Sadat Urges AllOut Drive to Convene Peace Conference at Geneva
description: CAIRO, Nov. 9President Anwar elSadat called tonight for an allout drive to convene a new Middle East peace conference at Geneva and urged other Arabs to unite behind Cairo's efforts.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: When Lucite and Plexi became household words several years ago, Roe Kasian's name was synonymous with popular cleancut modular designs in those materials. This week the Koreanborn designer surfaced again when he introduced his new lacquer collectionmodular and traditional tables. etageres, chairs, chests, plus screens and accessories such trays, boxes and mirrors. Each piece is handcrafted, handcoated (with no less than 10 coats of lacquer) and handpolished. Some pieces are patterned with oak leaves (real leaves embedded on rice paper), and all are lacquered with his special formula that leaves them fire and waterproof, crackfree and seamless. Perhaps the best news of all is that delivery is immediate and the prices moderate. A set of three nesting tables with the oakleaf finish in black or muted orange is $325; an oxblood occasional table (18 by 17 inches). $215; and a black chest with nine drawers (52 inches long), $1,200. The collection is sold exclusively at Bergdorf Goodman, fourth floor.

Tickets are $6.95 to $8.95. For reservations and more information, call 9247160.

description: TRENTON, Nov. 9 A drive to eliminate the June 30 expiration date of the New Jersey income tax began materializing today following Governor Byrne's 300,000vote reelection victory over State Senator Raymond H. Bateman.

title: REA ExPresident Is Indicted by U.S. For Embezzlement
description: Tom Kole, the former president of REA Express Inc., the nation's largest ground and air express service before it went into bankruptcy two years ago, was indicted here yesterday on charges of embezzlement and conspiracy.

title: I.T.T. Lifts Net 40.2% and Raises Payout 6c to 50c
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation reported yesterday profit increases of 40.2 percent in the third quarter and 8.9 percent in the first nine months and announced an increase in the quarterly dividend to 50 cents from 44 cents a share, payable Jan. 1.

title: YALE SOFTENS STAND IN 6WEEK WALKOUT
description: NEW HAVEN, Nov. 9Yale's director of university operations says the administration is prepared to agree to concessions to striking service employees in an effort to settle the sixweekold walkout by 1,400 cooks, maintenance employees and other bluecollar workers.

title: Couple Sentenced in Kidnapping Of Daughter of Tennessee Banker
description: ASHEVILLE, N.C., Nov. 9 (UPI)Shelby Ann Baker, who pleaded guilty to aiding in the kidnapping of a Vanderbit University coed, was given a 10year sentence yesterday by a Federal judge.

title: Beat
description: For the last nine and onehalf years, I have been a New York City police officer. I was once a dedicated cop, and now, like so many others, I have grown to,regret having taken the oath, though police work is still rewarding, a problem lies within the city's administration. There has been a lack of open recognition and corrective action toward the stresses that are mounting in cops and their families. If our new Mayor, Edward Koch, could sit down with the coponthestreet, then maybe some of the problems continually talked about in back rooms of precincts could be brought into the open and solved.

title: Prostitutes From Midwest Vanish From 8th Avenue During Hunt by Visiting Police
description: The pimps have pulled all the white girls from the Midwest off the streets, a prostitute told the two Minneapolis policemen. You ain't going to find one of them tonight, mister.

description: DENVER, Nov. 9(AP)Jim Marshall, named the American Association manager of the year after guiding the Denver Bears to the league championship, has announced his resignation, a Bears spokesman said today.

title: Atlantic City Girds for Winter Lag In Its Business With Casino Delays
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 9 This faded resort, disappointed that the state has not moved faster to permit casino gambling to start here, has resigned itself to another winter of discontent.

title: Smoke Halts Pacific Jet Flight
description: HONOLULU, Nov, 9(UFI)A United Airlines charter flight bound for San Francisco was forced to turn back last night because smoke was detected in the plane's cockpit. The DC8, flight 5517; with 219 passengers aboard, landed without incident at Honolulu Airport, where it was examined by mechanics, an air???? spokesman said. The smoke was attributed to a compressor failure.

title: F.A.S.B. PROPOSES SHIFTS ON CURRENCY DEALINGS.
description: The Financial Accounting Standards, Board, the private sector's rulemaking body, proposed yesterday two relatively, minor changes to its controversial regulation dealing with foreign currency transactions.

title: Carter Speech: Standing Firm
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9President Carter has made it almost a trademark of his political career not to compromise on crucial issues until the eleventh hour, and in his speech last night he signaled that as far as he is concerned the eleventn hour had not yet arrived for his energy proNews gram.

title: VIETNAM BUDDHIST FLEES CHARGING PERSECUTION
description: PARIS, Nov. 9(Reuters)Vietnam's largest Buddhist movement has smuggled one of its top leaders out of the country to begin worldwide campaign against alleged religious persecution in Vietnam.

title: Last Survivor of Black Unit Dies
description: FORT HUACHUCA, Ariz., Nov. 9 (UPI) The last surviving member of the all black Buffalo Soldiers, B Troop, 10th U.S. Cavalry, James G. Barclay, died last Friday at Raymond Bliss Army Hospital. The funeral services were held today. He was 72 years old. He is survived by his wife, Lois.

title: AMENDMENT VICTORY SPURS COURT CHANGE
description: Following the surprising victory of the amendment providing for the gubernatorial appointment of judges to the New York Court of Appeals, its elated backers began mapping plans yesterday to have judges appointed to other courts as well.

description: On Saturday, the Museum of American Folk Art, the smallest museum on West 53d Street (sometimes referred to as Museum Row), will hold its annual house tour, consisting this year of five Manhattan residences.

description: NEWARK, Nov. 9 Reformists in Essex County, long controlled by one of the strongest Democratic Party machines in the state, began preparations today for a reorganization of New Jersey's most populous county.

title: Fire Destroys Tijuana Businesses
description: TIJUANA, Mexico, Nov. 9 (AP)A fire that sent flames 300 feet into the air destroyed eight downtown businesses and heavily damaged two here today as fire. fighters from the United. States joined Mexican units trying to halt the blaze. Estimates of early damage exceeded $5 million No injuries were reported.

NBC Chief Suggests Networks Act Jointly in Projecting Winners on Election Night
description: The chairman of NBC proposed yesterday the establishment of a pool for election projections by the three networks that would enable them to announce the name winner at the same time on election night.

title: Spring Fashions: A Little Something For Everybody
description: WHILE NONE of the spring readytowear collections shown yesterday achieved the peaks of creativity reached earlier in the week, they demonstrated the widespread appeal of Seventh Avenue fashions. There were clothes for the woman who likes to keep up with, but not ahead of the main fashion movement. There were styles for the exotic, the totally relaxed and the individual woman.

description: RECPIES  soil recipes  are handy to have for all sorts of earthy indoor gardening chores. They make light work of repotting and the right soil recipe for a particular plant helps insure that everything will grow well.

description: ON A WARM autumn night, the loud screech of a lone horn ran through the 200 block of Brooklyn's Dean Street. It would have startled a passerby. To residents, however, it signaled the beginning of the Boerum Hill Safety Committee's Freon horn drill,

title: Hundreds at Guy Lombardo's Rites
description: FREEPORT, L.I., Nov. 9Guy Lombardo, who for half a century ushered in each New Year for millions of Americans as his band played the sweetest music this side of heaven, was eulogized in funeral services today as one who held the affection of the boondocks, Broadway and the kids.

description: BONN, Nov. 9Chancellor Helmut Schmidt said tonight that he expected the major West German terrorists and their collaborators would be arrested in a matter of time either in West Germany or in neighboring countries.

description: Robert Szold, lawyer whose career ranged from helping to shape United States child labor law to leadership in the Zionist movement, died yesterday at the Harkness Pavilion at Columbia Presbyterian Medical Center. He was 88 years old.

title: Nonhikers and Sprawling Development Menace the Appalachian Trail
description: HARPERS FERRY, W.Va.The hikers trudging the Appalachian Trail as it snaked along the top of the Blue Ridge paused a few minutes for a look at the long valley spreading far beneath them. Bathed in the late morning sunlight, the treetops glowed warmly in red, yellow and russet tints as far as the eye could see.

title: Joe Louis Is Improving
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 9 (AP)Methodist Hospital reported today that Joe Louis continued to improve following heart surgery. The former heavyweight boxing champion underwent surgery last Thursday for replacement of a diseased section of the descending thoracic aorta. The hospital spokesman said Louis, 63 years old, was still in an intensive care unit.

description: The Soviet Union is preparing to buy substantial amounts of grain, according to Edward Lamb, owner of the Nevada National Bank, who was in New York yesterday after a visit to the Soviet Union,

title: Topics
description: In Brittany, Corsica and other areas, as Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau has noted, France has its own problems with separatists, and Paris would react very angrily indeed if Canada were to receive and decorate a Corsican separatist almost as if he were a head of state. So it is all the more dismaying that French President Giscard d'Estaing and his Government last week treated visiting Quebec Premier Ren Lvesque virtually as though Quebec were an independent state rather than one province of the sovereign Canadian nation.

title: Poet's Conviction in Slaying of Wife Upheld
description: PORTLAND, Me., Nov. 9The Maine Supreme Court has upheld the murder conviction of James E. Lewisohn, a poetprofessor who is serving a mandatory life sentence in the Maine State Prison here for the 1974 pistol slaying of his wife.

title: Minor Party Results Later
description: Returns for minorparty candidates for the major offices will be printed when election officials certify the official votes. The results carried are unofficial and some are incomplete.

title: William C. Sullivan, ExF .B .I. Aide, 65, Is Killed in a Hunting Accident
description: William C. Sullivan, former head of the Federal Bureau of Investigation's intelligence operations who broke in dramatic fashion with the late J. Edgar Hoover, was killed early yesterday in a shooting accident near his home in Sugar Hill, N.H. He was 65 years old.

title: Carter's Welfare Plan Is Criticized
description: Deputy Mayor Lucille Rose yesterday told a Congressional subcommittee looking into the Carter Administration's plan for restructuring welfare programs that workers in public service jobs should be paid wages equal to the prevailing market rate for that job.

title: Beethoven Sonatas Impressive On Cassette
description: At its best, the cassette now is a serious rival of the longplaying record, and that best is represented currently in these two Advent releases. Played on a highquality machine, it is impressive on all counts, though it still lacks the aural shimmer at the top that can be heard on the finest disk recordings of piano music.

title: 11 in Crowd at Accident Killed
description: DURBAN, South Africa, Nov. 9 (AP)A tractortrailer careened into a crowd at the scene of a fatal accident on the highway to Pietermaritzburg and killed 11 persons, the police reported today. Many others were injured.

title: Israeli Town Where Rockets Hit Gets On With Life, Buries Dead
description: NAHARIYA, Israel, Nov. 9At 11 A.M. today, the chilling wail of airraid sirens interrupted the shoppers and coffee sippers on the main street of this pleasant, treelined town.

title: 022! But Don't Laugh AT the Bucs
description: Through 22 consecutive games, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers have obeyed John McKay's first commandment in taking over the expansion team last year. I think it would be a mistake to try and win too fast, the coach said at the time. I don't want to do everything for a victory or two when the principal idea is to build a football team. John McKay, who had built four national champion college teams at the University of Southern California, did not realize that at Tampa Bay he would be building a tradition instead of a teama tradition of losing unmatched by any other National Football League franchise at the start of its history. In their first year, the Bucs became the first N.F.L. team ever to lose all 14 games on its schedule. This year they have lost all eight games as they await sunday's visit by the New York Giants but John Mckay is still seething over what happened in the Bucs 330 loss to the Rams last sunday in Los Angeles. In their eagerness to maintain the Bucs tradition, the Rams jumped offside on one play.After the Whistle, the referee stepped off the 5yard penalty against the Bucs instead of against the Rams. Realizing his mistake, the referee laughed as he turned and stepped it off properly. Some of the other officials also laughed. I didn't mind them making a mistake, John McKay snapped later. But they laughed. They shouldn't have laughed.

title: Jazz: Braxton Leads New Band
description: THE NEW Anthony Braxton band performing at Storyville through Saturday affords a chance to become acquainted with some important new faces and to hear more familiar musicians in a new light. It is a thicker, heavier band than those Mr. Braxton has fronted in the past, but it is finely balanced in sonorities, personalities, and talents. If it stays together it will undoubtedly be the best group Mr. Braxton has led.

title: Bucky Harris Dies at 81
description: Bucky Harris, who managed five major league teams, including the Yankees, died Tuesday in Bethesda, Md., at the age of 81. Details on Page D23.

title: BURNS SAYS RESERVE PLANS TO KEEP BRAKE ON GROWTH IN MONEY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 9  Reaffirming his tightmoney, antiinflationary policies, Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, told a Senate committee today that the Federal Reserve System intends to keep the brakes on growth in the nation's money supply.

title: Choosing Home Insulation
description: THE home furnaces have already been called into action to chase away the night chill of early fall, and many homeowners, anxiously anticipating another long, expensive winter, have begun exploring the merits of adding home insulation.

description: The porter in a Brooklyn subway station was shot to death and the token clerk seriously wounded yesterday when a gunman and two accomplices were thwarted in their attempt to rob the safe in the token booth.

description: ADAMSMilton L. On 11/8/77. Beloved husband of the late Gilda. Devoted father of Milton M. and Anna Visconti. Also survived by five grandchildren. Reposing Sisto Funeral Home Inc., 3489 E. Tremont Ave., Bronx. Requiem mass Saturday, 12 noon, St. Benedict's Church. Interment St. Raymond Cemetery.

title: BUCKY HARRIS, AT 81; EXYANKEE MANAGER
description: BETHESDA, Md., Nov. 9Bucky Harris, a member of baseball's Hall of Fame who managed five major league teams, died here yesterday, his 81st birthday. Harris, the Boy Manager of the 1920's, had suffered from Parkinson's Disease and he spent most of his later years in a retirement home.

title: F. B. I. Domestic Intelligence Found Curbed
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 9 (UPI)Congressional investigators said today that the Federal Bur??u of Investigation had sharply restricted its domestic intelligence work and, with some exceptions, appeared to be complying with guidelines to end years of abuse.
