To address these matters properly, Mr. Koch must first organize an administration capable of running the city governmentat least as well as it runs now and with a staff likely to be diminshed by further attrition, or even layoffs.

title: World News Briefs
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 11 (AP)The Thai military commander, Gen. Kriangsak Chamanad, was appointed Prime Minister today to replace Thanin Kraivichien, ousted in a bloodless coup on Oct. 20. The appointment followed by one day the proclamation of an interim Constitution that promised elections in 1978 or 1979.

title: Carey Denies That He Neglects His Official Duties for Social Life
description: Governor Carey, responding publicly for the first time to what he termed vicious gossip, denied yesterday that he had been neglecting his official dutiesin favor of an afterhours social life in bars and other nightspots.

title: New PBS Show for the Elderly Accents Positive Side of Aging
description: SAN FRANCISCOTelling veteran television viewers that Hugh Downs seems to be a truly decent man with a gentle sense of humor and a gift for communication is like telling Republicans that President Carter seems to be a Democrat occupying the White House.

title: Gentry Resigns As A. &P. Chief After 2 Years
description: The Great Atlantic and Pacific Tea Company, the big supermarket chain that has been struggling to maintain its profitability, announced yesterday the resignation of Grant C. Gentry as president and chief administrative officer.

title: Kickback Charge Against Provenzano Is Dismissed
description: Anthony Provenzano, the leader of the teamsters union in New Jersey, won the dismissal yesterday of a Federal indictment that charged him with conspiracy to arrange a kickback on a $2.3 million loan from a union pension fund.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Article 4  No Title

title: Young Assails South Africa Arrests
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 11Anhew Young, the chief United States delegate, said today that the South African Government's arrest of hundreds of blacks outside Pretoria was one of a series of irrational and fearful things that would contribute to its further isolation.

title: Perquisites of City U. College Presidents Are Assailed
description: An audit by the New York City Comptroller's office has charged that some of City University's 18 college presidents followed a pattern of extravagance in a year of fiscal austerity, spending city funds and student fees on Oriental rugs, expensive lunches, parties, dues at a country club, chauffeured cars and maid service to go with citypurchased houses and cooperative apartments.

title: A FORDKIM MEETING SOUGHT AT ONE TIME
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP)An Ohio Congressman tried several times to arrange a meeting between President Ford and Hancho C. Kim, a Korean businessman now accused of taking part in the alleged effort of the Korean Government to influence Congressmen, a former Ford aide said tonight.

title: Hanoi Asks Return of Hijackers
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 11 (UPI)Vietnam today demanded the return of four men who hijacked a commercial airliner to Singapore, the official Hanoi radio said. Two of the crewmen aboard the DC3 were killed in the hijacking two weeks ago.

title: Famous Mother's Daughter Creates Her Own Image
description: For the last few months it has been impossible not to see Bess Myerson on television. But her daughter, Berra Grant, who has a career of her own, has not been part of her mother's act. She was to be found recently in the warehouse area of the Lower West Side, up a flight of shabby stairs to the second floor of the Joseph A. Zaloom company, whose business is the importing and roasting of pistachio nuts.

title: 2 Sought by Bonn Badly Wounded By Dutch Police
description: AMSTERDAM, Nov. 11 (AP)Two West Germans. one of them sought in the murder of HannsMartin Schleyer were hospitalized in serious condition today after a gun fight with Dutch police.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: Article 7  No Title

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 11The Assembly will have a record number of women12among its 80 members when the newly elected 198th New Jersey State Legislature convenes at noon on Jan. 10, but there will be only one woman in the 40member Senate.

title: Notes on People
description: Margot Fonteyn led a delegation to the Soviet Embassy in London in support of Rudolf Nureyev's efforts to persuade the Russians to allow his mother to visit him in the West. But, said Dame Margot, We were not received. We just left the petition on the doorstep. Copies of the petition seeking permission for a visit to Mr.

title: Financial Follies: Wall St. Parody
description: The Financial Follies of 1978, an annual parody of the year's activity in business and finance sponsored by the New York Financial Writers Association, was presented last night to, an audience of brokers, bankers and businessmen with potshots, as usual, at some of the major issues of the day.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Two Young Athletes Long Road to Yale
description: DERBY, Conn., Nov. 11Don't expect to find the regulars in Stork's Tavern, corner of Eighth and Hawkins, tomorrow afternoon, the regulars who sip beer and play cards in the tiny bar. Look for them in the Yale Bowl, mingling with the minkandtweed alumni of Harvard and Yale.

title: Greek Opposition Gaining in Conservative Area
description: KALAMATA, Greece, Nov. 11On consecutive nights this week, the leaders of the two main opposition parties in the impending Greek election came to this capital of fertile Messenia Province, famous for its wealth of olives and figs, to preach to the unconvertedthe traditionally conservative Peloponnesian farmers and small merchants.

title: New Pact Is Offered In Dockers Strike
description: Shipping employers gave striking longshoremen yesterday a detailed proposal that appeared to provide the basis for an expeditious settlement of the 42dayold strike that has tied up container shipping from Maine to Texas.

title: Slaying Suspect Freed
description: CAMDEN, N. J., Nov. 11 (AP) The widow of Blenda Gay, a defensive end for the Philadelphia Eagles football team, was released from the Camden County Jail yesterday after being imprisoned nearly a year awaiting a trial in her husband's murder. The suspect, Roxanne Gay, 26 years old, was freed after five members of the North Jersey Branch of the National Organization of Women raised $4,500, which is 10 percent of her $45,000 bail.

title: SHIFT FROM GAS WINS TENTATIVE APPROVAL IN SENATE AND HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP)House and Senate energy conferees gave unanimous but tentative approval today to the bulk of President Carter's plan'to make power plants and industries switch from oil and natural gas to coal.

title: TEACHER GROUP BACKS RIGHTTOSTRIKE BILL
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 11Leaders of the New Jersey Education Association urged members today to work for passage of pending legislation that would give teachers a limited right to strike.

title: SOUTH AFRICA INVOKES PRODUCTION POWERS
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 11The South African Government today took special powers over industry that include the right to order foreignowned plants to produce strategic materials that become unavailable from overseas suppliers.

title: BRITAIN RENEWS SANCTIONS AGAINST SMITH REGIME
description: LONDON, Nov. 11 (Reuters)Britain renewed economic sanctions against Rhodesia for a 12th year today amid receding hopes of ceasefire talks next week.

title: Gerard Moves Against State
description: Attorneys for Dr. Mark Gerard began contempt proceedings yesterday against the New York State Racing and Wagering Board for refusal to comply with a court ruling allowing the veterinarian to return to work at Belmont Park.

title: New Orleans Mayoral Vote Today: A Black vs. White
description: NEW ORLEANS,Nov. 11Voters in this exotic but economically ailing Southern city go to the polls tomorrow to elect a mayor in a race characterized by legal turmoil and quiet but powerful racial feeling.

title: Pentagon Says ArmsSale Figure Was $1.4 Billion Above Estimate
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The Defense Department said today that the Pentagon sold $1.4 billion more in arms in the 1977 fiscal year than had previously been estimated.

title: CANADA FORCES ACCUSED OF MAIL INTERCEPTIONS
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 11The Government has ordered an investigation of a report published today that Canadian armed forces units have intercepted private mail in security operations.

title: Dennis Wheatley, Writer on Occu?t
description: LONDON, Nov. 11(AP)  Dennis Wheatley, the British writer of thrillers, who was best known for his books on the devil and the occult, died at his home here today at the age of 80.

title: Second Man Questioned in Slaying
description: A friend of Shlomo Tat, a material witness in the murder and robbery of Pinchos Jaroslawicz, a diamond dealer, is being questioned by detectives working on the case.

title: U.S. Fines Gulf Oil $229,500 for Gifts In Political Drives
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (AP)The Treasury Department fined the Gulf Oil Corporation $229,500 today in connection with illegal campaign contributions and indicated more large fines can be expected against other companies.

title: Arab Foreign Ministers Gathering In Tunis to Review Peace Strategy
description: TUNIS, Nov. 11A conference of Arab foreign ministers opening here tomorrow has already been upstaged by the declaration of President Anwar elSadat earlier this week that Egypt was prepared to go to a new Middle East peace conference at Geneva without first settling the procedural problems.

title: South African Arrest Scene Calm
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 11Calm returned today to the black township outside Pretoria where police using helicopters and attack dogs arrested more than 500 persons yesterday, including 400 who allegedly lacked the necessary residence permits.

title: Superman Nears His 1,000th Goal
description: Gordie Howe doesn't count his years or goals. He will be 50 in March and a grandfather in April, but he is still skating easily in the World Hockey Association, and any game now for the New England Whalers he will score his 1,000th goal.

title: A Prison Fugitive Gets 125 Years For 5 Robberies in St. Louis Area
description: ST. LOUIS, Nov. 11(UPI)Federal District Judge John F. Nangle today sentenced Terrance Karl Alden, a fugitive from a New Jersey prison who robbed five financial institutions in this area, to 125 years in prison.

title: Books of The Times
description: The problem of declining academic achievement in this country is a serious one that cries out for serious analysis and thoughtful suggestions about what can be done to reverse the apparent downward trends. Unfortunately, this book doesn't provide it. Our Children's Crippled Future is a disjointed accumulation of facts and figures, held together by a selective sense of history and an indulgent nostalgia for a golden age that never existed. Its main contribution would seem to be that its turgid style and tangled syntax stand as additional proof, if any is still needed, that the misuse of language is indeed a problem in America today.

title: Jabbar Speaks Out
description: INGLEWOOD, Caliif., Nov. 11 (UPI)  Kareem AbdulJabbar of Los Angeles, speaking out for the first time since being fined $5,000 by Larry O'Brien for punching Kent Benson of Milwaukee Oct. 18, criticized the National Basketball Association commissioner today for not taking any disciplinary action against Benson.

title: Jury Is Unable to Reach a Verdict In ArsonMurder Case in Jersey
description: JERSEY CITY, Nov. 11 (AP)A Hudson county court jury was unable to reach a verdict in the trial of a Jersey City man charged with arson and murder in the deaths of a grandmother and six children in a tenement fire here last March.

title: Deaths
description: ARONOFFSedle nee Littman, beloved wife of Abe, devoted mother of Lowell, Arline Mains and Cynthia Morris, deer grandmother of Drew, Ellen, Marc, Cathy, Meryl, Bonnie & Brian and greet grandmother of Heather, Joel, William and Eric adored sister of Ethel Kolber, Augusta Enter, Beatrice Saks and Irving Littman. Services Sunday 12:15PM Schwartz Brothers Forest Park Chapels Queens Blvd & 76th St. Rd. Forest Hills.

title: Comsat to Buy Its Own Stock At $37 a Share
description: The Communications Satellite Corporation, still flush with capital after more than $400 million of investments in satellites and earth stations over the last 13 years, announced yesterday a plan to buy back 1.5 million of its 10 million common shares.

title: Impatience May Cost Pitt A Chance at Major Bowls
description: Bowl officials are, by tradition, impatient fellows. They want to get teams for their games at the earliest possible date even if it means they risk landing a team that loses after it is selected.

title: Case of Girl Who Drank Drain Cleaner Is Settled For HalfMillion Dollars
description: The family of a girl who lost her esophagus after drinking a small amount of LiquidPlumr, a drain cleaner, won a $500,000 outofcourt settlement yesterday.

title: MILWAUKEE AND ILLINOIS REACH ACCORD ON SEW AGE
description: CHICAGO, Nov, 11The state of Illinois and the city of Milwaukee have reached an agreement in a sewage pollution case marked by seven years of legal battles.

title: United Merchants Ask U.S. Court To Approve Plan to Pay All Debts
description: United Merchants and Manufacturers Inc., which went into voluntary bankruptcy last July after closing its Robert Hall clothing store chain, applied yesterday for court approval of a plan to pay all its debts. The plan, filed in Federal bankruptcy court in New York, calls for the outstanding debt to be paid in full with interest and for the distribution of 555,555 shares of United common stock.

title: Talks Deadlocked In 4Week Walkout At Black Network
description: Negotiations are deadlocked in a fourweekold strike by 27 technicians, audiotape operators and news writers of the National Black Network, a radio program service for stations aimed at black audi ences.Supervisory personnel, assisted by a few temporary nonunion employees have been handling the technical opera tions and delivering the network's hourly fiveminute newscasts.

title: Belfast Explosions Kill One
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Nov. 11 (AP)Two bomb blasts in the center of Belfast killed a man and injured several persons today. The dead man was identified as Paddy Shields of Belfast's mainly Roman Ctholic Lower Falls district.

title: Mozambique Seems to Have Built Discipline Without a Martial Air
description: MAPUTO, Mozambique  In slightly more than two years of independence, this Marxist state seems to have succeeded where so many developing African nations have failed: creating a sense of discipline without outwardly turning the country into an armed camp.

title: Man Gets Suspended Sentence In Death Threat to Rockefeller
description: CAMDEN, NOV. 11 (UPI)A John Birch Society member was sentenced in Federal District Court today in connection with death threats against former Vice President Nelson A. Rockefeller.

title: Britain Debates How to Use Its Oil Wealth
description: LONDONEver since October 1970, when the British Petroleum Company made the first major discovery, this ohronically troubled country has dreamed of the day when its North Sea oil might rescue it from economic decline.

title: Riot Police in Seoul Break Up Demonstration by 2,000 Students
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Nov. 11(AP)Riot policemen used tear gas to break up a demonstration by about 2,000 students at Seoul's National University today. The students were demanding democratic reforms and the unconditional release of all political prisoners.

title: CLEANWATER RULES EASED BY CONFEREES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11A HouseSenate conference committee has agreed to give industry more time to install antipollution equipment and to relax Federal controls over the nation's environmentally delicate wetlands.

title: Business Records
description: Southern District

title: Companies Issue Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended Sept. 30 unless otherwise Indicated. (N) Indicates stock s, traded on The New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (O overthecounter.

title: SOVIET BUYING TO RAISE GRAIN PRICE, GROWER SAYS
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 11 (UPI)A farm leader said today that surprise wheat sales to the Soviet Union should cause prices to jump by spring, but a grain exchange executive asserted that any major increase would depend on how soon the Russians took delivery.

title: Personal Investing
description: There is a casino overtone. If you put your money in the stock market, there is a chance you won't get it all back. In fact, there is a fairly strong chance that you won't get it all back.

title: Gertrude Astor, 90, an Actress In Silent Films and the Talkies
description: HOLLYWOOD, Nov. 11(AP)Gertrude Astor, whose 50year career as a leading lady spanned the silentfilm era and the early talkies, died of a stroke Wednesday on her 90th birthday.

title: Sheryl Gilbert Is Married to Peter. A. Jaszi
description: Sheryl Gilbert, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Milton Gilbert of Basel, Switzerland, and Peter Andrew Jaszi, sort of Mr. and Mrs. George Jaszi of Chevy Chase, Md., were married yesterday in Washington. Judge Harold Leventhal of the United States Court of Appeals performed the ceremony in his chambers.

title: Kissinger on Kissinger
description: WASHINGTONNow that Henry Kissinger has resumed his old trade of authoralthough at stratospheric level and no longer as a working professor he can analyze what changes he wrought during eight years as statesman, at first behind the scenes, then at stage center.

title: SOVIET DENOUNCES U.S. ON RIGHTS AT BELGRADE
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 11(UPI) The Soviet Union and Czechoslovakia, in the angriest debate yet at the Belgrade conference, today accused the United States of massive violations of human rights.

title: You  Oo, Oo, Oo Oo, Oo, Oo
description: News bulletin: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police have been illegally reading and copying other people's mail for the past 23 years, according to the Canadian Government.

title: ISRAEL AGAIN BOMBS SOUTHERN LEBANON; ARTILLERY IN ACTION
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 11  Israeli fighterbombers raided southern Lebanon today for the second time in three days, and Israeli artillerymen exchanged fire with Palestinian gunners.

title: Patents
description: WASHINGTONA patent for a color technique used in micropublishing was granted this week to a staff member at an RCA Corporation laboratory in Zurich.

title: Activist Clergy Bear Burden Of Arrests in the Philippines
description: MANILAThe Rev. James B. Reuter does not look like a dangerous man. A kindly, energetic Jesuit priest from New Jersey who has lived in the Philippines since 1938. he counts among his former students the wife of the country's Secretary of Defense, Juan Ponce Enrile. At her request, in fact, Father Reuter recently led the celebration of the couple's 20th wedding anniversary and said mass when Mrs. Enrile's mother died.

title: Topics
description: A landlord can keep out of his building intelligent persons, aware of their rights, who may give him trouble in the future. So stated the New York State Supreme Court last week in a decision that is bound to have revolutionary consequences. Stung by this affront, intelligent people are sure to come out of their booklined closets and into the streets. They will seek legislation to protect the intelligent minority. Then will come a ruling that every landlord must rent to a fair representation of people with an I.Q. above 130  the first official intelligence quota.

title: Down East Slowdown
description: BAILEY ISLAND, MeThe rhythm of life has slowed now and it is quiet once again after the bustle of summer. The visitors have left, gone over the bridge and back to the mainland.

title: 1979 Deficit of $40 Billion May Still Allow a Tax Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The budget being prepared for the fiscal year 1979, according to Acting Budget Director James T. McIntyre Jr., will show a deficit in the neighborhood of $40 billion, a figure that evidently leaves room for a substantial tax cut next year.

title: Laetrile Convictions of Five Upset
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 11 (AP)The California Court of Appeal has reversed the conviction of five persons charged with conspiracy to sell laetrile, a controversial substance described by its backers as a cancer cure.

title: DESIGNEE FOR U.S. JOB WITHDRAWS HIS NAME
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Interior Secretary Cecil D. Andrus announced today that he had asked President Carter to withdraw the nomination of Robert Mendelsohn as Assistant Secretary for Policy, Budget, and Administration at Mr. Mendelsohn's request.

title: Farber Takes a Post With Jack Hilton Inc.
description: Barry Farber, the defeated mayoral candidate, has accepted a senior advisory position wtih a publicaffairs consulting company. Resumption of his radio show here will be among his duties.

title: California Asks Supreme Court To Help Resolve Hughes Dispute
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 11 LAP}The California authorities asked the Supreme Court today to help to resolve conflicting claims between the two states about which one the late Howard R. Hughes regarded as his home.

title: Radio
description: 6.A.M.,WNYCAM. Mass: Sub tuum praesidium, Obrecht; Mass Magnae Deus Potentiae, Isaac; Jubilate Deo, Fiocco.

title: Anglicans Update Lord's Prayer
description: LONDON, Nov. 11 (AP)The Church of England has approved a new version of the Lord's Prayer that puts it in modern English.

title: A Man Accused of Bribery Cleared
description: A man accused of bribing a former mayoral assistant to get New York City to buy land in which he had an interest was acquitted Thursday night after contending he had been lured into proposing corrupt financial dealings.

title: Democratic Leaders of Legislature Fail to Agree On Lifting Income Tax Time Limit at This Session
description: EAST BRUNSWICK,Nov. 10Democratic legislative leaders divided today over whether the current lameduck session of the State Legislature should be pressed to vote on eliminating the June 30 expiration date of the state income tax.

title: Mondale Visits New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N. H., Nov. 11(UPI)Vice President Mondale arrived in New Hampshire today to help draw some money into the state Democratic Party's depleted coffers by attending a $10aperson reception for large contributors to the campaign of Senator Thomas J. McIntyre.

title: Kevin Porter Sparkles as Nets Set Back Bulls by 9189
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Nov. 11For Kevin Porter, it was the beginning of a new chapter in his professional basketball career: his first game at his new home court. For the New Jersey Nets, it was a new ending to a story that had been becoming sadly familiar.

title: KOCH LIKELY TO ASK BADILLO TO ASSUME HIGH POST IN CITY
description: Representative Herman Badillo, who after losing in September's Democratic mayoral primary became a key adviser to the ultimate winner, Representative Edward I. Koch, will be offered a high position, probably as a Deputy Mayor, in the Koch administration, according to sources close to the Mayorelect.

title: Metropolitan Show Will Display PreMiddle Ages Art
description: An exhibition of late GrecoRoman and early Christian art from more than 100 public and private collections, among them the British Museum, the Louvre and the Vatican, will open Nov. 19 at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Thomas P. F. Hoving, director of the museum, announced yesterday.

title: Smoker Loses Compensation Plea
description: SANFRANCISCO, Nov. 11(UPI)The California Workers Compensation Appeals Board has ruled that persons who ruin their health by smoking on the Job cannot blame their employers. The board's decision, announced yesterday, held that the JohnsManville Company did not have to pay workers compensation to a man who smoked on the job for 28 years and developed chronic bronchitis.

title: Fed Board Widens Scrutiny of BankHolding Units
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11The Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System approved a major expansion of regulatory powers over large bank holding compa. nies today.

title: Favored Affiliate, Cordero Up, Wins Sport Page by a Neck
description: Only a neck and nose separated the first three finishers in yesterday's $52,600 Sport Page Handicap at Aqueduct, which was won by Affiliate with Angel Cordero up.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: DETROIT, Nov. 11Bernie Traurig, the second professional rider to perform for the United States Equestrian Team. made his debut on the squad by riding Fair Warning to victory today at the opening session of the Royal Winter Fair horse show.

title: Dollar Falls Slightly In European Trade; Gold Advances $1
description: LONDON, Nov. 11(AP)The dollar dropped slightly today against all major West European currencies in very light foreign exchange trading.

title: BLUMENTHAL SEES TAX BILL STRESSING RELIEF, NOT REFORM
description: WASHINGTON,Nov. 11 Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal said today the first priority of the tax bill President Carter will submit to Congress in January will be relief for individuals and business and not the fundamental revisions of the tax structure that the Administration has been discussing for months.

title: Nuclear Panel Disputes Reactor Safety Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11 (UPI)The Nuclear Regulatory Commission staff said today that only one out of 45 atomic reactors checked so far may have the type of electrical connector defects that caused scientists last week to urge the shutdown of virtually all reactors in the United States.

title: Two Young Athletes Long Road to Yale
description: DERBY, Conn., Nov. 11Don't expect to find the regulars in Stork's Tavern, corner of Eighth and Hawkins, tomorrow afternoon, the regulars who sip beer and play cards in the tiny bar. Look for them in the Yale Bowl, mingling with the minkandtweed alumni of Harvard and Yale.

title: Israeli Leader Says He Welcomes Offer By Sadat for Talks
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 11Prime Minister Menahem Begin asked the citizens of Egypt today to join Israelis in a silent oath of no more wars, no more bloodshed, and no more threats.

title: Argentina Adds Curbs on Dissident
description: BUENOS AIRES. Nov. 11Argen'ina's military junta has issued a decree formally depriving a jailed newspaper publisher of Ifs civil rights placing his property in state custody and authorizing indefinite detention without a court order.

title: City Opera: Three OneAsters Billed as Trilogy
description: The City Opera's production of three oneact operas, gathered under the allpurpose title of Trilogy, returned to the State Theater for a single, endofthefallseason performance Thursday night. Introduced last spring, Mozart's The Impresario and Poulenc's La Voix Humaine remained much as before, but Frank Corsaro's staging and generally deplored adaptation of Stravinsky's Soldier's Tale has been dropped in favor of Ravel's L'Heure Espagnol.

title: A Load the Barges Should Carry
description: Railroads build and maintain their own tracks. Truckers pay fuel taxes and tolls to compensate government for the use of the highways. The barge industry, by contrast, pays nothing for the use of 15,000 miles of deepchannel inland waterways operated by the Federal Government at an annual cost of hundreds of millions of dollars.

title: ASSIGNING TEACHERS BY RACE TO CONTINUE
description: A Federal District Court judge in Brooklyn refused yesterday to restrain the Board of Education from assigning teachers on a racial or ethnic basis.

title: Soviet Said to Offer 3Year Ban on Civilian ABlasts
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 11The Soviet Union has reportedly proposed a moratorium on nonmilitary nuclear explosions that would expire after three years and would have no relationship to a complete ban on testing of nuclear weapons.

title: Japanese Launching Postponed
description: TOKYO, Nov. 11(Reuters)Japan's first experimental communications satellite will be launched from Cape Canaveral, Fla., on Dec. 15 instead of Dec. 9 as originally scheduled, the National Space Development Agency said today.

title: Goldin, Over Beame Protest, Bars Sale of Notes Without Underwriter
description: A plan to revive the sale of shortterm New York City notes by offering them directly to the public without an underwriter was rejected by City Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin yesterday over the strenuous protest of Mayor Beam.

title: New U.S. Parole Board Member
description: Free at last! Free at last!

title: Philharmonic, With Maazel, In 3 Classics
description: The New York Philharmonics program in Avery Fisher Hall on Thursday night was so oldfashionedtraditional is probably a nicer wordas to seem fresh. It included the Suite No. 1 from Handel's Water Music, Mozart's Jupiter Symphony and Schumann's Rhenish Symphony. It was conducted by Lorin Maazel. Interestingly enough, the concert and its three repetitions have sold out.

title: Nugent Is Lovably Obnoxious As He Carries On With Guitar
description: Ted Nugent is a caricature. With his lion's mane of hair, his line of streethippie patter, his macho, posturing and his combination of superamplified guitar playing and acrobatics, he might as well have stepped out of a Furry Freak Brothers underground comic from 1967.

title: A Declaration of Independence𠅔and a Burst of Americana
description: The spectacular season for American fashion is marked by an equally spectacular growth on the part of American designers. Sometimes it has been marked by an abrupt change of pace from the kind of clothes the designer has been accustomed to making. In other cases, it is a continuation or improvement of an established style.

title: Publicly Traded Funds
description: Friday, Nov. 11, 1977

title: Bridge:
description: one or the differences an observer would note between the defensive play of an intermediate player and an expert is their attitude toward aces. The moderate performer tends to snatch his aces quickly, before the rats get, at them, while the expert is more restrained. He knows that there are many situations in which the problems of the declarer are simplified by acesnatching defenders.

title: Guards Union Head Urges Ouster Of Tufo as Correction Panel Chief
description: The head of the union representing New York City's 3,000 correction officers has called for the removal of Peter Tufo as chairman of the city's Board of Correction.

title: ExSenators Convictions Upheld
description: BOSTON, Nov. 11 (AP)The United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit upheld today the conspiracy and extortion convictions of two former Massachusetts state senators, who now face a year in Federal prison. The court said that the evidence against Joseph J. C. DiCarlo and Ronald C. MacKenzie justified the verdict. They were convicted last February of shaking down a New York consulting concern for $40,000 and sentenced to one year in prison and a $5.000 fine.

title: Mozambique Seems to Have Built Discipline Without a Martial Air
description: MAPUTO, Mozambique  In slightly more than two years of independence, this Marxist state seems to have succeeded where so many developing African nations have failed: creating a sense of discipline without outwardly turning the country into an armed camp.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Ver??'s La Travlata, 2; Verdi's Rl?oletto, 8.

title: Pele, by Another Name
description: The Cosmos former soccer star, Pel was born Edson Arantes do Nascimento in the Brazilian village of Tres Coracoes.

title: Coast Town's Dialect Keeps Brightlighters in the Dark
description: BOONVILLE, Calif.Five generations of Leo Sanders's family have lived in and around this coastal valley town, where folks have been harpin Boontling, or speaking the local dialect, for close to a century now.

title: Todd Case: Dr. Nicholas Responds
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Nov. 11 Dr. James A. Nicholas, the prominent orthopedist and the team surgeon for the New York Jets, said today that ?e had hospitalized Richard Todd, Jet quarterback, because the player was in agony and not because, as some teammates and the coach believed, the doctor was employing a double standard of health care.

title: Scores on WQXR
description: Scores of leading football games will be given over WQXR on the 6 P.M. news broadcast and on other news reports. Please do not telephone The New York Times for scores; the calls tie up lines and interfere with the work of the newspaper and the radio station.

title: Grain Futures Drop; Gold Climbs
description: Grain futures declined yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade, primarily reflecting the prospect of record corn and soybean crops this year as well as the current unfavorable weather in growing areas.

title: Auto Mechanics School: For Women on the Road to SelfSufficiency
description: FREEHOLD, N. J.William Pollack, who teaches auto repair to a class of 18 women, described their final exam to his students the other day: If you can drive your car home from here, he said, you passed.

title: In the Long Run He Was a Success
description: Max Telford was chased by a bear in the Yukon, was the target of a beer bottle in Alberta and carried letters from the Mayors of 50 North American cities to the Mayor of Halifax, Nova Scotia.

title: Drinking Water in Parts of S.I. Found Contaminated
description: Drinking water in the middle eastern section of Staten Island was contaminated yesterday as a result of flooding in the area following a twoday storm and a day of heavy rain, a City Health Department official reported.

title: Reform of the U.S. Criminal Code: Parole Provisions Bother Liberals
description: When a bill identified as S. 1437 was voted out of the Senate Judiciary Committee last week, it was an event of more than passing interest. The legislation is a recodification of the Federal criminal laws and it has been 11 years in the making. Its history and its current status shed light on how the legislative process works in Washington.

title: Deirdre Drohan Bride Of Thomas Forbes 3d
description: Deirdre Mary Drohan, daughter of Judge and Mrs. William J. Drohan of Yonkers, was married yesterday afternoon to Thomas H. Forbes 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Forbes Jr. of Riverdale, the Bronx. Msgr. Peter E. McNulty performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of the Visitation in the Bronx.

title: William Elio Weds Samantha Smith
description: Samantha Smith of Miami, daughter of Mrs. von Bettels Smith of Southport, Conn., and Roland F. W. Smith of Wilton, Conn., was married last night to William T. Elio, also of Miami. He is a son of Thomas W. Elio of Geneva and the late Mrs. Elio.

title: 5 Killed as Czech Trains Collide
description: PRAGUE, Nov. 11(AP)A passenger train collided with a freight train in central Czechoslovakia today, killing five per sons and injuring eight, the official news agency reported. Five of the injured were reported in serious condition.

title: Exam Tested In Dance Time
description: One spends so much time examining the intricate structure of Senta Driver's dances that there is hardly any time to enjoy them as performances. They are like abstracts commenting upon other styles and though carefully and frequently brilliantly designed, they scarcely ever touch the emotions. The company, Harry, presented seven works Wednesday evening as part of the Dance Umbrella series at the Entermedia Theater.

title: Jets Renowned Surgeon
description: Despite national prominence and a list of patients that has included John F. Kennedy, Joe Namath and Billie Jean King, Dr. James Adam Nicholas gets excited by a simple thing such as a Jet football game. The 56yearold Nicholas is on the sideline for all games, pacing, shouting encouragement, booing a bad call by the officials.

title: Explosives Found in Prison
description: STUTTGART, West Germany, Nov. 11 (Reuters)Explosives were found today in the cell block of a prison here where three West German terrorists died last month.

title: ISRAEL AGAIN BOMBS SOUTHERN LEBANON; ARTILLERY IN ACTION
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 11  Israeli fighterbombers raided southern Lebanon today for the second time in three days, and Israeli artillerymen exchanged fire with Palestinian gunners.

title: THE REV.J. PASCHALL DAVIS
description: The Rev. J. Paschall Davis, an Episcopal priest and a lawyer who was a leader in the Nashville, chapters of Planned Parenthood and the Euthanasia Educational Council and other social action organizations, died yesterday at his Nashville home after a stroke. He was 69 years old.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: The former executive director of the American Cancer Society in Bergen County was sued in a civil complaint yesterday for allegedly diverting more than $30,000 in charitable contributions to his use.

title: Why Can't Canadiens Win at Home?
description: Glenn Resch suggested it all might have been a hoax, this socalled slump of the Montreal Canadiens. They sure as hell weren't in a slump tonight, Resch said Thursday night, after Montreal routed the Islanders, 51, putting 36 shots on goal. Then, turning to a reporter from one of Montreal's Frenchlanguage newspapers, Resch, the losing goalie, asked, Was it true what we were reading? Or did it just set us up here?

title: Bryant Key As 76ers Top Knicks
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 11  Joe Bryant, one of last season's unhappiness boys, has been given a new lease on life during the nascent coaching regime of Billy Cunningham. Tonight he gave the Philadelphia 76ers the lift they needed to defeat the Knicks, 127119, before a capacity crowd of 18,276 at the Spectrum. The triumph kept Cunningham unbeaten in four games as coach.

title: SOUTH AFRICA INVOKES PRODUCTION POWERS
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 11The South African Government today took special powers over industry that include the right to order foreignowned plants to produce strategic materials that become unavailable from overseas suppliers.

title: Woman Democrat to Appeal Loss In Greenwich by 1 Vote in Recount
description: For about 48 hours it seemed that Ruth L. Sims has, by six votes, become the first Democratic chief executive of Greenwich, Conn., in 72 yearsand the first woman to hold that post, known as First Selectman, in the town's history.

title: Music: 4 Saints and Socrate
description: It was a journey into America's artistic past, though not so distant that some of the artists themselves could not be in attendance. Virgil Thomson, preeminently, was there Thursday night at the Beacon Theater to witness a concert performance of his Four Saints in Three Acts and a minimalist staging of Satie's Socrate that employed Mr. Thomson's English translation.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Turner's Teams Lose Money
description: A?AN?A Nov. 11 (AP)Ted Turner said yesterday that the two major league sports franchises owned by his firmTurner Communications Corporationhad a net loss of $380,000 in the third quarter of this year. Turner said the sports, broadcasting and billboard company lost 39 cents a share on revenues of almost $8.6 million in the threemonth period ended Sept. 30. The losses, Turner explained, were due to increased expenses for the Atlanta Braves and the Atlanta Hawks.

title: Peru to Sign Accord With I.M.F. For $100 Million Standby Credit
description: LIMA, Peru, Nov. 11(UPI)Peru will sign an agreement with the International Monetary Fund within a week for a standby credit of $100 million to aid the country's economic recovery, a top finance official said today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TODAY, Nov. 12

title: Beame Urges Carter to Qualify Staten Island for U.S. Flood Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11Mayor Beame calied on President Carter today to declare Staten Island a disaster area eligible for Federal relief because of the floods from this week's heavy rains.The Mayor said that Mr. Carter informed him that a request from Governor Carey that the island be made a disaster area had not yet reached the White House.

title: Kathleen A. O'Neil Wed To William Burnham Jr.
description: Kathleen Ann O'Neil, daughter of Mrs. Carl W. Lundgren of Newington, Conn., and the late Kenneth R. O'Neil, was married yesterday to William Arthur Burnham Jr. The Rev. Robert Robbins performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of the Resurrection in Rye, N.Y.

title: FREDERICK TODD DIES; MILITARY HISTORIAN
description: Frederick Porter Todd, who retired in 1965 as director of the West Point Museum at the United States Military Academy, died Wednesday in Cornwall (N.Y.) Hospital after a long illness. He was 74 years old and lived in CornwallonHudson, N.Y.

title: A Simple Garage in Jersey for Repairing NotSoSimple Cars
description: STOCKTON, N.J.Quiet rock music rolls out of a stereo that is the most complex instrument at a simple garage here to which car owners from Philadelphia. New York City and as far away as Massa?nusetts bring some of the world's most precisionbuilt automobiles.

title: Weekly News Quiz
description: Questions are based on news reports in The Times in the last week.

title: Television
Advance in DNA Research
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11While Congress considers but does not legislate regulations to cover recombinant DNA experiments, the actual research in this controversial realm of genetics is advancing at a remarkably fast pace. Research on recombinant DNA, or deoxyribonucleic acid, involves splicing genes from one species into the genetic machinery of a far different form of life. Genes from yeast, food flies, sea urchins and mammals have already been spliced into the genetic material of bacteria,

title: BLUMENTHAL SEES TAX BILL STRESSING RELIEF, NOT REFORM
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 11  Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal said today the first priority of the tax bill President Carter will submit to Congress in January will be relief for individuals and business and not the fundamental revisions of the tax structure that the Administration has been discussing for months.

title: CourtBars L.I.R.R.Strike,but Union May Defy Ban
description: Long Island Rail Road trainmen and conductors were enjoined yesterday from striking Monday, leaving unions uncertain about whether to abide by the injunction, and commuters still worried about how they would be getting to work next week if the unions did not.

title: News Summary
description: SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 12, 1977

title: Dow Up by 13.34 to 845.89 As Volume Rises Sharply
description: The stock market, apparently convinced that the Federal Reserve would ease its credit reins, continued to advance sharply yesterday in the heaviest trading in more than a year and a half.

title: Passaic Valley Floods
description: Whenever New Jersey suffers flood damage, there is a clamor for action. The clamor has begun anew following the storm last Monday and Tuesday that caused damage estimated at more than $75 million in North Jersey alone.

title: Around the Nation
description: MIAMI, Nov. 11A Federal jury today found a West German businessman guilty of acting as an unregistered foreign agent and of exporting computer data without a license.

title: New Pact Is Offered In Dockers Strike
description: Shipping employers gave striking longshoremen yesterday a detailed proposal that appeared to provide the basis for an expeditious settlement of the 42dayold strike that has tied up container shipping from Maine to Texas.

title: Men in Overseas Caps Know Real Veterans Day
description: NEWARK, Nov. 11Fifty World War I veterans of the 312th Infantry Association of the 78th Regiment, some of them wearing their overseas caps, reminisced today at the Clipper Ship Restaurant about their experiences in the Great War

title: SIDONA'S EXTRADITION TENTATIVELY APPROVED
description: A Federal judge has tentatively decided that Michele Sindona, the Italian banker, should be extradited to face charges of fraudulent bankruptcy in Italy.

title: On Benefits of Mandatory Retirement
description: PALO ALTO Calif.Seemingly out of nowhere, during the past few months, legislation has been introduced in the United States Congress, the California Legislature and elsewhere to prohibit mandatory retirement at age 65.

title: Eight More Cited in Drug Case
description: PROVIDENCE, Nov. 11 (AP)Eight more persons were indicted today by the first statewide grand jury in Rhode Island history on charges stemming from the seizure last August of more than seven tons of marijuana. In all, 28 people were indicted today for conspiracy to deliver.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: HAYDN HARVEST The auditorium darkens except for the music stands of the orchestra by a miniature stage. After a prelude, the curtain parts for a group of singing, dolllike figures Jupiter and Mercury, an elderly couple and a chorus of townspeople and neighbors.

title: STAMPS
description: With a new site, longer run and record participation anticipated, the National Postage Stamp Show, this week takes the philatelic spotlight. Sponsored by the American Stamp Dealers Association, the show taking place at the New York Coliseum, Columbus Circle, instead of the Rotunda of Madison Square Garden.

title: Eleanor Owl, Sleuth; A SUMMER IN THE SOUTH By James Marshall. Illustrated by the Author. 97 pp. Boston: Houghton Mifflin Company. 55.95. (Ages 7 to JO)
description: Throughout this boisterous mystery, set in a Florida resort hotel, one senses James Marshall as intent on his own sophisticated amusement as on entertaining young readers. Yet they will love it, and will laugh a lot. How does Marshall brine it off?

title: Pitt's Big Plays Rout Army, 52 to 26
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Nov. 12 Who needs ball control when you have Matt Cavanaugh, Willie Taylor and Gordon Jones?

title: If Their Home and Block Are Stable, Aged Find City A Good Place to Retire
description: Ethel and Martin Drach have made peace with themselves. They have looked at condominiums in Florida and apartments at the east end of Long Island. They even almost sold their home of 37 yearsan attached house in Kew Gardens, Queensonly to changes their minds at the last moment. But after two unsettling years, they have finally come to a decision.

title: FollowUp on the News
description: It isn't often that $1 million walks out of a bank vault, but it appeared to happen at the First National Bank of Chicago last month. Somehow that much in cash was missing, with no sign of forcible entry. An official of the bank, the nation's ninth largest, offered three possible explanations: an accounting erne, misplacement of the money or theft.

title: Republicans Cheered By Election Results
description: HARTFORD THE Republican state chairman, Frederick K. Biebel, thinks the results of Tuesday's municipal elections are a sign that Connecticut's disheartened Republicans are pulling themselves together and building their political organization and their morale.

title: Tells U.S. Iran Will Not Take Lead in Urging IncreaseHe Confers With Carter on Tuesday
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The Shah of Iran has informed the United States that in contrast to previous practice his country will not take the lead in seeking an increase in oil prices at next month's meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries in Caracas, Venezuela, Administration officials said today.

title: Writein Candidate in Scranton Refuses to Concede
description: SCRANTON, Pa., Nov. 12James Barrett McNulty, who waged a strong campaign for writein votes in a general elec??? still clung today to the hope that ??? would he elected as this city's next Mayor.

title: Holland Tunnel Is Honored for 50Year Service
description: The Holland Tunnel yesterday recrived the cis is erluivalmt or a gold watch for admirable service50 ye:zrs of it and still goingin the form of a bronze plaque dedicated to he underground highway which joins a continent to a city.

title: Ohio State Wins Ninth, Crushing Indiana, 357
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Nov. 12 (UPI)Ohio State, stunned by an early Indiana touchdown, recovered in the second half on the running of Jeff Logan to post a 35.7 Big Ten victory over the Hoosiers today.

title: BRIDGE
description: Since it is possible to prove, statistically, that wearing top hat is a sure way to avoid death from malnutrition, might be unsound to assert that if you want to live a long life you should become a bridge expert.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: One's 50th birthday is no fun. No amount of convivial noises can mask the fact that that particular round number In that particular context forms one of life's more discouraging tidemarks. The suspicion grows upon us that after it may be downhill all the way.

title: On Call in Retirement
description: SOUTHBURY THE SLEEK ambulance glided over the undulating rural roads, its red emergency lights blending easily with the varied hues of the early fall dusk. Soon its passenger would be resting comfortably in nearby hospital and the driver and his attendants would be back where they had begunin retirement.

title: ABOUT WESTCHESTER
description: SOUTH SALEM THE pursuit of a rare vintage makes fanatics out of otherwise estimable men. Consider, for example, the Australian who shelled out $510 for a bottle of 1825 Chateau GruaudLarose in London. Or the New Yorker who thought nothing of paying $135 for a 1961 Chateau MoutonRothschild. Then, there's Peter L. Rinaldi.

title: Retired Businessman, 68, Found Slain, Roommate, 63, Injured in a Reported Robbery in Luxury Building
description: A 68yearold retired businessman was stabbed to death early yesterday and his 63yearold roommate suffered head injuries in what the roommate said was an attempted burglary at a thirdfloor apartment in a luxury building, the Sovereign, at 425 East 58th Street in Manhattan.

title: Notes: The Hotel Tab For Forgetful Guests
description: Increasing numbers of hotel guests are leaving behind much more than their fingerprints when they check out of hostelries around the world. Absentminded guests, in fact, are leaving behind just about everything but their eyeteeth and giving hotel owners all kinds of headaches.

description: HEN David Macaulay set out in 1973 to explain Gothic iirchiteel tire, he contrived I he story of an imaginary town in 13thcent my France, a composite of many mil towns that took it opon it self to erect a cathedral lilt cathedral was to be die biggest 111(1 the best in all Of Franck., and the townspeople

title: Donna Catherine Fiancee
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph William Catharine Jr. of New Canaan, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Donna MariElizabeth Catharine, to Dennis H. Borden, son of Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Borden of Delaware, Ohio. The future bridegroom, whose marriage ended in divorce, and his fiance plan to be married May 6 in New Canaan.

title: NEW AID FOR ANGOLA HURTS CUBA'S CHANCE FOR NORMAL U.S. TIES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12To the disappointment of those Carter Administration officials who would like to build normal relationships with both Cuba and Angola, Cuba is increasing its involvement in Angola rather than cutting it back.

title: Mrs. Dodge Art Collection Will Be on Public Display
description: Two decades have passed since the last Morris and Essex show, but the grandeur of that noted event and the world of Geraldine Rockefeller Dodge will be recalled this week. Hundreds of the art connoisseur's favorite animal bronzes and famous paintings will be on public display for the first time, from noon to 3 P.M. on Wednesday and Thursday, when the new gallery and library adjunct opens at St. Hubert's Giralda Shelter on the Dodge estate in Madison, N. J.

title: Begin Invites Sadat To Visit Jerusalem For Talks on Peace
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 12 (UPI)Prime Minister Menahem Begin said today: I hereby invite President Sadat of Egypt to come to Jerusalem to conduct talks about permanent peace between Israel and Eavot.

title: Mormon Paper Names Publisher
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 12 (AP)Wendell J. Ashton, Mormon church public communications director, has been named publisher of the churchowned Deseret News. Mr. Ashton, managing editor of the newspaper 30 years ago, fills a post left vacant since the death of Earl Hawkes in 1972. The afternoon newspaper has been run since then by William B. Smart, who will continue as editor and general manager.

title: 1,500 in El Salvador End Takeover Of Ministry and Free 86 Hostages
description: SAN SALVADOR, Nov. 12 (AP)Some 1,500 workers who seized the Labor Ministry headquarters three days ago ended, their occupation today and freed 86 hostages b who were escorted from the build ing by Red Cross officials.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: THE CRASH OF 79, by Paul E. Erdman. (Pocket, $2.50.) When Bill Hitchcock, a Californian, becomes manager of Saudi Arabia's Central Bank he has to cope with a series of world crises and nuclear war scares. This slambang novel by a onetime international banker, who knows whereof he writes, has had a long run on the hardcover bestseller list.

title: Music: Mahler by the Canterbury
description: When the Chicago Symphony comes to New York to perform Mahler's gigantic Symphony No. 8, as it did two weeks ago, one would expect the soldout signs to appear as a matter of course. When the Canterbury Choral Society performs the same work, as did Friday night in Avery Fisher Hall, and every seat is occupied, this may tell us something about the undiminished popularity and drawing power of Mahler's music these days.

title: Figure Skater Improvises On and Off the Ice
description: Whether he is creating highly detailed dreams on canvas or fantasies of movement and expression on the ice, Toiler Cranston thrives on spontaneity.

title: WIDER KOREA INQUIRY BY SENATE UNIT SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12The Senate ethics committee, whose inquiry into the Korean scandal has quietly started to take shape, plans to question all 100 senators and about 50 former senators soon on their possible connections with South Korean officials and agents, according to Senate aides.

title: Fair Warning Captures Second Crown at Toronto
description: TORONTO, Nov. 12After just four classes, Fair Warning, the newest member of the United States Equestrian Team's stable of mounts, became the first double winner in the international division tonight at the Royal Winter Fair horse show, winning the faultandout class. Yesterday, Fair Warning. who is ridden by Bernie Traurig, captured the opening international class of the show.

title: SHOP TALK
description: BETHET YOU don't need the kind of clothes in the suburbs you require in the city, but On the other hand, you needn't settle for the turtleneck, wool trousers and cablestitch Shetland sweater school of dressing, either, said Leslie Glucksman.

title: Defense Rests in Texas Millionaire's Murder Trial
description: AMARILLO, Texas, Nov. 12 (AP)Atter three weeks of volatile and dramatic testimony, the defense rested its case today in the murder trial of Cullen Davis, the millionaire industrialist.

title: Sunday Observer
description: In 1959 the old propellerdriven Lockheed Constellation in which President ??? hower used to travel the country was displaced by the new jetpowered Air Force One, and the age of the worldwidePresident air circus was born. It was another ??? tion of advancing technology's power to expand man's scope for ???.

title: The Region
description: As if the Port Authority hadn't enough troubles in various executive suites, now there is a bit of a rumble in the kitchen. Questions of favoritism and conflict of interest were raised last week about a contract covering Windows on the World and the 21 other restaurants in the World Trade Center.

title: WHY MEN DOMINATE WOMEN
description: There is not a single country in the world today whose top political position is held by a woman. Although, during the last decade, women have entered fields previously barred to them, men still monopolize the key positions in government, industry and military institutions. The questions remain: Are there innate biological harriers that prevent women trom attaining equal power? Or, is there something built into the human male that makes it more natural for him to command females than for females to command him? To answer, one must know why male supremacism has been so wellnigh universal.

title: Looking for a Family

title: Buccaneers (022) See Big Chance To Make History Against Giants
description: TAMPA, Fla.. Nov. 12History might he made in this v.,iFeuacking, town tomorrow. Not schoolbook history, not Mr. Wells's history. But National Football League history.

title: Assessing the Presidency: The Yardstick Is Changed
description: WASHINGTONOne day last summer, the White House put out a 4,000word paper entitled A brief summary of significant actions by President Carter in the first six months of his Administration. contained 143 items, ranging from elimination of perquisites for the staff to the opening of a campaign for human rights abroad, and it depicted a new and dynamic President effectively engaged in constructive change around the world.

title: BRITISH COMNISTS ADOPTING SOFT LINE
description: LONDON, Nov. 12Britain's tiny Communist party is meeting this weekend to ally itself ideologically with the Eurocommunists in Italy, Spain and France.

title: The Golf Clinic
description: When the temperature drops at this time of year, switch to a lower compression ball.

title: R. T. Townsend, Former Officer Of Advertising Agency, Was 87
description: Reginald T. Townsend, former vice president of the Lennen & Mitchell advertising agency and president of the St. Nicholas Society of New York City in the mid40's. died yesterday a Northern Westchester Hospital in Mount Kisco, N.Y. He was 87 years old and lived in Cross River, N.Y.

title: Cathy Paulin Todd Engaged
description: Jo Anne Britt Paulin of Atlanta and Robert J. Paulin of Charlotte, N. C., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Cathy Leigh Paulin Todd, to Russell Ford Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Ford of Orleans, Mass., formerly of New Canaan, Conn. Mr. Paulin, an engineer and designer, is with Falkenberg & Associates, a Charlotte technical services concern. Mr. Ford's father is a city planning consultant in Orleans. The prospective bride has a B.F.A. degree with honors from the Atlanta College of Art, and her fiance, a graduate of New Canaan Country School and the Choate School, attended Denver University. The wedding is planned for the spring.

title: What's Doing in ACAPULCO
description: MANY FACESAll the contradictions of Mexico are crowded into this bustling portturnedresort. The old downtown area retains echoes of a Colonial era when Acapulco received merchandise from the Orient and gold from Peru to be transshipped to Spain, while the main drag with its highrise hotels fringing the sweeping bay today seems modeled after Miami Beach. The luxurious hillside mansions at the eastern end of the bay look across three miles of glistening water to the La Laja slums where thousands of peasant migrants arrive every year in search of work. Affluent Mexicans and Americans sit side by side in sophisticated restaurants, while foreign students eat off street carts and impoverished Indians beg on the sidewalks for the price of a tortilla.

title: In the Face of International Isolation and Pressure, South Africans Are Rallying Behind Government
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 12One night last week, somebody painted Vote Nazil in bold black letters on a wall facing one of the busiest intersections on Jan Smuts Avenue, the boulevard that leads to this city's wealthy northern sub. urbs.

title: Big Brother Is Watching With Love
description: EAST MEADOW WHEN Howard Frank! of Bellmore decided to serve as a volunteer in the Big Brothers/Sisters of Nassau County, his unwritten commitment was for one year. Now, a year and a half later, Mr. Frank) intends to stay a Big Brother as long as I'm alive and as long as some little brother needs me.

title: Carving the Bird: Gently Pull the Leg
description: THE most important assignment on Thanksgiving Day is the carving of the turkey. All the planning, shopping and cooking would be for naught without the carving. Unfortunately, the bird comes fully assembled and must be dismantled before eating.

title: .S. Suit Alleges Aluminum Wire Is Fire Peril in 1.5 Million Homes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12Americans living in 1.5 million houses and mobile homes built from 1966 to 1972 with aluminum electrical wiring are in imminent danger of fires, the Consumer Product Safety Commission has charged in a lawsuit filed in Federal District Court here.

title: Cornell Dean Quits, Citing Differences On Fiscal Matters

title: Today's Homework: Make It, Invent It, Enjoy It

title: Judge Backs $50 Million Loan Plan For Philadelphia School District
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 11 (UPI)The Philadelphia School Districtunable to pay its employees and in jeopardy of closinghas received permission to borrow a $50 million loan it a Common Pleas to its terms.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Julius Portnow's article Animals and a Killer Society  [Opinion Page, Oct. 23] is honest and reflects the current problems that animal welfare faces today.

title: Marghretta Gilbane Is Wed
description: Marghretta Lennon Githane and John Abram Smithers Jr. were married yesterday in St. Margaret's Roman Catholic Church in Rumford, R. I., by Msgr. Arthur Geoghegan. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Gilbane Jr. of Rumford and Harwichport, Mass. Her husband is a son of Mrs. S. Phelps Platt Jr. of New York and John Smithers of Red Hook, N.Y. The bride is teacher at the Episcopal School in New York and Mr. Smithers is with George W. Millar Company, industrial and finepaper distributors, in New York.

title: New York City's Discriminating Schools

Their roster of alumni who distinguished themselves in public service, scholarship, the amts and the sciences matches that of the most prestigious private schools. Even when the city's public education system appeared to falter under the weight c numbers and other problems, these schools maintained their high standards.

title: Essex Gunsmith: One of a Rare Breed

Friend, one of a very rare breed here in New Jersey. He is a highly trained gunsmith whose craft dates back to the 1400's.

title: Lost Luggage: The Plight of the Traveler Sans Pajamas

And when it does, it's like being deprived of a faculty; new values are learned, new fears endured, new battles fought.

title: Let's Buy Back Capitalism on the Road
description: Any trucker may deliver gherkins from Texas to the Heinz factory in Pittsburgh. If, however, that same trucker picks up a cargo at the Heinz plant to avoid returning norne empty, he or she might well be in a pickle. The transport of raw farm products is unregulated. But to carry processed food, a trucker must obtain a license from the Interstate Commerce Commission. And if another trucking firm objects to the competition, the license will almost certainly be denied.

That's because the 1999 alumnus has played an influential role in turning a huge wasteland into one of the most valuable pieces of real estate in the state.

Ah!, etc.and as they chant they shudder like the trembling of terminal nerves. We are more or less off and, if not running, at least shaking hopefully.

Rankings are based on sales for 1977 only.

title: News Summary
description: Arab foreign ministers made pleasfor solidarity among the 22 members of the Arab League at the opening of a threeday meeting in Tunis. They are deeply concerned about two potentially divisive issues: Egypt's urging of a new Middle East conference despite differences with Israel over procedural matters, and the confrontation looming between Morocco and Algeria over the guerrilla war in the Western Sahara. The Arab world is in a very difficult situation, said the Tunisian Prime Minister, Hedi Nouira, the most difficult we have ever known. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Home Style
description: The college dormitory is changing. No longer just for aging teenagers, its look these days reflects an increasing number of olderand even youngerstudents, and its mood is slowly turning from the camaraderie of bull sessions and open doors to what one young student called living in a hotel with empty corridors and locked doors.

title: Station Wagon Supermarket
description: SHARON MITCHELL, with her young son by her side, nosed the orange Volvo station wagon down the aisle of the food market and stopped beside the cash register. Without stepping out of the car, she told the clerk what she wanted, had her order deposited on the back seat, paid S17.27 and drove out the other end.

title: The N.C.A.A. vs. Individual Rights: Why 4 Collegians Couldn't Go to Russia
description: As you read this, I will be in the Soviet Union with a group of swimmers from Mission Viejo, Calif. The purpose of the twoweek trip is to give some of our top swimmers an opportunity to train with and compete against the best swimmers from the Soviet Union.

title: ART VIEW
description: There are photographs that are deliberately created to be works of art, and there are photographs produced for a wide variety of other purposesamong them, political propaganda, social reportage, advertising promotion, erotic stimulation, scientific research and personal reminicence. In the mind of the photographer who consciously sets out to create a work of art, this division between deliberate esthetic purpose and all other intentions is obviously a crucial one. There have been critics, too, for whom this division acquired at times a desperate importance, quite as if their own functionno less than that of art itselfdepended on sustaining it. Yet theirs has proved to be a lost cause, and not because we value art less but precisely because we now value so much more, and are so eager to annex so much that hitherto fell outside its boundaries to the mainstream of artistic experience.

title: Article 8  No Title
Little Woman
description: THE collection of selfproclaimed spiritual leaders and intellectual giants who congregated about mid19th century Boston, each more eccentric, more narcissistic than his neighbor, must have provided as much irritation as inspiration for those who lived among them. William Ellery Channing, announcing, I am universal; I have nothing to do with the particular and definite; Henry David Thoreau, insisting that true love depened on complete nonverbal communication; Nathaniel Hawthorne, trying with increasing desperation to refuse LOUISA MAY A Modern Biography of Louisa May Alcott. By Martha Saxton. Illustrated. 428 pp. Boston: $14.95. Houghton Mifflin Company. an invitation to a club; he couldn't drink, he explained, he couldn't eat, he couldn't talk; Bronson Alcott and his friends, refusing to wear silk lest they exploit wormsamong such men Louisa May Alcott grew up. No wonder, her current biographer, Martha Saxton, argues, that she had difficulty defining herself as a woman.

And there is

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12 (AP) Food stamp allotments will be increased on Jan, 1, the Agriculture Department has announced, because of higher food prices last spring and summer.

title: At This School, Age Is No Barrier

Over lunch in the cafeteria, Elton Nichols, who is 73, traded sports news with members of the football team. Not far away a socialstudies class listened intently as Grace Cerra, who is 68, quietly explained the kind of poetry taught when she was a student.

title: Uganda Said to Kill Up to 20 Persons in Religious Purge
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Nov. 12 (UPI)President Icli Amin's security forces, in a new purge against Christians, have killed up to 20 persons and arrested up to 400 over the last three weeks, church and diplomatic sources said today.

title: SelfEvident Truths?
description: THE first childhood memory of the author the Declaration of Independence was of being carried on a pillow by a mounted Negro slave. After burial, Thomas Jefferson lay in a coffin constructed by a slave carpenter. It was slave labor, not an abstract Creator, that made and sustained Jefferson's world, endowing it with mansions like Monticello; with an income sufficient to import the books, musical instruments and scientific equipment conducive to rational happiness; and with sufficient leisure to contemplate the unalienable rights of man.

title: Alabama Routs Miami; Kentucky Tops Florida
description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala., Nov. 12 (UPI)Alabama started slowly with a scoreless first quarter, then exploded for 15 points in the second quarter and routed Miami of Florida, 360, today.

description: The more things change, the more they remain the same. The old French proverb aptly describes the way the Division II and Ill college basketbail shapes up for the coming season in the metropolitan area.

title: Talk With John Fowles
description: EIGHT years ago John Fowles (pronounced as in howls) made one of his rare visits to Hollywood in order to discuss the projected movie versionafter several screenplays, it is still unfilmedof his novel The French Lieutenant's Woman. A halfhour early for his appointment with the head of production at Warner Brothers, he wandered around the Burbank studio and had a curious sense of Hollywood's barrenness and inertia. Nothing was in production, he recalled during a recent visit to New York. The set for Camelot was still up and that had been shot years before. It was like an elephant's graveyard.

title: Perth AmboyAid for Alcoholics
description: PERTH AMBOY THE medical treatment of alcoholics is regarded by hospital officials as one of the most costly and frustrating problems they face. Transported to the hospital by ambulance crews or in the back seat of police radio car, patients suffering from acute cases of alcoholism are admitted through the Emergency Room and then usually spend anywhere from a week to a month or more recovering from the immediate ravages of the disease.

description: BAITING HOLLOW, L.I.  Suffolk County's agricultural industry is all out here on the East End now, said Prof. Wilbur Selleck, director of Cornell University's Long Island Vegetable Research Farm, so it makes sense to expand our research facilities here.

Sullivan back, scored that touchdown on a 2yard run and it was befitting. Pagliaro then threw the football in the stand and the Eli supporters whipped out their white handkerchiefs and waved them at the Harvard people following an old tradition.

And new developments in Washington included more liberal rules for charter flights and air cargo.

The desaid the new question WAS being added to the Customs Service declaration form because of the possibility of foreign animal disease viruses, such as foot and mouth digease, being brought to this country by international travelers.

description: By Thom Racina. 358 pp. New York: G. P. Putnam's Sons. $8.95.

title: McCutcheon Victor in Run
description: Jesse McCutcheon of Martin Luther King turned in the fastest individual time and Brooklyn Tech won the Public Schools Athletic League crosscountry team title yesterday at Van Cortlandt. Park, the Bronx. McCutcheon, running the second A race, was clocked in 12 minutes 54.8 seconds over the 2.5mile course.

title: OneDesign Champions Face a Final Challenge
description: After a season of seemingly endless regattas, there is now a grand finalea test for the best. For the onedesign classes, those boats that compete with similar hulls and sails, the thousands of club and regional races are over. The national regattas for the multitude of classes have been staged. There is only one step leftthe championship of champions. Some 20 national onedesign class winners will meet on the Chesapeake Bay off Annapolis, Md., Thursday for the start of the fourday series.

title: Hungarian Pianist Shows Agility, Power
description: Many young pianists, out to make a splash in their New York debuts, give way to the temptation to prove that they can play as fast than the next one, or faster. Tibor Szasz, a Hungarian who now lives in this country would have made a better impression in his recital last Sunday night at Carnegie Hall if he had not been so concerned with velocity, headlong impetus and massive sonorities. He proved to be quite a pianist, nevertheless, with the agility and power to storm excitingly through the double octaves of the Liszt Sonata and to take from the wrist the even more difficult double octaves in the finale of Beethoven's Waldstein Sonata, in the style of such virtuosos as Emanuel Ax and Vladimir Horowitz.

title: Mixed Artistic Sensibility Shown By Tokyo Modern Dance Group
description: The Tokyo Modern Dance Group that made its American debut at Japan House Thursday evening is a finely trained company that has assimilated several strains of contemporary choreographic development. Among the most prominent of these is the work of Martha Graham, but the group's presentation of repertory works reveals a sense of development time that is quite clearly its own. The body may contort in a way that would please even the most ardent Grahamite but the phrasing is not at all Western.

title: Carborundum Fights a Takeover Bid
description: Wall Street professionals  arbitrageurs who risk millions of dollars on quick turnaround deals  smell another takeover killing, one that may rival fat profits realized on the play in Babcock & Wilcox earlier this year.

title: Patchogue Goes Undefeated And Joins the Playoff Crowd
description: And than there were six. That's the number of Suffolk teams in next weekend's three playoff games.
