title: DOCKWORKERS REACH 3YEAR SETTLEMENT TO END 44DAY STRIKE
description: North Atlantic shipping employers, and striking longshoremen reached agreement yesterday on a new threeyear contract that was expected to bring an end by next weekend to the strike that has tied up container shipping on the Atlantic and Gulf coasts for 44 days.

title: Javits Criticizes Administration Efforts on Terrorism
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13  Senator Jacob K. Javits today criticized the Carter Administration's efforts to combat international terrorism.

title: Dave Anderson
description: monday morning is never quiet for Art McNally, the National Football League's supervisor of officials. Monday morning is when Art McNally's phone keeps ringing. Coaches and general managers are calling to evaluate the judgment, wisdom and the discretion of the stripedshirted zebras grazing at yesterday's games. Art McNally is a good listener. He has an ear that is tougher than any middle linebacker. He also has an Irish cop's face that seldom smiles while on duty, in keeping with his experience as an N.F.L. official for nearly two decades. Most of the complaints remain within the walls of Pele Rozelle's castle on Park Avenue, but lately some voices have gone public. Tex Schramm, the Dallas Cowboys president and the chairman of the N.F.L.'s Competition Committee, spoke of how there should he more of turno??? in officials. Chuck Knox, the Los Angeles Rams coach, talked of having a touchdown stolen from him. Mean Joe Greene, the Pittsburgh Steelers cuddly defensive tackle, threatened to punch out an official and was fined by the commissioner for impersonating a hockey player. But beneath the discontent, some changes appear about occur in the stripes of N.F.L. zebras.

title: Politics of the Possible
description: BOSTON, Nov. 13It does not get the headlines of energy legislation, but in terms of law or politics, one of the most significant measures moving through Congress this year is S.1437, a 360page bill with a rather forbidding title: The Federal Criminal Code Reform Act of 1977.

title: China Marks 111th Anniversary Of the Birth of Sun Yatsen
description: PEKING, Nov. 13 (Agence FrancePresse)Peking, Shanghai and other Chinese cities yesterday celebrated the 11 th anniversary of the birth of Sun Yatsen, Hsinhua, the official press agency, reported today.

title: SelfHelp for Beaten Women
description: A selfhelp guide for women who are beaten by their husbands or male companions is now available free to victims in New York State.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: A WINTRY DAY IN THE CITY, with temperatures hovering near the freezing point, drew these skaters to the rink in Rockefeller Center yesterday. A frosty, clear day (no snowyet) is forecast for today.

title: Carey Fills Harbor Panel Post
description: Bertram Perkel was named yesterday to he the New York State member of the Waterfront Commission of New York Harbor, an agency run Jointly with New Jersey. The appointment to the $37,862 position by Governor Carey must be confirmed by the State Senate.

title: Symbolic Newark Church Finally Has Pastor
description: NEWARK, Nov. 13A permanent pastor was installed today at a downtown Roman Catholic Church that knows of only two Catholic families who live within its parish boundaries. The church tore down its school for lack of pupils long ago and hasn't filled the pastor's position in almost a decade.

title: Carnegie Hall to End Its LiveIn Studios for Artists
description: Carnegie Hall has decided to end the right of Creative and performing artists to live in, the studios beside and above the concert hall, a tradition of Bohemian life that dates to the turn of the century.

title: Miss Holtzman Criticizes Inspection s of the Summer Lunch Program
description: This year's Summer Food Service program in New York City, less troubled by charges of fraud and waste than in 1976, was accused by Representative Elizabeth Holtzman yesterday of endangering needy children by failing to safeguard the sanitary preparation, quality and nutritive valua the food served.

title: Work Starts on, Japanese Tunnel
description: MINAKAMI, Japan, Nov. 13 (Reuters)The Japan Public Highway Corporation has started work on a 6.8mile road tunnel that will cost $235 million and take nearly seven years to complete. The KanEtsu Tunnel will be part of a 185mile expressway linking Tokyo and the Sea of Japan.

title: Klan Representative Urges Muslims to Go to Africa
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 13 (UPI)A spokesman for the Ku Klux Klan has told a seminar on racism that the Klan still considers the Black Muslims former cannibals who should return to Africa.

title: Negotiations Resume In 2 Teacher Strikes
description: Negotiations resumed In Mount Laurel between school officials and 850 striking Willingboro teachers in an attempt to end the walkout, which has kept schools closed in the Burlington County community since Nov. 4.

title: Miss Cook Captures Powerboat Title
description: KEY WEST, Fla., Nov. 13 Betty Cook of Newport Beach, Calif., drove her 38foot Scarab No. 89 Kaama to victory in today's world offshore championship race.

title: Planned Parenthood Federation Maps Projects in 80 Countries
description: EDINBURGH, Nov. 13 (Reuters)Family planners from more than 100 countries today approved a program for vastly expanded services.

title: Screen: Bunuel's That Obscure Object of Desire
description: Every film festival should end with a new film by the incomparable Luis Bufiel, whose latest work, the triumphantly funny and wise That Obscure Object of Desire, is a work of such perfect control and precision that it has the effect of magically clearing the mind. It restores one's common sense and one's appreciation for the fantastic.

title: Lenin Mausoleum to Be Closed
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 13 (Reuters)Soviet officials announced today that the Lenin Mausoleum on Moscow's Red Square would be closed for two months for repairs.

title: PBS Rejection of Film on Plutonium Stirs Dispute
description: A new controversy has erupted in the publictelevision industry over the rejection by the Public Broadcasting Service of an independently produced documentary on the uses and hazards of plutonium, the lethal byproduct of nuclear energy. The onehour film, Plutonium: Element of Risk, had been commissioned by the system and received $124,000 from a special publictelevision fund for documentaries and $25,000 from KCET, Los Angeles.

title: GiantsBuccaneers Scoring
A.D.A. LISTS ADVANTAGES HELD BY HOUSE INCUMBENTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (AP)Americans for Democratic Action said today that each incumbent seeking reelection to the House of Representatives had an advantage of more than half a million dollars over the challenger.

title: TeenAge Runaways Turn To Prostitution as Rebellion
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 13By age 15 Rebecca knew she wanted to be a prostitute. The glitter and the glamour of the hustler's life held far more appeal for her than did her job at the pizza parlor, the frequent fights she had with her father and the boredom of her quiet neighborhood here.

title: Bertolaccini Victor in Golf By a Stroke
description: SINGAPORE, Nov. 13 (UPI)Silvia Bertolaccini shot a threeunderpar 69 today to rally from three shots off the pace and win the $100,000 Colgate Far East women's golf tournament.

title: Expert on Terrorism Urges U.S. To Press Counteroffensive Plans
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 13 (UPI)  A Government expert has warned that terrorists may soon be able to paralyze entire cities in the United States and has urged that a Federal crisis management group be set up to deal with such potential catastrophes.

title: Kogan, Ever a Violin Master, Plays Authoritative Program
description: Since the death of David Oislrakh, Leonid Kogan has been the most important violinist regularly exported by the Soviet Union. The deadpan musician, who these days somewhat resembles Buster Keaton, has been playing for American audiences for about 20 years, with increasing authority. His recital yesterday afternoon at Avery Fisher Hall, on the Great Performers at Lincoln Center series, was therefore no surprise, but was still a marvelous show of mastery over the violin.

title: Saturday's College Football Results
Asian Women Nurture a Growing Consciousness and Activism in Chinatown
description: Goldie Chu is a tall, slender, softspoken woman from New York's Chinatown. She is 46 years old and a mother of five. Recently, someone said to her:

title: Evel Knievel Is Sentenced To Jail for Hitting Author
description: SANTA MONICA, Calif., Nov. 14 (AP)Evel Knievel, the motorcycle daredevil, was sentenced today to six months in the county jail for beating his former press agent with a baseball bat.

title: An Archbishop For Cypriots Chrysostomos
description: ATHENS, Nov. 14When matters would reach an impasse during a conference of delegates from Eastern Orthodox Churches in Geneva late last year. the man who was frequently called upon to smooth things over and set the wheels moving again was Metropolitan Chryostomos of Paphos, representative of the News Church of Cyprus. He's a consummate mediator, said the Rev. John Romanides, a professor of theology who represented the Church of Greece at the Conference. He listens carefully thinks clearly and is very persuasive.

title: News Summary
description: President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said he would address the Israeli Parliament on Middle East peace within the next week if he received an invitation from Prime Minister Menahem Begin. Mr. Begin, when told of Mr. Sadat's statement, announced that he would ask the United States to send the invitation on Israel's behalf. It would be the first time any Arab leader has publicly visited Israel since its founding in 1948. [Page 1, Column 6]

title: India Will Undo Merger Of Four'News Agencies By Gandhi Government
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 14The Indian Government announced today that the four Indian news agencies that had been forced to merge during the emergency rule of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi would be reconstituted as independent units.

title: Market Place
description: One day in early November, the shares of Nevada Power, a utility that supplies electricity for the Las Vegas area, surged 5 points to 29. The stock moved up on the announcement that directors had voted a 3for2 stock split and also approved what amounted to a 50 percent increase in the cash dividend.

title: Money
description: Monday, November 14, 1977

title: Spanish Red Leaves for U.S., With Rival on His Heels
description: MADRID, Nov. 14The Spanish Communist leader, Santiago Carrillo, left today for an I 1day visit to the United States where he is expected to enhance his image as a democraticminded Communist independent of Moscow. Following him tomorrow on a competing American pilgrimage will be Felipe Gonzalez, first secretary of the important Spanish Socialist Workers Party.

title: Conrad C. Fink Named Executive Of Park Broadcasting Inc in Ithaca
description: The appointment of Conrad C. Fink as executive vice president for administration of Park Broadcasting Inc. and Park Newspapers Inc. of Ithaca, N.Y., was announced yesterday.

title: Two Officers Testify Colleague Killed Boy Without Plain Cause
description: Two fellow policemen testified Jesterday that Officer Robert H. Torsneyaccused of fatally shooting a 15yearold boy last year on Thanksgiving nighthad acted without apparent provocation and seemed calm during and after the shooting.

title: CROP YIELD INCREASES IN TEST OF COMPOUND
description: A significant new hope for increasing production by treating plants with a substance originally isolated from alfalfa hay has been bolstered by successful tests last summer in the open fields of farmers.

title: HIGH COURT ALLOWS RISE IN OIL PIPE FEES UNTIL SUIT IS DECIDED
description: 4.3 Ruling Backs Stay of Lower I.C.C. Rates for Alaska LineTax Cases to Be Reviewed

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: An Essex County grand jury criticized the Newark police yesterday for allegedly failing to act swiftly when vandals pelted the Broadway Junior High School with rocks on Sept. 29, 1976 and set fire to the auditorium. Thousands of dollars in damage occurred while nonteaching school staff members were on strike.

title: VIENNA POLICE SEEK HELP IN HUNT FOR KIDNAPPERS
description: VIENNA, Nov. 14The Viennese police asked law enforcement agencies throughout Europe for their help today in their hunt for the kidnappers of a 73yearold Austrian millionaire, who was released late last night after four days in captivity.

title: Nat'1 Basketball Ass'n
Court Rejects Challenge Of Race in New Orleans
description: NEW ORLEANS, Nov. 14 (AP)The Louisiana Supreme Court refused today to consider a challenge of the New Orleans mayoral race, letting stand the election of Ernest N, Morial, the city's first black Mayor.

title: Bridge:
description: Most experts, while admitting that their own game is virtually flawless, would agree that other, lesser experts give away more points in defense than they do in dummyplay. Even at world championship level, some defensive problems are too tough.

title: British Football
Brilliant Joffrey Season Ends With Company, at 21, in Red
description: It has been said that it takes at least 20 years to develop a major classic ballet company of international stature. It has taken Robert Jaffrey 21. although, in fairness, his company did have about a year out in the middle, after a contretemps over his financial backing. Given that small conces Brilliant Joffrey Season Ends With Company, at 21, in Red sion, he has brought it in right on schedulefor apart from any consideration regarding this or that program, ballet or dancer, the company as a whole has somehow looked different. It has looked, if you like, more considerable, more substantial than ever during its fall season at the City Center 55th Street Theater, which ended cheerfully on Sunday night.

title: Associated Press
description: PRETORIA, South Africa Nov. 14South African police officers denied under oath today that they had assaulted Stephen Biko but acknowledged that they had forced the black leader to spend 19 days naked in a cell before moving him to an office where they interrogated him around the clock and kept him shackled in handcuffs and leg irons almost continuously for 50 hours.

title: Red Sox Owners Lose Bid to Speed Club Sale
description: BOSTON, Nov. 14 (AR)Owner; of the Boston Red Sox lost in court today in their effort to sell the team Quickly.

title: AUTHORITY AND THE FAMILYII
description: AVON, N. Y.Those who wield authorityfathers, teachers, magistrates, and priestshave all suffered a loss of credibility. Since authority no longer commands respect, those in power have to impose their will through psychological manipulation.

title: 2 Bodies Found in Crashed Plane
description: JAY, Vt., Not. 14 (AP)An airman lowered from an Air Force helicopter today found two bodies in the wreckage of a small plane that disappeared more than a week ago on a flight from Fulton, N.Y., the state police said. No sign was found of a third person thought to have been on the craft, officials said. No positive identification of the two bodies was made, they said. New York authorities identified those on the plane as Roger Prown, the pilot, Anthony Mellone and Francis Tetro, all of Fulton

title: The U.N. Today
description: Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. on policies of apartheid of the Government of South Africa.

title: In Memoriam
description: EDWARDSLouis F. After 35 years: beautiful memories still remain a precious possession.

title: The Misnomer That Stuck
description: The early supporters of the women's movement got a label that caught on  but it was inaccurate.

title: Col. Irene McMahon, 65, Served As Aide in Volunteers of America
description: Col. Irene R. McMahon of the Volunteers of Amrica died Sunday in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville, N.Y., following an extended illness. She was 65 years old and lived at 12 Elaine Terrace, Yonkers.

title: TeenAgers Mural in Park Slope Stirs Vandalism
description: A colorful, partly completed mural in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn that eventually was to depict racial unity has instead provoked vandalism and charges of racial prejudice.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Copyright 1977 by Dally Racing Form, Inc.

title: SUSPECT SEIZED IN KILLING IN EAST SIDE APARTMENT
description: A suspect was arrested yesterday in the murder of Harry Kassoff, a 68yearold retired businessman who was stabbed to death Saturday in his apartment in the sovereign, at 425 East 58th Street.

title: Bradley, ExKnicks Star, Will Seek Nomination for Case's Senate Seat
description: TRENTON,Nov. 14Bill Bradley, the 34yearold former New York Knicks basketball player, formally opened a bid today for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate seat held by Clifford P. Case, Republican of Rahway, whose term expires next year.

title: Pregnancy Ban At Air Academy To Be Repealed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  The Air Force, breaking with the policy of the other armed services, plans to allow women enrolled in the Air Force Academy to remain in the school if they become pregnant.

title: Bell Is Sure Agency Has Won Back Trust
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19 (UPI)Attorney General Griffin B. Bell said today that he believed the Justice Department had regained much of the public confidence it lost in the Watergate scandal.

title: 'Turning Point' Limns Ballet Life
description: The story to date: 20 years ago Deedee abandoned her ambitions to become a star of the American Ballet Theater and, instead, moved to Oklahoma City with her husband, Wayne, with whom she opened a fabulously successful ballet school, raised three fabulously sweet children, moved into a splitlevel house and acquired a fabulously long station wagon. Deedee chose loveunlike her best friend, Emma, who chose success and became Ballet Theater's prima ballerina.As our movie, which is called "The Turning Point." opens, Deedee and Emma are reunited when Ballet Theater comes to Oklahoma City. Old hopes are rekindled for, as all of us know, an old hope never dies in fiction of this sort, no matter how many tears are pumped on it. Emma, who gets 19 curtain calls and has "everything" envies Deedee, while Deedee, the one who got pregnant, still dreams of stardom. Wil Ithey ever find peace and fulfillmentthese two women who now recall theirhow shall I put it?turning points?To ask that question is to know the worst about this entertaining new movie, an old-fashioned backstage musical transplanted to the world of ballet by three people who not only know it but also love it, sentimental clichs and all."The Turning Point," which opened last night at special performances at the Coronet and Baronet Theaters, begins its regular commercial engagement at the Coronet today. It's the work of Herbert Ross, the director; Arthur Laurents, the screenwriter, and Nora Kaye (Mrs. Ross), the former ballerina who is its executive producer. Their curious, collective achievement is in having found so much vitality in the sort of movie that demands that its audiences weep with sympathy for characters who have all they ever wanted but simply don't realize it yet.Among the film's principal assets are Shirley MacLaine, looking very pretty and almost matronly, but not quite, as the sharp-tongued, intelligent, deep-down furious homemaker, Deedee; and Anne Bancroft as the driven ballerina, Emma, a woman of ravaged beauty and whose frail frame could possibly lift a freight car if she willed it.The intensity of their lifelong friendship, and rivalry, is carefully and sometimes hilariously detailed as "The Turning Point" follows Deedee's daughter, Emilia, charmingly played by Leslie Browne, her mother and her little brother to New York, where Emilia joins Ballet Theater's school. It's not giving away too much to report that the girl's almost instantaneous success means that one day in the not too distant future she will be replacing her beloved godmother, Emma, as the A.B.T.'s major attraction.These are more or less the bones of the film, which are hardly bare, what with Emma's having to face the reality of time's passage, and Deedee's having to come to terms with her missed opportunities. Could she have danced the lead in "Anna Karenina" 20 years ago? Probably not, though from what we see of Emma in the role, it's mostly walking through steam.There are also the emotional crises faced in New York by Emilia, who has an unhappy affair with a young Soviet dancer named Yuri, a role played with cheerful ease by Mikhail Baryshnikov, the young Soviet dancer who chose success in the West several years ago.As Emilia learns that the love of a young Soviet ballet dancer is not foreverwhich is just as well when one has her eye on the top of the billand as Emma and Deedee are wrestling, once physically in a very funny and moving scene, with their doubts, "The Turning Point" gives us excerpts from more than a dozen ballets that feature, in addition to Mr. Baryshnikov and Miss Browne, the stars and the corps de ballet of Ballet Theater.The manner in which Mr. Ross handles these sequences defines the choice that he made when planning "The Turning Point." That is, he chose to create a backstage film about the ballet rather than a ballet film. The excerpts are lovely but often so brief that not even an obnoxious child would have time to become bored. Because this is a film about people and not dance, the film spends as much time showing us the dancers' faces and reaction shots of people in the audience as it does showing us the complete figures of the dancers in motion. The method is that of show-biz, not art.Show-biz is also apparent in the tone of Mr. Laurents's screenplay, which delights not only in backstage sentiment but also backstage bitchiness with, I'm told, all sorts of references to people living and dead. Though "The Turning Point" does show us that ballet is an extremely difficult, physically demanding art, the film's concentration on its female characters tends, if only by accident, to confirm the oldest ballet clich of them allthat ballet is, in this country anyway, women's work.All of the men in the film exist as little more than dance partners or as props for the drama. This is partly the result of the focus of the movie in which Miss MacLaine and Miss Bancroft give such powerhouse performances and only Mr. Baryshnikov is allowed to be a man of any substance.The others, including Tom Skerritt, who plays Miss MacLaine's blandly decent husband, are background figures. Such a comment, I realize, could also be made about any number of Bette Davis. Joan Crawford or Greer Garson movies of long ago."The Turning Point" is entertaining, not for discovering new material, but for treating old material with style and romantic feeling that, in this day and age, seem remarkably unafraid."The Turning Point," which has been rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"), contains some mildly vulgar language and one nude love scene that is so tastefully and genteelty done, perhaps because it is actually the last scene in a ballet.

title: Somalis Hail Moves On Soviet and Cuba
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 14 (AP)Thousands of chanting demonstrators paraded throughout Somalia today in support of the Government's order expelling Russian advisers, closing Soviet bases in the country and severing diplomatic relations with Cuba, according to the official radio.

title: Council Member Is Killed
description: LONDON, Nov. 14 (Reuters)Lieut. Solomon Gesesse, a member of Ethiopia's ruling military council, was killed by antrirevolutionaries last night, the Addis Ababa radio said today.

title: Deaths
Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The Supreme] Court agreed today to decide whether the preservation of 200 tiny fish in the Little Tennessee River justified abandonment of a nearly complete $127 million Federal, dam that threatens to destroy their only known habitat.

title: Former Political Writer Is Expected to Be Named Carey's Press Secretary
description: David Murray, a former political writer in New York and Washington, is expected to be named Governor Carey's press secretary within a week.

title: Television
description: Richard Mulligan (left) plays Billy Crystal's stepfather in Soap, tonight at 9:30 on Channel 7.

title: Pinkie Masters, Owner of Tavern In Georgia and Friend of Carter
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Nov. 14 (AP)Pinkie Masters, a Savannah tavern owner for nearly a quarter century and a personal friend of President Carter, died yesterday. He was 64 years old.

title: T.V.A. Begins to Move a Town Lying in Clinch River's Path
description: CLINCHPORT, Va., Nov. 19For the first time, the Tennessee Valley Authority is moving a town, and most of the inhabitants appear happy at the prospect.

title: U.S. Aid for Small Refiners Causes Oil Industry Discord
description: PRINCETON, Ind.On the surface, the themes are heartwarming and inspiring. A young executive takes command of an aging small refinery that has been more or less shut down for eight years and, after a year of hard work, seems to be making a go of it But there is a silent partner in the success story of the Princeton Refinery Inc., the Federal Government, which is diverting $10,000 a day in special benefits to the refinery under a controversial program known as small refiner bias.

title: A Moody Message, to Two Cities
description: The capital market, speaking through Moody's In vestors Service, is telling anyone who will listenincluding, we trust, the Federal Governmentthat New York City cannot be saved from ultimate bankruptcy by the bondbuying public. It requires a major policy decision in Washington.

title: Cards Win and End Cowboy String, 2417
description: IRVLNG, Tex., Nov. 14 (AP)Jim Hart rallied St. Louis with a pair of fourthquarter touchdown passes and the Cardinals knocked off the last of the National Football League's unbeaten teams with a wild and bitterly fought 2417 victory over the Dallas Cowboys tonight.

title: PLAN ON CASINO HIRING IS ACCEPTED BY PANEL
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Nov. 14An advisory group to the Casino Control Commission that will regulate casino gambling here tentatively approved today an affirmativeaction plan that calls not only for 20 percent minority hiring in casino construction, but also for implementation of the same quota in job categories and in manhours of working time.

title: SchoolStrike Dilemma
description: WILLINGBORO  A bitter strike of 850 teachers and the jailing of striking teachers in Matawan last month have lent new urgency to efforts to find a better way to solve school labor problems in New Jersey.

title: Jet Quarterback Sunday? Wait Until Friday to See
description: Who will be the Jets' quarterback on Sunday in Baltimore against the ferocious Colts? Wait, until Friday. to see.

title: Companies List Reports Covering T heir Sales and Earnings Figurea
L.I.R.R. Union Delays a Walkout
description: Conductors and brakemen agreed yesterday to delay further any strike action against the Long Island Rail Road until after Dec. 5, as the railroad and 16 other unions announced agreement on a new contract.

title: Terrorists Sought in U.S. Waters On Threats to Lufthansa Airplanes
description: Coast Guard boats are patrolling waters. near airports in the New York, Philadelphia and Boston areas at the request of West German officials who say they have received threats, ostensibly from terrorists, that Lufthansa airplanes will be shot down by rockets.

title: Trainer Questioned in Ringer Case
description: MIAMI, Nov. 14New York and Florida investigators and agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation today began interrogating Mrs. Crista Mancuso, a horse trainer, in connection with alleged wholesale horse switching, hidden ownership of horses and insurance fraud involving South American imports.

title: Dividends
Chico Freeman's Quintet Is Tops
description: The quintet that Chico Freeman is leading at Sweet Basil on Sunday and Monday nights this month is a splendid indicator of the way youth and age are reinforcing each other in New York's new jazz. Mr. Freeman is in his early 20's, but his father, Von Freeman, is one of the most respected tenor saxophonists in Chicago and has taught his son, also a saxophonist, a great deal.

title: The Issue of Steel Imports A Deepening Controversy
description: As the Carter Administration ponders how to deal with the difficult problem of highvolume steel imports, there are indications that the controversy has hecome more complex in the month since the White House held its initial explor atory meeting with industry The leaders and a large ConEconomic gressional delegation. The danger is that this hot isScene sue both here and abroad may not he resolved easily or quickly.

title: Hawks Get McMillen Of Knicks
description: When Tom McMillen became a Knick last Dec. 9 as a throwin in the Bob McAdoo deal, he said: A pro athlete is a puppet in a puppeteers world. I try to do what I can within that framework.

title: Associated Press Members of Stephen Biko's family await start of the inquest in Pretoria, South Africa. From left are his elder brother, Kaya
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 14South African police officers denied under oath today that they had assaulted Stephen Biko but acknowledged that they had forced the black leader to spend 19 days naked in a cell before moving him to an office where they interrogated him around the clock and kept him shackled In handcuffs and leg irons almost continuously for 50 hours.

title: Unions Links With Liberals
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Organized labor and the liberal wing of the Democratic Party, old comradesinarms that have been estranged for nearly a decade, are finding themselves fighting shouldertoshoulder these days in a growing number of legislative battles. To.Day's announcement by the White House of plans to sup. port the HumphreyHawkins fullemployment bill repre.Sents a victory for both the trade union movement and the ilberallett, which had been pressing jointly for Presidential action on the legislation. Labor reform, a higher minimum wage and the Panama Canal treaties are among the other issues on which the two parties have been working together recently.

title: Pay Increase for White House Aides Is Disclosed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14The salaries of all but the highestranking members of President Carter's staff were raised five weeks ago, his chief spokesman confirmed today.

title: Giants Plan a More Daring Offense
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 14The Giants promised today to play offense for the rest of the season.

title: Letters
description: As an actuary, while I do not specialize in pension work, I pay attention to what happens to the Social Security system, which was one of the best accomplishments of the New Deal of Franklin D. Roosevelt. That system has recently got into difficulty because of insufficient income to meet payment of pension and disability benefits.

title: SADAT SEEKS ISRAELI INVITATION TO MAKE ADDRESS IN PARLIAMENT; BEGIN AGREES, WILL ASK U.S. HELP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said today that he was prepared to address the Israeli Parliament within the next week once he had received a formal invitation from Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel.

title: Taxes & Accounting
description: While the accounting profession's reaction to a Senate subcommittee's report recommending selfpolicing is one of relief, some firms indicate that they do not go along with the few specific recommendations for change. Page 69.

title: Mark A. McCloskey Dead at 86; Helped Prevent Crimes by Youth
description: Mark Alexander McCloskey. an educator concerned chiefly with young people in trouble, died Sunday night in A nursing home in Northfield, Vt., at the age of 86. Until his move to Vermont, he had lived at 145 East 35th Street.

title: Hundreds Flee Los Angeles Canyon as Brush Fire Advances on Homes
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 14An unseasonal brush fire roared through the rugged Topanga Canyon residential area here tonight. causing hundreds of people to flee their homes.

title: Bond Prices Lose Early Gains and Close Mixed
description: The credit markets continued their move toward higher prices and lower interest rates yesterday morning, but prices drifted downward in the afternoon and the market closed with a mixture of small gains and losses.

title: Theater Mystery 61 Unlisted Seats In Westchester?
description: WHITE PLAINS, Nov. 14An account1 ing firm has determined that the West1 chester Premier Theatre contains 61 more seats than It has been showing in its records.

title: TV: O'Keeffe, Portrait of Artist
description: Georgia O'Keeffe, the painter, was born on a Wisconsin wheat farm 90 years ago today, and her birthday is being marked quite beautifully on public television tonight with a Perry Miller Adato documentary (it will be carried on Channel 13 at 8). Georgia O'Keeffe marks the first time that the artist has agreed to a film portrait of herself and her work. And, as scheduling would have it, the production is being used to open several days of special programming that public television and radio are constructing around this weekend's National Women's Conference in Houston.

title: WILLIAM G. ZEHNDER
description: William G. Zchnder, president of the Cologne Reinsurance Company of America, Stamford, Conn., died Saturday in Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital after a lengthy illness. He was 55 years old and lived at Carriglca Drive, Riverside, Conn.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: A first step in the proposed takeover of Maule Industries, a Florida cement company now in bankruptcy proceedings. was announced in Greenwich, Conn., yesterday by Lone Star Industries, a leading cement producer.

title: Notes on People
description: King Juan Carlos of Spain presided yesterday over the opening of a yearlong celebration of the thousandth anniversary of the first appearance of the Spanish language in written form. The celebration attended by cabinet ministers, 25 Latin American ambassadors to Spain and the entire membership of the Royal Academy of the Language, took place at the monastery of San Milian de la Cogolla, in the northern province of Logrono. At thatmonastery, an anonymous monk is said to have first recorded words of the language later known as Castilian Spanish. The celebration of the thousandth anniversary will include ceremonies throughout Spain and in Latin America, the Philippines and the United States.

title: About New York
description: After the client has been removed well beyond left jab range to the city's latest sanctuary, a secret hotel for, literally, beaten wives, she must be helped to her feet. One of the first selfrecriminations of these wives, according to the woman who runs the hotel, is over the audacity of what they have donemoving out, with the kids, too.

title: Senator Fears Helms Accord Could Set a Precedent
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 19Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr. charged today that the arrangement under which Richard Helms avoided a criminal trial could set a precedent for making intelligence officials immune to accountability before the courts or Congress.

title: Taxes & Accounting Relief Over Senate Unit's Report
description: The accounting profession's reaction to a Senate report recommending that the profession generally police itself one of relief that no new legislation is being proposed.

title: Arab Meeting Condemns Israeli Attacks in Lebanon; Heated Exchange Reported Over P.L.O. Resolution
description: TUNIS, Nov. 14The foreign ministers of the Arab League condemned the recent Israeli air raids into southern Lebanon today and called on the great powers to take all necessary measures to halt what they called Israel's aggressive acts.

title: The New York Times/Paul Hosofros TRANSITION TALKS BEGIN: Edward I. Koch meeting with Mayor Beame at City Hall yesterday. Of his first visit to City Hall as Mayorelect, Mr. Koch said: I look forward to a wonderful four years here. Details, Page 37.
description: Mayorelect Edward I. Koch paid his I first visit to City Hall yesterday since winning the election, and he and his transition team met for an hour with Mayor Beanie and his team.

title: Saudi Arabia and Iran Reported To Favor OPEC Price Freeze
description: Saudi Arabia and Iran. the two biggest exporters among members of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries, both appear to have decided to support an oil price freeze at an OPEC meeting that starts Dec. 20 in Caracas, Venezuela.

title: Nazi Group and Opponents Fight On a College Campus in Illinois
description: RIVER GROVE, Ill., Nov. 14 (AP)A fight erupted between Nazis and antiNazis tonight outside a college auditorium where a noted Jewish hunter of alleged Nazi war criminals, Simon Wiesenthal, was scheduled to speak.

title: Cash Bonuses Planned For Reserve Recruits
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 (Reuters)The Pentagon announced today a ninemonth test starting Jan. 1 to see if cash bonuses will ease manpower shortages in the Army Reserve forces.

title: Pregnancy Ban At Air Academy To Be Repealed
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  The Air Force, breaking with the policy of the other armed services, plans to allow women enrolled in the Air Force Academy to remain in the school if they become pregnant.

title: Meadowlands
Paper Companies Lead In Capital Projects
description: Paper Companies were the leading United States industry in the announced value of manufacturing capital projects during the third quarter of 1977, according to a survey of 221 major projects around the world released yesterday by the Conference Board.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: FOOD FOR THOUGHT Is Marriage Necessary? is today's topic in the Lunch & Learn lecture series at the Schimmel Center of Pace University, one block east of City Hall. The speaker is Dr. George Shanker, professor of sociology, woo will examine the family scene todayas many husbands, wives, daughters and sons go their separate wayswith an upbeat conclusion. Doors open at noon for the buffet; the lecture begins at 12:25 P.M. and you may leave at any time. The tab is $4 for lunch and lecture, and $1.50 for the lecture alone.

title: New York City Bricklayers Union Accepts 14% Pay Cut in New Pact
description: The bricklayers union in New York City, most of whose 4,000 members are unemployed as a result of the sagging construction industry, has agreed to a 14 percent wage cut in a threeyear contract with major mason contractors.

title: Canadian Party Seeks a Leader
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 14 (UPI)The Social Credit Party, which advocates monetary reform, will hold a national leadership convention in Winnipeg next June, almost a year after the death of the party leader, Andre Fortin, in a car crash, it was announced here. John Martin Hattersley, an Edmonton lawyer, is the only leadership candidate at this time, a spokesman said.

title: News Summary
description: President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said he would address the Israeli Parliament rm Middle East peace within the next week if he received an invitation from Prime Minister Menahem Begin. Mr. Begin, when told of Mr. Sadat's stat, ment, announced that he would ask the United States to send the invitation on Israel's behalf. It would be the first time any Arab leader has publicly visited Israel since its founding in 1948. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: SENATOR NELSON ASSAILS DRUG MARKETING PRACTICE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Senator;Gaylord Nelson opened yet another investigation into the pharmaceutical industry today by charging that major drug companies use classic bait and switch tactics in selling products made by small companies under the brand names of larger and more prestigious concerns at higher prices.

title: Carter Endorses Modified Version Of Humphrey  Hawkins Jobs Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  President Carter endorsed today a compromise fullemployment bill that would set, as a national goal, a reduction of the overall. unemployment rate from the present 7 percent to 4 percent in 1983.

title: Roosevelt
description: RESULTS

title: Black Nations Urge U. N. to Adopt Economic Curbs on South Africa
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 14African countries demanded economic sanctions, including an oil embargo, against South Africa today as the General Assembly opened debate on the country's racial policies.

title: Dockworkers and Carriers Begin Talks on Local Port Agreements
description: Longshoremen and shipping companies in ports on the Atlantic and Gulf Coasts began negotiating local agreements yesterday to supplement the new master pact:ached here on Sunday.

title: Meadowlands Results
Helium Football? Not So
description: The Houston Oilers suspicions that the Oakland Raiders used heliumfilled football for kicking last Sunday turned out yesterday have the weight of a lot of hot air. Even if the ball, spirited away from Oakland after the Oilers loss, had contained helium instead of air, would not have mattered.

title: N.C.A.A. Panel Penalizes 2 on Minnesota Five
description: MINNEAPOLIS, Nov. 14 (AP)Mychal Thompson is barred from play in the University of Minnesota's first seven basketball games this season, and a teammate, David Winey, must sit out the first three games.

title: Polyethylene Costs Cut by New Method Devised by Carbide
description: With the cost of raw materials and energy rising and Federal regulations threatening the chemical industry, the Union Carbide Corporation yesterday introduced a process that could revitalize the production of lowdensity polyethylene used to make products from trash bags to communication cables.

title: Assochiled Press SEEKS SENATE SEAT: Bill Bradley, exKnicks player, in Trenton after announcing he will attempt to challenge Senator Case. Page 45.
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14Bill Bradley, the 34yearold former New York Knicks basketball player, formally opened a bid today for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate seat held by Clifford P. Case, Republican of Rahway, whose term expires next year.

title: Today, a Bicentennial Observance For a Plan of Union That Failed
description: The Bicentennial fervor of 1976 may have t.allen victim to 1977. but anniversaries roll on. After all, the American Revolution did not formally end until 1783, so it is had to see how bicentennialism can possibly disappear before 1983.

title: China Purchases 591,000 Bushels of Soybeans From the U.S.
description: China, normally a modest exporter of soybeans, has recently bought 591,000 bushels of the proteinrich oilseeds from the United States, the Agriculture Department reported yesterday.

title: Roger S. Hewlett, a WtiterEditor At Time and Sports Illustrated
description: Roger S. Hewlett, a writer and editor first at Time magazine and then from 1958 to his retirement in 1971 a senior editor at Sports Illustrated, died yesterday in Middlesex Memorial Hospital in Middleton, Conn. He was 66 years old and lived on Sill Lane in Old Lyme, Conn. Mr. Hewlett, whose forebears gave Hewlett, L.I., its name, graduated in 1933 from Harvard, took to the stage and was with the road company of Boy Meets Girl and Brother Rat. After turning to writing, and joining Time in 1944, his experience came in handy when he did the cover story on Gwen Verdon when she starred in Damn Yr.nkees.

title: Associated Press SEEKS SENATE SEAT: Bill Bradley, exKnicks player, In Trenton after announcing he will attempt to challenge Senator Case. Page 45.
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14Bill Bradley, the 34yearold former New York Knicks basketball player, formally opened a bid today for the Democratic nomination for the United States Senate seat held by Clifford P. Case, Republican of Rahway, whose term expires next year.

title: Georgia Bible College To Reopen. After Flood
description: TOCCOA, Ga., Nov. 14 (AP)The Tor coa Falls Bible College is to reopen tomorrow, nine days after a flood killed 38 persons in a lowlying area of he campus. The earthen darn holding back an nearby community known as Toccoa Falls.

title: Yoji and Tamiko Morita cutting their wedding cake last year and reminiscing in their Tokyo home recently.
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14When Yoji Morita married Tamiko Minemura here last year, his father compared the couple's new life together to a railroad train on a lone uncharted track.

title: TRUDEAU UNDAUNTED, COLLEAGUES REPORT
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 14The serious problems afflicting Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau's Government seem to have neither affected his ebullient personality nor lessened his popularity, though his standing with the voters is less easy to assess than his highly visible personal deportment.

title: Alleged Illegal Drug Manufacturer on S.I. Is Seized
description: Federal agents raided a rented house in Tottenville, S.I., yesterday, subdued two vicious German shepherd guard dogs, and arrested a 27yearold pharmacist who they said was using the house to turn out millions of capsules of quaalude. a depressant.

title: Rangers Recall Fotiu; Hoist Is Sent Down
description: Nick Fotiu, the New York Rangers enforcer, rejoined the team yesterday after spending two weeks with New Haven of the American Hockey League. The Rangers either had to bring back the popular left wing or put him on waivers yesterday.

title: Pentagon Game Simulates a Nuclear Blackmail Case
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14In a sign of how seriously the United States Government has come to view the problem of international terrorism, the Pentagon recently simulated a hypothetical situation dealing with the theft of an American nuclear weapon by terrorists.

title: CONTRACTOR RESISTS ORDER FOR BACK PAY
description: In what could be a precedentsetting case, a Brooklyn contractor has challenged a backpay order by the National Labor Relations Board on the ground, in part, that the six workers involved were illegal aliens whom it had hired without knowing their illegal status.

title: Vikings' Tarkenton Out For Rest of the Season
description: The fibula is the long, thin outerbone of the human leg between the knee and the ankle, attached at the ankle. Fractures of the fibula down near the ankle, which seldom are serious, happen with some frequency to skiers. But last Sunday they happened to three quarterbacks and that was serious.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: LACHOWICZ (Polish). Rotterdam Nov 25, Bremerhaven 26 end Gdynia 28, sals from Pt. Newark, N.J. Letters, mails and parcel post for the Netherlands, Austria, Czechesiovakia, Ccrmany and Poland.

title: Books of The Times
description: It happens to be a fine fall for mystery fictionas if, after a number of tedious years, we've finally gotten the crime out of Washington and back onto the shelves of rental libraries where it belongsand I haven't even read Michael Gilbert's Petrella at Q (Harper & Row, $8.95) or Berton Roueche's Fago (also Harper & Row, $8.95), which are bound to be good.

title: HUGHES PAPERS SHOW LOCKHEED PROPOSAL
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 14Howard R. Hughes, who controlled but did not own the assets of the medical institute that carried his name, once planned to use those assets as bait in a plan to help him divest a moneylosing helicopter manufacturing company, according to records filed in a Houston court today to The New York Times

title: Open Interest
description: Monday, Nov. 14, 1977

title: Bonn Is Plagued by Issue of Nuclear Waste Disposal
description: ASSE, West Germany, Nov. 12Twentytwo years after West Germany first gained access to atomic power, the Government is involved in acrimonious debate with industry and environmental groups over the future of nuclear energy in this densely populated industrial country.

title: Tennis
SECRET RESEARCH FRONTS ELIMINATED C.I.A. SAYS
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 14 (AP)The Central Intelligence Agency no longer uses secret organizations as fronts for financing human behavior research, its Director, Adm. Stansfield Turner, said today.

title: Sarnbo's Restaurants Net Up 16%; W. R. Grace Halts Merger Talks
description: Sambo's Restaurants, California coffee shop chain W. R. Grace & Company had been interested in acquiring until yesterday when it suspended discussions, reported profit increases of 16 percent for the third quarter and 10.6 percent for the first nine months of this year.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 14Flood damage in northern New Jersey last week totaled more than $94 million, state officials said today, and the Governor's office asked President Carter to declare four counties a major disaster area.

title: william r. barrett, 55, a news service editor
description: william r. barrett. assistant managing editor for united press international, collapsed and died yesterday at the port authority bus terminal in manhattan. he was 55 years old and lived in rutherford, n.j.

title: Helms and The Name Of Duty
description: WASHINGTONPresident Carter has prudently declined to agree with Richard Helms, the former C.I.A. director, that Mr. Helms's conviction on two misdemeanor counts was a badge of honor. Mr. Carter did insist that the Helms plea bargain with the Department of Justice upheld the law but close scrutiny of this powderpuff deal casts serious doubt even on that.

title: First OneMan Police Cars Report a Quiet Night
description: For Police Officer James Carroll on radiocar patrol in Sector FiveOh John Charlie in the Northwest Bronx, it was an unusually quiet tour.

title: People and Business
description: Calvin Collier yesterday resigned his seat on the fivemember Federal Trade Commission, effective Jan. 1. Mr. Collier, who said he resigned for personal reasons, served as chairman from March 1976 until earlier this year, when Michael Pertschuk was appointed to the post by President Carter. Mr. Collier also is a former general counsel to the F.T.C.

title: Women's Movement at Age 11: Larger, More Diffuse, Still Battling
description: Eleven years ago this month, a handful of women met in Betty Friedan's ruby and sapphire Victorian parlor on the West Side and announced they were seeking true equality for all women in America.

title: A Countess's Champagne Party Becomes a $45aTicket Fizzle
description: Countess Vera von Ledeburg and Oliver Rubin invite you to escape to Voyage des Folies,  read the elegant, embossed invitation, promising a champagne reception at 9 P.M. in the posh Metropolitan Club, with Andy Warhol, Jacques Bellini and Jimmy Breslin among the Honorary Guests.

title: SADAT SEEKS ISRAELI INVITATION TO MAKE ADDRESS IN PARLIAMENT; BEGIN AGREES, WANTS U.S. TO HELP
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  President Anwar elSadat of Egypt said today that he was prepared to address the Israeli Parliament within the next week once he had received a formal invitation from Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel.

title: WEATHER FORECASTS PRESAGE GOOD CROPS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14With the warning that longrange weather forecasts are right only six out of 10 times, the National Weather Service predicted today that the early winter months in the Northeast and Central Mississippi Valley states would be colder than normal.

title: U.S. Archbishop Urges Evangelism And T rue Conversion of Catholics
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Sounding strong evangelical note that reflected major new emphasis in Roman Catholicism, Archbishop Joseph L. Bernardin of Cincinnati urged the National Conference of Catholic Bishops today to seek vigorously the true conversion of millions of lapsed Catholics who have been falling away from the faith,

title: Schapiro Dismisses As  Baseless Suit Brought by LITCO
description: Morris A. Schapiro, president of M. A. Schapiro & Company, yesterday dismissed as selfserving and baseless charges in a Federal lawsuit brought by LITCO, a bank holding company. The suit alleges that Mr. Schapiro and his firm are centrally involved in a secret plan to acquire, at a premium price of $30 a share, a controlling 30 percent interest in LITCO for three Venezuelan investors.

title: 1,800 New or Rehabilitated Units In New York to Get U.S. Rent Aid
description: The construction or rehabilitation of more than 1,800 apartments in three boroughs under a Federal taxincentive program was unanimously approved yesterday by the New York City Planning Commission, but the commission nevertheless criticized the Government for the way in which buildings were selected for the program.

title: Ethiopian Official Is Believed to Have Been Executed
description: NAIROBI. Kenya, Nov. 14Official Ethiopian sources confirmed today that Lieut. Col. Atnafu Abate, nominally the Secondranking figure in the country's ruling military council, was subjected yesterday to a revolutionary measure, a euphemism that in the past has Meant execution.

title: Castaldo Won't Quit Yonkers Post
description: YONKERS, Nov. 14City Manager Vincent Castaldo, whose 18monthold administration was closely associated with the recently defeated Democratic majority on the City Council, said today that he would not resign his $42,000ayear post until he was ordered out.

title: House Panel to Arrange Polygraph Test for Ray
description: PETROS, Tenn., Nov. 14 (UPI)The staff of the Douse Select Committee on Assassinations mil with James Earl Ray for seven hours today and agreed to arrange a polygraph test for the consided killer of Dr. Martin Hither King the civil rights leader.

title: Business Records
Hospitals to Change MentalCare Policy
description: City, state and private voluntary hospitals in Brooklyn have agreed to replace a fragmented and admittedly chaotic system of mentalhealth care with one that will make each hospital directly responsible for mental patients in its respective area.

title: Transcript of the Interviews With Sadat and Begin
description: Following is a transcript provided by CBS News of separate interviews conducted with President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and Prime Minister Menahem Begin of Israel on the CBS Evening News television program. The program began with brief segments of Mr. Ct onkite's discussions with each leader, and then the rest of the interviews were shown.

title: $1 BILLION FUND DRIVE SET BY EVANGELICALS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14A group of business, professional and political figures plans to announce tomorrow that it will conduct a worldwide evangelistic campaign that envisions raising $1 billion over a fiveyear span.

title: Students Run County for a Day
description: ELIZABETH, Nov. 10Fiftytwo Union County high school students got a firsthand view today of how their county government operated, with some of them serving as active participants.

title: Steel Production Declined 2.9% During the Week Ended Nov. 12
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 12 was down 2.9 percent to 2.3 million tons, The American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday. The industry produced 2.4 million tons in the preceding week.

title: Hospitals to Change MentalCare Policy
description: City, slate and private voluntary hospilals in Brooklyn have agreed to replace a fragmented and admittedly chaotiC system of mentalhealth care with one that will make each hospital directly responsible for mental patients in its resnective area.

title: GIORGIO PESSINA
description: ROME, Nov. 14 (AP)Giorgio Pessina, a member of the Italian foil fencing team that won a gold medal in the 1928 Olympic Games at Amsterdam, died yesterday at the age of 75. Mr. Pessina wrote numerous books on fencing

title: Standards
description: In 1952, I was a senior at Thomas Knowlton Junior High School in the South Bronx. Even then, J.H.S. 52 was a dangerous place to get an education. When I started out in the seventh grade, there were about a dozen women teachers. By the time I advanced to the ninth grade in that allboys battleground, only one woman was left. People who graduated from my school bragged that they received a diploma and a Bronze Star. For surviving war.

title: The New York Times/Larry Morris
description: CAPTAIN FOR A DAY: Andrew Spaulding, 9, celebrating his ninth birthday in Borg Park on the Hackensack River. The submarine U.S.S. Ling, donated by the Submarine Memorial Association, is anchored there, and Is receptive to children's birthday party's being held in the shed alongside. In the second picture, Master Spaulding inhabits a torpedo tube, not part of tour.

title: Stage: Golda Traces Valor Butts Shackledby Padding
description: For its strength, Golda draws upon the valor, eloquence and growling humor of a very large figure of our times; and upon Anne Bancroft's wholehearted and remarkable recreation of her.

title: Kept Out
description: A news magazine recently discovered a Los Angles restaurant so exclusive ??? it has an unlisted telephone number. If ??? don't know the number, we don't want you, explained somebody connected with the place.

title: Old Glory Sales Set Marks
description: YONICERS, Nov. 14They came from Maine, Florida, California and all parts of Canada. One even came from Iran.

title: Libel Case Against CBS Raises Questions About the Release of Data
description: A Federal court decision that a news organization cannot be forced to disclose how it makes its editing decisions is being viewed by media lawyers as major step in the extension of First Amendment protections.

title: The WellHeeled Ostrich and the I.L.O.
description: Now that President Carter has made good on Henry Kissinger's threat to quit the International Labor Organization unless it behaved in a manner acceptable George Meany, two questions emerge: What can be done to limit the damage of the American resignation? And what benefit can be found in an otherwise unfortunate decision?

title: Radio
S.E.C. Is Rebuked On National Market
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 The Securities and Exchange Commission has failed to develop a national market system in securities trading and has exacerbated the potential for monopoly in securities clearing and settlement, a report issued by two House Commerce subcommittees concluded today.

title: Energy Aide in Philadelphia Pose
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov, 14 (UPI)Mayor Frank L. Rizzo today named Joseph A. LaSala, former regional head of the Federal Energy Administration, as city representative and director of commerce. Mr. LaSala, 53 years old, replaces Albert V. Gaudiosi, a chief aide to the Mayor, who resigned the $42,000ayear post Wednesday for personal reasons.

title: Cost of Welfare Abuse by Aliens Is Put at $5.4 Million in Jersey
description: NEWARK, Nov. 14 (AP)New Jersey taxpayers pay more than $5.4 million annually for abuse of the Federal welfare system by aliens, the General Accounting, Office says.

title: Carter Endorses Modified Version Of Humphrey  Hawkins Jobs Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14  President Carter endorsed today a compromise fullemployment bill that would set, as a national goal, a reduction of the overall unemployment rate from the present percent to 4 percent in 1983.

title: The New York Times/Neal Boenzi
description: A SUPER CAUSE: National pair champions Tai Babilonia and Randy Gardner go through their routine for the Superskates program at Madison Square Garden. The World Bronze medalists were among group of American stars who performed last night to raise funds for the U.S. Olympic team.

title: Boris Belkin Pushes His Violin
description: It is impossible to describe the effect of Boris Belkin's violin recital Sunday night at the 92d St. Y.M.Y.W.H.A. without saying a word about his appearance.

title: The New York Times/Hirotaka Yoshizakl Yoji and Tamiko Morita cutting their wedding cake last year and reminiscing in their Tokyo home recently.
description: TOKYO, Nov. 14When Yoji Morita married Tamiko Minemura here last year, his father compared the couple's new life together to a railroad train on a long, uncharted track.

title: Flora of Northeastern Is First in IC4A
description: Why would a young man pull on a pair of track shoes, shorts and a skimpy undershirt and run five miles over the flats and hills of Van Cortlandt Park in nearfreezing weather?

title: Sports Today
description: Knicks vs. New Orleans Jazz, at Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, 7:30 P.M.

title: CrossCountry
The Editorial Notebook
description: So the South Africans will continue to get no American arms, and the Shah of Iran, who arrives in Washington toclay, will buy his $1.2 billion of flying radar (AWACS) after all, and the Congress may or may not allow the South Koreans to keep the $800 million of equipment the Administration proposes to leave behind when the Army's 2nd Division sails for home. And the Pentagon now admits that is not really sore how many weapons it sold last year; it suspects the figure may be $11.3 billion worth. All these and other arms transfer problems have been news lately. They leave the public and the Congress wondering whether the policy guidelines the President issued with much fanfare in midMay have much to do with the hard questions raise.

title: Blomberg Going To White Sox
description: Ron Blomberg, turned off by the cold atmosphere at Yankee Stadium and turned on by the warmth of Bill Veecles personality, has reached agreement on a louryear, $650,000 contract with the Chicago White Sox.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
Grop YIRLD INGREASES IN TEST OF COMPOUND
description: A significant new hone for ineroasing production by trcating plants with a substance originally isolated from alfalfa hay has been holstered by successful tests last summer in the open fields of farmers.

title: Blumenthal Rejects Protectionism Or Devaluation to Cut Trade Gap
description: Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal warned yesterday that the United States could not take refuge in tariffs and quotas to protect its ailing industries. Instead, he said, the nation had to become a world leader in trade to help cone with its record trade deficit.

title: Art Songs By Gramm Are Lovely
description: Donald Gramm, that stalwart singing actor whose star has been rising steadily in the international opera skies, has for many years followed a complementary career as a recitalist. As his Town Hall appearance on Sunday night made clear, the ebullient bassbaritone must now be regarded as the premiere American male singer of art songs, an important artist at his Peak.

title: Body Found in Car in Brooklyn
description: The body of a man about 30 years of age was found yesterday afternoon in the trunk of a Lincoln Continental Mark 4 car parked in front of 1045 Atlantic Avenue in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn. Homicide detectives said the victim, a white man, had been shot twice. He had no identification papers on him. The car had New Jersey license plates.

title: Pont Quitting as. Northwestern Coach
description: EVANSTON, Ill., Nov. 14 (AP)John Pont, whose Northwestern team hasn't won this season announced his resignation today as head football coach. He will remain as the school's athletic director.

title: British Firemen Strike and Country Tries to Bear It
description: LONDON, Nov. 14Britain's 32,000 firemen struck for higher wages today, leaving only 9,000 hastily trained soldiers and a fleet of obsolete trucks to fight blazes across the country.

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME, Nov. 14 (AP)Andrew Young, the chief United States delegate to the United Nations, saying that food underpins all other human rights, proposed today the formation of a food corps of young volunteers to combat hunger in poor countries.

title: 2 Singer Aides Quit After Meter Inquiry
description: The Singer Company disclosed yesterday the retirement of one official cod the resignation of another after an internal investtigation of exchanges of price information since 1973 with competitors of its American Meter division, with headquarters in Philadelphia.

title: Charles B. Jones
description: JACKSON, Tenn., Nov. 1 4 (AP)Charles B. Jones Sr., son of Casey Jones, the legendary railroad man, died at his home here Saturday. Hew as 89 years old.

title: S.L.A. Head Criticizes Judge on Studio 54 License
description: Michael Roth, the outgoing chairman of the New York State Liquor Authority, in a rare attack on a judge, has accused Justice Hyman Korn of State Supreme Court of being influenced by the chic clientele of Studio 54a popular midtown discothequewhen he ordered that the club be granted a liquor license.

title: A Tentative Accord Is Reached at Boeing In 6Week Walkout
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 14 (AP)Negotiators reached a tentative agreement today on a contract that could end the sixweek strike by 24.000 machinists and aerospace workers against the Boeing Company.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: Front Page 2  No Title

title: Film
Dollar Drops to a New Low Against the Swiss Franc
description: The dollar fell to a record low against the Swiss franc in foreign exchange trading yesterday and declined against most other currencies abroad before rebounding somewhat in late New York trading, The Associated Press reported.

title: An Artist on Film and Behind the Lens
description: Let's face it, there has to be some luck in this business, said Perry Miller Adato, a film maker and producerdirector for WNET/Channel 13. How often does a celebrated artist arrive at a 90th birthday and you have a lovely film coming up?

title: CONFEREES DEBATE ELECTRICITY COSTS WITHOUT PROGRESS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 14 House and Senate energy conferees took up the issue on which they may be further est apart today, electricity rates, and made no progress in a day of arguing.

title: Crime Family Aide Guilty in Smuggling Of Bangkok Heroin
description: A member of the Gambino organized crime family, Vincent Napoli, was convicted yesterday of possession and sale land conspiracy involving narcotics smuggled into this country from Bangkok, Thailand.

title: N.F.L. Standings
Advertising
description: Soon Spellman & Company will mean another Mr. and Mrs. team in the agency business. Cathy Cash Spellman will be in charge of creative and Joseph X. Spellman in charge of marketing.

title: 44 PERISH IN BLAZE IN A MANILA HOTEL
description: MANILA., Nov. 14A fire fanned by the winds of a typhoon swept through a hotel here early today, killing at least 44 people, most of them foreign tourists, and injuring nine. More than 100 guests were safely transferred to other hotels.

title: Fuchs in Masterly Violin Recital
description: Oldfashioned is becoming a compliment in musical circles these days. Certainly the amiable quality of Joseph Fuchs's violin recital in Carnegie Hall Sunday night might well be described as oldfashioned in the pleasantest sense of the term.

title: Earthquakes Felt in California
description: GOLDEN, Colo., Nov. 14 (AP)Three minor earthquakes shook southern California last night and early today, according to officials at the National Earthquake Information Center here. No damage or injuries were reported. The most powerful of the quakes, which measured 4 to 4.2 on the Richter scale, was centered six miles east of El Centro, ahout 200 miles southeast of Los Angeles and 10 miles north of the Mexican border.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: BAYONNE JOB ACTION ENDS: City sanitation workers back on the job yesterday after refuse piled up following an apparent job action last week. The city hired a private firm, HudsonJersey Sanitation Corn pany, to pick up about 1,000 tons of garbage that accumulated on Thursday and Friday. The firm began to work on Saturday. Jerry Timoldi, president of the sanitation workers, said that there never had been a sickout.

title: A Very Busy Day for Koch Edw
description: Edward I. Koch, who has said he was going to be a Mayor who would ride the subway, shop in the neighborhood and carry his own shirts to the laundry, found out yesterday that he is going to have to stop answering his own telephone.

title: Records of College Football Teams and the Schedules of Their Remaining Games
JURY CHOSEN IN SLAYING OF GIRL IN CHURCH BLAST
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Nov. 14 (UPI)A jury of three blacks and nine whites was chosen today to decide whether decide former Ku Klux Klansman killed an 11year old black girl with a dynamite blast at Birmingham church in 1963.

title: Dow Drops 7.53 as Volume Falls; Transport and Utility Averages Off
description: The stock market retreated moderately yesterday following its explosive rally of last Thursday and Friday that marked its best performance of 1977.

title: W. Lyle Bull, ExOfficial Of American Export Lines And Navy Shipping Aide
description: W. Lyle Bull, former executive vice president of American Export Lines Inc., died Thursday in a hospital in Pompano Beach, Fla. He was 85 years old and lived in Pompano Beach.

title: School of Very Hard Knocks
description: If you're wondering why soccer is replacing football as the allAmerican game in the schoolyards of the nation, consider what happened in a high school football game Los Angeles recently.

title: MIDWEST TEENAGERS TELL OF FORCED VICE
description: Three teenaged girls told a state anticrime committee yesterday how they had been trained and recruited by pimps in Minneapolis to become prostitutes and thieves on New York streets, and how they had been terrorized into earning minimum of $150 a night.

title: AMEX SHOWS SHARP RISE IN THIRDQUARTER NET
description: The American Stock Exchange reported yesterday that its thirdquarter net income rose sharply over the yearago period, while its net income for the first three quarters of 1977 declined. Last week, the New York Stock Exchange reported higher net revenues from operations for both the threemonth and ninemonth periods.

title: VISITING BLACK GROUP ATTACKED IN BOSTON
description: BOSTON Nov. 14 (AP)Several white men swinging sticks and clubs attacked a group of black teenage students from Pennsylvania as they visited the Bunker Hill Monument on a school trip today. Four youths and their 25yearold teacher were injured.

title: Turnabout in Africa: Somali Ouster Completes Shift of Soviet Role
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 14Somalia's expulsion of Soviet advisers completes a remarkable reversal in the alignment of the superpowers in the two countries of the Horn of AfricaSomalia and Ethiopia Under the military government that deposed Emperor Haile Selassie three years ago, EthiNews opia has moved steadily to Analysis the left. In April, it severed a 24yearold military dependence on the United States and turned to the Soviet Union for both ideology and arms.

title: Cuba Military in Ethiopia Now Put At 400 by U.S., Up From 50 in May
description: 11 WASHINGTON, Nov. 14Cuba has expanded its military involvement in Ethiopia and may now have individual soldiers fighting against Somali forces in the Ogaden region, the State Department said today.

title: The Met, the Ballet And Old King Cole
description: IF YOU didn't know that Monday night was just too much, maybe you're lucky. The social swimmers almost drowned in a sea of activity.

title: New Fire Breaks Out Near Los Angeles After Earlier One Is Contained
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 15A major new brush fire swept across ehe Santa Monica Mountains tonight, blackening more than 2,000 acres and forcing scores of families to evacuate homes.

title: Number of Recalled Vehicles Nears 8Million Mark; Safety Campaign and Use of Standard Parts Cited
description: DETROIT, Nov. 15The number of cars and trucks being recalled this year for safety reasons by United States automobile manufacturers is skyrocketing.

title: How Parents Can Get Involved
description: Parents, consumer groups or educators interested in improving child nutrition may consult two local groups for organizational assistance.

title: Carter Expansion View Challenged
description: GENEVA, Nov. 15Lobited Nations economist challenged the Carter Administration's view that West Germany and Japan, by increasing their own industrial activity would join the United States in serving as locomotives that could pull the world out of the economic doldroms.

description: John Leonard

description: HOUSTON, Nov.15These are dark days in the nation's oil capital. After four years of increasingly complex and restrictive regulations imposed by two quite different Republican administrations, the oil industry is about to get

description: Close Encounters and Columbia Pictures

title: DISTRICT INTEGRATION PRESSED IN ATLANTA
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 15Arguments began in United States District Court here today on a sweeping American Civil Liberties Union suit that would mandate the transfer of schoolchildren across city, county and school district lines throughout a sixcounty area to eliminate de facto school segregation.

title: Books: A U.S. Adviser Who Fails To See Why We Lost in Vietnam
description: JOSEPH BlITI'INGP: has been writing lucidly thou! Viettuimese history for the last 20 years, and some of his five volumesespecially The Smaller Dragon, published in 1958, and Vietnam: A Dragon

title: Lord, Geller Regains The Arden Account
description: Only one thing makes an agency happier than when it wins an account, that's when it wins an account back.

title: Dollar Mixed in New York
description: The dollar finished lower against most major currencies in New York foreignexchange tread ng yesterday and steadied in European markets.

title: The U.N. Today
SCA to Evaluate Bid
description: SCA Services Inc., a wasteservice company, said its board had retained Paine Webber Jackson & Curtis, the brokerage concern, to assist in the evaluation of an offer by Waste Management Inc. to acquire SCA. Waste Management has offered to exchange 0.45 of its common for each of SCA's shares outstanding. The transaction would have a value of about $72.3 million.

title: Pharmacists Tell Senate Panel That. Drug Concerns Use Scare Tactics in Selling TradeName Products
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 15Officials of the nation's largest association of pharmacists told a Senate hearing today that their members prefer selling generic drugs as opposed to tradename products, hut that the practice had met with the violent opposition of organized medicine and the major pharmaceutical houses.

title: Albany Backers of Death Penalty Say They Could Override 78 Veto
description: Legislative backers of the death penalty In New York State predicted yesterday that they had enough votes to override a veto of any deathpenalty legislation enacted at next year's legislative session.

title: Tony Kornheiser
description: Football touches us. We bleed as the surgeon cuts into O.I.'s damaged knee; we shudder as Mean Joe Greene swoopss down for a sack: we soar as The Snake lofts one for the end zone; we sigh as Freeway Joe wastes on the sideline. Football overwhelms us. We accept the principle that football is a microcosm of life, though why it is so defies reason. We celebrate the legend of Vince Lombardi without understanding the man. We attach Roman numerals to Stine:. Bowls as if they were World Wars: the Super Bowls lead, XIII.

title: Grumman Unit Wins Navy Contracts
description: The Grumman Aerospace Corporation, a unit of the Grumman Corporation, has been awarded Navy contracts totaling $77.8 million in providing additional advanced procurement funding for F14 fighter planes and armament for the F14.

title: Three Inmates at Rikers Arrested
description: The police arrested three Rikers Island. inmates yesterday, saying that they had been involved in a series of shootings, assaults and shakedowns this year of drug dealers and store merchants in a fourblock area in Harlem. The men were charged with murder in the shooting of a man last month. All three had been arrested and held on Rikers Island on other charges since the killing in October. At least 36 persons have been shot, 17 fatally, in the area between West 145th Street and West 149th Street on Eighth and Seventh Avenues this year. Four were shot in three separate incidents on the night of Oct. 1.

title: 5 Arts Groups Form One Lobbying Voice
description: FIVE BIG ARTS GROUPS that seek to make friends and influence legislators now have a singlc voice in Washington. It's called the American Arts Alliance, and its aim is to raise a clear solo voice for the arts instead of a choral cacophony.

title: Jazz: Brass Reminiscent Of Kenton
description: THE NEWEST big jazz band in towna 14piece group led by David Chesky, a 21yearold pianistis a mixture of brassiness reminiscent of Stan Kenton, bigband rock that stems from Blood, Sweat and Tears and an underlying rhythmic drive that lightens and enlivens both of the band's primary sources.
