description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 21  The Center for the Study of Democratic Institutions in Santa Barbara has chosen. Maurice B. Mitchell, chancellor of the. University of Denver, to succeed the late Robert M. Hutchins as president.

title: An ExLegislator Roams the Halls Of the Knesset to Lobby for Peace
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 21  A former legislator roamed the hills of the Israeli Parliament today conducting the most extraordinary bout of lobbying ever seen in that raucous and unpredictable body.

title: Dramatic Wit and Wisdom Unite In Uncommon Women and Others
description: Wendy Wasserstein has satirical instincts and an eye and ear for the absurd, but she shows signs of harnessing these talents to a harder discipline.

title: Steel Output Down 1.5%
description: Steel production totaled 2.25 million net tons during the week ended Nov. 19, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported from Washington yesterday, down 1.5 percent from the 2.28 million tons produced the week before. At the new level utilization of plant capacity was 74.1 percent compared with 75.2 percent.

title: Dividends
description: MONDAY, NOVEMBER 21, 1977

title: New York's Tourist Boom Bringing $4.5 Billion a Year
description: Shows will be running inall 16 Shubert theaters in New York City this week and their marquees will remain lighted up at least into next year, the first time there has been such sustained prosperity on Broadway in more than 20 years.

title: Panel Will Study Effect of Trading In Westway for Transit
description: Governor Carey and Mayorelect Edward I. Koch named a threeman panel yesterday to study the economic effects of exchanging the Federal money earmarked for the Westway highway project for funds to improve mass transit in New York City. The panel was ordered to report within four weeks.

title: Bostock Signed by Angels And Red Sox Get Torrez
description: Already having lost a player they had, the Yankees lost one yesterday they didn't have but wanted. Three hours after the Boston Red Sox officially announced their agreement with Mike Torrez, the California Angels unveiled Lyman Bostock as the latest in their line of expensive freeagent acquisitions.

title: Jersey Chief Justice Asks $12,500 Raises
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21Richard J. Hughes, the Chief Justice of New Jersey, told a joint session of the State Legislature today that it must increase judicial salaries substantially in this session or invite deterioration of the state's court system.

title: Cairo Crowds Cheer The Man of Peace
description: CAIRO, Nov. 21President Anwar elSadat was welcomed home from Israel tonight and acclaimed as the man of peace by tens of thousands of Egyptians standing shoulder to shoulder for most of the 20mile route from the airport to his home beside the Nile.

title: New Vaccine Approved by F.D.A. For a Potentially Fatal Pneumonia
description: A new vaccine to protect against a common, potentially fatal type of pneumonia was approved yesterday by the Food and Drug Administration. It is intended primarily for use among older people and those with chronic illnesses.

title: Beame Projects $249 Million Gap in Next Budget, $163 Million More Than He Forecast Last April
description: Mayor Beame released yesterday a financial plan for the 1979 fiscal year that projected a $249 million budget gap for New York City, $163 million more than his prediction of last April, but considerably less than the estimates of others.

title: MORE TALKS PLEDGED
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 21President Anwar elSadat of Egypt ended his epic mission to Israel today by joining with Prime Minister Menahem Begin in repealed pledges of no more war.

title: Peter M. Kelly, 38, News Editor; Served in Colorado and Wyoming
description: TORRINGTON, Wyo., Nov. 21 (UPI)Peter M. Kelly, the ColoradoWyoming news editor for United Press International, died here Friday of an apparent heart attack before he could begin research on the story he planned to write about high school graduates of the 1960's and their lives 10 years later. He was 38 years old.

title: ABC Game: A Football Soap Opera
description: It is 23 minutes into the show, and the Dallas Cowboys and St. Louis Cardinals are swinging into action with their fists.

title: F.B.I. Releases Most Files on Its Programs to Disrupt Dissident Groups
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21The Federal Bureau of Investigation released today 53,000 heavily edited pages of heretofore secret files on its 15year counterintelligence programs against domestic dissidents. The documents contained many new details of bureau operations, but few apparent new disclosures of abuses.

title: Redskins Overcome Packers, 109
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (AP)A scrambling Joe Theismann threw a 7yard touchdown pass to. Mike Thomas late in the fourth quarter tonight, enabling the Washington Redskins to edge the Green Bay Packers, 109, and remain alive in the National Football League playoff sweepstakes.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT BUFFALO

title: Doctor Says Police Blocked Hospitalization of Biko
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 21A doctor who supervised the medical examinations of Stephen Biko in the last week of his life testified today that he wanted to have the black leader transferred to a local hospital for observation of possible brain damage but had been forbidden to do so by the security police.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Horses listed in order of post positions Letter designates OTB listing. FIRST$7,500, cl., 3YO and up, 1m. (chute).

title: Opera: Grimes Revived by Met
description: Benjamin Britten's Peter Grimes returned to the Metropolitan Opera last night for the first time since the 197273 season, for the delectation of those who regard it as one of the highwater marks of 20thcentury music theater. The revival, presented in tribute to the memory of the late British composer, brought back Jon Vickers in the title role, which he made his own in previous Metropolitan performances.

title: RUMORS ABOUT KOCH ARE FOUND BASELESS
description: Charges and rumors floated just before the recent election hinting that Representative Edward I. Koch was a homosexual were found yesterday completely baseless by the City's Department of Investgiation.

title: Stocks Mixed as Dow Adds 0.35; Whiting Rises 4, Cessna Loses 4
description: The stock market finished mixed yesterday in slower trading, the Dow Jones industrial average rising 0.35 point to 836.11.

title: Swami Pavitranada, 81, Author And Leader of Vedanta Society
description: Swami Pavitranada, spiritual leader of the Vedanta Society of New York and a monk of the Ramakrishna order of India, died Friday at the society's center, 34 West 71st Street, where he made his home. He was 81 years old.

title: U.S. WILL COMPARE COSTS IN AWARDING CONTRACTS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 21 (UPI)  The Government announced today an overhaul of its system for awarding billions of dollars in contracts to private business.

title: 2 Children Die in Fire As British Strike Goes On
description: LONDON, Nov. 21 (AP)Two children died in a fire in their East London home today, the eighth day of a nationwide firemen's strike, and the police were searching for a man suspected of starting three fires in 24 hours at a London hospital.

title: Assembly Panel Stays Vote on Bill To Allow Public Employee Strikes
description: TRENTON, Nov. 21Members of the Labor Committee of the State Assembly declined today to vote on a bill that would allow teachers and other public employees in New Jersey to strike, agreeing instead to hold public hearings on the best way to handle such situations.

title: 45 on Honeymoon Jet Die in Andes
description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Nov. 21 (AP)A chartered Argentine jetliner carrying honeymooning couples and other vacationers to this famous lake and ski resort of Bariloche crashed during foul Military authorities said that 45 of the 79 persons aboard had been killed.

title: Aqueduct Jockeys Delay Action On Unionization Till Next Month
description: The revelation last week that Aqueduct's jockeys were contemplating unionizing set the stage for separate meetings yesterday by the track's riders and about 60 members of the Horsemen's Benevolent Protective Association.

title: Polaroid Severs Business Links To South Africa
description: The Polaroid Corporation has cut off all shipments to South Africa following disclosures that its distributor there was secretly selling film to the South African Government in violation of a 1971 agreement, the company announced yesterday.

title: Piano: Gorbaty's Mixed Blessings
description: Jan Gorbaty's Chopin recital in Alice Tully Hall Sunday night offered mixed blessings. The pianist, who has frequently given concerts in New York over the last 25 years, cultivates an attractively creamy tone that is admirably suited to the composer's dreamy side and he commands just the right sort of rhythmic giveandtake that is such an integral part of Chopin's style.

title: World News Briefs
description: COPENHAGEN, Nov. 22 (AP)The five Nordic Council countries, Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden, demanded today that Nigeria take immediate steps to protect foreign freighters against pitates in the congested port of Lagos.

title: Retired Police Lieutenant Is Indicted for Perjury In Harlem Bribery Inquiry
description: John Gormley, a retired police lieutenant, was indicted yesterday for perjury by the same special grand jury that has charged an inspector and two deputy inspectors with lying about bribetaking in Harlem commands between 1968 and 1976.

title: Kissinger Challenges U.S. Stress on Geneva Mideast Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Carter Administration affirmed its view today that an overall Middle East peacesettlement should be negotiated at a Geneva conference, but this was challenged by former. Secretary of State Henry A. Kissinger, who said the United States should not tie itself to any one particular formula.

title: Strikes Against All Ships Are Authorized in 3 Ports To Speed Contract Votes
description: General strikes at waterfronts in Philadelphia, New Orleans and Baltimore were authorized last night by the head of the International Longshoremen's Association. The aim of the effort is to end dillydallying in negotiations at the three deepwater ports, the Associated Press reported.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE STORY OF MAN'S ambivalent relation to animals is, to a degree, a history of his struggle with the animal part of himself. Animals have been the scapegoat of man's selfrevulsion or the idealized symbol of his acceptance of his physicality, In medieval religious imagery, we see both conceptions curiously juxtaposed. While the lion may. represent evil, devouring sinners, he also stanas for St. Mark, one of the four Evangelists. And, of course, Jesus is a lamb as well as a shepherd. The unicorn, the symbol of purity, is also capable of ferocity and is paradoxically slaugtered in the tapestries in the Cloisters. It is interesting, but perhaps too whim. sical, to suggest that man attacked his own purity with as much vengefulness as he directed toward his bestiality.

title: A.&F. Says Final Sales Exceeding Expectations
description: Results of the first five days in the closing sale of Abercrombie & Fitch have exceeded our expectations but the 85year old sporting goods chain expects to continue in business until about Dec. 17, the operating head of the company said yesterday.

title: New Jersey Briefs
description: Rutgers University's Graduate School of Business Administration in Newark will provide statewide management and technical aid to minorityowned construction concerns, the college announced.

title: The Duel: Official vs. Camera
description: Bo Matthews, the big San Diego Chargers fullback, carried the ball on a plunge into the Cincinnati defense from the 1yard line. Matthews was hit, his body spun and he landed in the Bengal end zone. Touchdown, of course. But there was no confirming signal from the officiating crew headed by Don Wedge, the referee, and then Dean Look, the line judge, placed the ball six inches from the goal line. Try again, Chargers.

title: India Begins Major Relief Effort As Cyclone Deaths Reach 10,000
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 22The Government began a major relief effort today as the official estimate of deaths from the cyclone that struck the state of Andhra Pradesh Saturday grew to 10,000.

title: $565,000 Embezzlement Charged To 2 ExTravel Agents in Teaneck
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 22A Bergen County grand jury charged today that two Greek immigrants, operating from a small travel agency in Teaneck, had embezzled $565,000 from five airlines. Both men returned to Greece last December, and the Bergen County Prosecutor, Roger W. Breslin Jr., said that his office had asked the State Department to invoke the nation's extradition treaty with Greece in an attempt to return the men here for trial.

title: Article 1  No Title
In Memoriam
description: LEPASTATYetta. In tender memory of our beloved mother and darling Pal, Toodles, who passed away November 23, 1945. Time will neverdim the sweet memory of your dearness, nor ease the pain and longing in our sad hearts for you daily. God bless you through eternity.

title: Notes on People
description: Welcome back home, President Carter said yesterday in formally accepting the credentials of Francois de Laboulaye as French Ambassador to the United States. Mr. Carter referred to the fact that the Ambassador was born in the United States. The President mentioned that France was America's oldest political and military ally and said, I hope before too long to visit your country. France was on the list of nine countries that Mr. Carter was to have visited on a trip originally scheduled, to begin yesterday. The trip may take place next Month if Mr Carter wins Congressional approval of an acceptable energy program.

title: Agency to Renovate Arts Facilities Proposed by State Senator
description: PRODUCTION OF MOVIES and plays in New York may both be up this year, but the chair man of a State Senate subcommittee nevertheless yesterday urged the creation of a state authority with the power to generate as much as $25 million a year for the rehabilitation of the theaters and the opening of new film and videotape production facilities. The subcommittee chairman, Sheldon Farber, RepublicanConservative of Queens, said such an authority could give us the impetus we need to drive pornographic entertainment ou tof Times Square.

title: Recital: Matitiahu Braun, Master of Strings
description: MATITIAHU BRAUN showed that he had more than one string to his bow Monday night in Town Hall by performing on both the violin and viola. The two principal works of the evening, Schubert's Arpeggione Sonata and Grieg's Violin Sonata No. 3, in minor, are sweetly lyrical compositions, and they proved to be admirable vehicles for Mr. Braun's cultured artistry on each instrument

title: Reform Jews Will Seek Affiliation In the World Zionist Organization
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Nov. 22In a move to achieve formal rights and recognition for Reform Judaism in Israel, delegates of the Union of American Hebrew Congregations have voted to establish a Zionistaffiliated body to seek membership in the World Zionist Organization.

title: Bones Linked to Kidnapping
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Nov. 22 (UPI) Bones found in a desert grave by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents have been identified as those of Lawrence Adell, a teenager who was kidnapped more than three years ago. He was the son of a former Detroit fire commissioner and industrialist, Robert Adell, who moved to Palm Springs when he retired. A demand for a $400,000 ransom was received but although Mr. Adell tried several times to pay it, the kidnappers never showed up. Two men were convicted of kidnapping the youth and sentenced to life in prison, but his fate remained a mystery.

title: Braves Top Knicks, 102101, On Smith's Late Jump Shot
description: The Knicks dared the Buffalo Braves to beat them last night and they did.

title: Around the Nation
description: BOSTON, Nov. 22 (AP)Three men accused of beating a group of black students who visited the Bunker Hill Monument pleaded not guilty today in Suffolk Superior Court.

title: Sadat Praised by Common Market
description: BRUSSELS, Nov. 22  The foreign ministers of the nine nations of the European Common Market adopted a Frenchinspired resolution today praising the visit of President Anwar elSadat to Jerusalem as courageous.

title: Belmont Ban on Gerard Continues As Court Defers Ruling Till Today
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Nov. 22Dr. Mark Gerard, the Muttontown veterinarian accused of switching racehorses at Belmont Park last summer, suffered another delay today in his continuing court battle to resume his profession.

title: Waldheim Orders Salaries Of U.N. Staff in Geneva Frozen at Present Levels
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 22Secretary General Kurt Waldheim announced today that the salaries of United Nations general services employees in. Geneva would be frozen on Jan. 1 and those of new employees would be about 17 percent below present ones.

title: House Subcommittee Subpoenas N.C.A.A. Records
description: A Congressional subcommittee subpoenaed records of the National Collegiate Athletic Association yesterday, less than a week after the subcommittee's chairman had warned the association not to interefere with the panel's investigation.

title: For MiddleClass Puerto Ricans, The Bias Problem Hasn't Ended
description: Jos Vega sat at his diningroom table and thought about the seven places in which he and his family have lived in the last 14 years, and the frustrations of being on the cutting edge poured out:

title: Corporation Affairs
description: In a new twist in the plastic bottle war, E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company said yesterday it had filed suit last week in Federal Court in Wilmington, Del., charging Pepsico Inc. and the Hoover Ball and Bearing Company with allegedly infringing Du Pont patents for polyethylene terephthalate plastic bottles.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: If you were to compare the time and effort required to produce a dish with the pleasure that dish offers those who dine on it, chances are that a fish would win wih honors. There may be nothing (outside of an omelet or a hamburger, perhaps) more gratifying to the platate in autumn or winter and the only laborif you could call it thatis involved in the preparation of the fish and a few vegetables, herbs and spices.

title: Concordes From London and Paris Land at Kennedy As 16Month Trial Passenger Service Is Initiated
description: Concorde airliners from London and Paris yesterday began their longblocked trial passenger service to Kennedy International Airport, the gateway that the operators of the supersonic craft have deemed essential if they are to have any hope of turning a profit.

title: U.S. Fines Gulf Oil for Free Trips
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 22 (AP)The Gulf Oil Corporation was fined $36,000 today after pleading guilty to illegally providing trips to an Internal Revenue Service auditor in charge of the company's, tax account.

title: Dance: Program Salutes Talley Beatty's Work
description: DURING HIS CAREER, Talley Beatty has worked successfully as a concert dancer with a strong sympathy for jazz movement, studied and performed African folk dance with Katherine Dunham, partnered Pearl Primus in Showboat on Broadway and danced in Maya Deren's justly celebrates film A Study in Choreography for Camera. For these and assorted other reasons he was celebrated by a program Monday evening at Klitgord Auditorium of the New York City Community College in Brooklyn.

title: India Begins Major Relief Effort As Cyclone Deaths Reach 10,000
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 22The Government began a major relief effort today as the official estimate of deaths from the cyclone that struck the state of Andhra Pradesh Saturday grew to 10,000.

title: Music: Lewin Captures Arcadia
description: THE NEW WORKS commissioned by the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center tend to be taken like so much medicine by its conservative audiences. Not so Frank Lewin's Variations of Greek Themes, which had its first performance at the society's concert late Sunday afternoon in Alice Tully Hall. The piece gave every indication of being a genuine crowd pleaser.

title: Miss Lopez, 20, Adds Spice to Golf Tourneys
description: A good thing for Graham Marsh that he wasn't in New York yesterday. Had he been, the 33yearold Australian golf professional would have been made to feel as old as Sam Snead.

title: Dr. L.W. Houston, Former President Of Rensselaer, 86
description: Dr. Livingston W. Houston, the president of Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute during a period of rapid expansion after World War II, died yesterday at Samaritan Hospital in Troy, N.Y. He was 86 years old.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: FastFood Lunches Planned To Lure New York's Pupils
description: The New York City Board of Education announced yesterday that it would soon introduce such fastfood items as tacos, pizza, french fries, cheeseburgers and supershakes into the schools in an effort to appeal to student tastes and reduce waste.

title: EARLY DEBATE IN U.N. ON RHODESIA SOUGHT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 22Thirdworld delegates in the Security Council said today that a debate would be scheduled next month on an interim report by a Council committee containing a proposal on legal action against oil coinpanies that supply oil to Rhodesia through South African subsidiaries.

title: Doctor Says He Did Not Ask Biko About Injuries
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 22A doctor who examined Stephen Biko after an alleged struggle with the security police while he was being held in custody testified today that he had never asked Mr. Biko or the police if the black leader had suffered a blow to his head in the struggle.

title: Islanders 42 Victors
description: Two thirdperiod goals by Bryan Trottier and one by Mike Bossy gave the Islanders a 42 victory over the Colorado Rockies at Nassau Coliseum. Page B8.

title: Egyptian Leaves U.N. Debate as Syria Attacks Sadat
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 22Egypt's chief delegate walked out of the General Assembly today in protest against a Syrian speech in which the visit of President Anwar elSadat to Israel was denounced as. a visit of shame and a stab in the back of the Arab people.

title: Patricia Grover Is Bride Of Alan GrahamCollier
description: Patricia Garvan Grover, daughter of Hope Jackson Garvan of New York and the late Francis P. Garvan Jr., was married yesterday in Bogart, Ga., to Alan GrahamCollier, professor of the philosophy of art at the University of Georgia. The Rev. William Larkin Power, professor of the philosophy of religion at Georgia and a Methodist minister, performed the ceremony at the bridegroom's home.

title: Syria Is Urged to Lead AntiSadat Arab Drive
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 22President Hafez alAssad, who tried in vair. last week to dissuade President Anwar elSadat from making his visit to Israel, has now come under strong pressure to assume the leadership of a new Arab alignment that rejects the CairoTel Aviv dialogue.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 23, 1977

title: CARTER SUPPORTERS ASSAIL SCHLESINGER ON HIS ENERGY VIEWS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 12Supporters of President Carter's energy legislation today denounced Secretary of Energy James R. Schlesinger for suggesting areas of compromise.

title: Hanover Bank Units To Open Saturdays
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Trust Company said yesterday that it would open 44 of its branches on Saturday and one on Sunday, from 10 A.M. to 2 P.M. beginning this weekend.

title: People and Business
description: Robert G. Welch, president of the Steel Service Center Institute, expressed concern yesterday at a meeting of the group in Chicago over the Administration's proposal to control steel imports by reference pricing, or establishing a socalled fair value under which imports could not be sold in the United States.

title: Dow Adds 6.41 as Trading Climbs; Glamour and Oil Stocks Stronger
description: The stock market, encouraged by a smallerthanexpected increase in consumer prices during October, pushed higher in active trading yesterday.

title: MYSTERY SIGNALS UNCODED, SATELLITE IS LAUNCHED
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 22 (UPI) Europe's firs tweather satellite, Meteosat 1, lifted off without a hitch tonight aboard a Delta rocket after two postponements caused by mysterious radio signals.

title: A Rump Roast From Fernande Allard
description: This recipe and the one below are those of Fernande Allard, as included in Grandes Dames de la Cuisine by Madeleine Peter.

title: Article 2  No Title
Radio
description: Music

title: Voluntary Desegregation Is Urged As Chicago Plans to Revise Schools
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 22  A 12point proposal for voluntary school desegregation that would rely on incentives and good will rather than mandatory requirements has been recommended as the framework in which Chicago should develop its stateordered plan for revising the school system.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 22Governor Byrne announced today the creation of a transition team to help set the goals for his second fouryear term.

title: Jordanian Official Believes sad at Opened Way to Peace by His Trip
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 22A top Jordanian official said today that President Anwar elSadats peace mission to Israel had achieved its purpose, opening the road to progress toward a Middle East peace settlement.

title: 5 North Jersey Counties Declared Flood Disaster Areaby U.S. Agency
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22The Small Business Administration declared as disaster areas today five North Jersey counties ravaged by a storm two weeks ago, making residents and businessmen eligible for longterm, lowinterest Federal loans. Damage has been estimated at almost $100 million.

title: Deaths
description: BERGSONBeniamin beloved husband of Freda devoted father of Alan and Howard, dear. brother of Hyman; loving grandfather of Eric. Services today 11:30AM at The Colonial Chapels of I.J.Morris, Inc., 46 Greenwich St, Hempstead, L.I.

title: Dayan Urges Prompt Action
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 22 (UPI)Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan said today that President Sadat's trip to Israel had forced a critical hour of decision on the nation. The state radio said Jordan's King Hussein might be the next Arab leader to visit Jerusalem.

title: The U.N. Today
Other Developments In Mideast Situation
description: Egyptian officials predicted that Arab anger over President Anwar elSadat's visit to Israel would be shortlived and that major Arab governments would decide to cooperate with. Cairo's peace offensive. Page A2.

title: New Products: A Pan,
description: For years, Linda Wasserstein, a dedicated bread baker and pastrymaking teacher from Long Island, searched for a way to make oldfashioned homemade bread that was moist on the inside, crusty on the outside. She experimented with clay flowerpots, toyed with the idea of building a brick oven in her backyard and even approached several manufacturers to create a bread pan that would allow cooks to create crusty bakery bread at home.

title: The Cubans Are Coming!
description: Last week was Cuba Alarm Week in Washington. A White House briefing painted a disturbing picture of a coordinated CubanSoviet attempt to subvert a dozen African countries. And then Robert Byrd, the Senate majority leader, chimed in with a warning that Havana's African connection might jeopardize Senate ratification of the strategic arms limitation agreement with the Soviet Union. Since Cubans were in Africa at the bidding of Moscow, he said, Moscow should bid them leave.

title: RESTRAINT PLANNED ON CARDIAC SURGERY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 22  The Regional Health Planning Council, which oversees health care systems for the state and Federal governments in five New Jersey counties, said today it would restrain the duplication or proliferation of costly heart surgery and cardiac diagnostic facilities in its area.

title: Net Schedule: O'Brien Replies
description: Larry O'Brien, commissioner of the National Basketball Association, said yesterday that a 21team schedule had been prepared to exclude the New Jersey Nets because the Nets might not have been able to arrange for a home court after they left the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, LI.

title: Photos: The Losers, 29 Years Later
description: WHATEVER BECAME of them? One looks at the photographs of yesteryear's wars, of sturdy, young heroes, of little children in the confusion of defeat, of young women in the hands of the enemy. Whatever became of them? How do they look today, those who survived the war, those who survived the years?

title: Phillips Enters Plea Of Guilty on Taxes
description: TULSA, Okla. Nov. 22 (AP)The Phillips Petroleum Company today pleaded guilty in Federal court here to one count of a fivecount charge that the company made illegal campaign contributions and evaded taxes on a political slush fund. totaling $3 million.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: LAST NIGHT'S GAMES

title: Standards Board Moves To Bar Differing Methods Of Accounting on Leasing
description: The Financial Accounting Standards Board announced yesterday it was broadening the definition of certain types of sales costs associated with developing new leases.

title: Technology
description: Disclosure of preliminary test results indicating a link between the birchwood sweetener xylitol and cancer in laboratory animals has put the Wm. Wrigley Jr. Companynow marketing nationally a xylitolsweetened chewing gum called Orbitunder a cloud of uncertainty.

title: Letters: On Teaching the Holocaust
description: To the Editor:

title: Meadowlands Results
description: Time1:12 4/5. uCoupled. Exacta (41) paid $50.

title: Eastern Literary Estabishnment Taken to Task at P.E.N. Meeting
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 22Several prominent members of the selfproclaimed Eastern literary establishment, meeting with a group of Southwest writers and editors here this afternoon; agree that their establishment should not exist.

title: Luigi Cardinal Traglia, 82, Dean Of the Sacred College of Cardinals
description: ROME, Nov. 2 (AP)Luigi Cardinal Traglia, dean of the Sacred College of Cardinals, died today at a Rome clinic after a long illness, the Vatican announced. He was 82 years old.

title: All His Kids Have Such Talent
description: ON THE NIGHT after Thanksgiving, many of the world's most famous violinists will gather in a Riverside Drive apartment to pay a fond tribute to their teacher, Ivan Galamian, who is 75 years old. Mr. Galamian, looking ahead to the birthday party the other day with what seemed to be a serious case of stage fright, confessed that he was nervous about the possibility that he would have to make a speech.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Islanders Defeat Rockies Despite Rocky Going, 42
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., Nov. 22The Islander fans in the Nassau Coliseum crowd of 14,683 sat on their hands for two and a half periods tonight, waiting in vain for their favorites to explode against the Colorado Rockies. For 45 minutes they witnessed a desultory exhibition by the team that had scored nine goals in its last game and possessed the National Hockey League's leading point scorer, leading goal scorer, leading rookie scorer and leading line.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: WITH THANKSGIVING in the offing, it seems only proper to deal with food and feasting. Irwin Goldstein says everything in the following story is accurate, except the telephone numbers, which he changed to protect the innocent, especially his Aunt Sophie, who is clearly to be protected as an endangered species characterized by a goodness all too rare. One day not long ago, it seems, Aunt Sophie was at home in the Bronx when her telephone rang.

title: Music: Jazz Fuses With AvantGarde
description: CONCEPTUALLY, Leo Smith's concert with the Creative Music Studio Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall had much to recommend it. Like Anthony Braxton, with whom he has worked closely, Mr. Smith treads the elusive borderlines between jazz, classical avantgarde and ethnic musics. One puts the word jazz in quotation marks because, for musicians of this sort, jazz is considered yet another form of improvisatory music.

title: Energy Aides and the Pentagon Singled Out for Way With Words
description: This year's Doublespeak Award will be given tomorrow to the Pentagon and the Energy Research and Development Administration. The two agencies, neither of which is expected to delegate anyone taoreceive the award in person, are singled out by the National Council of Teachers of English for describing the neutron bomb as a radiation enhancement weapon

title: RONALD EARL WILLIS
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., Nov. 22 (UPI)Ronaid Earl (Ron) Willis, a former St. Louis Cardinals relief pitcher who was stricken with a malignant brain tumor in January, died last night at a local hospital. Willis, 34 years old, had doggedly fought his illness, rejoining his former ball club this summer as a parttime scout.

title: A WorkSharing Concept To Ease Impact of Layoffs
description: Now that President Carter has endorsed a modified HumphreyHawkins job bill, new attention is being given in government, industry and labor to experiments aimed at fusing worksharing and unemployment insurance as way stations on the road to full employment. The plan under study seeks to diffuse the impact of layoffs in periods of slack business or governmental cutbacks by spreading the available work over the entire work force through a fourday week, instead of dropping onefifth of the workers from the payroll altogether.

title: 3 BIG BROKERAGE FIRMS DRAW CENSURE OF S.E.C.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  The Securities and Exchange Commission today censured White Weld & Company, Kidder Peabody & Company and Butcher & Singer Inc. for minor violations of the agency's reporting requirements.

title: CONSUMER PRICE RISE AT 0.3% FOR 3D MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Government reported today another modest increase in the inflation rate with a rise of threetenths of 1 percent in the Consumer Price Index for October.

title: 18 Chicago Aldermen to Investigate Cab Fare Dispute
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 22The Chicago City Council voted unanimously this morning to establish a special committee of 18 aldermen to investigate the controversy resulting from charges by a former aide that Mayor Michael E. Bilandic conspired with a taxi company official to get fares increased.

title: Events Today
description: Film

title: Wine Talk
description: HEAVEN'T picked out your wine for dinner tomorrow? Well, don't look here for help. If you were hoping for yet another redwiththemeatwhitewiththefish lecture, forget it. This is an unabashed, heartonthesleeve Thanksgiving story.

title: TV: A Survivor Brightens Search for Sunken Liner
description: FROM THE START, this week's schedule was crammed with assorted specials. Then Egyptian President Anwar elSadat's hastily arranged trip to Israel justifiably monopolized attention for several days. That leaves a reviewer with the roundup, a somewhat frustrating attempt to catch up and give more notable efforts at least a couple of paragraphs of attention.

title: Prices of Precious Metals Futures Stabilize After Recent Steep Fall
description: Enough buyers came into the precious metals futures market yesterday to stabilize prices after the steep decline of the last several sssions.

title: Carter Vows More Research Funds
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (Reuters)President Carter said today that the new Federal budget to be submitted to Congress in January would contain expanded funds for scientific research and development.

title: Gold and Dollar Register Declines
description: LONDON, Nov. 22 (AP)Gold prices declined today in Europe in reaction to the completion of President Anwar elSadat's trip to Israel. The dollar also continued its slide.

title: Stage: How Scott Kept Date With Icy Death
description: New Haven WE SHALL STICK IT OUT to the end but we are getting weaker of course and the end cannot be far. It seems a pity but I do not think I can write more.... For God's sake look after our people. These words conclude the journal found on the frozen body of the Antarctic explorer Capt. Robert Falcon Scott.

title: Sports Today
description: BOXING

title: Braves Appoint Cox to Manage
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 22 (AP) ??ed Turner, owner of the Atlanta Braves, today named Bobby Cox manager of his National League team and said he hoped the former coach of the world champion Yankees would lead us to the promised land. Turner said Cox, 36 years old and the youngest manager in the major leagues, was signed to a twoyear contract. Salary terms were not disclosed.

title: Allison Switches to Ford On Grand National Circuit
description: SPARTANBURG, S. C., Nov. 22 (AP) Bobby Allison will switch to Bud Mooreprepared Fords for NASCAR stockcar races next season, and the driver who had worked with Moore, Buddy Baker, announced he would change to Chevrolets sponsored by M. C. Anderson.

title: Best Buys
description: GUESS what this week's big food bargain is? No, not hummingbird lips. It's turkey, and even if there is one already in the oven, there's no reason why another can't be stuffed into the freezer. This is the time of year when lots of stores hawk the big bird at close to cost, hoping to recoup their largesse when people invest in the trimmings. So it makes sense to stash one away for use in one of those weeks when you want to glow with pride at your pennypinching foresight.

title: Foreign Relations Committee's Influence at Lowest Point in 20 Years
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22At a time when the Carter Administration badly needs assistance on Capitol Hill for its foreignpolicy program, the influence of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee has declined to its lowest ebb in 20 years.

title: The Women's Work Is Not Yet Done
description: The National Women's Conference in Houston has left its imprint largely on the minds of those who were there. It will be their task to make the experience meaningful to the nation.

title: Concordes From London and Paris Land at Kennedy As 16Month Trial Passenger Service Is Initiated
description: Concorde airliners from London and Paris yesterday began their longblocked trial passenger service to Kennedy International Airport, the gateway that the operators of the supersonic craft have deemed essential if they are to have any hope of turning a profit.

title: Macy's Gets 7% of Sales Sundays
description: After more than a full year of its controversial Sunday openings here, R. H. Macy & Company, the area's biggest remiler, has come up with a measure of their full worth.

title: U .S. Waives Interest For D .&H. Railroad In Another Rescue
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Government came to the rescue of the troubled Delaware and Hudson Railroad again today, waiving more than $1 million in interest payments on Federal loans and promising to consider another $11 million in additional aid.

title: Vance Asks Brazilians to Restrict Nuclear Programs
description: BRASILIA, Nov. 22Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance urged Brazil's leaders today to reconsider their commitment to a nuclearenergy program using plutonium fuel, calling it uneconomic and politically hazardous.

title: Removal of the Rothko Executors And $9.2 Million Damages Upheld
description: Calling the conduct of the three executors of the estate of Mark Rothko, the painter, manifestly wrongful and indeed shocking, the New York State Court of Appeals yesterday unanimously upheld a lowercourt decision that removed the three executors.

title: Fending Off A Holiday Funk
description: THE RICHLY loving, warm and happy holiday times that almost everyone remembers or glorifies from childhood are often wretched, stressful times of the year for many adults.

title: Cairo Expects Arab Furor to Pass
description: CAIRO, Nov. 22Egyptian officials predicted today that Arab anger over President. Anwar elSadat's mission to Israel would be shortlived and that Arab governments except for traditional hardliners would decide to cooperate with the Egyptian initiative.

title: Shell, Esso Sign Pacts With Britain On Participation in North Sea Oil
description: LONDON, Nov. 22 (Reuters) Shell U.K. Ltd. and Esso Petroleum Ltd. have signed participation agreements with the British Government, which gives the stateowned British National Oil Corporation the right to buy 51 percent of their North Sea oil output, the energy department said.

title: Advertising
description: This is the tale of inspiration and where it leads, and it concerns Karl Katz and, later, his son, Evan.

title: Japan Wire Dumping Studied by Treasury
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI) The Treasury Department today began antidumping investigations on imports of steel wire strand from Japan and India.

title: Inquiry Into Charges of Brutality By Philadelphia Police to Continue
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 22  United States Attorney David W. Marston said today that his office would continue its investigation of allegations of widespread brutality by officers of the Philadelphia Police Department despite the acquittal yesterday of three white policemen charged with beating a black man with their fists and night sticks.

title: Santiago Carrillo: His Words and U.S. Visit
description: Komisar: When did you begin to change your attitude toward the Soviet Union?

title: Meadowlands
description: Horses listed in order of post positions

title: Personal Health
description: RIGHT NOW, there are more people on fad diets than sound ones. This grim assessment, from an official of the American Society of Bariatrics (the doctors who treat obesity), testifies first to the intractable naure of the problem of overweight and second to the unwillingness of most of the more than 60 million Americans afflicted with this problem to accept the fact that there is no short cut to successful weight control.

title: Time for Thanksgiving
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The startling political events of this Thanksgiving week can hardly be understood without paying some attention to the moral and religious convictions of President Sadat of Egypt arid Prime Minister Begin of Israela couple of true believers who, like Jimmy Carter, proclaimed their religious faith before they took office.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SPIRIT OF '77 New York prides itself on preservation of the old, like the Landmark Tavern, and the handiness of a gleamingly attractive nowspot such as the Opera Cafe of the Metropolitan.

title: Sniper Slays New Rochelle Girl, 13
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., Nov. 22A 13yearold girl was shot to death here last night by a sniper and a woman was wounded in what the police said was a deliberate attempt to shoot someone among the friends and family members who had gathered at the girl's home.

title: Pipes and Cigars Banned on Planes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  The Civil Aeronautics Board voted today to ban all cigar and pipe smoking on the nation's commercial airliners and took steps that could eventually prohibit cigarette smoking on aircraft as well.

title: Forest Service Seeks to Extend Wilderness Preservation System
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22Nearly 66 million acres within the national forests and national grasslands are roadless and undeveloped, suitable for preservation as wilderness areas, the Forest Service has reported.

title: INTEREST CONFLICT IS LINKED TO O'HAGAN
description: Fire Commissioner John T. O'Hagan was found yesterday to have been involved in a possible conflict of interest in raising funds for a private foundation that then used the money to pay his tuition for a graduate course at Columbia University.

title: RUDGE BARS A RETRIAL OF REILLY FOR MURDER
description: A judge in Connecticut Superior Court ruled yesterday that Peter A. Reilly, whose conviction for the 1973 slaying of his mother was overturned last year, could not be retried.

title: Memory Serves A Perfect Feast
description: TWO hundred eightyfour years ago tomorrow the first American in my family ate a drumstick at the, Plymouth Colony's first Thanksgiving dinner. Did he enjoy the wild turkey that was shot down? The red corn, the dry beans, the squash pudding? It's something I don't suppose, at this late date, we'll ever know.

title: New Yankee Flamethrower
description: Almost from the time he started pitching, Rich. Grossage has concentrated on what baseball men call bringing it. In the trade that means getting the ball to the plate so fast that the batters have trouble seeing it. If Gossage (rhymes with sausage) throws for the New York Yankees the way he threw this year for the Pittsburgh Pirates, the 26yearold relief pitcher may get arrested for speeding.

title: H.E.W. Plans Study on Treatment Of Women Under Social Security
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)The Department of Health, Education and Welfare said today that it was setting up a panel to study whether women receive fair treatment under the Social Security system.

title: Roosevelt
description: ENTRIES

title: McConn Defeats Briscoe by 2 to 1 In Election for Mayor of Houston
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 22In a surprisingly lopsided vote, Jim McConn, a former city councilman, was elected Mayor of Houston today, piling up huge victory margins in the city's predominantly black, Mexican  American and white blue  collar neighborhoods.

title: Bull Market on Free Agents
description: Don't think that Wall Street is the only place where they use clouded crystal balls these days. They've got them in sports, too.

title: A Magic Butter Sauce for Fish
description: (White butter sauce)

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Instant Replay Grows In the Religious Field
description: KIAMESHA LAKE, N.Y.A rabbi was spotted slipping out the back door before a speech by a colleague the other day. When teased about leaving, he reflected for a moment and came back with, That's all right. I'll listen to it on cassette.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: School Days, School Days

title: Panel Recommends Convention Center Near 34th on River
description: A sevenmember committee appointed by Mayor Beame recommended yesterday that New York City build its new convention center over the Penn Central railroad yards south of 34th Street along the Hudson River.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Women's Conference: The FollowUp Is Next
description: When it was all over, the delegates at the National Women's Conference in Houston had to keep reminding themselves that they had not made law. The motions to amend and the points of inquiry, the sitting and the standing, had produced a long list of specific programs, for battered wives and abused children. for working and minority women and for the equal rights amendment. But the delegates had not made law; they had only made recommendations, to be forwarded to the President and Congress.

title: The Long And Short Of Stylish Freedom
description: It was close to 10 years ago that Yves Saint Laurent dropped over to the barricades where a student rebellion was taking place in Paris. He was so moved by the way the rebels looked, he went back to his atelier and designed a collection that was mostly black and mostly pants.

title: TREASURY IS CAUTIOUS ON HELPING NEW YORK
description: Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal told Governor Carey and Maya Beame yesterday that the state and the city itself would have to do more to help New York City back to solvency before there could be additional Federal help.

title: BEGIN'S DEPUTY SAYS ISRAEL IS CONVINCED SADAT WANTS PEACE
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 22Israel's Deputy Prime Minister declared today that Israel was now convinced that President Anwar elSadat genuinely wanted peace.

title: HUGH A. JOHNSON
description: Hugh A. Johnson, who retired last Jan. 1 as chairman of the board of the Hugh Johnson & Company Inc., a brokerage house in Buffalo, died early yesterday in Buffalo General Hospital. He was 70 years old and lived in Buffalo.

title: Careers
description: With the heightened national awareness of the environment, there is a growing need throughout the nation for toxicologists to work for both Government and industry.

title: Cuisine de Femme: Tending the Fires
description: LA VRAIE cuisine de femme authentic woman cookingone of France's most. respected culinary traditions, is fading from the scene, at least in its most classic and celebrated form. But as I was pleased to discover during a recent visit to Paris, there still remain a few practitioners upholding this tradition. Highly pratsed by such famous and diverse gastronomes as Brillatsavarin, Balzac, de la Reynire, Escoffier, Curnonsky, Pellaprat, Toklas and Colette, women cooks, amateur or professional, were considered keepers of the flame, preparing regional and bourgeois dishes exactly as they had been prepared for generations, unaltered by innovation or invention.

title: Companies Issue Earnings Figures
description: For periods ended Oct. 31 unless otherwise indicated. (N) Indicates stock is traded on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Draft Charter for Spain Said to Set Strict Limits On Powers of the King
description: MADRID, Nov, 22 (UPI)The first draft of Spain's new constitution strictly limits the powers of the King, reduces the voting age to 18 years and leaves the way open to divorce, the national news agency Cifra said today.

title: Jobless Rate in Britain Off to 6.4%
description: LONDON, Nov. 22 (UPI).Britain's unemployment rate dropped to 6.4 percent in November, the third consecutive monthly decline, the Department of Employment said today.

title: Extensive Homosexuality Is Found Among Seagulls Off Coast of California
description: IRVINE, Calif., Nov. 22 (UPI)A university research team says that about 14 percent of the female seagulls on an island off the California coast are lesbians, calling it the first solid evidence of widespread homesexuality among wild birds.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: There are worse things that can happen to you than getting trapped by a bore, although sometimes it is hard to think what they may be. At first, a boreis only a minor irritant, a passing cloud, or maybe a temporary effluvium. But bores persist, which is why they are bores, and they can make you numb. Then, they can make you angry, although as often as not your anger win be directed not at the bore but at yourself. How, you will ask, have I gotten myself into this? Why can't I get away? Am I such, a schlemiel as all that? Actually, there are ways of freeing yourself from bores, but hardly any of them are perfect. You do whatever

title: Fukuda Calls for Action on Surplus
description: TOKYO, Nov. 22 (AP)Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda today urged quick action to cut Japan's huge trade surplus with the United States as the dollar hit another postWorld War II low in Tokyo and the stock market suffered its worst oneday plunge in three years.

title: Campus Mood: The Focus Is on Grades
description: Shortly before noon one day recently, 18 members of the Spartacus Youth League gathered near the sundial at Columbia University and, chanting slogans and carrying placards, began marching in a circle to protest a visit to the campus by recruiters from the National Security Agency.

title: Yanks Sign Gossage To $3.6 Million Pact
description: Rich Gossage, whose father almost but not quite struck it rich in the gold fields of Cripple Creek, Colo., in the 1940's, struck gold on his own in New York yesterday. The righthanded relief pitcher signed a sixyear contract with the Yankees believed to be worth $3.6 million.

title: Torsney Fired Gun While in a Seizure, Psychiatrist Holds
description: A psychiatrist testifying for the defense reiterated under crossexamination yesterday that Robert Torsney, the police officer accused of fatally shooting a Brooklyn youth last Nov. 25, acted reflexively during an epileptic psychomotor seizure.

title: Many Cyclones Hit in November
description: November is the month dreaded by coastal residents in India and Bangladesh, for it is then that the most devastating cyclones occur.

title: CarterIII: SALT Of the Earth
description: WASHINGTONAccording to President Jimmy Carter: The lack of another SALT accord between the United States and the Soviet Union, limiting their strategic armaments, might not necessarily produce an economic depression but it would certainly produce a depression of the spiritand ultimate disaster.

title: Kansas City Joins the Running To Land a Pro soccer Franchise
description: Kansas City has emerged as a candi date (with Boston, Houston and Montreal) for a franchise in the North American Soccer League.

title: BEGIN'S DEPUTY SAYS ISRAEL IS CONVINCED SADAT WANTS PEACE
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 22Israel's Deputy Prime Minister declared today that Israel was now convinced that President Anwar elSadat genuinely wanted peace.

title: Professional Football
description: American Conference

title: THOMAS C. HOUTS
description: Thomas C. Houts, who retired In 1959 as assistant vice president of the First National City Bank of New York, died Monday in a nursing home in Middlebury, Conn. He was 83 years old and lived at 160A Heritage Village, Southbury, Conn.

title: Books: ExF.B.I Agent and Mafiosi He Knew
description: ANTHONY VILLANE is not the first former agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation to reveal that life in the bureau was not always as it is portrayed by James Stewart in the movies and Efrem Zimbalist Jr. on television. Still, Brick Agent is a gritty, tough view of the necessarily seamy side of crimebusting.

title: Thelma Mother Hill Dies at 53; Noted Teacher of Black Dancers
description: Thelma Hill, a noted dance teacher, died Monday evening of smoke inhalation from a fire in her apartment at 15608 Riverside Drive West. She was 53 years old.

title: Macy's Team Puts Final Touches on Floats
description: HOBOKEN, Nov. 22  Sometime tomorrow, someone will slap a final lick of paint on Smaug the Dragon, brush down the fur of Fiver the Rabbit one last time, and send them off into the Lincoln Tunnel.

title: Another ExC.I.A. Official AIleges Agency Failed Some Saigon Allies
description: A second former official of the Central Intelligence Agency who served in South Vietnam accused the agency yesterday of leaving behind its Vietnamese allies and collaborators and then covering up the evacuation failures.

title: Rochelle Hilsenrath, Student, Wed to Philip Goldschmiedt
description: The marriage of Rochelle Hilsenrath, daughter of Rabbi and Mrs. Yakov R. Hilsenrath of Highland Park, N. J., to Philip Goldschmiedt took place last evening at the Terrace on the Park in Flushing Meadow, Queens. The bride's father, rabbi of the Highland Park Jewish Center, officiated with the bride's brother, Rabbi Baruch M. Hilsenrath. Eight other rabbis and a cantor also participated.

title: Bridge:
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 22Two of the country's most famous women players were the winners in the life master women's pairs at the American Contract Bridge League's Fall Nationals here last night.

title: Citizens Union Aide Returning
description: Gary H. Sperling, executive director of the Citizens Union from 1971 to 1976, is returning to head the staff of the civic watchdog organization. He succeeds Stephen Shestakofsky, who resigned to move to the Boston area.

title: Smoking Restrictions Sought by Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (UPI)The Defense Department wants smoking stopped in dining halls and classrooms, and says the welfare of nonsmokers. should be Considered in work areas as well, according to Pentagon spokesmen.

title: Market Place
description: Some of the biggest investors in today's stock market are companies that are actively buying up their own shares, reflecting the relatively low values the stock market is putting on shares generally.

title: $150,000 for Appassionato Top Price at Belmont Sales
description: Signs that New York State may eventually become as popular a thoroughbred breeding center as Kentucky's blue grass country continued to surface yesterday as FasigTipton, Inc., concluded its twoday auction for horses of racing age at Belmont Park.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22 (AP)The House Communications subcommittee staff has recommended regulating the three television networks to prevent deceptive and misleading acts. The recommendation, in a 72page report obtained today, referred to sports competitions such as the winnertakeall tennis matches in which both players actually received money guarantees.

title: News summary
description: WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 23, 1977

title: Military School Chief Quits After Dispute
description: PORTSMOUTH, Va., Nov. 22 (AP)The president of Frederick Military Academy, where a teenaged cadet was ceremonially dismissed last week in a drumming out that angered some parents, has resigned.

title: Japan Steel Efficiency Stirs Problems
description: TOKYO, Nov. 22Earlier this fall NHK, Japan's semi  Governmental television network, dispatched a film crew to Youngstown, Ohio, to get local reactions to the steelimport controversy rising between the United States and Japan.

title: Chess:
description: Alfred North Whitehead once counseled, Desire simplicity, but distrust it. The famous philosopher and mathematician was not addressing himself to chess, for here the matter is quite different.

title: Private Lives
description: WE SAT in one of the several dining rooms in the grand hotel under a vaulted ceiling. Somebody else could tell you about the wooden ribs on that ceiling, but I am the sort of person who doesn't know an ogive from a tierceron or, for that matter, a Ford from a Chevrolet. Besides, while with appropriate seriousness my friend and I drank beer, yonder, through glass doors, on the other side of the beach, the Pacific Ocean was showing off.

title: INDIVIDUALS STEP UP U.S. NOTE PURCHASES
description: Individual investors apparently stepped up their purchases of Treasury notes yesterday as the Federal Government sold $3.77 billion of twoyear securities at an average rate of 7.13 percent.

title: Nobel Is Suggested For Sadat and Begin
description: BONN, Nov. 22 (AP)  Two West German lawmakers said today that they were proposing President Anwar elSadat and Prime Minister Menahem Begin as joint candidates for the 1978 Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Paul Schoeffler, Opera Baritone; Best Known for Wagner Roles
description: AMERSHAM, England, Nov. 22 (AP)Paul Schoeffler, Germanborn opera baritone who appeared throughout Europe and at the Metropolitan Opera in New York, died here yesterday. He was 80 years old.

title: For MiddleClass Puerto Ricans, The Bias Problem Hasn't Ended
description: Jos Vega sat at his diningroom table and thought about the seven places in which he and his family have lived in the last 14 years, and the frustrations of being on the cutting edge poured out:

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Joanne Chesimard, serving a life sentence in New Jersey for slaying a state trooper, has pleaded not guilty in State Supreme Court in Manhattan to a 6yearold indictment for attempted robbery. The indictment against the head of the so called Black Liberation Army stemmed from a 1971 incident in which she allegedly robbed a Michigan man of $250 in cash and personal property in his hotel room.

title: F.D.A. Seeks Alcoholic Drink Warning for Pregnant Women
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22In an attempt to reduce birth defects, the Food and Drug Administration is seeking to have labels placed on containers of liquor, beer and wine warning pregnant women that the excessive use of alcoholic beverages may harm their babies.

title: About Real Estate
description: STAMFORD, Conn.A large office construction project in a waterfront setting has started here, testing the theory that a waterfront location remote from downtown activity has potential as a corporate center.

title: DICK LAWRENCE
description: Dick Lawrence, an executive vice president in charge of domestic syndication for Paramount Television, died yesterday at Mount Sinai Hospital at the age of 51. He lived at 303 East 57th Street.

title: Pop: Happily Casual Fran Warren
description: THIRTY YEARS have passed since Fran Warren had her breakthrough hit, singing A Sunday Kind of Love with Claude Thornhill's orchestra. Since then, Miss Warren has been playing in musicals and singing as a single in clubs, but that 1946 hit is still the song that identifies her. So, at Hopper's, the Avenue of the Americas at 11th Street, where she is appearing through Saturday, Miss Warren uses that record for her entrance. But that is as far as she goes with nostalgia.

title: Counseling Services
description: The following organizations have services for people who themselves are in need of help:

title: Koch and Costikyan Move to Dampen Controversy
description: Mayorelect Edward I. Koch and the man he has designated to be his first deputy mayor, Edward N. Costikyan, tried yesterday to damp down the first controversy of the budding Koch administrationa controversy that arose when Mr. Costikyan raised the possibility that he might not accept the post because of Mr. Koch's plans to deemphasize it.

title: 9 Hurt as Car Goes Out of Control Leaving Garage on West 33d St.
description: Nine people were injuredmost of them slightlywhen a car went out of control last night as it was leaving a parking garage on 33d Street opposite Madison Square Garden.

title: Second Recount Ordered In Close Greenwich Vote For First Selectman Nov. 8
description: BRIDGEPORT. Conn., Nov. 22 (AP)Superior Court Judge Irving Levine, saying sufficent reason exists for a recount, today ordered a recount of the recent controversial election of First Selectman in Greenwich.

title: Campus Mood: The Focus Is on Grades
description: Shortly before noon one day recently, 18 members of the Spartacus Youth League gathered near the sundial at Columbia University and, chanting slogans and carrying placards, began marching in a circle to protest a visit to the campus by recruiters from the National Security Agency.

title: Costs to Consumers Up 0.2% in October For New York Area
description: Increases in costs for housing, transportaton, food and medical care were the principal reasons for a rise of twotenths of 1 percent in consumer prices during October in the New York Citynortheastern New Jersey area, according to figures released yesterday by the. Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: How Federal Economy Standards Are Affecting the Push for Sales of Small Cars
description: DETROIT, Nov. 22When the General Motors Corporation and the Ford Motor Company recently siasned prices on their most fuelefficient cars and then made some previously optional equipment standard, the move was more than an attempt to give their foreigncar competitors a onetwo punch.

title: MISSIONARIES IN BRAZIL TOLD TO LEAVE COUNTRY
description: BRASILIA, Nov. 22 (AP)A group of 150 foreign missionaries, including more than 100 Americans, have been told to end their work with Indian tribes here and leave the country, Brazilian officials said today.

title: U.S. AND ALLIES FAIL TO AGREE ON MOVES TO SPUR ECONOMIES
description: PARIS, Nov. 22The United States and its principal industrial allies acknowledged today that their plans for heading off a further worldwide economic slowdown were now failing.

title: Phone Service Set Up For Noise Complaints
description: The Federal Aviation Administration has set up a telephone service for receiving complaints about Concorde noise. The number is 9952829.

title: Article 3  No Title
A Coast Promoter Of Rock Concerts Slain in His Home
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 22 (AP)Steve Wolf, one of the leading rock music promoters in the Los Angeles area, was shot to death early yesterday during an apparent robbery attempt at his exclusive hilltop home, the police said. Two men who sped away in a Cadillac were being hunted.

title: Pipes and Cigars Banned on Planes
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22  The Civil Aeronautics Board voted today to ban all cigar and pipe smoking on the nation's commercial airliners and took steps that could eventually prohibit cigarette smoking on aircraft as well.

title: Hawaii Sugar Workers End Strike
description: HONOLULU, Nov. 22 (UPI)Hawaii's 7,200 union sugar workers began returning to the plantations today after overwhelmingly approving a new contract, ending a 20day strike. The agreement between 15 companies and the International Longshoremen's and Warehousemen's Union provides a wage increase of 30 cents an hour from Nov. 19 and an additional rise of 10 cents from July 1, 1978, raising the minimum wage for starting, sugar workers to $4.49 an hour and the top scale to $6.62.

title: COALITION SET UP TO BACK FULL EMPLOYMENT BILL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22A coalitior of civil rights, labor, religious and community organizations threw its weight today behind the HumphreyHawkins full employment bill endorsed last week by President Carter. The coalition, naming itself the Full Employment Action Council, called a news conference today to counter spreading criticism that the legislation backed by Mr. Carter is without teeth and meaningless.

title: Roscoe L. Barrow, TV Policy Shaper
description: Roscoe Lindley Barrow, former law professor at the Hastings School of Law, died Monday in Berkeley. He was 64 years old.

title: Legion Moves Convention Site
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Nov. 22 (AP)Differences between a hotel and American Legion officials have led the Legion to move its 1979 national convention site from Kansas City to Houston. Legion officials approved the move after charging that the management of the Crown Center Hotel, which was to have been the convention headquarters, was too slow in completing convention plans and not flexible enough in granting price cuts and free rooms to the Legion.

title: Marine Drill Sergeant Acquitted
description: SAN DIEGO, Nov. 22 (UPI)A Marine Corps drill sergeant accused of setting a recruit afire was acquitted by a courtmartial yesterday. Sgt. John Norris, 22 years old of San Bernardino, Calif., was found not guilty of assaulting Pvt. Vincent Aldaz of Granite City, Ill., ending a threeday trial at the Marine Corps Recruit Depot.

title: Young Conductor, Pianist Excel
description: IT WAS A LARGE helping of youth last night at Carnegie Hall. For Edo de Waart, at 36, is young, as conductors go. And his piano soloist was the 29yearold Paul Shenly, winner of the 1976 Avery Fisher Award. Mr. de Waart was conducting the Rotterdam Philharmonic, an orchestra with which he has been associated for 10 years. That makes him something of a conductorial prodigy.

title: Court Delays Sentencing Of Sorkin Until Monday
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 22 (AP)The sentencing of Richard Sorkin, an agent who pleaded guilty to having spent illegally $364.000 entrusted to him by seven professional athletes, was postponed today until next Monday in Nassau County Court.

title: CONSUMER PRICE RISE AT 0.3% FOR 3D MONTH
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 22The Government reported today another modest increase in the inflation rate with a rise of threetenths of 1 percent in the Consumer Price Index for October.

title: Opera: Grimes Revived by Met
description: BENJAMIN BRITTEN'S Peter Grimes returned to the Metropolitan Opera Monday night for the first time since the 197273 season, for the delectation of those who regard it as one of the highwater marks of 20thcentury music theater. The revival, presented in tribute to the memory of the late British composer, brought back Jon Vickers in the title role, which he made his own in previous Metropolitan performances.

title: Radio
description: 9:0810 A.M., WQXR: Piano Personalities. Hans Kann and Daniel Blumenthal. Seven Hungarian Dances, Brahms.

title: Bergen Paper Told to Surrender Tapes of Talk in Slaying Case
Home Beat
description: The Source WHY DO curators of the Metropolitan Museum, Winterthur Museum and the Victoria and Albert Museum go to High Point, N.C.? Not to attend the twiceyearly Southern Furniture Market. They go to visit High Point's Furniture Libraryan institution that is the bestkept secret in the furniture industry.

title: Companies Release Their Earnings Reports
description: For periods ended Oct. 31 unless otherwise indicated. (N) indicates stock is traded on the New York Stack Ex. change, (A) American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: After Storm in India, a Grim Future
description: LAKSHAMANA, India, Nov. 23 The hardpressed villagers along this coastal region of southeastern India are struggling to put their lives back together after a devastating tropical cyclone and flood that killed at least 7,000 people last weekend.

title: Canadian Embassy Opens Art Gallery
description: WASHINGTONThe Canadian Embassy has opened its own small art gallery.

title: Deaths
description: BECKERRuth Weisgerber,on November 23, 1977. Of Massapequa, L.I. Beloved wife of Harold W. Loying mother of Allan Benton Miller. Reposing at James Funeral Home, 540 Broadway, Massapequa. Religious services Friday, 8:00 P.M. and Saturday 10:00 A.M. Interment Woodlawn Cemetery.Visiting to start Thursday 7:00 P.M.,Friday, 25,710 P.M. In lieu of flowers, contributions to the American Cancer.Society appreciated.

title: Saskatchewan Tax On Oil Is Overruled
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 23In a decision that requires the return of hundreds of millions of dollars to oil companies, the SuTreme Court of Canada ruled today that the taxes and surcharges levied by the government of Saskatchewan on oil produced in that province were unconstitutional.

title: Bears and Cards Favored in TV Games
description: Between 12:30 this afternoon and midnight Monday, it will be possible to watch 10 football games, college and professional, on television in the metropolitan area. The program of five pro games begins with Chicago at Detrait, Channel 2, 12:30 P.M., and the second half of the doubleheader presents Miami at St. Louis, Channel 4, 3:30 P.M. Televised games on Sunday will be the Giants at Cincinnati, Channel 2, 1 P.M., followed by the match of the weekend, Baltimore at Denver, Channel 4 at 4 o'clock. On Monday night it will be Buffalo at Oakland, Channel 7, at 9. Previews of today's two games follow, with wonlost records in parentheses. Weekend previews will be listed here tomorrow.

title: Rockies Yield 5 in 1st Period at the Garden
description: Afer Vancouver shu hem ou in humiliaing fashion before heir home fans Sunday nigh, he New York Rangers rebounded wih a 63 vicory over he Colorado Rockies las nigh a play heir nex four games on die road. Medison Square Garden. The Rangers

title: 3 ExBanking Officials Are Indicted In Misapplication of $3.3 Million
description: NEWARK, Nov. 23 (UPI)A former vice president of Fidelity Union Trust Company, and two banking officials have been indicted on charges of misapplying $3.3 million in bank funds to cover up a series of bad investments.

title: 2 Indicted in Beating of Patient
description: TRENTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)Two attendants at the Trenton Psychiatric Hospital have been indicted on charges of beating a patient. Willie J. Hartwell, 25 years old, and Hasain Muhammad, 19, both of Trenton, were charged yesterday with atrocious assault and battery. Authorities said the patient, Leonard Claudat, 26, of Jersey City, had suffered four broken ribs and several bruises on the face and body in the beating on Oct. 2.

title: Masterly Drama In Semmelweiss
description: Buffalo

title: Huge U.S. Deficits Called Likely
description: PARIS, Nov. 23The Carter Administration is quietly warning its industrial allies that the United States is likely to run a series of huge balance of payments deficits over the, next few years, deficits roughly the same size as the $20 billion deficit it now expects both this year and next.

title: ToscaniniStokowski Memorial To Be Held at St. Patrick's Dec. 4
description: The combined choirs of St. Patrick's Cathedral and the Cathedral of SS. Peter and Paul in Philadelphia will present a memorial concert honoring Arturo Toscanini and Leopold Stokowski at St. Patrick's Cathedral on Dec. 4 at 7:30 P.M.

title: Soviet Said to Fear Arab Split Imperils Geneva Talks
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23The Soviet Union reportedly still wants the Geneva conference on the Middle East convened, but is apparently worried that the visit to Israel by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt has damaged the prospects of negotiations by deepening the split in Arab ranks.

title: Sound
description: MORE THAN any other component, the loudspeakers in your stereo system determind what you hear. They, after all, produce the actual sound. In a sense, they are musical instrumentsbut instruments of an extraordinary kind, alternately or simultaneously sounding off as violins, trumpets, drums and flutes, or whatever musical fare is fed to them in the form of electricity. That such unlikely devices proved possible at all is a fortunate and astounding feat in the intertwined history of music and electronics.

title: Sadat Sends a Message to Israel Expressing Sincere Appreciation
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 23The office of President Ephraim Katzir made public tonight the contents of a cablegram sent by President Anwar elSadat in which he offered my most sincere appreciation for the reception afforded me and my delegation during my sojourn to your country. Mr. Sadat said the trip marked a historical turning point in the destiny of the Middle East and ended by conveying my deep thanks and regards.

title: The U.N. Today
SadatIsraeli Topics: Heart Trouble, Pipes
description: TEL AVIV, Nov. 23 (Reuters)Israel's Deputy Prime Minister, Yigael Yadin, said today that the atmosphere at the first meeting last Saturday between President Anwar elSadat and Prime Minister Menachem Begin had been quickly relaxed by small talk about heart ailments.

title: The Second Grade's Room Mother Rebels
description: MY DAUGHTER came home from school the other day with a terrifying note in her lunch box. It was addressed To the Second Grade Room Mother. Across from this was written my name. The note continued, Please pick up for the parent luncheon next Thursday 24 cans tomato sauce, 10 pounds spaghetti, 12 loaves of bread. . . . There was more, including Call the following parents. A directory of names and numbers followed.

title: Richard Biles: Eccentric Dance
description: THERE'S A STRONG ELEMENT of eccentricity in Richard Biles's approach to designing dances. At best the effects produced by it have a potent mystery, but at worst the pieces degenerate into silliness. There were examples of both on his company's program Tuesday evening at the Theater of the Open Eye.

title: Sports Today
description: FOOTBALL

title: DIET MAY BE A LINK TO 10 MORE DEATHS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  Federal health officials have received reports that the deaths of 10 more persons, including those of two men, may be tied to crash dieting with predigested liquid proteins, raising to 26 the number of fatalities that have come under suspicion.

title: Checking Out The Checks
description: IN A WORLD papered with florals, pastoral scenes, polka dots and paisleys, the graphpaper check is the opiate of the rationalistsand lately it has been turning up on more home furnishings than there are pages in graphpaper pads. Whether you call the check pattern tattersall, windowpane, counterpane, cross section, crossword or quadrille, it is the same grid of parallel, vertical and horizontal lines intersecting at equal intervals to form a pattern of squares.

title: New Bond Issues
description: Wednesday, Nov. 23, 1977

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS

title: NEW SOMALI ATTACK ON HARAR REPORTED
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, Nov. 23 (AP)Somali secessionists in eastern Ethiopia were reported today to have started an assault on Harar, one of two remaining Ethiopian strongholds in the northern part of the Ogaden region, but were reported meeting resistance.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: White Males Challenge Affirmative Action Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23After James A. Cramer earned his doctorate in sociology, he taught for a year at Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond. The next year, two jobs opened up in the department and Dr. Cramer applied, but both went to women who had lower qualifications and less experience.

title: A Noted Economist And Wife Are Slain Near Johannesburg
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 23 (AP)A prominent South African economist and his wife were found shot and stabbed to death in their home near here early today. Indecipherable words had been sprayed in foothigh letters with red paint in two rooms of the house.

title: HEWLETT EARNINGS OFF 1,8% IN QUARTER
description: The HewlettPackard Company reported yesterday a 1.8 percent drop in earnings for the fourth fiscal quarter but a 33.8 percent rise for the fiscal year ended Oct. 31.

title: Design Notebook
description: WHEN Cosimo de Medici was married in 1608, the event was celebrated by a mock naval battle of mythological boats. There was a Ship of Neptune and a Ship of Hercules as part of a fantastic flotilla with dragon prows and tree mastsbeautiful, extravagant, symbolic and surreal creations designed especially for the occasion.

title: Concerns Convicted Of Fixing Bag Price
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 23 (AP)Two paperbag manufacturing executives and their companies were convicted in Federal District Court here today on charges of criminal price fixing.

title: WHITE HOUSE DENIES SCHLESINGER HINTED RETREAT ON ENERGY
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23White House officials said today that controversial remarks earlier this week by Secretary of Energy James H. Schlesinger did not signal a retreat by President Carter on energy legislation. They added that the President might veto rather than sign such legislation if it were seriously weakened or transformed into an undue financial bonanza for oil companies.

title: I.T.C. Backs Chrome Import Relief
description: The International Trade Commission voted three to one in favor of granting the domestic highcarbon ferrochrome industry immediate relief from import competition, according to a statement issued yesterday by Airco. Inc.

title: TV: Froth to Top Off Dinner
description: A PART from the traditional dinner, Thanksgiving has become a day of parades and football, both of which happen to be sturdy television commodities. The big parade, R. H. Macy's 51st extravaganza in Manhattan, will be carried on CBS, while NBC will offer a sampler of five parades around the nation, from Macy's in New York to the Aloha Floral in Honolulu, taped last month. Both presentations begin at 9 A.M. and continue for three hours.

title: Ricki Zucker Is Married To Andrew Glantz, Student
description: Ricki Zucker and Andrew Glantz were married yesterday in Temple BethEl of Great Neck, LI., by Rabbi Jerome K. Davidson. He was assisted by Cantor Barbara Herman.

title: The Madisons Rediscovered
