description: DID Dolley Madison have a ball gown made for herself out of red velvet draperies she so hastily ripped from the windows of the flaming White House in 1814?

title: Korchnoi Defeats Spassky
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 23 (AP) Victor Korchnol defeated Boris Spassky today in a close second game of their world match, tkaing a 1 lead in the match to determine which one will challenge the world champion, Anatoly Karpov, next year. The third game is scheduled for Friday.

title: EGYPTIAN AT U.N. ASKS WIDER PEACE EFFORT
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 23Egypt's chief delegate declared today that President Anwar elSadat had opened the road to peace by going to Jerusalem, but insisted it now was up to all those concerned also to act in the interests of averting war.

title: Marist Football Coach Resigns
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y., Nov. 23 (AP)Ron Levine, head football coach at Marist College for 14 seasons, has resigned. Levine said today increasing demands of his law practice make it impossible to continue as coach. He is the only football coach Marist has had.

title: $55 FLORIDA AIR FARE IS APPROVED BY C.A.B.
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board gave its approval yesterday to nofrills $55 and $75 fares between New York and Miami and Fort Lauderdale.

title: Soviet Monk Is Reported Released After 40 Years in a Prison Camp
description: ZURICH, Nov. 23 (Reuters)A Russian Orthodox monk was recently released after 40 years in a Soviet prison camp and placed in a psychiatric clinic in Kazan, a Swiss religious rights group said today.

title: CHARLES ARATA GRONDONA
description: Charles Arata Grondona, a chemical engineer who retired in 1969 as a consultant to the International Paper Company in New York, died Nov. 14 in United Hospital, Port Chester, N.Y., after a brief illness. He was 77 years old and lived at 19 Old Hill Farms Road, Westport, Conn.

title: The White House Denies It's Angry About Moynihan
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Jody Powell the President's press secretary, is going to some pains to let it be known that the White House is not angry with Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan. The outspoken New York Senator has not hesitated to criticize Administration actions this year relating to the Soviet Union, SALT negotiations, Israel, New York's economic wellbeing, welfare revision and food stamps. But a recent denunciation of Mr. Moynihan by a White House staff member of importancepublished Nov. 7 in The New York Timescaused consternation at the Executive Mansion. Mr. Powell called The Times to repudiate the aide's statement, and then in a later lengthy telephone interview accused the aide of ignorance or malice or both.

title: Vance Says Venezuela Is Rejecting Requests for a Freeze on Oil Prices
description: MACUTO, Venezuela, Nov. 23Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance said today that he had been unable to persuade President Carlos Andres Perez of Venezuela that an oil price freeze should be imposed next year.

title: SEP ARATE U.S. PRICE POLICY FOR ALGERIAN GAS BACKED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)The Carter Administration's pricemonitoring agency urged the Department of Energy today to, reject recommendations that would require all natural gas consumers to absorb the high cost of Algerian gas.

title: Relief Is on the Way From West to India
description: In separate actions, President Carter and leaders of relief organizations in various Western nations offered assistance to the victims of the cyclone and flood in southeastern India.

title: Jersey Paper Told To Surrender Tape Of Prison Interview
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 23A Superior Court judge ordered an afternoon newspaper here today to surrender tapes of a jailhouse interview with a murder suspect, contending that the newspaper had no right under the United States Constitution or state law to withhold them.

title: WNET Rejects Black Program
description: AFTER TWO MONTHE of indecision on whether to carry a controversial pisode of Black Perspective on the News, distributed by the Public Broadcasting Service, WNET/13 has finally rejected the program and instead has produced its own onehour special on the same general subject, political extremism. That program has been scheduled for Dec. 14 at 10 RM.

title: CAR SALES OFF 3.9% FOR MIDNOVEMBER; G.M.'S DOWN BY 14.4%
description: DETROIT, Nov. 23Newcar sales by the nation's four major automobile manufacturers fell 3.9 percent below their yearearlier level in midNovember, the car producers reported here today.

title: Books of The Times
description: WHAT IS a short story, and how do we distinguish it from a sketch, a play, or a novel? What is the difference between slick and quality fiction? For those who enjoy thinking about such questions, Rust Hills has done valuable service in Writing in General and the Short Story in Particular, a distillation of 20 years experience with teaching, editing and anthologizing the short story, by the once and present fiction editor of Esquire magazine, I particularly admire two things about the book. The first is the way it is organizedthe way, for example, Mr. Hills's discussion of Techniques of Foreshadowing neatly dovetails with his section on Foreshadowing and Suspense, which of course brings up Techniques of Suspense, under which heading come Mystery and Curiosity, Conflict and Uncertainty and Tension and Anticipation as logically and inevitably as Ending follows Middle and Beginning.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 24, 1977

title: Backgammon:
description: Last week, the New England Backgammon Club held its annual tournament to benefit the Boston Symphony. Mel Drapkin, one of Boston's finest players, overwhelmed Keven Brandt, 17 to 3, in the finals after beating this writer, 15 to 12, in the semifinals. In the other semifinals, Brandt overcame Don Kandel, while Bill Robertie defeated Jim Halperin to take the consolation prize.

title: New York Agency Is Refinancing Bonds
description: The New York State Project Finance Agency, set up to complete work started by the illfated Urban Development Corporation, is refinancing almost $240 million of bonds carrying skyhigh taxfree interest rates of 8 and 9 percent that were placed privately with savings banks. The effort will save the agency an estimated $17.4 million.

title: GerulatisMcEnroe Tennis Battle Set
description: Vitas Gerulaitis vs. John McEnroe. The blithe spirit against the giantkiller.

title: CODD PROMOTES 256, AND THAT'S IT FOR '77
description: Police Commissioner Michael J. Codd yesterday promoted 256 members of the force, including a sergeant who is still recuperating from injuries received 14 months ago when a terrorists' bomb exploded while he was trying to disarm it.

title: Article 3  No Title
Treasury, Using Supermarkets, Renews Effort to Sell the $2 Bill
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)The Treasury Department today renewed its effort to convince skeptical Americans that the $2 bill should have a prominent spot in their wallets.

title: Disease Curbing Sale Of Upstate Yule Trees
description: ALBANY, Nov. 23Apprehensive about the spread of a disease that is menacing pine trees in the Adirondack Mountains, the state today restricted the sale of pines for Christmas trees grown in parts of 10 counties in the Adirondacks area.

title: Meadowlands
description: ENTRIES

title: U.S. and Vietnam Reconvene Dec. 7
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (Reuters)The United States and Vietnam will reconvene their Paris talks on the restoration of normal relations from Dec. 7 to 10, the State Department said today.

title: Morgan Library Buys Hawthorne Notebook
description: Discovered in an old family chest by Mrs. Frank E. Mouffe of Boulder, Colo., the lost notebook of Nathaniel Hawthorne has now been purchased by the Morgan Library, 29 East 36th Street, and is on display there through Sunday.

title: Trial of Sprayregen Ends in a Conviction
description: Gerald Sprayregen, a New Rochelle businessman, was convicted yesterday of misappropriating $2 million from John's Bargain Stores, the nowbankrupt company that operated 200 outlets.

title: SEVERE QUAKE ROCKS ARGENTINA, KILLING 70
description: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 23 (AP)A powerful earthquake jolted western Argentina early today, killing at least 70 people, injuring hundreds and demolishing thousands of dwellings, the Government reported.

title: Oh, What A Tangled Web...
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23  Many Presidentwatchers are talking about, though few are writing about, the strange case of Mr. Carter's false statements regarding his participation in the decision to pleabargain with Richard Helms.

title: The Burdens and Problems Faced by Egypt and Israel
description: We all still bear the consequences of four fierce wars waged within 30 years, President Anwar elSadat told the Israeli Parliament at the start of this historic week. The worst of those consequences have obviously been the loss of life and the anguish of families. But the economic costs of war and of constant preparedness Scene against the threat of war have also imposed heavy burdens on Egypt and Israel.

title: Young and Old ItalianAmericans Naturalized as Citizens in Brooklyn Federal Court
description: Marianni Malucci, who is 85 years old, and John Robert Scotto, who is only 3, stood together with 260 other persons born in Italy and swore allegiance to the United States of America ysterday, making themselves the country's newest naturalized citizens.

title: GOVERNOR IS ELECTED IN AMERICAN SAMOA
description: PAGOPAGO, American Samoa, Nov. 23 (AP)Peter T. Coleman will become the first elected Governor of American Samoa next January, ending 77 years of leadership appointed by the United States Government.

title: Jersey Liquor Dealers Are Told To Give Information on Kickbacks
description: TRENTON, Nov. 23 (AP)A questionnaire requesting information about personal knowledge of kickbacks or bribes in the liquor industry must be completed by wine and liquor wholesalers, a state appeals court ruled.

title: CARTER SIGNS BILL DELAYING BAN ON USE OF SACCHARIN
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)President Carter signed today legislation postponing for 18 months the Food and Drug Administration's proposed ban on the use of saccharin as an artificial sweetener. the White House said.

title: Supplies of Distallates Increased To Record in Week Ended Nov. 18
description: Supplies of distillate oil were at a record of 261.6 million barrels for the week ending Nov. 18, according to the latest weekly supply figures released by the American Petroleum Institute, This week's supply of distillate surpassed the weekago record of 260,5 million barrels, and is 36 million barrels ahead of the yearago week. Distillate oil production was unchanged from the week before at 3.3 million barrels a day.

title: Relative of Al Capp Killed With a Reporter Colleague As Their Car Is Rammed
description: The 22yearold granddaughter of Al Capp, the cartoonist, was killed early yesterday and a fellow reporter on The Newark StarLedger was critically injured when the car in which they were riding was rammed in the rear as it was stopped at a traffic light on a Lower Manhattan Street.

title: Islanders' Scoring
description: TUESDAY NIGHT

title: Meadowlands Results
description: TUESDAY NIGHT

title: After Storm in India, a Grim Future
description: LAKSHAMANA, India, Nov. 23 The hardpressed villagers along this coastal region of southeastern India are struggling to put their lives back together after a devastating tropical cyclone and flood that killed at least 7,000 people last weekend.

title: Walter Payton Keeps You Young
description: As a distance, 275 yards is not that startling. It's not even the length of a football field's perimeter. But in the National Football League it's the most yards a running back ever has gained in one game. To appreciate what Walter Payton of the Chicago Bears accomplished last Sunday, think of it in terms of 1 yard at a time. Only a running back understands that perspective. Running 8 yards might not seem like much, Larry Csonka of the Giants once said, until you put 11 defensive players in the 8 yards. Against the 11 defensive players of the Minnesota Vikings in a tough 107 game, Walter Payton ran for 275 yards. And today he will be on display in a nationally televised game from Detroit, where O. J. Simpson galloped 273 yards last Thanksgiving Day for the record until Walter Payton put the Chicago Bears back on the map. Through more than half a century, other Bear running backs were the mapmakres, notably the Hall of Fame four Red Grange, Bronko Nagurski, George McAfee and Gale Sayers, the most running backs in the Canton, Ohio, shrine from any one team. And now Walter Payton appears to be running toward Canton.

title: Nassau ExAssemblyman Accused of Failing to File Tax Returns for 4 Years
description: A former Republican Assemblyman, Milton Jonas of North Merrick, L.I., was charged yesterday with failure to file Federal incometax returns for a fouryear period during which he earned $300,000. According to a criminal information submitted in Federal District Court in Brooklyn, the income came from Mr. Jonas's salary as a member of the State Assembly and from his law practice between 1971 and 1975. Assemblymen earned $15,000 a year until 1975, when their pay was raised to $23.500.

title: NEW & USEFUL
description: Oh, You Beautiful Doll

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 23The Assembly has scheduled a vote for Monday on a bill to lower the age of criminal responsibility from 16 to 14 years. The action is in line with a recent trend within the state to try to bring spreading juvenile crime under control.

title: Roosevelt
description: ENTRIES

title: Concordes Leave Kennedy; Noise Levels Are Higher But Within Legal Limits
description: The British and French Concorde airliners that opened supersonic passenger service to Kennedy International Airport on Tuesday flew back to Europe yesterday, their takeoff noise in nearby communities higher than on earlier, proving tests but still well within legal limits.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 24, 1977

title: Jersey Man Is Wounded. Before He Can Testify On RealEstate Case
description: NEWARK, Nov. 23A Bergen Count man wearing a bulletproof vest because of an attempt on his life earlier this year was shot and wounded yesterday by a nervous, almost apologetic, gunman, just before he was to testify on a $7 million Florida realestate bankruptcy case in which he was a principal.

title: North Stars Serve an Early Holiday Feast
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Nov. 23Fun time on Thanksgiving Eve in Minnesota! With the North Star playing like turkeys, the Islanders were treated to an easy 92 victory tonight.

title: THANKSGIVING DAY
description: ParkingAlternatesideofthestreet regulations suspended. Sunday rules in effect. (Regular rules will be in effect tomorrow.)

title: The Holiday Disappoints Many Skiing Operators
description: Although Thanksgiving had been targeted as the opening date by more than a dozen of the East's major ski centers, reports yesterday from the snow country showed that operators would have little for which to be thankful today. Eight resorts, from Maine to New York's upper Catskills, will have lifts runningbut over limited skiing terrain. Since there has been little snowfall, those centers in business will be offering manmade snow cover.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)More than a million illegal aliens were captured ;lying to cross the United States border from Mexico in the last fiscal year, the immigration and Naturalization Service said today.

title: 5 Die in Fire at Home for the Elderly
description: CAMDEN, Nov. 23Five of six elderly residents of an unlicensed boarding home died early today in a fire that officials believe was started by a cigarette.

title: 14 BEGIN SUMMATIONS IN BARNES DRUG CASE
description: Defense summations began yesterday in the narcotics trial of Leroy (Nicky) Barnes, who was portrayed by the prosecution as the leader of a Harlem organization that made millions of dollars a year by selling drugs.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The J. B. Lippincott Company, the Philadelphia publishing concern, announced yesterday that Harper & Row, Publishers Inc., had offered to acquire 100 percent of Lippincott through an exchange of stock.

title: Moon Church Fights a City's Curb On Its DoortoDoor Solicitation
description: McKEESPORT, Pa., Nov. 23 (AP)The Unification Church of the Rev. Sun Myung Moon has charged McKeesport officials with denying its members the right to solicit funds.

title: Port of Baltimore Is Closed in Expanded Dock Strike
description: About 4,000 dock workers began yesterday, a general strike that shut down the port of Baltimore while the International Longshoremen's Association made tentative plans for a Monday ratification vote that could end its limited 54day strike in ports from Maine to Texas.

title: Vietnamese Leader Leaves Peking
description: PEKING, Nov. 23 (Reuters)The Vietnamese Communist Party leader, Le Duan, left for southern China today after three days of talks here with China's leaders. Mr. Le Duan, who was seen off at the airport by Chairman Hua Kuofeng, is scheduled to return home Friday after a stop in Canton.

title: NATIONAL GUARD ROLE IN JOBS PLAN BACKED
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 23When Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. announced a plan here to use the state National Guard to help solve the problem of high unemployment among the city's youths, there was speculation about whether the youths would go along with the idea.

title: World News Briefs
description: BONN, Nov. 23Klaus Croissant, a lawyer who in the past has defended notorious terrorists, charged from the maximumsecurity Stammheim Prison in Stuttgart through counsel today that he was under pressure aimed at inducing him to commit suicide.

title: Hers
description: SMELL THE TURKEY roasting in the family oven. Worry over the stuffing, mash the turnips and kick yourself that for the second year in a row you've forgotten the marshmallows that turn sweet potatoes into a child's banquet. Thanksgiving is a family lovein, prompting longhaired nephews to hitchhike home, dotty aunts to tipple in the corner, and overexcited children to OD on mince pie. The kickoff for Christmas, Thanksgiving is the beginning of the love season where the presence of that allconsuming emotion fills the heart to overflowing and where the absence of it causes heart and soul to rollercoaster into calendar depression.

title: Conferees Back 3Year Extension Of the Federal Legal Aid Program
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)House Senate conferees agreed today on a threeyear extension of the Federal legal aid program, retaining a controversial provision to prohibit lawyers from handling school desegregation suits.

title: GARDENING
description: HOW ABOUT a rose garden on a sunny windowsill? That's a promise. The roses will be about the size of a dime, or maybe a quarter, and the bushes will be as large as a man's hand.

title: General in Dispute Over Arms Sales Leaving Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23A controversial threestar Air Force general who has stirred the ire of the White House quietly leaving his Pentagon job overseeing arms sales abroad.

title: 3 Hurt in Crash of Freight Trains
description: KINGMAN, Ariz., Nov. 23 (AP)One Santa Fe freight train struck the rear of another parked in downtown Kingman early today, injuring three crewmen and scattering burning wreckage along a sixblock stretch of tracks. Up to six locomotives and 32 freight cars left the tracks and several caught fire, the authorities said.

title: Business Records
description: SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, Nov. 23, 1977 Petition filed by;

title: How Bachelors Make Themselves at Home
Physicists Think They Have Created Double Particle
description: Physicists at Argonne National Laboratory in Illinois believe that by smashing together two protons, the nuclei of hydrogen atoms, they have very briefly created a diproton heavier than the combined weight of the two original particles.

title: Film: 'Another Man' Falters
description: SHE (GENEVIEVE BUJOLD) is a French baker's daughter who leaves her battered homeland at the end of the Franco-Prussian war and travels by sea to America, where she and her husband, a photographer, board a wagon train and head for the Old West. En route, a Polish woman prophesies that she will be widowed and never see France again. Both things turn out to be true.And he (James Caan), he is a veterinarian. One day, he returns home and, after greeting his dogs and cattle, discovers that his pretty young wife has been raped and murdered. He is heart-broken for a few years, but gradually he begins to recover. This is most fortunate, since he and she are by now living in the same frontier town, and fate is ready to throw them together. At the very end of Claude Lelouch's "Another Man, Another Chance," they fall in love.The plot sounds like vintage James Michener, give or take a couple of generations, and indeed it has the makings of a good yarn. However, Mr. Lelouch proves to be less interested in telling his story than in tippy-toeing around its edges. There is abundant cross-cutting, between images as disparate as the veterinarian's giving a local schoolteacher a friendly squeeze and a breadline in wartime France.There are filters so yellowy that the sky turns green. Most maddeningly of all, there is incessant hand-held camerawork in sequences that don't warrant it: One of Mr. Lelouch's favorite tricks is to track the camera for a while, hold it only half-still as a conversation takes place, and then track some more. The viewer is likely to feel seasick long before Miss Bujold makes her ocean voyage.It would be unfair to accuse Mr. Lelouch of pretentiousness, since more often than not one is bound to be uncertain about just what he is pretending to do. The opening bars of Beethoven's Fifth Symphony, for instance, punctuate many scenes for no apparent reason. "If I can't joke about death, what can I joke about?" asks one rather bewildering character. And the film begins with a modern-day sequence in which Mr. Caan, playing one of his own descendants, is hired to photograph an ad man's vision of what the Old West must have been like.This involves a Cadillac, four horses and several women in pioneer garb, and Mr. Caan complains that it's silly. More to the point, the whole sequence is silly, especially since neither the photographer nor the present is referred to again.By the second half of the film, though, Mr. Lelouch has either cleaned up his act or lost his power to annoy. The story begins to take flight when Miss Bujold and Mr. Caan finally meet, and the rest of it is told in a reasonably straightforward manner.The performances are helpful even when Mr. Lelouch is not. The film is so poorly and inconsistently dubbed into English that the actors often seem to be shouting from across a large, empty room, but Miss Bujold nevertheless creates a feeling of intimacy. Her peculiarly childlike prettiness becomes ever more interesting as time gives her an incongruously haggard look.Mr. Caan has had few roles that show him off to proper advantage, accentuating his playfulness and physicality. Here, he struts about manfully and says things like "Over my dead bodyyou got it?" But he also radiates an easy charm, and his ruggedness helps keep Mr. Lelouch's sepia-toned tableaux from turning to utter mush.Jennifer Warren and Francis Huster are quite memorable as the ill-fated first spouses; so is Susan Tyrrell, in a less successful way. Miss Tyrrell is Mr. Lelouch's rather bizarre choice for the role of the good-natured schoolmarm with whom Miss Bujold leaves her daughter and Mr. Caan his son. Even in her most innocuous moods, Miss Tyrrell never quite seems like the sort of person with whom one ought to park small children."Another Man, Another Chance" is rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"). It contains a nasty rape scene, though not a graphic one, and another sequence that makes childbearing look like the scariest thing in the world.

title: Georgia Kennedy Married
description: The marriage of Georgia Kennedy, an actress and singer, to Bob Dresner, Sales manager in New York for the W. Koury Company of Sanford, N. C., pants manufacturers, took place yesterday at the New York Society for Ethical Culture. Algernon Black, leader emeritus, performed the ceremony. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Kennedy of Pompano Beach, Fla. Her previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bridegroom's, He is the ton of Mrs. Harkell Greenblatt of Deerfield Beach, Fla., and the late Abraham Dresner of New York.

title: Little to Be Thankful For In Wampanoags' Land
description: MASHPEE, Mass., Nov. 23The rustic wooden signs at the town limits, erected as a centennial project in 1970 when feelings were different here, proclaimed that this is MashpeeLand of the Wampanoag. But the signs have taken on an ironic meaning since the Indians filed a lawsuit 15 months ago to recover all 16,000 acres of the town.

title: Calendar of Events
description: Design Works, Louis Abrons Arts for Living Center, Henry Street Settlement, 466 Grand Street

title: Torres Makes It Official By Signing With Red Sox
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23 (AP)Mike Torrez, the New York Yankees' World Series pitching hero last month, completed his jump from the world champions today by signing what was termed the biggest contract ever offered by the Boston Red Sox.

title: Personal Beauty
description: STAND up straight, the teacher urged. We are not cooked spaghetti. Six brunettes and two blondes, aged 3 and 4, giggled. We're spaghetti before you put it in the pot, one said as everybody stood tall.

title: Syria, P.L.O. Seek to Avert Egyptian Separate Peace
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 23Syria and the Palestine Liberation Organization opened a diplomatic offensive today against separate Egyptian peace moves toward Israel but kept the doors open to their participation at a Geneva peace conference.

title: Midwest Farm Land Prices Drop, Putting New Squeeze on Growers
description: LEOTI, Kan., Nov. 20The price of farm land has turned downward in most of the nation's major graingrowing regions for the first time in many years, threatening troubled growers with new financial problems.

title: Stage: Miscued Musical Misanthrope
description: AYOUNG WOMAN, noticing this reviewer writing on a yellow pad during the intermission of The Misanthrope, a musical version of Molire's play, leaned forward to ask which of the characters on stage was supposed to be the misanthrope. She was writing a school paper on the performance, she said, and needed to know.

title: Growing Opposition to Conversion To Metric System Is Found in Poll
description: Despite publicity campaigns by governmental and private organizations in recent years, a growing proportion of Americans oppose adoption of the metric system in this country, a Gallup poll indicated yesterday.

title: Family Money: The Pitfalls in Budgeting for a Condominium
description: IT has taken distress sales of one kind or other to move the glut of condominiums in such overbuilt areas as Monmouth County, N.J., and Dade County, Fla., but the condo is clearly the housing of the future.

title: Victor in L.I. Town Board
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 23 (UPI)Barbara Blumberg, a DemocratLiberal, has won a seat on the North Hempstead Town Board by a margin of 115 votes over Stuart Ain, a Republican, according to an official canvass by the Nasau County Board of Elections. The recount showed that she received 31,152 votes to 31,037 for Mr. Ain. The unofficial vote tabulation on election night gave Ms. Blumberg victory by 218 votes and Mr. Mn then called for a recount. Mr. Ain said he was undecided whether he would go to court to question the result.

title: Anker Is Reorganizing 46 Special Schools For Pregnant and Handicapped Students
description: School Chancellor Irving Anker has ordered a reorganization of 46 special schools for pregnant teenagers and handicapped children to reduce the backlog of students waiting to get into the schools and increase teacher time in the classroom.

title: White Males Challenge Affirmative Action Programs
description: WASHINGTON, Nov, 23After James A. Cramer earned his doctorate in sociology, he taught for a year at Virginia Commonwealth University in Richmond. The next year, two jobs opened up in the department and Dr. Cramer applied, but both went to women who had lower qualifications and less experience.

title: Concordes Leave With Noise at Legal Level
description: The British and French Concorde airliners that opened supersonic passenger service to Kennedy International Airport on Tuesday flew back to Europe yesterday, their takeoff noise in nearby communities higher than on earlier, proving tests but still well within legal limits.

title: Notes on People
description: THE anthropologist and adventurer Thor Heyerdahl set sail yesterday in a giant boat made of reeds from the marshes of southern Iraq in the hope that he would discover how mariners 5,000 years ago navigated the Indian Ocean. We'll go as far as the boat goes, even if it takes a year, said the 63yearold Norwegian explorer, who, with a crew of 10, seeks to prove that the Sumerians, the earliest known settlers in what is now Iraq, were the first to spread their civilization to the world. The 54foot reed sailboat, named the Tigris, is said to be the oldest type of vessel known to man. It weighs 40 tons.

title: Tokyo Cabinet Shifts Expected
description: TOKYO, Nov. 23 (AP)Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda plans to reshuffle his 11monthold Cabinet next week to bring in more economic experts to deal with the current business recession, informed sources said today.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A gunman robbed a Brooklyn bank of $2,500, then shot and killed himself when cianfronted by a police officer, authorities reported.

title: 1,000 Rail Workers Face Layoff
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23 (AP)More than 1,000 Norfolk & Western Railroad workers have been notified of a Dec.1 layoff because of the prospect of a coal strike in the Appalachians. A Norfolk & Western spokesman, reached by telephone in Roanoke, Va., said yesterday that prospects were dim that agreement could be reached between mine operators and the United Mine Workers and ratified by union members before the Dec. 6 strike deadline.

title: Ranger' Scoring
description: FIRST PERIOD1, Rangers, DeBlois (4) (unassisted), 1:01. 2, Colorado, Spruce (5) (Gardner, Croteau), 6:13. 3, Rangers, Hickey (11) (Murdoch, Vadnals), 15:26. 4, Rangers, Murdoch (9) (Hickey, Maloney), 15:36. 5, Rangers, Vickers (6) (Gilbert, Tkaczuk), 16:22. 6, Rangers, DeBlois (5) (Fotiu, Duguay), 19:06. PenaltiesEdur (13:27); Van Boxmeer (13:46).

title: American Stock Exchanze
description: TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 22, 1977

title: Dr. M. D. Moseson And Marna Ludwig, Nurse, Wed on L.I.
description: At the Great Neck (LI.) Synagogue yesterday, Marna Lynn Ludwig, a registered nurse at North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, L.I. was married to Dr. Michael D. Moseson, a senior resident in surgery at North Shore. Rabbi David Moseson, an uncle of the bridegroom, performed the ceremony.

title: $55 FLORIDA AIR FARE IS APPROVED BY C.A.B.
description: Continued From Page A1 holic beverages will be sold on board, but soft drinks will be free. Adults will be charged $2 for the movie, children $1.

title: Padres Gamble on Gamble
description: With a rapid series of multimilliondollar deals making baseball look like a game between General Motors and IBM, Oscar Gamble crept quietly into the vault yesterday and made out like J. Paul Getty.

title: MOSCOW TERMS SAKHAROV PATHOLOGIC INDIVIDUALIST
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23 (Reuters)A Soviet foreign affairs weekly today published a personal attack on Andrei D. Sakharov, the physicist and humanrights advocate, as his wife denied that she had been forced by the Soviet authorities to return from eve surgery in Italy ahead of time.

title: Ousted Mexican Journalists Start a Liberal Paper
description: MEXICO CITY, Nov. 22 A group of liberal journalists who were forced out of the newspaper Excelsior by the Government last year have started an ambitious new daily aimed at remedying the absence of independent opinion in the Mexican press.

title: Washington & Business
description: WASHINGTONJohn H. Fanning, who was sworn in this week to a fifth fiveyear term as a member of the National Labor Relations Board, probably knows as much as anyone about the way the national labor law operates.

title: Pistons Trade Barnes For Braves'Shumate
description: Marvin Barnes, the talented but troublesome forward who spent his summer vacation serving time in a Rhode Isalnd prison for violation of his parole, is no longer a Detroit Piston. He was traded yesterday to the Buffalo Braves; with Detroit's No. 2 and No. 4 draft picks this season, for John Shumate, a future No. 1 pick and a player to be named later. Solrces close to the Pistons said that the player to be named later would be Gus Gerard, a reserve forward.

title: Future of an Anchorage Newspaper Rests With Judge After Acrimonious Hearings on Joint Operating Pact
description: ANCHORAGE, Nov. 23The future of the morning newspaper here rests in the hands of a Federal District judge after two afternoons of hearings that sometimes sounded more like acrimonious divorce proceedings than the dissolution of a twoyearold business relationship.

title: Article 4  No Title
Junior League Holds Ball For Debutantes at Plaza
description: The Junior League of the City of New York held its 29th annual ball in the Plaza's Grand Ballroom last night to honor 24 debutante provisional members, and to raise funds for its Community Services Trust Fund.

title: Freighter With Tons of Marijuana Seized Off North Carolina Coast
description: A 130foot freighter carrying several tons of marijuana was seized off the coast of North Carolina Tuesday night by the United States Coast Guard and customs agents, the Coast Guard announced.

title: Dr. Beatrice Kassell, 65; Professor And Expert on Digestive Enzymes
description: Dr. Beatrice Kassell, a research scientist, died Monday at Massachusetts General Hospital in Boston of complications that followed brain surgery. She was 65 years old.

title: CHARLES M. TRUCHAN
description: Charles M. Truchan, a vice president of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Inc., died yesterday in Englewood (N. J.) Hospital after a brief illness. He was 37 years old and lived in Dumont, N.J.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: ENTRIES

title: Horn of Plenty for Thanksgiving
description: Calder, watch out. Your massive sculptures may grace more civic plazas, but can more people see them there, pause a second and smile before going their busy way, than they can near the entrance to the Lincoln Tunnel?

title: Letter: On Libel Suits
description: To the Editor:

title: October Inflow at $106 Million For New York Savings Banks
description: The Savings Banks Association of New York State said yesterday that net deposit inflow for October was $106 million, compared with $262 million in October last year. September saw a net outflow of $127 million.

title: Home Improvement
description: CLEARING or unstopping a clogged sink drain is one of those annoying home repair problems that always seem to occur on a holiday weekend when a plumber or local maintenance man is almost impossible to reach (not that they are much easier to reach on ordinary weekdays).

title: What Makes Bachelors Feel at Home
description: ITOLD Mother to think chrome, I didn't want any plants or pets to take care of, and to use silver and white, the colors of my favorite team, the Oakland Raiders, said Peter Axthelm, Newsweek's Damon Runyonish sports writer, describing the decor of his Turtle Bay apartment (shown on Page C1). It was done by his mother, Marjorie Axthelm Schooly, a Rockville Centre, L. I., interior decorator.

title: THANKSGIVING DAY
description: ParkingAlternatesideofthestreet regulations suspended. Sunday rules in effect. (Regular rules will be in effect tomorrow.)

title: Soviet Cuts Imports From West In Bid to Reduce Its National Debt
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 23The Soviet Union has reduced its imports from the capitalist world by nearly $2 billion so far this year from 1976 levels, according to official figures made public here today.

title: Where to Go For Leather Restoration Or Repair
description: Ten years ago, there were 20 shops in New York that specialized in restoring and replacing inlaid leather table tops; today there are only three. To some extent, the demand for this service has declined: With labor and material costs so high, many consumers decide to replace leather furniture rather than have it recovered. And yetfor antiques, family heirlooms, even wellloved luggageone may be looking for a craftsman who can repair or restore leather.

title: DAYAN SAYS ISRAEL MUST DECIDE SOON ON ITS PEACE TERMS
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 23Saying that the time was ripe for peace negotiations with all Arab foes, Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan told the nation today that Israel had to decide, and soon, on its lastditch attitude on the questions of ultimate borders, on a solution to the Palestinian problem and on the nature of the peace to be negotiated.

title: Faulting the Italian Reds
description: ROMEThe Christian Democrats are in the main responsible for Italy's current crisis, a crisis that is not only economic but also moral, political and institutional. More and more, the Christian Democrats have taken on the trappings of a power machine, based on an extended network of patronage and corruption that tends to confuse itself with the state.

title: An Australian Mayor Demands a Halt in Vietnam Refugee Boats
description: DARWIN, Australia, Nov. 23 (AP)The mayor of Darwin demanded today that the federal Government act to halt the flow of Vietnamese refugee boats into this northern port city.

title: Dividends
Berkowitz, Seeking Impartial Jury, Asks for Trial in Sullivan County
description: Lawyers for David R. Berkowitz, who is accused of being the 44caliber killer, applied yesterday to have his coming trial moved from Brooklyn to. Sullivan County or some other upstate area in order, they said to get an impartial jury.

title: GhostProne England Publishes
description: LONDON, Nov. 23England, which tends to believe in ghosts, has just published a Who's Who of them.

title: HECTOR MARCHINI
description: Hector Marchini, vice president of the Morania Oil Tanker Corporation of New York, died Tuesday of cancer in New Milford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 66 years old and lived in Warren, Conn.

title: STATE DEPT. STOPS PAYING FOR WOMEN'S YEAR MAIL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (AP)The State Department has stopped paying for mail sent out by the International Women's Year Commission because of a controversial news release distributed by the panel, a spokesman said today.

title: Celtics, Led by Cowens, Defeat the Rockets
description: BOSTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)Dave Cowens scored 22 points and six other Boston players scored in double figures tonight as the Celtics defeated the Houston Rockets, 109100.

title: In Memoriam
description: GALLANTGlacys 8. November 24, 1965, a data sadly remembered. We shall but love the better after death

title: Letters
description: Plea From the Middle Class

title: Bergen Paper Is Told to Surrender Its Tapes of a Jailhouse Interview
description: HACKENSACK, N.J., Nov. 23A Superior Court judge ordered an afternoon newspaper here today to surrender tapes of a jailhouse interview with a murder suspect, contending that the newspaper had no right under the United States Constitution or state law to withold them.

title: Those Russians on Our Party Line
description: The United States Government has known for several years that Soviet spies in our midst are listening in on longdistance telephone calls among Americansmostly, it seems, to pluck out official and commercial secrets. For mysterious reasons of national security, presumably tied to American eavesdropping on Soviet communications, the matter has been officially played down. Now President Carter has approved a program to protect the Government's telephone talkersbut not yet the rest of us.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
description: AT BOSTON

title: U.S. May Offer Soviet Deal Shelving Neutron Bomb
description: WASHINGTON Nov. 23The Carter Administration is examining the possibility of not deploying the controversial neutron bomb in return for a pledge by the Soviet Union to limit a new mobile missile that is aimed at Western Europe.

title: Actually, the Main Course Is Roasted Sitting Duck
description: BERKELEY, Calif.The line of candles up and down the table glimmer drunkenly in their sockets. Opposite me, dear little Miss Brownrigg has plainly had too much of the sparkling wine. She has been laughing uproariously for some time now at a very tedious narration of Mr. Blackwood's. On my left, Cousin Ted has finally fallen asleep, head sunk beatifically on ample chest, crumbs in his beard. At the head of the table, Cousin Effie, at 76 still virtually the sole creator of this mighty feast, sits bolt upright and expressionless, as if stuffed.

title: Dollar at Lows in Europe As Prices of Gold Increase
description: LONDON, Nov. 23 (AP)The dollar dropped to new alltime lows today against the currencies of Japan, West Germany and Switzerland. The stagnant American economic performance remained the reason for the low confidence in the dollar.

title: Gerard Gets A GoAhead From Court
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 23Mark Gerard, the veterinarian accused of switching racehorses at Belmont Park, won the right to return to his equine practice today.

title: Holiday Closings
description: Banks, stock exchanges and commodities markets in the United States are closed today for the Thanksgiving holiday. Government offices and most businesses are also closed, and the Postal Service will operate on a holiday schedule without regular deliveries, The weekly report on the money supply, normally issued each Thursday afternoon by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, will be issued tomorrow.

title: People and Business
description: Paul S. Mirabito, 62 years old, has been elected chairman, president and chief executive officer of the Burroughs Corporation, effective Jan. 1, the company announced yesterday. He will replace Ray W. Macdonald, 65, who is retiring after 44 years with the computer and office equipment manufacturer but who will continue to serve on the board.

title: Protest Puts Off a Vote on a 50% Pay Increase for Yonkers Officials
description: YONKERS, Nov. 23Nearly 400 Yonkers residents, angered by a proposal to increase elected city officials salaries by 50 percent, forced the withdrawal last night of the measure that presumably once had the unanimous support of the 13member City Council.

title: Minority Bankers Are Chagrined As Deposits by U.S. Show Drops
description: CHICAGOMainly because Medicare is watching its bank balances more closely, Federal deposits in minority banks have declined under the Carter Adminitration even though the President had pledged the Government's best efforts to increase such deposits.

title: Diane G. Roemer Wed To Rabbi Isaiah Wexler
description: Diane Grace Roemer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Mark Roemer of East Mead dow, L.I, was married yesterday to Rabbi Isaiah Wexler at the Lincoln Square Synagogue. The bridegroom is a son of Rabbi Stanley B. Wexler of the. Young Israel of Westchester, who performed the ceremony, and of Mrs. Wexler.

title: Plan to Curb Coffee Manipulation
description: A new plan to prevent the possible Manipulation and cornering of the coffee futures market next month was disclosed by the Government and the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange late yesterday.

title: About New York
description: The maestro settled for two all beef patties, special sauce, lettuce, cheese, pickles, onions on a sesame seed bun, and the band played on. He wore his trench coat and his bandmaster's hat with the scrambledeggs peak and regarded the sweepsecond hand of his watch, timing the march of 101 teenagers as they thundered the theme from Rocky off the walls of the cavernous Seventh Regiment Armory.

title: Public Service Given FuelCost Adjustment
description: The state's Board of Public Utilities approved a plan to tack an additional $4.12 on an average Public Service Electric & Gas Company gas bill by implementing a fueladjustment clause.

title: $55 FLORIDA AIR FARE IS APPROVED BY C.A.B
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board gave its approval yesterday to nofrills $55 and $75 fares between New York and Miami and Fort Lauderdale.

title: Big Board and Amex Issue Reports Of Changes in Stock by Insiders
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in stock by officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanges.

title: BERGEN MAN IS SHOT BEFORE TESTIMONY
description: NEWARK, Nov. 23A Bergen County manWearing a bulletproof vest because of an attempt on his life earlier this year was shot and wounded yesterday by a nervous, almost apologetic, gunman just before he, was to testify on a $7 million Florida realestate bankruptcy case in which he was a principal.

title: Egypt Expels 3 Palestine Aides, Suspends P.L.O. Radio
description: CAIRO, Nov. 23The Egyptian Government has expelled three Palestinian officials, apparently in reprisal for Palestinian denunciations of President Anwar elSadat's trip to Israel.

title: Giants Pick Up Hart, Running Back Dropped by 3 Teams
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Nov. 23The Giants today signed a player released by three other National Football League teams this year who will not be the answer to the following key questions concerning Sunday's game at Cincinnati with the Bengals:

title: Article 2  No Title
12 Killed in Crash of Helicopter On Flight to North Sea Oil Wells
description: STAVANGER, Norway, Nov. 23 (AP) A helicopter on a routine flight to offshore oil wells crashed into the North Sea today, killing all 12 persons aboard, officials said.

title: GRAND JURY INQUIRY ON LANCE REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23Bert Lance, the former Georgia banker who resigned under fire in September as President Carter's director of the Office of Management and Budget, has become the subject of a Federal grand jury investigation in Atlanta, Justice Department sources said today.

title: Top Pop Records
description: These are the most popular albums and singles nationwide, compiled by Record World, a trade publication. Albums are determined by sales figures from major retail outlets; singles are chosen combined sales and radio airplay. An asterisk indicates an especially fastselling record.

title: ELECTIONS IN TAIWAN A SETBACK FOR REGIME
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Nov. 23An election for local offices on this Chinese Nationalistruled island last weekend, which produced the first antiGovernment violence in 30 years, was one of the worst setbacks for the governing Kuomintang Party since 1949.

title: Worker Is Accused Of Defrauding City Of $21,500 in Relief
description: A 31yearold longshoreman who pleaded guilty yesterday to defrauding the Federal Government of nearly $5,000 in aidtothedisabled payments while earning 560,000 was accused of having defrauded New York City of more than 521,500 in welfare benefits.

title: HEWLETT EARNINGS OFF 1.8% IN QUARTER
description: The HewlettPackard Company reported yesterday a 1.8 percent drop in earnings for the fourth fiscal quarter but a 33.8 percent rise for the fiscal year ended Oct. 31.

title: Music: That Heavenly Lieder
description: SINGING LIEDER OF a genuinely intimate sort with orchestral accompaniment is one of those tests of sensitivity that may be demanded of sopranos when they apply for entry into heaven. It can be done, and done exquisitely, as Jessye Norman proved last night when she performed six songs of Richard Strauss at Carnegie Hall with the Rotterdam Philharmonic under the Dutch orchestra's youthful music director, Edo de Waart.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: Guillermo Vilas, Brian Gottfried, Bjorn Borg and Manuel Orantes have clinched places in the eightman Grand Prix Masters tennis championship at Madison Square Garden Jan. 4, Colgate, the sponsor, said yesterday.

title: Rubin Almeyda, a Victim of Parental Abuse, Is Interred a Second Time
description: Rubin Almeyda was buried for the second time yesterday.

title: Ukrainian Bishop Is Advanced
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Nov. 23 (AP)The Ukrainian Catholic Bishop here has been appointed Archbishop of Philadelphia, the highest position for the Ukrainian church in America. Bishop Joseph Schmondiuk will be installed as the Metropolitan Archbishop of Philadelphia in a ceremony Dec. 1 at the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception in Philadelphia. Bishop Schmondiuk will be replaced in Stamford by Bishop Basil Losten, who will be formally installed on Dec. 7 in a ceremony at St. Basil's College in Stamford, starting at 2 P.M.

title: GRAND JURY INQUIRY ON LANCE REPORTED
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 23Bert Lance, the former Georgia banker who resigned under fire in September as President Carter's director of the Office of Management and Budget, has become the subject of a Federal grand jury investigation in Atlanta, Justice Department sources said today.

title: La Guardia Is Getting New Eastern Shuttle Terminal
description: Plans for a $25 million Eastern Airlines shuttle terminal to replace a 16yearold temporary facility at La Guardia Airport were announced yesterday by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Disks: Schubert Quartets, Rubinstein Piano
description: WHEN OTTO DEUTSCH, the Schubert scholar and cataloguer, can do no better than to say that the composer wrote about 20 string quartets, you see how much chance of being precise the rest of us have. Three quartets are believed lost, and others exist only as fragments. Nevertheless, the Melos Quartet has gathered together 16 of the works, in varying states of completion, and put them into a splendidly informative and appealing album,

title: Europe's New Weather Satellite Is Placed in Stationary Orbit
description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla., Nov. 23 (AP) The Meteosat 1 weather satellite owned by the European Space Agency was in a stationary orbit 22,300 miles from the Earth today.

title: Nat'l Hockey League
description: AT LANDOVER, MD.

title: Degrees of Hope
description: It is, again, a time to give thanks for blessing received, the disappearance of evil, a good crop, a life saved. This year, and more particularly this week, gratitude arises from the unexpected persistence of a mere state of mind: hope. We have all watched this extraordinary emotion raised among Egyptians and Israelis. History should have brutalized them beyond hope. They should have been made cynical by tragedies and duplicities; prepared by 30 years of rhetoric to regard hope as merely cruel delusion. Yet they waved their flags, played their anthems, and are ready to believe, despite all precedent, in a prospect of peace.

title: New Jersey. Briefs
description: The United States Labor Department announced yesterday in Washington that it had awarded grants totaling $4,598,000 to provide new job skills for lowincome persons in New Jersey. The grants went to the state government ($199,675) and four countiesMorris ($308,465), Bergen ($1,402,289), Somerset ($206,858 and Monmouth ($497,703). Newark 3,011 receive $1,788.003 and Elizabeth $195,167.

title: Banned in Classrooms, Book Is Put in Library
description: LUDLOW, Mass., Nov. 23 (AP)The Ludlow School Committee has voted to return a controversial book on the female body to the shelves of the high school library but to ban its use as a classroom text.

title: SLIGHT GAIN SHOWN IN CREDIT MARKETS
description: The credit markets rose slightly in price yesterday, at least partly because many traders were anticipating that the Federal Resefye would report something of a decline tomorrow in the nation's money supply for the week ended Nov. 16.

title: $547,000 IN OILGAS GIFTS LINKED TO NINE SENATORS
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 23 (UPI)  Nine members of the Senate Finance Committee, which approved a series of tax breaks for the oil and gas industry, received more than $547,000 in contributions from oil and gas interests in the last three years, a Ralph Nader group reports.

title: Music: Trio From Coast Subtly Lovely
description: IF YOU BELIEVE, as many people do, that Northern California is a mellower place than New York, it follows that a topnotch chambermusic group from the San Francisco Bay Area might be expected to favor a gentler, less propulsive playing style than one customarily hears in Manhattan.

title: Market Place
description: The technical pattern traced, by the stock appeared to be weak, and the speculatora professional man with substantial capital  decided to go short, selling borrowed shares to be repurchased later, hopefully at a lower price.

title: Swedish Band Swings as of Yore at Storyville
description: A 12PIECE Swedish jazz band called Kustbandet (which means the Coast Band, although it does not refer to any specific coast) arrived in New York on Tuesday to show Americans what jazz used to sound like. Kustbandet. which played at the Overseas Jazz Club on Tuesday afternoon and later that evening began an engagement at Storyville, 41 East 58th Street, that will continue through Saturday, has a repertory based on the arrangements of the big bands of the late 20's and early 30'sFletcher Henderson, Luis Russell, Duke Ellington, Cab Calloway, CoonSanders and bands in which Bix Beiderbecke played, among others.

title: Doctor Says He Approved Biko Trip
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 23A Government doctor testified today that he had approved a police plan to take Stephen Biko on a 700mile road journey without qualified medical assistance despite tests showing that the black leader had suffered possible brain damage.

title: Psychiatrist Says Torsney Shot Boy Ina State of Panic
description: A psychiatrist testifying for the prosecution said yesterday that Police Officer Robert Torsney had acted in panic when he killed a Brooklyn youth last Nov. 25, and had not been suffering from mental defect or disease, as another psychiatrist had testified.

title: 2 Nonpolitical Panels Urge Raises Of $10,000 for Top City Officials
description: Two nonpolitical committees of prominent businessmen yesterday recommended that New York City raise the salaries of more than 2,000 policymaking executives from managers up to mayor.

title: Stocks Advance on Broad Front; Natural Gas and Oil Issues Strong
description: The stock market forged higher across a broad front yesterday despite only a nominal advance in the Dow Jones industrial average. Natural gas and oil stocks were strong.

title: Mediator Halts Lockheed Talks In Dispute Over Job Security
description: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 23 (AP)A Federal mediator has indefinitely suspended intensive contract talks in the 43 dayold strike against the Lockheed Companyafter negotiations became mired on the issue of job seniority, union and company after negotiations became mired on

title: Bridge:
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 23The pretigous blue ribbon pair championship was dominated by mixed partnerships at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nationals here this afternoon.

title: 5 Killed in North Sea Crash
description: STAVANGER, Norway, Nov. 23 (Reuters)Five people were killed and seven are missing in the crash of a helicopter in the North Sea today. The helicopter, on regular service between Stavanger and North Sea oil installations, was flying to an oilrig platform in the Ekofisk field when it crashed about 30 miles south of here.

title: GOING OUT
description: CLAN CANVAS That enterprising family of artists, Jerzy and Bogumila Koss and their teenage offspring, Tomira and Wlodek, have a new display, running through Dec. 3, at the Harkness House Gallery, 4 East 75th Street. The show ranges from the parents' collages involving television, film and computer tape, and color abstracts, to the children's painted portraits and masklike images. Gallery hours are Mondays through Fridays from 10 A.M. to 7 P.M. and Saturday until 5 P.M.

title: Men Found Concerned About Partners' Sex Satisfaction
description: Contrary to the beliefs of many women, a new national survey indicates that most men are deeply concerned about their partners' sexual satisfaction.

title: Article 1  No Title
Little to Be Thankful For In Wampanoags' Land
description: MASHPEE, Mass., Nov. 23The rustic wooden signs at the town limits, erected as a centennial project in 1970 when feelings were different here, proclaimed that this is MashpeeLand of the Wampanoag. But the signs have taken on an ironic meaning since the Indians filed a lawsuit 15 months ago to recover all 16,000 acres of the town.

title: Leader Urges Restraint in Estimating Disaster Toll
description: VIJA??AVADA, India, Nov. 23When President N. Sanjiva Reddy arrived in this city th:9 afternoon for a twoday inspection of the flooded coastal region of southeastern India, his first caution to the reporters and officials greeting him was, Let us not get panicky in estimating the death toll.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Dominique Bastien, Executive, Marries Carol Louise Bearnot
description: Carol Louise Bearnot, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Bearnot of Riverdale, the Bronx, was married at the Hampshire House yesterday to Dominique Bastien, son of Dr. and Mrs. Pierre C. V. Bastien of West Windsor, N. J. Rabbi Bert Siegel performed the ceremony.

title: South Africa's Gulag
description: It is a common experience for Americans to see tyranny in another country and suddenly appreciate the freedom in their own. The feeling is strongest with a people who seem like us, so that we can imagine ourselves in their situation. That is one reason why visits to the Soviet Union can be so disturbing.

title: Grain Futures Prices Are Narrowly Mixed in a Slight Preholiday Rally
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 23 (AP)Grain futures prices were narrowly mixed today on the Chicago Board of Trade as the market rallied slightly on the moves of local professionals to cover short positions before the Thanksgiving holiday.

title: Yale Film Festival To Honor John Hubley
description: John Hubley, the artist of the animated film who died last February, will be honored by an exhibition and film festival to he held at Yale University in New Haven from next Wednesday through Dec. 7.

title: Clubbing Some New York City Clubs
description: New York's real estate tax structure is notoriously Byzantine, with loopholes the size of Hagia Sophia. The Tax Commission has been doing its best to close the larger escape tunnels and to return some of the city's unusually large number of taxexempt properties to the tax rolls. The effort is commendable, both as a way of helping a city in distress and as a move toward equity.

title: Stockholder Group Sues Kennecott To Block Offer for Carborundum
description: Dissident stockholders of the Kennecott Copper Corporation, charging a waste of corporate assets, filed suit here yesterday against the company and its 17 directors in an effort to block a $567 million offer for the Carborundum Company.

title: Knicks' Box Score

title: Bridge Closed by Barge Crash
description: ST. GEORGES. Del., Nov. 23 (AP)The St. Georges Bridge over the Chesapeake and Delaware Canal was closed for more than 10 hours today after a fuel oil barge hit one of the structure's main piers. After an inspection for structural damage, the United States Army Corps of Engineers opened the bridge shortly after 11 A.M.

title: La Guardia Getting 25 Million Terminal For Eastern Shuttle
description: Plans for a $25 million Eastern Airlines shuttle terminal to replace a 16yearold temporary facility at La Guardia. Airport were announced yesterday by the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey.

title: Sense of History Pervades QuakerSettled Burlington
description: BURLINGTON, Nov. 23On the eve of Thanksgiving, a sense of history was particularly strong today in this little city where the Quakers arrived 300 years ago and set up Yorkshire and Londonshire sections to house settlers from York and London.

title: DAYAN SAYS ISRAEL MUST DECIDE SOON ON ITS PEACE TERMS
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 23Saying that the Lime was ripe for peace negotiations with all Arab foes, Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan told the nation today that Israel had to decide, and soon, on its lastditch attitude on the questions of ultimate borders, on a solution to the Palestinian problem and on the nature of the peace to be negotiated.

title: COSTIKYAN BOWS OUT AS A DEPUTY TO KOCH WHEN DENIED TOP JOB
description: Edward N. Costikyan, who had been one of Mayorelect Edward I. Koch's closest advisers during his election campaign, said yesterday that he would not serve in the Koch administration because the new Mayor would not appoint him as first deputy.

title: New Mayor of Houston
description: HOUSTON, Nov. 23His opponent labeled him a bankrupt real estate boondoggler who would lead the nation's fifth largest city into financial ruin. But minutes after Jim McConn knew last night that he had been elected Mayor of Houston, he pronounced himself the richest man in the world. He won by a surprising landslide, getting 66.6 percent of the votes cast. But local political analysts were saying that Houstonians were not voting for Jim McConn, they were voting against his opponent in the runoff election, Frank Briscoe.

title: 2 Admit $40,000 Bank Fraud
description: NEWARK, Nov. 23 (UPI)Two New Jersey men have pleaded guilty to Federal charges of conspiring to obtain fraudulently more than $40,000 in bank loans to pay off their gambling debts. The men, Richard Maglione, 46 years old, of West Long Branch, and Joseph Myer, 34, of Nutley, interrupted the opening day of their trial yesterday to enter guilty pleas.

title: Cancer Aide Out in Laetrile Dispute

The builder is Otto Paparazzo, one of the original partners, with his brothers, in the development of the Heritage Vdlage adult community in Southbury. At Pond Place his partner is Stanley Fisher, an industrialpark developer.

title: Ancient Kingdom of Macedon at a Glance
description: Vital StatisticsMacedon was a kingdom that came to be one of the great powers of the ancient world. Its borders varied over the years, but it was always centered on the plain at the head of the Thermaic Gulf, which juts into what is now the northeastern coast of Greece. Its people are thought by some scholars to have descended from migrants who streamed in from the north, through the valleys of the Morava and Varda Rivers, around 2000 B.C

title: Wet Grounds Postpone L.I. Soccer Title Game

The conductor was given the drawing this year as a 40thbirthday present from the 24 Sine Nomine Singers, an ensemble he founded and directs. The company opens its 10thanniversary season Sunday night at the 92d Street Y.W.H.A., with a program of Renaissance and 20thcentury music, Including works by Ravel and Debussy.

title: Bomb Discovered in St. Peter's
description: ROME, Nov. 24 (AP)A bag containing a lighted gasoline bomb was found in St. Peter's Basilica on Nov. 15, reliable Vatican sources said today. They said that if the device had exploded, it might have started a fire. There was no indication who had planted it. The sources said a similar device had been found and quickly dismantled last September beside the basilica's main altar.

Yonkers detectives said it appeared the man, gamin Sabanovic, 43 years old, shot Anna Kirschbaum, 30, then turned the rifle on himself. Both were dead when the police, who were summoned by neighbors, arrived on the scene. The couple had lived at the apartment at 840 Palisade Avenue for about three months. No note was found.

The 14,000member union voted last Friday to reject a company offer that included a $300 bonus plus costofliving and profitsharing benefits.

title: 16 Injured as Bomb Explodes at a Johannesburg Shopping Complex

title: Topics
description: In the Hippocratic Oath, every young physician pledges to act only for the good of my patients, keeping myself far from all intentional illdoing.... We have the examples of Nazi doctors experimenting on Jews and other inferior peoples and Soviet psychiatrists solemnly diagnosing political dissent as mental illness requiring confinement.

title: McGovern Asks Ties to Cuba

Recalling that the United States had a revolution of our own 200 years ago, the South Dakota Democrat called the 18yearold Castro regime a fact of life.

title: A Show of Forgeries For Real
description: HAVING spent 93 years commemorating distinguished authors and genuine masterpieces, the Grolier Club is now paying tribute to those who turn their hands to forgery. Beginning with a receipt signed Michelangelo, the show, at 47 East 60th Street, open free through Dec. 3, documents five centuries of the forger's literary art. Included are books and manuscripts that once passed critical muster, as. Well as others inspired by the miscreantsaccounts of how the truth emerged, and even novels based on the enterprise of deception.

He said no schedule had been worked out in the Jerusalem talks.

That's exactly how we felt about Girafe, the crowded but not talked about Italian restaurant on 58th Street just east Third Avenue, which has been under its present ownership for a year and a half. How come we haven't heard about this before? was our immediate feeling after a solidly delicious dinner complemented by some of the most clickingly efficient service we've seen in a long time. Nothing missed the eyes owners and captains, who seemed to have some extrasensory perception of customers wishes.
