description: FIRST PERIODNo scoring. PenaltiesPolonich (0:04); double minor (0:04); Harper (8:36); Flextal (16:33); Smith (16:33); Cameron (13:26); D. Petvin (19:17).

title: Dancers: An Indifferent Program
description: At least one program of indifferent ballets, if not two, could be drawn from any company's repertory, but the unremitting season of such works by Dancers has placed the troupe far beyond average statistics. One can only conclude that an indifference to esthetic standards produced the fifth and last new program Saturday evening in the oomnany's season at the Roundabout.

title: Dr. Karen R. Singer, Intern, Married to Dennis O'Rourke
description: Dr. Karen Ruth Singer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Singer of Washington, was married yesterday at Leonard's in Great Neck, L.I., to Dennis JamesORourke, son of Mr. and Mrs. Patrick B. O'Rourke of West Linn, Ore. Rabbi Marvin Savett performed the ceremony.

title: New Books
description: A Critiqueof Intervention, by Ludwig Von Mises (Arlington House, $8.95). Economic and social programs of the Weimar. Republic.

title: Slower Growth Rate Projected for 1978
description: The United States will avoid a recession in 1978, economic growth will be slower than it has been this year, and high inflation and unemployment will continue, according to.projections released over the weekend by the Conference Board.

title: Jane Z. Forman Is Bride Of Dr. Edward N Wolff
description: Jane Zandra Forman, editor in charge of special services at the Research Institute of America, and Dr. Edward N. Wolff, an assistant professor of economics at New York University and research associate at the National Bureau of Economic Research, were married at noon yesterday.

title: Queues A British Tradition Is Crumbling in the Wrong Places
description: LONDON, Nov.27The queue, as much a part of British life as gardening and afternoon tea, is beginning to show the strain of modern life.

title: Omaha Man Arrested in Shotgun Attacks at Nightclub
description: OMAHA, Nov. 27 (AP)A 32yearold Omaha man was arrested early today in connection with a shooting incident a nightclub here last night in which one person was killed and 26 injured.

title: Senator Case Emphasizes Determination to Rtin for ReElection in 1978
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27I expect to run for reelection in 1978. There is no doubt in my mind about that.

title: Season's Sales Hopes Up, But Price Cuts Start Early
description: Across the country, from the Trenton Common in New Jersey's capital to the Broadway Plaza complex in downtown Los Angeles, expectations are running high for record results in the Christmas shopping season which began over the weekend.

title: Combination of Cable TV and Satellites Creates National Super Stations
description: The combination of cable television and domestic communications satellites is fostering the creation of a new broadcast entity that has already acquired the industry sobriquet of super station. This is merely an ordinary local television stationone without a network affiliationthat, in effect, becomes a national station when its signal is picked up by satellite and distributed to cable systems around the country.

title: KOCH SAYS HE'LL PUT WOMAN IN DEPUTY JOB
description: A woman deputy mayor will be on tne team of top advisers that Edward I. Koch plans to announce this week, the Mayorelect said yesterday.

title: Books of The Times
description: True, we've lately heard more than enough about the decline of the family in America. We hardly need the historian Christopher Lasch's stern and recondite prose to remind us of the rising divorce rate, the declining birth rate, the growing generation gap and the changing attitudes toward marriage manifest in the rise of feminism and the quest for socalled open arrangements. But wait. The point of Haven in a Heartless World: The Fam ily Besieged goes considerably beyond popular perceptions of the present decline of the family. What Professor Lasch is arguing is that the family has been slowly coming apart for more than a hundred years. The divorce crisis, feminism, and the revolt of youth originated in the nineteenth century .  In fact, as he concludes, the erosion of the family has been in progress ever since bourgeois society conceived of it as a refuge where the woman ministered to her exhausted husband, repaired the spiritual damage inflicted by the market, and sheltered her children from its corrupting influence.

title: Alabama Official Prepares to Seek More Indictments in 63 Bombing
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., Nov. 27The Alabama Attorney General, William J. Baxley, is preparing to seek more indictments in the 1963 bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church in Birmingham. Four young black girls were killed in that blast.

title: Syria Intensifies Attack on Sadat While Keeping Its Options Open
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Nov. 27Syria intensified its campaign against the peace moves of President Anwar elSadat of Egypt today but there were strong indications that it would not join the rejection front led by Libya that opposes any negotiated settlement in the Middle East.

title: Medical. Schools Lose $11 Million In Dispute Over Foreign Training
description: Fourteen American medical schools have forfeited $11 million in Federal funds in a continuing battle over a new law that requires them to accept as transfer students Americans who began their medical studies in other countries.

title: Haywood Captures AccidentFilled Race
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., Nov. 27 (AP) Hurley Haywood captured the Camel  GT 250 automobile race today. The race was so destructive that in its early stages officials had to stop it and clear the track of debris and wrecked cars.

title: Bridge.
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 27Two New YOrl: experts were members of the leading team going into the final session of the Reisinger team championship at the American Contract Bridge League's fall nationals here tonight. Alan Greenberg and Jim Cayne led by almost half board.

title: Compromise Efforts on Issue of Funds Were Only Tentative and Sporadic in 3Week Recess
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Despite the hopes of the Congressional leadership, House and Senate conferees failed in the threeweek Congressional recess to make a serious attempt to iron out their differences on Federal funds for abortions for lowincome women.

title: INTERMARKET TRADES BY ELECTRONIC LINK MAY GET A TEST SOON
description: An electronic intermarket trading system, possibly a key element in the proposed national market system, may soon go into operation, testing the workability of another step toward competition among stock exchanges.

title: Elkin Kaufman, 72, Ad Executive Who Devised the Long Cigarette
description: Elkin Kaufman, senior vice president of the Lennen & Newell advertising agency from 1957 to 1966 and special projects manager for Philip Morris, the cigarette manufacturer, from 1966 until his retirement four years later, died Saturday at Lenox Hill Hospital after a long illness. He was 72 years old and lived at 4R0 Park Avenue.

title: Shopping Rush
description: For retailers, Sunday was a busy day. Pedestrians were five deep at Macy's as entertainers performed, above, and one shopper just had to rest after adding to purchases at Korvettes. Even pretzel vendors, right, were doing well. Merchants around the nation are expecting banner season in sales. Page 49.

title: Byrne and Appointments
description: TRENTON, Nov. 27At a news conference several weeks ago, when two members of his administration were considering applying for a state license to operate a gambling casino in Atlantic City. Governor Byrne was asked if public

title: 5 American Sailors Are Rescued From Small Boat Adrift Off Italy
description: NAPLES, Nov. 27 (Reuters)United States Navy helicopters rescued five American sailors today from a small boat that had been adrift in the Gulf of Naples since Friday, the American Sixth Fleet said.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: John Darnton's Nov. 14 news analysis contains a statement that is worth commenting on. He asserts that the dramatic diplomatic turn, from a nation that had been Moscow's prime ally in East Africa for the last eight years, was a result of Somalia's anger over Soviet support for Ethiopia in the fourmonthold war in Ogaden, the eastern region of Ethiopia that Somalia claims.

title: Congressional Group in Japan
description: TOKYO, Nov. 27 (Reuters)  A fourmember delegation from the United States Congress arrived here today to promote Japanese understanding of the JapanAmerica Friendship Fund, established by Congress two years ago to help Americans studying Japanese culture and Japanese studying America. The delegation is headed by Senator Jacob K. Javits, Republican of New York.

title: Howard Gershowitz Weds Pamela Grabois in Brooklyn
description: At the East Midwood Jewish Center in Brooklyn yesterday, Pamela F. Grabois, daughter of Mrs. Bernard W. Grabois and the late Mr. Grabois, was married to Howard M. Gershowitz, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis Gershowitz. Both families are of Brooklyn. Rabbis Harry Halpern and A. Stanley Dreyfus officiated.

title: Scoring and Statistics in N.F.L. Yesterday
description: AT SEATTLE

title: Henry Miller's Theater Is Being Refurbished
description: Henry Miller's Theater, until recent, years one of the most prestigious legitimate theaters, will rejoin Broadway's 35 houses devoted to dramatic and musical offerings. The theater, on 43d Street between the Avenue of the Americas and Broadway, has been taken over by the Durst Organization, which is refurbishing it to make it available in January.

title: Captain Beefheart Rocks Bottom Line
description: Don Van Vliet, better known as Captain Beefheart, made some of the most extravagant, fanciful and original rock music of the early 1070's. With his Magic Band, a group of shifting personnel but unchanging style, he fashioned a visionary mixture of Delta blues, freeform iazz and poetic license that encouraged no imitators only because nobody could copy it adequately.

title: 5 Steeler Interceptions Help Defeat Jets, 2320
description: The Jets, those perennial underdogs, reverted yesterday to their early season formthat is they didn't lose by much. With a rookie quarterback, Matt Robinson, guiding them most of the way against the Central Division's top team, the New Yorkers bowed to the Pittsburgh Steelers, 2320, at Shea Stadium.

title: Fate of an Earlier Attempt At Monetary Cooperation
description: The present disorderly, fevered state of the world monetary system (with the dollar weak against the other two major currencies of the industrial democracies, the West German mark and the Japanese yen) had its analogue in the mid 1930's. But in The the 1930's the three major currencies of the West Economic were the dollar, the British Scene, pound and the French franc, and the weakest of these was the franc.

title: Detroit Woman Elected President Of Temple Sisterhoods Agency
description: Lillian Meltzer of Detroit was elected president of the National Federation of Temple Sisterhoods last week at its biennial assembly in San Francisco.

title: Machine Tool Orders Off in October
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (Reuters)United States machine tool orders fell to $243.9 million in October from $252.2 million in September, the National Machine Tool Builders Association said. Shipments dropped in October to $195.7 million from $211.5 million the previous month. The industry's order backlog stood at $2.05 billion at end of October, compared with $2 billion at the end of September.

title: STRIKING BRITISH FIREMEN HELP FIGHT 2 BIG BLAZES
description: LONDON, Nov. 27 (AP)  Firemen in two cities temporarily ignored their 13dayold nationwide strike to help battle fires today where lives were lost. A child died in one blaze and an elderly woman in the other.

title: Planners Say Region Lost Population And Is Lagging in Economic Recovery
description: The New York Metropolitan region has had a significant population loss for the first time in its 350 years, a greater loss of jobs and slower economic recovery than the country since 1970, the Regional Plan Association reported yesterday.

title: The Key to the City
description: BOSTON, Nov. 27One of the toughest issues awaiting Edward. Koch as Mayor of New York is the proposal for Westway, a $1.16 billion. expressway running along the west side of Manhattan from the Battery to 42d Skzeet. It is in fact one of the most important urban planning issues in the Country.

title: Visit to Rikers Island Lays Bare A Welter of Festering Complaints
description: The New York House of Detention for Men on Rikers Island leaves images that don't blur easily. Against the background of Acting Correction Commissioner Joseph D'Elia's description of the increasing strain that both overpopulation in the jail and the increasing demand for inmate services are putting on his steadily dwindling force of officers, those images seem ominous.

title: RETIREMENT INCOME IS EMOTIONAL ISSUE
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27When House and Senate conferees meet in a few days to hammer out a Social Security financing kill, the most emotional item on their agenda will be the limit on earnings by retired persons.

title: Jacqueline Miller Is Married to Stewart Pearl
description: The marriage of Jacqueline Williams Miller, daughter of Elizabeth Boulon of Cruz Bay, St. John, Virgin Islands, and John Edward Miller of Winnetka, Ill., to Stewart William Pearl, son of Mr. and Mrs. Leonard Pearl of Skokie, Ill., took place yeserday afternoon.

title: Farrell Triumph's, 120
description: Monsignor Farrell won the championship of its own corner of the school football world yesterday when it defeated Tottenville, 120, for the Staten Island championship. John Skronski, junior quarterback, completed 23 passes for 215 yards, including a 37yard scoring pass to Frank Marone. Marone caught 13 passes for 115 yards.

title: Rangers Lose, 32
description: The New York Rangers gave up three goals in the second period and lost, 32, to the Sabres In Buffalo last night. Pat Hickey and Lucien DeBlois scored for the Rangers. Details on Page 46.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: THREE BY FOUR The early week's new cabaret acts include the club debut of a Broadway show singer, a seasoned pair of clowns and a popular iazz vocalist.

title: NKOMO GROUP SAYS SMITH IS ACTING IN DESPERATION
description: ALGIERS, Nov. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)The Zimbabwe African People's Union, led by Joshua Nkomo, today described the latest proposals by the Rhodesian Prime Minister; Ian D. Smith, to reach a political settlement with the country's blacks as the desperate move of a man faced with failure on the military, diplomatic and economic fronts.

title: Impact of War on Poverty Is Mixed for Harlem Block
description: On the front door of a Harlem apartment was a sticker with the message: I am the Good Shepherd. I am with you always. The door was unlocked.

title: P.8.A. in New York Won't Oppose Residency Rule for New Officers
description: The head of the Patrdlmen's Benevolent Association, reversing the union's traditional opposition to residency requirements, said yesterday he would not oppose mandatory residence in the city for new officers.

title: Deaths
description: AGGERHarold J., beloved husband of Lillian, father of Marlode. Service at Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave at 81 St, Tuesday, 11AM. Interment private.

Medical Schools Lose $11 Million In Dispute Over Foreign Training
description: Fourteen American medical schools have forfeited $11 million in Federal funds in a continuing battle over a new law that requires them to accept as transfer students Americans who began their medical studies in other countries.

title: What Grabs Buyers? Gadgets and Luxury
description: It is very early in the Christmas shopping season, but the gift grabbers. are already evident in. both fall and advance holiday buying. They range frow food processors to 14karat gold jewelry, from the soft look in women's clothes to classic men's shirts, from television cassette tape recorders to xnensive chronozraoh watches.

title: They Find Right Face Then Create a Mannequin to Resemble
description: She leads a short life, but a luxurious one. Her wardrobe has dozens of designer dresses, marvelous furs and jewels, and she's at home at some of the best addresses in town. She has a retinue of helpers to dress her, arrange her hair and refresh her makeup. Still, despite her thousands of admirers, she rarely smiles. And no wonder. Her life recently has been fraught with perils she died of an overdose of pills in Bendel's, was found hanging at Bloomingdale's and had her nose bobbed for the San Francisco Clothing store.

title: Montreal Beats Edmonton In Grey Cup Game, 416
description: MONTREAL, Nov. 27 (AP)Sonny Wade threw three touchdown passes in the second half as the Montreal Alouettes won the Grey Cup today by scoring a 416 victory over the Edmonton Eskimos in the Canadian Football League final.

title: Horses listed In order of Post positions
description: Horses listed In order of Post positions

title: Israel Schedules Policy Statement And Debate on Middle East Today
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 27Prime Minister Menahem Begin said today that he would make a policy statement to the Israeli Parliament, tomorrow on the rapidly moving Middle East situation and that would be followed by a fullscale debate.

title: Federal Study Links Sleeping Pills To 5.000 Deaths Yearly in U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)  A Federal study estimates that sleeping pills are associated with nearly 5,000 deaths a year in the United States, Dr. Robert L. DuPont, director of the National Institute on Drust Abuse said today.

title: The Season's First Snowfall Caps a Sunday of Shopping
description: The season's first snow in New York City fell yesterday at the close of a day that saw bundledup families troop through Herald Square and suburban shopping malls, marking the second year of widespread Sunday storeopenings.

title: Bengals Beat Snowstorm, And Also the Giants, 3013
description: CINCINNATI, Nov. 27John Hicks bought about $1,000 worth of tickets to the GiantsBengals game today and still did not get in. His Giant teammates weren't in the game very long either as Cincinnati, prepared for a 4inch snowfall, came out throwing before the storm was at its heaviest, took a 200 lead in the first quarter and defeated the Giants, 3013.

title: Coal Dispute Talks Resume Tomorrow At Urzinz of U.S
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27The Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service intervened in stalled negotiations today in an effort to prevent a coal miners strike on Dec. 6. The mediators obtained the agreement of both sides to meet again on Tuesday.

title: Why a Foreign Connection for Gas?
description: Consider the plight of gas utilities searching for ways to meet their customers needs. The only way to guaran tee supplies of scarce natural gas these days is to make a foreign connection. Pipeline companies already buy gas from Canada and with Federal permission, would like to go shopping in Mexico, Algeria and Indonesia as well.

title: Trudeau Is Reported to Give Pledge To Quit if Quebec Votes to Secede
description: Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada has been quoted as saying that he would resign if the province of Quebec voted for independence.

title: Supplementary OvertheCounter Listings
description: The following is a supplementary weekly list of mutual funds prepared by the National Association of Securities Dealers. The range'shown reflects prices at which securities could have been sold (bid) or bought (asked) last Friday.

title: BEN C. BLOCH, 87, PARTNER IN AN ARCHITECTURAL FIRM
description: Ben C. Bloch, a partner in the architectural firm of Bloch & Hesse (now Bloch Hesse & Shalat), died yesterday at the DeWitt Nursing Home in Manhattan after a long illness. He was 87 years old and lived at 25 Central Park West.

title: Debra Dennett Is Bride
description: The marriage of Debra Leigh Dennett, a student at Barnard College, to Nathaniel Ferguson Knappen, a graduate of Vassar College and the University of Virginia Law School, took place yesterday in Poughkeepsie, N.Y. The Rev. Rossiter Seward, a Unitarian minister, performed the ceremony in the Vassar chapel. The bride is the daughter of Roger Lee Dennett of Lakeville, Mass., and the late Mrs. Dennett. Mr. Knappen, son of Mrs. Theodore Temple Knappen of Centerville, Va., and the late Mr. Knappen, is with the New York law firm of Condon & Forsyth.

title: Strike Grounds French Planes
description: PARIS, Nov. 27 (Reuters)All Air France planes except the Concorde supersonic airliner were grounded today by a 48hour strike of pilots and technicians for a pay increase. Air France officials said only incoming flights and some chimestie routes were in service.

title: French Coalition Is Divided on Defense and NATO
description: PARIS, Nov. 27  A debate has broken out between partners in France's centerright Government over whether or not this nation is building a credible nuclear force and maintaining the independent national defense poIicies set forth by Charles de Gaulle a decade ago.

title: Rams' Defense Thwarts Offense of Browns, 9 to 0
description: The weather conditions at Municipal Stadium in Cleveland yesterday seemed made to order for the Browns against the tanned and warmblooded Los Angeles Rams. Snow fell throughout the game, and sharp winds whistled off Lake Erie, with the temperature in the low 20's.

title: Text of the Invitations To Cairo Conference
description: CAIRO, Monday, Nov, 28 (AP)The following text of Egypt's invitations to the planned Cairo meeting was published In today's issue of the semiofficial newsaaver Al Ahram:

title: 2 Pelleases Disconcerting
description: In theory, the American Symphony Orchestra's program yesterday afternoon in Carnegie Hall looked provocative: excerpts, from Debussy's opera PeIleas et Melisande followed by Schoenberg's gigantic tone poem Pelleas und Melisande. Here are two major works by seminal early 20thcentury composers, both conceived at Toughly the same time (around 1900) and drawing inspiration from Maurice Maeterlinck's revolutionary symbolic play of 1892.

title: Queues  A British Tradition Is Crumbling in the Wrong Places
description: LONDON, Nov. 27The queue, as much a part of British life as gardening and cfternoon tea, is beginning to show the strain of modern life.

title: Events Today
description: METROPOLITAN OPERA, Lincoln Center, Verdi's La Traviata, 8.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ATLANTIC CAUSEWAY(ACL). Goteborg Dec. 13, Oslo 15, Helsinki 17 and Leningrad 19; sails from Pt. Elizabeth, N.J. Letters, prints and parcel post for Sweden, Norway, Helsinki and Leningrad.

title: F. Raymond Peterson Dead at 82; A Lifetime in Key Banking Posts
description: F. Raymond Peterson, former chairman and president of the First National Bank of New Jersey and past president of the American Bankers Association and the New Jersey Bankers Association, died Saturday at his home in Hackensack, N.J. He was 82 years old.

title: Martha Jones Heard In Fine Piano Debut
description: In her New York recital debut Saturday night at Carnegie Recital Hall, Martha. Braden Jones impressed as a citable, conscientious pianist, but one whose expressive power is limited by technical and temperamental constaints. In one respect, she is an uncommonly scrupulous artist  faced with a choice between fidelity.to the spirit of the music and fidelity to the note, she chose slightly slower tempos that her fingers could handle.

title: Sending a LawEnforcement Message
description: For thousands of Gmen, Tmen and other Federal intelligence and lawenforcement personnel, this is season for listening carefully; the Government is sending them a message.

title: Louis Coxe Is Honored by Academy of Poets
description: Louis Coxe, poet and playwright, has leen named the 1977 Fellow cf the Academy of American Poets, it was announced by Mrs. Hugh Bullock. preF.ident of the academy. The fellowship awarded annually fordistinguished poetic achievement, carries dash prize cf 810.000. Mr. Coxe is the 36th winner of the award.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Citibank has agreed to combine the credit card balances of customers with both Visa and Master Charge accounts when figuring interest charges, the office of Attorney General Louis J. Lefkowitz announced yesterday, The new method will cut interest charges for cardholders whose accounts total more than $500, because in New York State the interest rate is 18 percent on the first $500 and 12 percent on the remainder.

title: An Astronomer Looks Back to See Ahead
description: KITT PEAK, Ariz.By looking back as far as possible toward the beginning, C. Roger Lynds hopes, with one of the world's most powerful telescopes and a novel observing method, to predict the fate of the universe.

title: Taxable and TaxFree Offerings On Week's pond Sale Schedule
description: In this week's schedule of bond sales, the following issues are expected:

title: El Paso Smelter Still Poses LeadPoisoning. Peril to Children in Juarez
description: EL PASO, Nov. 27The ASARCO Inc. smelter here, whose emissions, according to earlier studies, were causing lead poi soning in an estimated 10,000 children in two countries, now poses a threat to fewer United States children but to more Mexican children, a followup study has found.

title: Adoption Effort for Older Children Is Stepped Up in Two Counties
description: NEWARK  The State Commissioner of Banking, Virginia Long, and her hushand, Jonathan Weiner, recently decided to adopt two childrenan infant and 12yearold. In adopting the older child, they were following a pattern being urged by the division of youth and family services of the state's Department of Human services.

title: DAYAN BEGINS HIS TRIP TO SEE BONN LEADERS
description: BONN, Nov. 27  Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel arrived today for a fourday official visit to West Germany that, although scheduled long before the latest events in the Middle East, will be dominated by them.

title: Pinero's Eulogy Gets Out ofJail
description: With Eulogy for a SmallTime Thief, Miguel Pinero, author of the prison drama Short Eyes, has moved his jail out into the city. The characters are equally confined; not by bars but by crime and by the ignorant, desperate vision that remains in city streets from which society has withdrawn uptown, downtown or into the suburbs.

title: Donald Beates Watt, 84, Founder of Organization For Exchange Students
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Nov. 27 (AP)Donald Beates Watt, the founder of the Experiment in International Living an organization that has sent thousands of young Americans abroad and has received thousands of foreign youth in the United States, died in a Lancaster hospital today. He was 84 years old.

title: Dance: Pilobolus 6 Show More TonsvTurvv Skill
description: Judging by the mighty strange happenings over at the St. James Theater last week, Pilobolus Dance Theater is telling us there is only one law of gravity. What goes up, must come down on the solar plexususually somebody else's.

title: Woman in Fatal Mexican Abortion Had Secrecy Reason, Journal Says
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 7 (UPI)A Texas woman who died from a recent Mexican abortion crossed the border to keep the abortion secret from her family, not, as some groups have said, because of a cut off in Federal funds for most Medicaid abortions, a medical publication said today.

title: ROSE FELDMAN
description: Rose Feldman of Miami Beach died Saturday at her home. She was 79 years old and the widow of Harry Feldman, former director of the Flushing News Company. A native of New York City, Mrs. Feldman moved to Florida in 1972, one year after the death of her husband.

title: WASHINGTON PUZZLED OVER HOW TO REACT TO SADAT PROPOSAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Administration officials said today that they were perplexed over how to react to the call yesterday by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt for a preliminary Middle East conference in Cairo.

title: Brooklyn Man, 27, Fatally Shoots Burglar Outside Neighbor's Home
description: An unidentified burglar was shot to death yesterday morning when he reportedly pointed an air pistol at a 27yearold Brooklyn man whose brother bad just surprised the thief as he was ransacking their nextdoor neighbor's brincp in the Sheenshead Bay section.

title: Vorster Recalls, With Bitterness, 17 Months Spent As Detainee, and a Paper Draws Parallel With Biko
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov 27  South Africans have been offered an indignant appraisal of the practice of detention without trial from an unexpected quarter Prime Minister John Vorster.

title: JOSEPH B. JOINER
description: Joseph B. Joiner, former president of Maritime Petroleum Corporation in New York City, died Saturday in Hanover, N.H. He was 71 years old and lived in West Lebanon, N.H.

title: Gray Power Surging in Politics
description: TOMS RIVER. N.J.In its last session, the New Jersey Legislature passed a bill exempting older persons from the state income tax if they earned less than $7,500, or $10,000 for a couple. Twelve days before the recent gubernatorial election, Governor Byrne Game here to Ocean County, sometimes called 'the St. Petersburg of the Northeast, and signed the law at a local retirement community.

title: Diana Lee Yegelwel Bride of Jesse Louis Rotman
description: At the Park Avenue Synagogue yesterday afternoon, Diana Lee Yegelwel, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Benjamin Yegelwel of New York, was married to Jesse Louis Rotman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Morris B. Rotman of Chicago. Rabbi Judah Nadich performed the ceremony.

title: In Memorium:
description: HAVRETim. Darling,20 long years without you.Miss and love you al, ways. Mae

title: News Summary
description: Washington is perplexed over how to react to the proposal Saturday by President.Anwar elSadat of Egypt for a preliminary Middle East conference to convene in Cairo next Saturday, Administration officials said. As the United States weighed a reply, the Soviet Union, the other cochairman of the Geneva conference on the Middle East. remained silent. Moscow, like Washington, was apparently caught off guard and was seemingly concerned that plans for a Geneva meeting this year might fail because of Mr. Sadat's overtures. On American TV, Mr. Sadat said he was ready to negotiate in Cairo on procedures for a Geneva conference with Israel alone. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: Tallahassee Paper to Be Morning
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., Nov. 27 (AP)The Tallahassee Democrat, a weekday afternoon newspaper since 1915, will change to a morning publication on Jan. 1. The paper was first published as The Weekly True Democrat in 1905 and switched its name to The Democrat when it began weekday afternoon publication in 1915. Its name later was changed to The Tallahassee Democrat.

title: Tormented In Chile, She Seeks Inner. Peace
description: AMPLEFORTH, EnglandIn a modest cottage in the shadow of the imposing Benedictine abbey here, Sheila Cassidy, the British physician who was imprisoned in Chile two years ago, is leading a double life of a prominent fieure and wouldbe nun.

title: Nursing Home's Plight Draws Wide Concern
description: It was $87,000 down and $13,000 to go by Wednesday to save the Village Nursing Home at 607 Hudson Street, according to its administrator, John Issowits, who said yesterday that donations had come in from all over in the wake of national publicity of the home's plight.

title: Islanders Get 4 Quick Goals, Top Red Wings
description: DETROIT, Nov. 27After repeating 100 times, We shall play every period of a hockey game as hard as we can, the Islanders came out winging and swinging tonight against the rejuvenated Detroit Red Wings.

title: People's Firehouse Hails Victory, But Finds Winning Has Its Price
description: The People's Firehouse of Northside celebrated one victory yesterday, but the battle isn't over yet.

title: Japan Cabinet Changed by Fukuda
description: TOKYO, Monday, Nov. 28 (AP)Prime Minister Takeo Fukuda, plagued by a recession at home and criticism of Japan's trade policy abroad, shuffled his Cabinet today, naming a specialist in economic diplomacy to a newly created position in his Government.

title: Net FinalsWon By Mrs. King And Rosevvall
description: TOKYO, Nov. 27 (AP)The veterans Ken Rosewall and Billie Jean King turned back the clock today, posting finalround victories..in the Gunze World tennis tournament, which had total purses of $125.000.

title: Strauss Again Becomes Center Of Political Controversy in Bonn
description: BONN, Nov. 27  Former Defense Minister Franz Josef Strauss, a Bavarian conservative, was at the center of a political storm in West Germany last week and emerged as a possible candidate to succeed Chancellor Helmut Schmidt if the country were to swerve to the right.

title: Sports Today
description: Knicks vs. Houston Rockets, at. Madison Square Garden, Eighth Avenue and 33d Street, 7:30 P.M.

title: New York City Will Test Using Explosives to Raze Some Abandoned Buildings
description: Confronted with a growing backlog or more than 10,000 abandoned buildings scheduled for demolition, city officials said yesterday that they were planning to use explosives for the first time on an experimental basis to cut the time and costs of razing structures that have become firetraps and havens for drug addicts.

title: MILDRED MAHLER GEARE, 89, BALTIMORE NEWSWOMAN
description: BALTIMORE, Nov. 27 (UPI) Mildred Mahler Geare, an early advocate of women's rights and one of the first newspaperwomen to report on a Presidential convention, died yesterday. She was 89 years old. She retired as women's club editor for The Baltimore News American in 1974, ending a 52year career in the news business.

title: Barenboim Graces Beethoven
description: Although he marked his 35th birthday only last month, Daniel Barenboim has been playing Beethoven's piano sonatas in public for more than 20 years and has recorded the entire cycle. Even so, a recital such as he presented yesterday at Avery Fisher Hall, consisting of the last three sonatas, was a serious undertaking. That little trilogy is still not the property of every pietist who can hire a hall.

title: Soviet Concern Seems to Grow That Geneva Parley Will Be Postponed
description: Special to The New York Times MOSCOW, Nov. 27The Soviet Union is showing signs of mounting concern that plans for a Geneva conference to the Middle East are going to fall through this year because of the spectacular overtures to Israel by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt.

title: Looking to the West
description: PALO ALTO, Calif.One of the most alarming facts of today's world perhaps ultimately more menacing than nuclear overkillis the gross disparity of material wealth between the poor majority and the rich minority of the peoples of earth. This disparity not only causes countless problems but is morally unbearable.

title: Chinese Say They Have Found 1,000YearOld Cypress in Tibet
description: PEKING, Nov. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)Chinese botanists have discovered a giant cypress tree in Tibet that they say is at least 1,000 years old, Hsinhua, the official news agency, said today.

title: Slight Quake in Oregon and Idaho
description: ONTARIO, Ore., Nov. 27 (UPI)A mild earthquake about 2:30 A.M. today awakened residents of southeast Oregon and southwest Idaho, shook houses and rattl'd dishes but apparently caused little, if any, damage.

title: Study Says Region Lost Population And Lags in Economic Recovery
description: The New York metropolitan region has bad. sa significant population loss for the first time in its 350 years, a greater loss of jobs and slower economic recovery than the country since 1970, the Regional Plan Association reported yesterday.

title: Syntex Earnings Up in Quarter  Settlement With Fisons Cited
description: The Syntex Corporation yesterday reported improved sales and earnings for its first fiscal quarter, ended Oct. 31. Earnings of he pharmaceutical and chemical company rose to $14.5 million, or 75 cents a share, from $10.7 million, or 52 cents, in the like periOd a year ago. Sales rose to $83 million from $77 million.

title: WASHINGTON PUZZLED OVER HOW TO REACT TO SADAT PROPOSAL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27Administration officials said today that they were perplexed over how to react to the call yesterday, by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt for a preliminary Middle East conference in Cairo.

title: Aqueduct Racing
description: Nets 99, Seattle 96,Pro Transactions

title: Hal Linden in Hospital
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Nov. 27  Hal Linden, the star of TV's Barney Miller show, was admitted to the Sullivan County Community General Hospital in Harris today. Mr. Linden, 46 years old, is suffering from viral bronchitis and exhaustion and is expected to be hospitalized for several days.

title: KOCH SAYS HE'LL PUT WOMAN IN DEPUTY JOB
description: A woman deputy mayor will be on the team of top advisers that Edward I. Koch Plans to announce this week, the Mayorelect said yesterday.

title: INVITATIONS TO TALKS ARE ISSUED BY CAIRO
description: CAIRO, Nov. 27Egypt extended formal invitations today for preparatory talks in Cairo aimed at reconvening the Geneva peace conference but apparently did not include the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: Remember the way the desert looked from the observation deck of the Superchief? Or the taste of morning coffee served in the Twentieth Century Limited's gleaming china? Thousands do, among them a good share of the Congressmen who voted to create Amtrak in 1970 in the hope of saving longdistance intercity passenger rail service.

title: Honeyboy Edwards Plays Blues
description: David (Honeyboy) Edwards, whose concerts at the Alternative Center for International Arts last winter were perhaps the most important blues performances to take place in New York in 1976, was back at the center Saturday night and yesterday afternoon. If anything, he was in even better form than last year, delivering Mississippi Delta blues with unimpeachable authority and crackling rhythmic precision.

title: NEW YORK NEGOTIATES A GARBAGEFUEL PLAN
description: New York City is negotiating with a private company to convert 15 percent of its daily output of garbage into a powder that electric power plants can burn Instead of fuel oil.

title: A STRIKE IS PUT OFF AT PRATT & WHITNEY
description: HARTFORD, Monday, Nov. 28Workers at the Southington maintenance plant of the United Technologies Corporation's Pratt &Whitney Aircraft Division agreed early this morning to stay on their jobs for at least another week even though they had voted a few hours earlier to strike the plant immediately.

title: Knicks' Box Score
description: LATE SATURDAY KNICKS (112)

title: Pennsylvania Eases Pollution Enforcement for Steel
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.As part of Pennsylvania's emergency effort to help its ailing steel industry, state and Federal environrhental authorities have relaxed deadlines or reduced fines for several Pennsylvaia steel mills.

title: Market Place
description: Stock repurchases by companies that regard their shares as cheap in this market have become common events, and with shares selling at 4 and 5 times earnings, this is understandable.

description: 74:50, WKCR.Staircase, Sundial, Jarrett; Etudes, Books 1 and 2, Debussy; Etudes, Op. 10 and 25, Chopin.

description: At night in the Greenpoint section of Brooklyn, the deep voices of men, hoarse from liquor and the loading dock, drift to the street from gritty neighborhood bars. The taverns rear entrances are guarded by the neon legend Ladies Only.

title: P.L.O. Opposes Cairo Talks, but Will Be at Tripoli
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 27The Palestine Liberation Organization today said it would refuse to attend a preliminary meeting in Cairo to prepare for Middle East peace talks in Geneva, and would instead go to an Arab protest meeting in Libya.

title: Article 3  No Title
Jonathan Ruhsam WedsDiana Ripley
description: Diana Frothingham Ripley, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Louis R. Ripley of East Cornwall, Conn., was married'yesterday in Litchfield, Conn., to Jonathan Levering Ruhsam, son of Col. and Mrs. Harry E. Ruhsam of The Plains, Va. The Rev. Joseph Urban performed the ceremony in Trinity Episcopal Church, Milton.

title: Trade Adjustment Aid's Unmet Potential
description: BROCKTON, Mass.When President Carter rejected a recommendation of the International Trade Commission for higher tariffs on imported shoes last April, he ordered the improvement of a littleknown Federal program intended to provide financial and other assistance to workers and companies hurt by foreign competition.

title: Israel Schedules Policy Statement And Debate on Middle East Today
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 27Prime Minister Menahem Begin said today that he would make a policy statement to the Israeli Parliament tomorrow on the rapidly moving Middle East situation and that it would be followed by a fullscale debate.

description: KITT PEAK, Ariz.By looking back as far as possible toward the beginning, C. Roger Lynds hopes, with one of the world's most powerful telescopes and a novel observing method, to predict the fate of the universe.

title: P.B.A. in New York Won't Oppose Residency Rule for New Officers
description: The head of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association, reversing the union's traditional opposition to residency requirements, said yesterday he would not oppose mandatory residence in the city for new officers.

title: PROFESSORS STATEMENT BACKS AFFIRMATIVE ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27 (UPI)Ninety university professors, in a statement issued today, said that special hiring and admissions programs for minorities were temporarily necessary to make up for deeply entrenched discriminatory patterns of the Past.

title: Philadelphia Families Evacuated
description: PHILADELPHIA, Nov. 27 (AP)About 200 residents were evacuated from their West Philadelphia homes last night when 10 cars of a 91car Conrail freight train overturned.: 7ire rnd polio officials ordered the residents out because of the possibility or poisonous gases leaking from two tank cars involved in the accident. A Conrail, spokesman said that no leakage had occurred, however, and residents returned to their homes within three hours.

title: CANADIANS WARMTH TOWARD U.S. GROWING
description: OTTAWA, Nov. 27  A new warmth toward the United States has appeared in Canada, causing comment amang officials, diplomats and academics and in Canadian nationalist circles. The mood Is in striking contrast to the coolness and tensions that had led a departing American ambassador to issue a stinging critique of Canadian attitudes as he was about to leave Ottawa two years ago some commentators nave equated tne new Canadian posture with a return, at least in part, to the once'popular but later rejected concept known as continentalism, or the merging of the Canadian and American economies into a single North American unit.

title: Sabres Send Rangers To Another 32 Defeat
description: BUFFALO, Nov. 27A single goal in Boston, a single goal in Buffalo and the New York Rangers might have returned from a weekend trip with some points. But tonight they lost to the Sabres, 32, after losing to the Bruins the previous night by the same score.

title: HERBERT E. MITLER, 92, BUILDER IN MANHATTAN
description: Herbert E. Mitler, a realestate executive and builder, died Thursday in his home at 784 Park Avenue. He was 92 years old.

title: For a WellSpiced Dish, Add a Dash of Theatrics
description: When an individual dines, he brings to the table an assortment of senses, other than taste, that bear directly on how intensely he enjoys his food. There is the sense, of smell, of course.. And adults as well as children take pleasure in the snap, crackle and pop of food, but only if the food is supposed to crunch and make noises in the head. One says head. One hopes the noises aren't all that evident to the other guests around the groaning board. (Groaning board is a dreadful term, by the way. It conjures up images of what can happen when you serve your guests the wrong kind of wild mushrooms.)

title: Willis Reed's Fines: Time Is Money
description: Willis Reed fined himself $35 last week for being late to practice, and the Knicks applauded.

title: Rome Churches Protest Violence
description: ROME, Nov. 27  The Roman Catholic diocese of Rome marked a day of solidarity for victims of violence in Italy.

title: Swedish Steel Merger Is Expected
description: STOCKHOLMThree of Sweden's largest steel plants will be merged into a single company to be known as Swedish Steel Ltd. if approval is given as expected when Parliament reconvenes here in January.

title: Redskins Stymied in Playoff Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 27  George Allen's Redskins had psychology, history and a crowd of 55,031 on their side today, but most of the critical penalty flags thrown in Kennedy Stadium fell the right way for the Dallas Cowboys.

title: IT WAS THE RIGHT KIND OF DAY FOR HOCKEY yesterday as the Colonial All Stars defeated the Essex Hunt Club Foxes on the club's
description: The New York Times/ ???

title: World News Briefs
description: EAST BERLIN, Nov. 27 (Reuters)  Six people were killed and 45 were injured, eight seriously, when the steam ongine of an East German express train blew up and set fire to the first car it was pulling, A.D.N., the official news agency, reported today.

title: 1,000 Fans Brave Cold and Rain To Look at Elvis Presley's Grave
description: MEMPHIS, Nov. 27 (AP)More than 1,000 Elvis Presley fans, many of whom had stood in line for hours, walked up the quartermile drive of his Graceland Mansion in a cold, drizzling rain today to see his grave.

title: TV: From Gleason and Carney to Beverly Sills
description: Always dizzying, if not busy, in its variety, the television schedule tonight offers Jackie Gleason and Art Carney in low farce and Beverly Sills in an operetta teetering on high camp.

title: Suzanne Massu, Served as Major With Free French Forces in War
description: PARIS, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Suzanne Massu, who served with the Free French forces in World War II and whose husband, Jacques, helped topple the Fourth French Republic, died Friday, her family said today. She was 70 years old.

title: Gray Power Surging in Politics
description: TOMS RIVER. N.J.In its last session, the New Jersey Legislature passed a bill exempting older persons from the state income tax if they earned less than $7,500, or $10,000 for a couple. Twelve days before the recent gubernatorial election, Governor Byrne came here to Ocean County, sometimes called the St. Petersburg of the Northeast,, and signed the law at a local retirement community.

title: Time Bomb Defused in Cannes As French and Israelis Gather
description: CANNES, France, Nov. 27 (Reuters)Police today dismantled a time bomb 10 minutes before it was to explode in the bathroom of a'hall where a FrenchIsraeli friendship group was meeting.

title: Chess:
description: Why are so many draw offers accepted in toplevel play? Because most g;andmasters, most of the time, know better than to attempt to force a position where equilibrium has been reached.

title: 4 Die in Chicago Tavern Fire
description: CHICAGO, Nov. 27 (AP)Four persons died early today when a fire swept through a West Side tavern shortly after it closed. Fire Marshal Ennis Rice said that the cause of the blaze at the Blue Point Lounge was not known. Fire authorities said that the victims were badly burned and that their identities were not known.

title: Aid Sought for Imprisoned Doctors
description: LONDON, Nov. 28 (AP)Amnesty International published a list today of 92 doctors and other medical workers who it said were imprisoned in 25 countries for political reason.

title: The Canal: A Rampart
description: WESTPORT, Conn.The principal arguments vehemently raised in support of the Panama Canal treaties are not altogether convincing.

title: FECHOICE REPORTED TO RECONSIDER POST
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The lingering effects of an abdominal operation and a hernia condition have raised serious questions of whether Frank M. Johnson will be able to assume the duties of director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, senior Administration sources said today.

title: Sketches of FourWho Are Expected to Be Named Today by MayorElect as His Deputies
description: A week or so ago, when David W. Brown's name first appeared as potential deputy mayor, several of his friends aid associates said they doubted that he would accept such a position.

title: A Gram of Prevention?
description: Washington's efforts to bring the metric system to America appear to have lost groundseveral feet centimeters at least. A new Gallup poll finds that barely a quarter of the people interviewed approve of the system, fewer even than in 1973. Nearly half oppose it. And another quarter don't even know it exists, though it has been two years since President Ford signed the Metric Conversion Act declaring convention to be national policy.

title: Brazilian Guest at New York Hilton Is Found Slain
description: A man believed to be a Brazilian engineer was found dead yesterday, bound and asphyxiated, in his room at the New York Hilton Hotel. He was identified from a passport and photograph as Roberto Santos, aged 46 years old, of Rio de Janeiro. He had checked into the hotel Nov. 18.

title: lack Musick, 52, Guided Cornell's Football Team To Ivy Crown in 1971
description: John M. (Jack) Musick, who coached Cornell University's football team to its most recent Ivy League championship in 1971, died of cancer Sunday in a hospital n Clear Lake, Tex. He was 52 years old. A protege or Bob Blacitman, cornea present coach, Mr. Musick served at Cornell for nine seasons, from 1966 through 1974. During that span he had five winning and four losing teams with an overall record of 45 victories, 33 defeats and ties.

title: Koch Will Oppose Raises for City Aides
description: Proposed raises for New York City officialsincluding a twostage raise to $80,000 a year for the Mayorwoubi cause enormous psychological problems in negotiating with city labor unions, Mayorelect Edward 1. Koch said yesterday.

title: Lipthitz Sculpture Is Dedicated at Columbia
description: Bellerophon Taming Pegasus, the last and largest monumental sculpture by Jacques Lipchitz, was formally dedicated last evening at Columbia University in the presence of the sculptor's widow. Yulla.

title: People and Business
description: Free trade, and with it the economic and political stability of Western Europe, is being threatened by lowpriced exports from the Communist bloc and technologically sophisticated third world countries, according to Fiancois Ceyrac, oresident of the Patronat. the French National Federation of Industries.

title: $3.1 BILLION DEFICIT IN TRADE SETSRECORD
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Commerce Department reported today a $3.1 billion trade deficit for October. It was the first month in which the excess of the nation's imports over its exports exceeded $3 billion.

title: Waldheim Says Pay Reductions Don't Violate Pact
description: UNITNA) NA HUNS, N.Y., NOV. Zlimecretary General Kurt Waldheim contended through a spokesman today that his controversial decision last week on salary reductions and freezes for staff members in Geneva did not violate a collective bargaining agreement because a clause gave him the option to review salaries on the basis of new income evaluations.

title: ITRUST IMMUNITY ME. IS BARRED HIGH COURT RULING
description: WAHINGTON, Nov. 28The Supreme rejected today the contention of nerican Telephone and Telegraph ny that its farflung communicaletwork is immune from Govern ntitrust prosecution because it is subject to heavy Federal and egulation.

title: Egypt, Somalia Warn Of Threat by Soviet
description: ISMAILIA, Egypt, Nov. 28 (Reuters) Presidents Anwar elSadat of Egypt and Mohammed Siad Barre of Somalia today agreed that the Soviet Union was threatening the security of the area around the Horn of Africa, an Egyptian presidential spokesman said here.

title: Morton Wins a Duel of Quarterbacks
description: DENVER, Nov. 28Because the teams were so even and so good in all other areas, the BaltimoreDenver game here yesterday became a quarterback's contestBert Jones against Craig Morton. To the surprise of many, Morton About Pro Football had the better of the battle as the Broncos won, 2713, because he was the more conservative of the two, while Jones tried to do too much. Jones got greedy, to use a coaching phrase describing a quarterback's sin in the heat of battle. He threw a lot of passes, 46, and the three that were intercepted did in the Colts.

title: Vast Changes in Society Traced To the Rise of Working Women
description: Women who once drew only whistles on the construction site are now drawing union pay. Corporation men are turning down promotions rather than move and lose their wives incomes. Executives with newly militant secretaries find themselves lining up for the coffee wagon.

title: Suspect in Teacher's Kidnapping Is Identified as an Ohio Escapee
description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 28 (UPI)The man accused of kidnapping a suburban Cleveland schoolteacher and holding her is his rented mobile home in Florida for 12 days has been identified as an escapee of the Ohio Reformatory.

title: Badillo, Ronay Menschel, Paterson and Brown, Investigations Head, Are Expected to Be Named
description: Mayorelect Edward I. Koch intends to name David W. Brown, chairman of the State Commission of Investigation, as deputy mayor for planning, rounding out the team of four deputy mayors whose appointments Mr. Koch is scheduled to announce today.

title: Study of 17,000 Men Indicates Vigorous Sports Protect Heart
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 28A study of 17,000 Harvard alumni has found that there were fewer heart attacks among those who engaged regularly in strenuous sports activities like jogging, swimming, tennis and mountain climbing than among those who were less active.

title: Study by GATT Cautions On Use of Protectionism; Adaptationto Shifts Urged
description: GENEVA, Nov. 28Governments of industrialized nations that resort to protectionist measures instead of facilitating the adaptation of their industrial output to shifting world economic relationships are merely postponing the day of reckoning, according to senior economists of the General Aereement on Tariffs and Trade.

title: Propane Gas Clears a Town
description: BATTLE CREEK, Neb., Nov. 28 (AP)All 771 residents of this northeastern Nebraska community were evacuated today after propane gas began to leak from railroad tank car that had derailed nearby. The Nebraska National Guard was called out to guard the deserted streets of the town.

title: Landes Alleged to Have Practiced Law Without Having Certification
description: MINEOLA, L.I., Nov. 28Assemblyman Irwin J. Landes,. a graduate of the Harvard Law School, is under investigation for allegedly practicing law in New York State for the last 27 years without having been certified to do so.

title: Tax Aide Subpoenas Delinquents in Ohio
description: WEST JEFFERSON, Ohio, Nov. 28 (UPI)Tax Director Eileen Campbell has had no success in getting some residents of this Madison County village to fill out their local income tax forms, so she is trying a new tacksubpoenas.

title: ROBERT A. REED
description: FORT WAYNE, Ind., Nov. 28 (UPI)Funeral services will be held Wednesday for Robert A. Reed, former sports editor of The Fort Wayne JournalGazette, Mr. Reed; who died Saturday at the age of 80, retired in 1962 after 40 years as sports editor. He had played baseball and basketball at Indiana University, and he founded the Fort Wayne Golden Gloves boxing tournament and organized the Downtown Quarterback Club.

title: Advertising
description: In his office just before 9 A.M. yesterday Peter Rogers, president and creative director of Peter Rogers Associates, was makMg last  minute preparations for an interview with a prospective client.

title: Koch Plans City Agency to Coordinate Promotion of Arts
description: He'd like to set up an income tax checkoff system for voluntary support of culture, established a central council on the arts, encourage the decoration of subway stations by nearby businesses, make lobbies and hallways of city buildings available for art shows and eliminate Civil Service exams for puppeteers at the Swiss Cottage in Central Park.

title: Lehman and Kuhn Loeb to Merge
description: Lehman Brothers Inc. and Kuhn Loeb & Company, two of the most widely known and oldest investment banking firms on Wall Street, announced plans yesterday to merge.

title: Catskill Dervish Explores Drama of Motion.
description: Catskill Dervish, the latest ensemble effort of the Iowa Theater Lab, has no plot, characters, acting, instrumental music or dancingand for some theatergoers it may seem to have no point. What it does have is movement. This is one hour of intricate. gyrations, a classroom or laboratory exercise expanded into a performance piece. It is created as we watch it.

title: Nets Release Hawkins
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J. Nov,. 28 (UPI) The, New Jersey Nets announced today, that Bubbles Hawkins, who was the star of the National Basketball Association team last season after the de. parture,,of Julius Erving and the loss of Nate Archibald to an injury, has, been given his outright release.

title: Israel to Send 2 Key Aides to Cairo; Begin Urges Other Arabs to Go
description: JERUSALEM, Nov. 28Prime Minister Menahem Begin told the Israeli Parliament today that he would send two key officials to Cairo soon to take part in informal talks called by President Anwar elSadat to prepare for.a fullscale Geneva peace conference.

title: A Second H.E.W. Group Disagrees With Carter on the Abortion Issue
description: WASHINGTON. Nov. 28 (AP)A study group on teenage pregnancy has told the Department of Heal.h, Education and Welfare th t abortions are essential to reduce the numbers of highrisk adolescent births.

title: Dust in London's Subway System At Issue in a Health Controversy
description: LONDON, Nov. 28 (AP)The 74 miles of tunnels in London's subway system are dangerously dusty and need a cleanup, a group of scientists and workers contended today. Operators of the system, however, denied it.

title: 5 Die in Britain as Strike Of Firefighters Continues
description: LONDON, Nov. 28 (AP)Five persons died in separate blazes today, bringing the firerelated death toll to 31 in the first 15 days of a national strike by Britain's firefighters for higher pay.

title: GUILD APPROVES CONTRACT FOR SEATTLE NEWSPAPERS
description: SEATTLE, Nov. 28 (AP)The Pacific Northwest Newspaper Guild has approved a new contract, averting a threatened strike against the city's two daily newspapers.

title: CustoMers of New York Telephone Are Cleared to Hook Up Own Units
description: ALBANY, Nov. 28(AP)A new plan to let New York Telephone Company customers hook up their own phones will take effect Thursday, the Public Service Commission ruled today.

title: LEGISLATIVE STRATEGY MEETING: House and Senate Democratic leaders discussing priorities to take up in reconvening of Congress today. From left are Representa
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28Congress will reconvene tomorrow with the hope of completing final action on the energy package, Federal financing of abortions under Medicaid and Social Security legislation before the current session ends on Dec. 31.
