title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Sullivan County's supervisors don't want the murder trial of the suspected .44caliber killer held in that county. The board unanimously adopted a resolution directing the county attorney to draw up papers explaining the official opposition. Defense lawyers for the suspect, David R. Berkowitz, have asked that the trial be moved from New York City because of the extraordinary publicity surrounding the socalled Son of Sam case. Sullivan County was mentioned as a possible alternative site in court papers.

title: Maine Power Project Backed
description: AUGUSTA, Me., Nov. 28 (UPI)The regional head of the Energy Department said today that the proposed DickeyI incoln hydroelectric project was a viable method of providing energy and lessening New England's dependence on foreign cil. In the center of New England's energy posture we looked at the facts and DickeyLincoln appears to be a viable energy alternative, Robert W. Mitchell said in a telephone interview from his Boston office.

title: About New York
description: The 4year old immigrant boy pounces mindlessly on the couch, stares at the television set, and presses the remote control buttons he holds, making the channel change repeatedly with a zapzap sound. Inevitably, it settles on another lesson about America:

title: Lehman and Kuhn Loeb to Merge
description: Lehman Brothers Inc. and Kuhn Loeb & Company, two of the most widely known and oldest investment banking firms on Wall Street, announced plans yesterday to merge.

title: Doctors Offer Advice For Persons Over 35
description: Physicians advise persons past the age of 35 not to begin a program of rigorous activity without first undergoing a complete physical examination.

title: Trenton Topics
description: TRENTON, Nov. 28Joseph H. Rodriguez, the head of the State Commission of Investigation, failed today to turn over transcripts of an inquiry to the Senate Judiciary Committee looking into allegations that the agency was used for political purposes, and there was increasing speculation that an attempt would be made to curtail the independence of the S.C.I. or let it die when its legislative mandate expired in December 1978.

title: ExManila Senator Avows His Innocence And A sks C ivil Trial
description: MANILA, Nov. 28A former Philippine Senator who was sentenced to death on Friday by a military tribunal appealed fo the Supreme Court today to put an end to drumhead courtsmartial and assert the independence of the judiciary the republic is to be saved.

title: de Deficit and Money Supply actors in Drop of 4.85 for Dow
description: TOKYO, Nov. 2, Fukuda carried ization of his cal to deal with Jape plus and the stei the Japanese yen.

title: Cohesive Sine Nomine Singers Mark 10 Years With Brilliance
description: One of the noteworthy things about Harry Saltzman's Sine Nomine Singers, aside from the fact that the chorus has survived to celebrate its 10th anniversary, is the sheer sustained beauty of its tone.

title: Leaving Lab Coat Behind
description: I'm famous for going around the world with my overnight bag, observed Dr. Rosalyn S. Yalow, this year's Nobel Prize winner for medicine.

title: Assoclattd Press
description: Governor Byrne, center, meeting with members of the State Assembly and Senate in his office in Trenton yesterday.

title: Inmate Killed and Five Hospitalized By Fire in a Kentucky County Jail
description: BOWLING GREEN, Ky., Nov. 28 (UPI) One inmate was killed and five others were hospitalized by a fire that broke out late yesterday in the Warren County Jail, the authorities reported.

title: Spassky and Korchnoi Draw
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Nov. 28 (Agence FrancePresse)The fourth game between Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union and the Soviet expatriate Viktor Korchnoi in the world chess championship challengers final ended in a draw here today. Korchnoi leads 31 in the 20game contest to find a challenger to the world champion, Anatoly Karpov of the Soviet Union.

title: Biko Inquest Renews Interest in Deaths of Other Detainees
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Nov. 27The inquest into the death of Stephen Biko in South Africa, with its revelations about the conduct of security police, has awakened interest in the deaths of other, less wellknown black political detainees in that country.

title: Sorkin Sentenced Up to 3 Years in Jail
description: MINEOLA, LI., Nov. 28Richard Sorkin, the agent for 50 professional hockey and basketball players who admitted having looted their trust accounts of about $1 million for gambling with bookmakers and stockmarket plunges, received a sentence up to three years for grand larceny in Nassau County Criminal Court today.

title: Four Children Die in Fire
description: PINE GROVE, Pa., Nov. 28 (AP)A 6yearold Schuylkill County girl tried to rescue her three brothers from their burning home early today and perished with them, the state police at Pottsville said. Debra Umberger died after she ran back into the house in an attempt to save her brothers, Michael, 2, Daniel, 3, and Mark, 9, who were trapped on the second floor.

title: Jan Yoors, Tapestry Artist, Author And Photographer, Is Dead at 55
description: Jan Yoors, an internationally known artist who worked in tapestry and photography, died Sunday in St. Vincent's Hospital after having suffered a heart attack last Thursday in his home, at 108 Waverly Place. He was 55 years old.

title: Of The Times
description: A DRAGONFLY. By Will D. II. 268 pages. Seabury Press.t asks Will D. Campbell, or less, what's the Chrisampbell tells P. D, East, bastards but God loves us gy goes tms dusth take but it took Preacher southern Mississippi farm o the Baptist ministry at rights activist; field repfor the National Council and now director of the Southern Churchmenfar end up loving the white much as his black victim.

title: Economic scene
description: Rcovery efforts, saying the Carter istration might well study Canaexperience with controls and its ing policy to offset the inflation on taxes. Page 55.

title: PAPER IN HACKENSACK,. YIELDS ON RECORDINGS
description: HACKENSACK, Nov. 28The Record abandoned today its fight to keep possession of its tape recordings of a jailhouse interview with a suspected murderer, Harry De La Roche Jr., and complied with a court order to surrender the tapes.

title: Fashioning a Wardrobe With Odds Ends and Her Own Advice
description: She usually buys expensive shoes, very expensive shoes. But this time was different. DianaMarye Huff was looking around one of her favorite antique clothing stores, Early Halloween, on Ninth Avenue, when she noticed the brown suede shoes. They looked exactly like the shoes Audrey Hepburn wore as a Givenchy model in Funny Face," and so she bought them immediately. They cost $12.

title: 3 Women Spurn Terms Set by Chile For Return Home
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 28Three Chilean women who last week were refused reentry when they tried to go, home today rejected the Chilean Government's offer to allow them back if they signed a statement saying they would refrain from any political activity.

title: Berger in New Post: Consultant for M.A.C.
description: The Municipal Assistance Corporaton announced yesterday it had retained Stephen Berger as a $2,500amonth consultant to assist the corporation with its statutory responsibility to monitor New York City's budget and its compliance with the required financial reforms.

title: HIGH COURT ASKED TO LIMIT NUCLEAR PLANT LICENSES
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)Lawyers for citizens groups asked the United States Supreme Court today to make the Government figure out what to do with nuclear wastes and consider energysaving alternatives before it licenses any more nuclear power plants.

title: Dollar Mixed in Trading Abroad
description: The dollar, which has been eroding steadily against major foreign currencies. closed mixed in Europe in foreignexchange trading yesterday, the Associated Press reported. But the announcement of a recordlevel United States trade deficit is likely to add to the downward pressure on the American currency, traders said.

title: The car you want
description: may be listed today In the Automobile Exchange of The New York Times. See the Sports Pages.

title: The New York Times/Nov. 29, 1977 Guerrilla camps at Chimoio and Tembue were hit by Rhodesians.
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Nov. 28The Rhodesian Government said today that it had carried its fight against black nationalist guerrillas deep inside Mozambique last week, killing at least 1,200 persons, smashing two guerrilla bases and destroying much war materiel.

title: Iraq Seeks Baghdad Meeting
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Nov. 28Iraq called today for a meeting in Baghdad next week of Arab countries and Palestinian guerrilla organizations opposed to President Sadat's contacts with Israel.

title: Trial Begins in Killing of Heiress And Theft of Millions of Dollars
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Nov. 28 (UPI)One of two men charged with killing Marjorie Jackson, an eccentric heiress, last May and stealing millions of dollarsbut feeling even more behindwent on trial today.

title: SmallTown Big Shot Gets Deflated In Melodrama at the Hudson Guild
description: George Sibbald's The Dodge Boys, at the Hudson Guild Theater, has more plot than point. It is a thinly written, poorly constructed melo clyama about the downfall of a smalltown big shot.

title: Spanish Leftists Fight Police Chief's Mourners
description: MADRID, Nov. 28 (UPI)1Mourners returning from the funeral of a police chief slain by Basque separatists clashed with leftist youths today in the center of Pamplona, the capital of the northern province of Navarre. According to initial reports, several persons were injured in the fighting, in which bicycle chains and other weapons were used.

title: Bus Shelters Built Where Advertisers Prefer, Goldin Says
description: The company franchised by the city to build bus shelters has built them only in areas in Manhattan desirable to advertisers, leaving Manhattan and Bronx riders at 500 bus stops to suffer in sleet and snow this winter, Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin said yesterday.

title: Koch Finds Out A Friendly Tour Can Make News
description: My coming to City Hall is not news. Edward 1..Koch protested when a blaze of camera lights greeted, him in the building's rotunda yesterday.

title: Jersey Waste Case to High Court
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Supreme Court agreed today to decide whether New Jersey can, prohibit other states from disposing of solid waste within its borders without interfering unconstitutionally with interstate commerce.

title: Sadat Denies Giving A Kiss to Golda Meir
description: President Anwar elSadat of Egypt last night cleared up a minor mystery of his visit to Israel.

title: Two Welcome Headlines
description: A frontpage headline in the conservative Wall Street Journal for Nov. 28, 1977, reads: Black Jobless Problem/ Still Haunts President/Despite New Programs.

title: Production of Steel Increased 0.8% In the Week to 2.26 Million Tons
description: Steel production for the week ended Nov. 26 increased by 0.8 percent to 2.26 million tons, from 2.25 million tons in the preceding week, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: PRESIDENT OF BURMA IS CAMBODIA'S GUEST
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 28Breaking more than two and a half years of virtually total withdrawal from normal state relations, Cambodia is now entertaining Burma's President, Gen. Ne Win, as an official visitor.

title: News Summary TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 29, 1977
description: Washington is accepting Egypt's bid to attend informal talks in Cairo to pave the way for a Middle East peace conference in Geneva, Administration officials said. They said that a decision on who will represent the United States would be announced. The Administration's acceptance was conveyed to the Soviet Ambassactor,.Anatoly F. Dobrynin, by Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance. Most State Department officials expect Moscow to side with Syria and other Arabs and stay away from the Cairo meeting. [Page 1, Column 6.]

title: U.& SAID TO ACCEPT INVITATION OF EGYPT TO MEETING IN CAIRO
description: SOVIET INFORMED OF DECISION Vance Reported to Urge Moscow to Join in Accepting Sadat's Bid for PreGeneva Conference:WASHINGTON, Nov. 28The Carter Administration decided toddy to join with Israel and accept Egypt's invitation to attend informal talks in Cairo to prepare the way for the convening of a Middle East peace conference in. Geneva, Administration officials said.

title: Bridge: Quintet With 2 New Yorkers Wins Last Big Event of Year
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 28The last big event of the 1977 bridge year was won here last night by a quintet that included two New York experts, Alan Greenberg and Jim Cayne. They are stockbrokers with the firm of Bear, Stearns & Company, as is a third member of the team, Jim Jacoby of Dallis.

title: Indian Cyclone Death Toll 20,000; Homeless Put at Over 2 Million
description: VIJAYAWADA, India, Nov.28 )UPI)The death toll from the cyclone and tidal wave that devastated India's Andhra Prade3h state on Nov. 19 has been estimated at 20,000, the Indian national news Agency Samachar said today.

title: Knick's Box Score; KNICKS (104)
description: HOUSTO'l 1861

title: Article 4  No Title
description: STORM CONTINUES EAST: A major storm that dumped up to seven inches of snow in Upper Middle Western states last Friday and then blanketed Ohio over the.

title: Petrolane Lifts Common to 22c
description: Petrolane Inc. announced that its boards of directors have increased the quarterly common dividend to 22 cents a share from 18 cents, payable Dec. 28 to holders of record Dec. 9. The company is the largest independent distributor of lique fied petroleum gas in the nation.

title: Notes on People
description: Edward Glerek, chairman of the Polsh Communist Party, arrived in Rome yesterday for a threeday Official visit hat will include a meeting in the Vatian with Pope Paul VI. He will be the first Polish Communist leader to meet with the Pontiff, although 80 percent of the Polish people are Roman Catholies. Mr. Gierek's audience with the Pope is set for Thursday, but he was welcomed at the airport yesterday by Monsignor Domenico de Luca of the Vatican Secretariat of State as well as by Italian Prime Minister Giulio Andreotti. While in Italy Mr. Gierek will sign several trade agreements, including one by which Italy will supply Poland with Fiat car engines.

title: Soviet Warns Ships in the Pacific About Missile Launchings Dec. 1.10
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 28 (AP)The Soviet Union will launch missiles into two areas of the North Pacific, east of Japan, from Dec. 1 to 10, the press agency Tass said today.

title: Gulf Executive Pleads No Contest
description: PITTSBURGH, Nov. 28 (AP)A Gulf Oil Corporation executive pleaded no contest today to Federal charges that he illegally gave vacation trips to an Internal Revenue Service auditor on the company's behalf.

title: Pittsburgh, Penn State Dominate AllEast Squad
description: Despite losing the battle for the Lambert Trophy and last Saturday's game, 1513, to its crossstate rival, Penn State, Pittsburgh outgained the Nittany Lions for berths on the United Press International All  East college football team, announced yesterday.

title: Thomas Carey Sings Brahms
description: There is no mystery concerning the neglect of Brahms's Die schone Magelone compared to the roughly similar song cycles of Schubert and Schumannit isn't nearly as good. Not only is there less subtlety and variety than in Die Winterreise or Dichterliebe, but Brahms's 15 songs aren't really selfsufficient. In effect, they make up incidental music for a separate text; what is worse, they fail to provide the finely drawn progression of feeling that unifies the great Schubert and Schumann sets.

title: Torsney's Insanity Defense Linked To Fact Slaying Victim Had No Gun
description: The lawyer defending Police Officer Robert Torsney, who is accused of killing a Brooklyn youth on Nov. 25, 1976, told a jury yesterday that the fact that the victim had no gun was very important because if there was no gun, this man is sick.

title: New Agency Sought By Amerada Hess
description: Although it is not talking about it, the Amerada Hess Corporation is looking for a new ad agency.

title: DOCTOR IN BIKO CASE NOT TOLD OF INJURIES
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Nov. 28A Government doctor who examined Stephen Biko a few hours before his death in a Pretoria prison cell testified today that he had not been informed of the results of earlier medical tests showing that the black leader probably was suffering from brain damage.

title: Death Toll 8 in East German Blast
description: BERLIN, Nov. 28 (AP)The death toll from the explosion of a steam locomotive at an East German railroad station rose to eight today, the official East German press agency A.D.N. reported. The explosion, which set the first passenger car afire, occurred yesterday as a train from East Berlin was entering the Bitterfeld station outside Halle, 72 miles southwest of Berlin.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The United States Steel Corporation said yesterday that it had been able to greatly shorten the time needed to make an environmental impact study for a huge proposed steel mill near Conneaut, Ohio.

title: Study of 17,000 Men Indicates Vigorous Sports Protect Heart
description: MIAMI BEACH, Nov. 28A study of 17,000 Harvard alumni has found that there were fewer heart attacks among those who engaged regularly in strenuous sports activities like jogging, swimming, tennis and mountain climbing than among those who were less active.

title: Book Helps With Books That Help
description: The Secret Power of Pyramids! Be Your Own Doctor! You Can Master Disease! Salvation Through Sex!

title: Miss McBride Brings Down House at AllAmerica Night
description: Somebody at the New York City Ballet came up with a redwhiteandblue program of allAmerican popular music Sunday night to close the company's brief repertory season before its monthlong Nutcracker engagement.

title: Asscid Rejects Sadat Effort, Saying It Delays Peace
description: DAMASCUS, Nov. 28President Hafez AlAssad of Syria categorically rejected today Egypt's dialogue with Israel and said it would only prolong the conflict in the Middle East.

title: W.H.A. Disciplines 8 For Roles in Brawl
description: HARTFORD, Nov. 28Two World Hockey Association players were fined and suspended and six others were fined by the league today as the result of a benchclearing brawl during the New EnglandEdmonton game here last Saturday.

title: Bruins Sport AwardWinning Defense
description: Perhaps recognizing a trend in the style of play adopted by its most successful teams over the last four years, the National Hockey League added an award last week. The trophy will be presented annually to a forward who AboutPro Hockey excels in the defensive aspects of the game. The trophy is named in honor of Frank J. Selke, a former Montreal Canadiens general manager and Toronto Maple Leafs player.

title: Jordan Responds to Egypt
description: AMMAN, Nov. 28 (Reuters)Jordan announced tonight that, it could attend a meeting in Cairo called by President Anwar elSadat of Egypt only if the talks were attended by all theparties to the Middle East conflict.

title: Reforming The Drug Agency
description: The Justice Department's Drug Enforcement Administration, formed in 1973 to lead President Nixon's War on drugs, is one Government agency that has escaped postWatergate reform. Despite mounting evidence that the nation's drugenforcement program is both misdirected and abusive, Congress has neglected to act. The Drug Enforcement Administration continues to operate virtually without constraint in this country and in 79 more.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: Merely to avoid embarrassment in the international politics of whale conservation, the U.S. Government has traded off the constitutional rights of American citizens. In bringing the International Whaling Commission to place a moratorium on Inupiat subsistence bowhead whaling, it has violated its trustee responsibility to protect the culture and subsistence hunting rights of aboriginal American natives.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: ROME, Nov. 28 (UPI)A surgeon who performed an autopsy today on Bob Elmore said a narcotics overdose was the likely cause of death, but it would take several days to complete a laboratory analysis and come up with a definite finding. Friends said if heroin was the cause of Elmore's death, it probably was the first time he was taking it.

title: Vance to Attend NATO Meeting
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 28 (AP)Secre tary of State Cyrus R. Vance will attend a meeting of the North Atlantic Council, the North Atlantic Treaty Organization's highest authority, on Dec. 8 and 9 in Brussels, a State Department spokesman said today.

title: Dave Anderson
description: Not too long ago Red Holzman was revered as a basketball brain, the coach of the New York Knicks in 1973 and 1970, when they won National Basketball Association championships. On the bench, Walt Frazier once said, Red knows everything that's going on. He's at his best when we're at our worst. But the world turns. Willis Reed has succeeded Red Holzman as coach. And the brain is now listed as the Knicks consultant. Red's current duties, declares the Knicks yearbook, will revolve around player evaluations.

title: Thomas E. Mullaney
description: MONTREALThe Canadian recovery frog! the recession of 197475 has been lafted and tortuous in contrast to the robust pattern in the United States. From the middle of 1976, for example, to the end of this year's third out, ruel, Canada's gross national The product has grown less than 2 percent and will probEconomic ably continue to run in low Scene gear for some time.

title: Engineer of a Wall St. Merger
description: Barely tour years into a new camel as an investment banker, Peter G. Peterson yesterday became the prospective chairman and president of the combined securities firms of Lehman Brothers and Kuhn Loeb & Company. Since tha Wall Jllerl. lal1UOL4lpG la with securities firms that Man could not make a go of it in an increasingly competiin the Live environment, Mr. PeNews terson, who engineered the merger from his seat a top.

title: Hnueilings
description: BAUERTiborAn unveiling of the Bauer tombstone & a memorial service will be held at Mr. Hebron Cemetery, Long Island Expressway, Flushing, NY on Sunday, December 4 at 11:30 on the grounds of Macho& lah Grave #50, Line x2 Block 120. Mr. Tibor Bauer was born in Budapest, Hungary on May 18, 1906. He was the son of the late Joseph & Regina Bauer & came to the United States in 1940. He was a US citizen & served in the military service of the United States during WWII for years, recieving an honorable discharge In 1945. Mr. Bauer received his Bachelor of Science degree from NY University in 1949 & his Masters Degree of Business Administration in 1955 from New York University Graduate School of Business. He became a Certified Public Accountant in 1950. Mr. Bauer was a member in good standing of The American Institute of Certified Public Accountants & of The New York State Society of Certified Public Accountants. He was a member of several committees of the NY State Society of Certified Public Accountants & eventually became a committee chairman. Mr. Bauer was predeceased by 3 brothers, Julius, Bela, & Laszlo. He is survived by Livia & Marla Bauer, sistersInlaw, Marika, Emma & Judy Bauer, nieces, & Joseph W. Ba& John J.

title: Fresh Tremors Shake Argentina

title: Upper Voltans Approve Constitution

Referendum results released today by the Interior Ministry for 2,081 of the country's 2,991 polling stations showed 1,746,598 votes in favor and 22,890 against.

The wife of Richard Wyse, a former Newsday editor, she moved there with him on his retirement in 1970 but continued to write her column until her own retirement last April. She was 69 years old.

Two previous Goldstein trials have been held, with one ending in a mistrial and the other ending in conviction that was later overturned because of prejudicial statements made by the prosecutor.

Averell Harriman and former dean of the New York Law School.

Xrays on his ankle were negative but Coach Bobby Leonard wants to give the ankle time to heal completely. Leonard hopes to have Williamson back in the lineup against Chicago on Friday.

title: Organ: Artistry Of Gillian Weir

title: Golfer Shot as He Tees Off
description: CORONA, Calif., Nov. 28 (UPI)  A golfer who was shot as he was about to tee off in a tournament today was reported in satisfactory condition at local hospital. The golfer was apparently the victim of a stray bullet that was fired during target practice. The bullet hit Soji Sakai, 33 years old, of Torrance, Calif., in the shoulder, penetrated his lung and lodged an inch from his heart.

title: No Troopers in South Boston High For the First Time in Three Years

description: Boris Amarantov, Soviet mime, has arrived in New York after a twoyear attempt to gain exit visa. Yesterday, he rejoiced at being able to perform here, and gave  in mime  first impressions of a snowy New York City.

description: The person who is dying or cancer usually needs protection from pain and fear. It would seem more than frivolous to argue that this person, with perhaps weeks or days to live, has an even greater need for protection from drug addiction. Yet tnat is now the situation must appear News to many cancer patients and Analysis their families.

title: Carter to Go Abroad Next Month
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29  President Carter's foreign trip is to begin late next month whether Congress enacts energy legislation by then or not, a White House spokesman said today.

title: The New York Times/Neal Boenzl MAKING SANTA FEEL. AT HOME: The season's first real snow fell on New York yesterday, but later turned to leaving no trace. More rain, heavy at times, is expected for today and tomorrow, with milder temperatures.

description: The Dallas Cowboys are the only team in the National Football League to have clinched one of the eight places in the playoffs. By then Dallas officials realized their team was home free with three regularseason games still to be played.

title: Advertising
description: There is no end in sight for the public's mistrust of business and trying to change that attitude with advertising would probably be counter productive. The only way business can halt the plunge of its stock of public confidence is to change its own behavior, but this it won't do.

title: Bulletproof Vest Saves A Transit Officer Knifed In Fight at Subway Stop
description: A bulletproof vest a Transit Authority policeman promised his wife he would always wear while on the job saved the officer from stab wounds yesterday afternoon as he was breaking up a fight on a crowded subway platform.

title: Red Smith
description: When a baseball team invests $3,155,000 in a free agent named Larry Hisle or $2,850,000 in one like Oscar Gamble, some reactions are predictable. The free agent can be relied on to buy a RollsRoyce, hire a tax attorney, subscribe to the Wall Street Journal and register Republican. The owner of the club that hires him is guaranteed to take bows as the paragon of selfless sportsmanship and announce that his team is now the social, economic and artistic peer of any other, not excluding the Yankees with their storebought

title: Long Is Firm on Energy Legislation
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Backers of President Carter's energy program tried today to persuade Senator Russell B. Long that he and the oil industry needed energy legislation, especially an increase in the price of natural gas, more than they did.

description: Leaking gas fumes that caused evacuations and hospital treatment were reported in four states yesterday.

description: CRANSMONTANA, Switzerland, Nov. 29 (Reuters)Fabienne Serrat of France, the women's world giant slalom champion, won a World Series special slalom today with a combined time for two runs of 1 minute 43.79 seconds.

title: Brokers
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 29When they weren't speculating about Wall Street mergers or fretting about Government regulatory moves, the Securities Industry Association members arriving today for their annual convention talked about people. And one of those talked about most was William M. Batten.

title: U.S, GROUP PROPOSES $250 MILLION FUND TO MODERNIZE STEEL
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29An interagency task force set up to deal with probems of the steel industry sent a preliminary summary dr its report to the White House today, proposing? $20 million program of Federal aid for communities hit by steel layoffs and a $250 million revolving loan guarantee fund to provide fresh capital for modernizing the industry.

title: Bringing Eels to U.S. Tables Proves a Slippery Goal
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn.The basement laboratory seems like the setting for a movie about a mad scientist. At the bottom of a rickety staircase, there are rows of tanks with silently churning water. Fluorescent lights cast enough glow to illuminate the snakelike creatures gliding restlessly from side to side in the tanks. A steady hum of pumps drones on.

title: Nets Are Seeking to Void Jersey Pact With Knicks
description: The Nets have asked that the $4 million settlement reached with the Knicks allowing them to move to New Jersey be vacated.

title: 10 Oil Concerns Given Permission To Drill Off New York and Jersey
description: The Federal Environmental Protection Agency has granted final permits to 10 major oil companies enabling each to begin drilling one exploratory oil well off the New York and New Jersey coats as early as Jan. 3.

title: Music: 4 Guitars Sing as One
description: CELEDONIO ROMERO evidently believes in what may well be an old Spanish adage: The family that plays guitars together stays together. He seems to be right, too, for over the last 15 years he and his three sons, Celin, Pepe and Angel, have been a frequent and winning combination in the concert hall, whether playing singly, in pairs or all four at once.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The New York State Banking Superintendent, Muriel Siebert, said yesterday that her department would seek again next year to get the Legislature to outlaw redlining by the refusal of banks to grant mortgages in povertystricken and other areas they consider financially risky.

title: I.R.S. Said to Urge Tightening On Foreign Tax Credits for Oil
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Internal Revenue Service has recommended a tightening of the controversial use of foreign tax credits by American oil compnflies, but it Is doubtful that any change resulting from the recommendation would lead to a significant revenue gain for the Treasury, authoritative sources said today.

title: Two Frontrunners Are Emerging In Race for Badillo's House Seat
description: Two state legislators of Puerto Rican extractionSenator Robert Garcia and Assemblyman Jose E. Serranoemerged yesterday as early frontrunners for the Bronx Congressional seat that Herman Badillo will vacate on Jan. 1.

title: William Paul Durkin, 64; Retired Chief Engineer For Radio Station WHN
description: William Paul Durkin, who retired two years ago as chief enginer at WHN, died Monday at St. Joseph's Hospital in Stamford, Conn., after a long illness. He was 64 years old and lived at 564 Scofieldtown Road in Stamford.

title: New York Sets Rebates For Counties That Pared Ineligible Aid Recipients
description: Counties in New York State that have reduced the number of ineligible welfare recipients to 5 percent or less of their caseloadsall 57 counties outside New York Citywill receive rebates totaling $10.5 million from the state this week, Governor Carey announced yesterday.

title: Vorster's Party Expects Biggest Victory Ever as Whites Vote Today
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 29White South Africans vote in a general election tomorrow that is expected to give Prime Minister John Vorster's National Party its biggest victory in 29 years in power despite grave domestic and international problems caused by policies that subordinate blacks.

title: Inquiry Finds Fraud in RaceHorse Switch
description: New York racing investigators have established to their satisfaction that the horse that ran and won at Belmont Park last September as the longshot Lebon was actually the Uruguayan champion Cinzano, and that Dr. Mark J. Gerard was the hidden owner of the horse.

Nevertheless, unilateral strategy sessions among leaders of both the United Mine Workers and the mine owners continued to debar a facetoface Meeting as the strike deadline moved closer.

title: Swedish Princesses May Receive Equal Right to Succeed to Throne
description: STOCKHOLM, Nov. 29 (UPI)The Swedish Government has approved a report by a special commission calling for the monarch's firstborn child, whether male or female, to be first in line of succession.

title: Wine Talk
description: WHEN WE TALK of alternatives to the highpriced wines of Bordeauxthe famous wines of the Medoc and St. Emilionwe tend to think of other countries: Spain, Italy, the United States. For some reason, we usually ignore the fact that some extremely good wines, authentic clarets at that, are produced right in the center of the Bordeaux region and sold at very reasonable prices.

title: Anaconda Talks Broken Of
description: BOSTON, Nov. 29 (AP)A fourhour meeting between negotiators of Anaconda Brass Division and three striking unions ended today with the sides still far from an agreement to settle a 60day walkout in six plants. William Hannon, a Federal mediator, said no date was set for another meeting, adding, They're far apart. A total of 2,500 employees went on strike Oct. 1 against plants in Ansonia and Waterbury, Conn., Buffalo, Detroit, Kenosha, Wis., and Los Angeles. They manufacture nonferrous alloys, sheet, wire, rod and tubing.

description: CLEVELAND, Nov. 29 (UPI)Members of the Cleveland Teachers Union have voted overwhelmingly not to work without pay, Eugene Kolach,, president of the union, said tonight.

title: Killed in Fire at Log Home
description: PRIEST RIVER, Idaho, Nov. 29 (AP)A woman and five children died today when fire destroyed their log home as the father of the family watched, the authories In Bonners County said. The father iscovered the fire and tried to awaken is family, said Gordon Sundquist, a eputy. He rushed to the door and hought the family was behind him. hen the father, William Ackerman, ripened the door to the house, oxygen rushed in and the house became an inferno, Mr. Sundquist said.

description: TRENTON, Nov. 29Assembly Speaker William J. Hamilton Jr., Democrat of New Brunswick, today scheduled a vote for Thursday on a bill to allow 197879 publicschool budgets to increase by an additional $50 millionpossibly enough to forestall several looming teacher strikes.

Johnson Jr. of Alabama asked President Carter today to withdraw his name from nomination as Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation because of his health problems, thus reopening the Administration's long efforts to fill the lawenforcement post.

title: DallasDenver Time Reset

The game, which will be televised by NBC (Channel 4 in New York), has been a sellout for more than a month.

description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI)The Treasury Department announced today it had begun investigations involving six European nation for allegedly selling sheet steel in the United States below cost.

description: Eight lame  duck appointments by Mayor Beame won the narrow consent of the City Council yesterday, but not before harsh advice was offered the Mayor and some of the candidates.

title: 60 Minute Gourmet

title: Harvester's Net Up 59% in Quarter
description: The International Harvester Company, a leading agricultural equipment maker and producer of trucks anti construction equipment, reported yesterday a 59 percent jump in earnings for the ?? ended Oct. 31 on a 10.5 percent sales gain.

title: Bridge:
description: For American bridgeplayers as a whole, the word Reisinger suggests the national team championship played annually at the Fall Nationals on bdard  a  match lines. This prestige event is half a century old, but it has borne its present name since 1965, when a new trophy honoring the late Curt Reisinger was put into play.

title: Report Is Critical Of Vesco Lawyers
description: A report sharply critical of a prominent Washington law firm that once represented Robert L. Vesco, the financier who is now a fugitive in Costa Rica, was released yesterday over the strenuous objections of the firm, Hogan & Hartson.

title: Best Buys
description: FIRST, the news for those who do their shopping now, rather than at the end of the week: you rummage around in supermarket freezers; it may still be possible to come up with a turkey carrying last week's exceptionally attractive sale price.

title: A New Most Wanted List
description: One of the Carter Administration's most promising appointments has now had to be withdrawn. In intellect, experience and devotion to the rule of law, Frank Johnson personifies the ideal director for the Federal Bureau of Investigation as it approaches a new phase in its history. That he could not now, for reasons of health, take the job is a misfortune. Yet Judge Johnson, whose full recovery from major surgery is still months away, was wise to withdraw. Reshaping and revitalizing the agency will be hard enough for a director able to exercise full energies.

title: What's in Chancellor's Future?
description: EXECUTIVES of the National Broadcasting Company yesterday made somewhat conflicting statements on the status of John Chancellor as anchorman of the NBC Nightly News.

title: A Raided Camp in Mozambique Buries Victims
description: MAPUTO, Mozambique, Nov. 28Smoke was still rising from smoldering ruins at a Rhodesian guerrilla transit camp, over the weekend when a group of reporters reached it from Maputo.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I recently saw reference in French cookbook to a blanc legume, wihch sounds like a white vegetable. Can you tell me what it is?

title: U. S. Handing Back to Japan Vast Air Base That Was Key to Military Operations in Asia
description: TACHIKAWA, Japan, Nov. 27.The paint is peeling now. The houses are empty and so are the barracks. The basketball hoops are gone. The unused ropes on the flagpoles bang forlornly in the winds. And grass grows on the runways.

title: Corporation Affairs
description: The Equitable Life Assurance Society of the United States announced that it has completed the purchase of 13 office buildings, three parking garages and one subordinated ground lease in six major cities from the Tishman Realty and Construction Company. The purchase price totals about $200 million including assumption of mortgage debt.

title: All About: Picking Out a Pipe
description: They can be covered with pigskin, garnished with gold, and made of marbled and brightly colored plastics or complicated inner tubing dubbed sys tems. They come in every kind of wood  stained red, brown, black, orange and a variety of colors in between  and can have rough, Volcanic finishes or be slickly smooth with lacquer. And with prices ranging from 50 cents to $1,000, tobacco pipes never cease to dazzle and bewilder this country's 7.3 million nine smokers.

title: TEACHERS IN JERSEY SENTENCED TO JAIL
description: MOUNT HOLLY, N. J., Nov. 29Ten leaders of 1,200 striking Willingboro teachers and custodial employees were sentenced to jail today for defying a backtowork order, three weeks after Governor Byrne commuted the jail sentences for contempt of 106 striking teachers in Matawan.

title: SOVIET INFORMS U.S. IT WON'T TAKE PART IN PARLEY AT CAIRO
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Soviet Union told the United States today that it would not participate in the informal talks in Cairo in preparation for convening a Geneva conference even as the Carter Administration announced that it would attend.

title: High Court Urged To Uphold Sex Bias In Indian Custom
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Supreme Court was urged today to preserve Indian culture and tradition by upholding tribal ordinance that openly discriminates against the children of women who marry Outside the tribe.

title: Japan Ready to Cut Its Tariffs 40% Over 8 Years for Trade Accord
description: GENEVA, Nov. 29Japan announced today that it was ready to cut its tariffs by an average of 40 percent over eight ears as pantof the projected international pact on the lowering of world trade barriers now under negotiation here.

title: Park Lawyer Says Korean Kept Diary of His Financial Dealings
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI)Tongsun Park kept a diary in 1972 describing his alleged financial dealings with members of Congress and other American officials his lawyer said today.

title: CRITICIZED AIDE GETS HIGHER TRANSIT POST
description: A man who gave up his post as director of subway and bus operations in a 1971 shakeup at the New York City Transit Authority and who was criticized in a 1974 audit for questionable expenseaccount billings has been selected to head the authority's bus operations, officials confirmed yesterday.

title: Metropolitan CrossCountry
description: INTERCOLLEGIATE INDIVIDUAL LEADERS At Van CoriIandt Park

title: Gromyko Attacks Cairo Plan
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 297Foreign. Minister Andrei A. Gromyko, in the first official Soviet statement on the Middle East since President Anwar elSadat's trip to Jerusalem, deplored Egypt's initiatives today.

title: House Unit Discloses Korean Plan To Manipulate U.S. Organizations
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29A House subcommittee disclosed today a 1976 plan by the South Korean Central Intelligence Agency to manipulate the Ford. Administration, Congress, American news organizations, academicians and the clergy to Seoul's advantage, overtly and covertly.

title: GEORGE H. WALKER JR., 72; INVESTMENT BANKER, DIES
description: George Herbert Walker Jr., an investment banker and former executive of the New York Mets, died yesterday at his home in Greenwich, Conn. He was 72 years old.

title: Dock Workers Accept a New Pact And Return From 60Day Walkout
description: Striking dock workers voted overwhelmingly yesterday to accept a new master contract and local agreements, bringing to an end the walkout that had paralyzed container shipping from Maine to Texas for 60 days.

title: SUMMATIONS ENDED IN BARNES DRUG CASE
description: Summations were completed yesterday in the twomonth trial of Leroy (Nicky) Barnes and 13 other men on charges that they took part in a conspiracy responsible for the sale of millions of dollars of heroin and cocaine in Harlem.

title: The Program
description: PHILADELPHIA ORCHESTRA, Ritcardo Muti, conductor. At Carnegie Hall.

title: U.S. Return of Crown To Hungary Protested
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)Hundreds of HungarianAmericans marched in a cold rain to the White House today to protest the planned return of the Crown of St. Stephen to Hungary.

title: Iowa Town Is Sold On Bid of $587,000
description: HURSTVILLE, Iowa, Nov. 29 (UPI)The town of Hurstvilleall 23 houses, a tavern, store, warehouse and city hall was sold today for $587,000, some $400,000 less than Laurel Summers asked for the town he owned for nearly 30 years.

title: Carter News, Parley On TV This Morning
description: President Carter's news conference this morning will be telecast live by the three networks, and their local stations on ChanneIS 2;4 anc11. The news conference, which isischeduled, to begin at 10:30 A.M., will also be broadcast on radio stations WCBSAM, WINS, WMCA and WNYCAM.

title: A U. S. Official Accuses News Media Of Unproved Notions About Aliens
description: I ouis Nuez, the acting director of the United States Commission on Civil Rights, said yesterday that the news media, especially newspapers, had fostered commonly held notions about undocumented workers through inaccurate reports of their economic impact, their abuse of Government aid and their criminal activities.

title: Prices of Commodity Futures
description: Tuesday, November 29, 1977

title: MEAL FUND OF POLICE HELD SUBJECT TO TAX
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Supreme Court ruled today that meal allowances paid to members of the New Jersey state police, ranging from $1,740 to $2,136 a year, represent income on which they must pay Federal taxes.

title: Narcissism In the Me Decade
description: ANN ARBOR, MICH,

title: From Stems to Bowls
description: There are few pipe shops in the metropolitan area that are selfcontained; that is, where you can have pipes made to order, have pipes repaired on the premises and where tobaccos can be blended to suit any individual's taste. These pipe shops also sell their own btsnds of tobaccos, which are often less expensive than, commercial products'.

title: ETHEL REPASS AMBACH
description: Ethel Repass Ambach, the mother of Gordon M. Ambach, the New York State Education Commissioner, died Monday in Brookline, Mass., after a long illness. She was 77 years old. Mrs. Ambach had taught elementary grades in both public and nonpublic schools for more than 40 years in South Dakota, Illinois, Rhode Island and Massachusetts.

title: Judge Johnson Withdraws Bid For F.B.I. Post
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29Federal District Judge Frank M. Johnson Jr. of Alabama asked President Carter today to withdraw his name from nomination as Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation because of his health problems, thus reopening the Administration's long efforts to fill the lawenforcement post.

title: APL's Takeover Bid Puts Pabst In a Froth It Prefers Freedom
description: Row does it feel to have an unwelcome admirer?

title: Mr. Koch's Cast of Equals
description: In selecting four of his six deputies, New York's Mayorelect Edward Koch has dealt impressively with an important political problem and left himself with a growing management problem. Herman Badillo and Basil Paterson are outstanding public servants and assets to any governmental enterprise. Together with David Brown and Ronay Menschel, the other designated deputies, they also represent a delicate balance, by race, sex and ethnicity, that should go far to broaden Mr. Koch's political reach and base of support. The still open question, however, is whether the team of equals that Mr. Koch envisions will be able effectively to run the city.

title: More Christmas Gifts
description: Continued from Preceding Page

title: World News Briefs
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Nov. 29 (AP)President Ne Win of Burma, the first head Of state to visit Cambodia since the Communist victory there in April 1975, returned to Rangoon today.

title: SOVIET INFORMS U.S. IT WON'T TAKE PART IN PARLEY AT CAIRO
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Soviet Union told the United States today that it would not participate in the informal talks in Cairo in preparation for convening a Geneva conference even as the Carter Administration announced that it would attend.

title: For Holiday Baking: Cookies, Cookies, Cookies
description: Last Sunday marked the beginning of the Advent observance, that preChristmas celebration that begins on the fourth Sunday before the big day itself. Throughout Europe, and most especially in Germany, Austria and Scandinavia, it is the special time in which to do holiday baking.

title: Roses in November for Holman As City College Renames Gym
description: City college threw a bouquet to Nat Holman last night by naming its 3,500seat gymnasium after its forniei ketball coach, the most famout figure in The school's 130year hiStory.

title: Personal Health
description: George knew the doctors had exhausted their repertory of promising treatments, and that his remaining time on earth was short. But when he conveyed this understanding to his family, they goaded him, Come on, what are you talking about? There's plenty more drugs where those came from. You'll see, you'll be better in no time. As the days wore on and George got sicker and sicker, he became silent and depressed, unable to talk to the people he most loved because they refused to acknowledge his imminent, inevitable death.

title: Italian Editor, Shot by Leftists Two Weeks Ago, Dies in Hospital
description: TURIN, Italy, Nov. 29 (AP)A. Turin newspaper editor shot by leftist guerrillas died in a hospital today.

title: Anna Kisselgoff Chief Dance Critic
description: THE APPOINTMENT of Anna Kisselgoff as chief dance critic of The New York Times was announced yesterday by A. M. Rosenthal, executive editor. She replaces Clive Barnes, who resigned from The Times last week.

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: THIS IS the season you are invited everywhere, which means you are invited to many places you do not want to go. Therefore, this is also the season of excusesof reasons true and untruewhy you do not go everywhere you are invited, and why you do not do everything you are asked. A really good excuse must be tactful, and, if it is untrue, it must be so wildly improbable, or have, such an aura of truth about it, that no one wotild ever doubt it.

title: Koch's Corporation Counsel
description: It may surprise rnany people that a political professional such as Edward I. Koch has a former law partner, and a friend for 13 years, who can say, I've never been a member of a political club or organization in any way

title: Stage: Esther
description: WITH ALL the potted plants and foliage dripping from hanging urns, the stage could have been set for Cocoanuts or a travesty of Ali Baba and the 40 Thieves. Unfortunately, the play that opened last night at the Promenade Theater was Carol K. Mack's Esther, a deadly earnest new Old Testament drama.

title: L.I. Golfer Wins Club Event
description: BOCA RATON, Fla., Nov. 29 (AP)Bill Davis of Old Westbury, LI., shot a twooverpar 74 in heavy winds and rain today to win the third event of the P.G.A. club professional tournament series by six strokes. Davis, whose 66 at Boca West Country Club yesterday was the lowest score since the series began two weeks ago, collected $3,000 for his fourunderpar 140.

title: Rock: Meat Loaf Salty, Bombastic and Popular
description: MEAT LOAF is the rather graceless name that a large rock performer has chosen for both himself and for the band built around his singing and the songwriting and keyboard playing of a man named Jim Steinman. Recently the two put out a debut album called Bat Out of Hell that has been well received by some writers and radiostation personalities, and their twonight stand at the Bottom Line Sunday and Monday was sold out in advancelargely because of Meat Loaf's cult following from his portrayal of Eddie in The Rocky Horror Picture Show.

title: Inoculations in Elizabeth
description: Public health authorities must today inoculate 650 high school students in Elizabeth, the last of 2,750 students in the city's public schools who showed no record of vaccinations when the school year began, or be suspended on orders from the state.

title: Why Did Badillo Give Up Seat?; He's Taking a $10,000 Cut as a Deputy Mayor, But He May be Gaining Citywide Constituency
description: The question, that everyone in political circles was asking yesterday was why Herman Badillo would give up a sate seat in the House of Representatives to become one more Deputy Mayor in someone else's administration at a $10,000ayear pay cut. To hear Mr. Badillo tell it, I'm interNews ested in visible changes, not Analysis in titles. But political observers believe that Mr. Badillo may have concluded that as a Representative he was at a political dead end, having twice run for Mayor and failed. With his new job he may be able to establish a citywide constituency and end his Wage as a Puerto Rican politician with appeal mainly to Puerto Ricans.

title: Roses in November for Holman As City College Renames Gym
description: City College threw a bouquet to Nat Holman last night by naming its 3,500seat gymnasium after its former basketball coach, the most famous sports figure in the school's 130year history.

title: Upheavals Among Smith Alumnae Illustrate Role Changes
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass.Most of the young women who left the picturesque Smith campus 22 years ago with the advice given them in Adlai E. Stevenson's commencement addressthat their task in life was to make good cultured homes for their active ambitious husbandsfollowed it, at least for a while.

title: Anais Nin's Publisher Gives $10,000 to Fund
description: The Anais Nin Memorial Fellowship Fund, established to honor the writer who died early this year, has received a gift of $10,000 from Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, Miss Nin's publisher.

title: Roosevelt
description: Horses listed In order of Post positions Letter designates OTB listing

title: Suit Over Fatal Fire Limited
description: NEWPORT, Ky., Nov. 29 (AP)The City of Southgate cannot be sued for financial damages arising from the May 28 Beverly Hills Supper Club fire in which 164 persons died, a Campbell County Cir. cult Court Judge, John Diskin, ruled today. The city had been named as defendant In many of the suits filed sine( the blaze. Damages being sought tote more than $1.5 billion,

title: South African Opposition Party Finds Itself in a Losing Battle
description: JOHANNESBURG, Nov. 29From her 10thfloor downtown apartment here; Marjorie Railing can see almost all the way to Soweto, the black community that put South Africa on front pages around the world last year.

title: Dock Workers Accept a New Pact And Return From 60Day Walkout
description: Striking dock workers voted overwhelmingly yesterday to accept a new master contract and local agreements, bringing to an end the walkout that had paralyzed container shipping from Maine to Texas for 60 days.

title: Racist Assails Alabama Aide On Extradition
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 29The selfstyled white racist J. B. Stoner, who was indicted in a 1958 bombing near a black church in Birmingham, Ala., mounted only a meager legal defense against extradition today but unleashed a torrent of racial abuse against Attorney General Bill Baxley of Alabama, the man who managed to bring charges against him after almost 20 years.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 30,000 Ford Vehicles Recalled
description: WASFINGTON, Nov. 29 (AP)The Ford Motor Company is recalling about 30,000 1978 light trucks and vans to correct a potential fuel leak, the Transportation Department announced today. Models involved are FI00, F150, F250 and F340 light trucks; E100, E150, E250 and E350 Econoline vans, and E100, E150 and E250 Club Wagons, all equipped with 300 CID engines and Car terIV carburetors.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: PITTSBURCH, Nov. 29 (AP)The Pittsburgh Penguins today traded Pierre Larouche, a center, to the Montreal Canadiens for Pete Mahovlich, also a center, and Pete Lee, a minor league player.

title: Mysterious Eruptions Recorded By a Powerful Scanner in Space
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The most powerful and diverse scanner of highenergy radiation yet sent into space has recorded a number of distant eruptions of unknown origin.

title: DOW DROPS BY 1230 ON REPORT THAT OPEC WEIGHS PRICE RISES
description: Stock prices plummeted yesterday after a reported proposal by experts of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries for a substantial increase in oil prices next year.

title: House Defeats Abortion Proposal After Senate Passes Compromise
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The Senate and the House of Representatives remained deadlocked on the abortion issue today despite extraordinary efforts by Congressional leaders to reach a compromise.

title: Waldheim Accepts S adat Invitation, Urges U.N. Talks
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 29Secretary General Kurt Waldheim proposed today that talks to prepare for a new Middle East peace conference in Geneva be held on the neutral ground of the United Nations soon after the end of the controversial preparatory meeting in Cairo that some Arabs have refused to attend.

title: Klavan Goes to WOR And Drive Time
description: GENE KLAVAN, a radio institution in New York as the earlymorning personality for WNEW AM for nearly 26 years, will switch to WOR Radio on Jan. 2 to conduct the lateafternoon drive time program. Mr. Klavan's shift will be from 3 P.M. to 7, a period that is second only to the earlymorning hours for radio listening.

title: Denver Seeks Democrats in 78
description: DENVER, Nov. 29 (AP)Denver has offered $147,500 in cash and inkind services to try to lure the Democratic National Committee's 1978 midterm conference to Colorado. It is among four cities under final consideration for the party's meeting, to be held in December. The others are Memphis, Seattle and Honolulu.

title: About Real Estate
description: When the United States Customs Service moved into a new building at the World Trade Center in 1973, it cast adrift its former building at the foot of Broadway at Bowling Green.

title: Former Sanitation Official Admits Perjury Over Missing Trash Bags
description: Walter Bachman, inspector general of New York City's Sanitation Department until he was suspended last May, pleaded guilty yesterday to having committed perjury when he testified on April 27 at a Department of Investigation hearing on the disappearance of 40,000 heavyduty trash bass worth $4,000.

title: Funds for Nuclear Unit Voted
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI)  The Senate today passed and sent to the White House a $298 million authorization for the Nuclear Regulatory Commission. Part of the bill, passed by the House early this month, requires the commission to develop a plan for dealing with safety problems in nuclear power plants and submit it to Congress by Jan. 1.

title: Nice in New Hebrides Break Up Protest in Independence Dispute
description: VILA, New Hebrides, Nov. 29 (AP)The police used tear gas today to break up a crowd of 500 demonstrators protesting a rival political faction's declaration of a provisional government.

title: Books of The Times
description: OF CURTIS BILL PEPPER'S novel Marco, one might say, paraphrasing Samuel Johnson: It is not done well, but one is moved to find it done even halfway well. For what reader can fail to be caught up, if not torn to pieces, by the plight of Dario and Silvana Frasca, two young Italians, who, after happily anticipating the birth of their second child are presented with a monstrous though living deformity? Worse, after the Frascas have been reconciled to their new son's condition, and have convinced themselves that his apparently superior mind will enable him to compensate for his physical deficiencies, they discover they have no hope at all. So Dario removes Marco from the lifesupport system, he has come to depend on, and commits the act of euthenasia with which the novel begins.

title: British Football
description: ENGLISH F.A. CUP

title: INTEREST RATES RISE IN THE BOND MARKETS
description: Interest rates crept slightly higher yesterday as fixedincome securities prices continued their postThanksgiving dip.

title: Associated Press BLIND STUDENT MAY RECEIVE SPECIAL HELP: Samuel Fusaro, left, who was forced to drop out of his final year at the New Jersey College of Medicine and Dentistry because of a deteriorating eye condition, with Assemblyman Anthony M. Villane Jr. !n Trenton yesterday. Dr. Villane, himself dentist, is sponsoring a bill that would offer a special degree program for Mr. Fuser, who Is legally blind. College officials have protested against the Legislature dictating degree standards, but, in an apparent, compromise, a spokesman for the college said that a special degree program was offered that would require faculty approval.
West Europe, Like U.S., Weighs Price Floor for Imported Steel
description: PARIS, Nov. 29Western Europe is following in the Carter Administration's footsteps and considering setting minimum prices for imported steel hi an effort to reverse the declining fortunes of its steel producers.

title: Rules of Thumb
description: Even when a pipe smoker narrows his or her choice down to unadorned handmade briar pipe, there is still a plethora of shapes and sizes to choose from.

description: Film

title: Notes on People
description: ALTHOUGH Ernest Morial was elected Mayor of New Orleans on Nov. 12, he is not taking office until next May and meanwhile is looking for work to tide him over. I'm serious about looking for a job, said Mr. Morial, who resigned from the State Appeals Court in order to run for office. I am looking through the classified ads. This is no joke. My family is living off my wife's salary now, and we have tuition notes and other things to take care of. Sybil Morial, the Mayorelect's wife, teaches at Xavier University. Mr. Morial said he hopes he can find some parttime legal work.

title: Immigrants
description: RESEDA, Calif.We never quite lose our accents, we immigrants. Even if we spend more than half our lives as American citizens, our manner of speech is still considered by many somewhat unusual.

title: Deaths
description: BECKMANAlbert, M.D. The Board Of Trustees of Frarictin General Hospital express sorrow at the death of Dr. Beckman, member of the Board Of. Trustees, Director of The Department of Pediatrics and member of the Medical Staff. We extend sincere sympathy to his family and friends. ROBERT BECKMAN, President Board of Trustees

title: GEORGE H. COMBS JR., RADIO COMMENTATOR
description: George Hamilton Combs. Jr., a former radio commentator and one of the youngest men ever elected to Congress, died yesterday of emphysema at a hospital in West Palm Beach, Fla. He was 78 years old.

title: RETAIL STORES GET EARLY HOLIDAY LIFT
description: The year's Christmas shopping season got off to a strong early spurt last week, swelling November business and giving New York City's largest retailers one of their better months of the year.

title: Stage: Mamet Expands Range in Woods
description: CHICAGO

title: A Time For Patience
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Nov. 29President Anwar elSadat's personal television diplomacy in the Middle East has been so spectacular that it is now popular to call for more highly publicized conferences to maintain the momentum for peace.

title: Navy Says Trident. Submarine Is Year Behind Schedule
description: WASHINGTON, Nov., 29The Navy disclosed today that the Trident missilelaunching submarine, which will be the most expensive Ship ever constructed by the Navy, is one year behind schedule and $400 million over its budget.

title: Meusel, Yankee Outfielder, Dies; A Member of Murderers
description: DOWNEY, Calif., Nov. 29 (UPI)Bob Meuse!, a New York Yankees outfielder who was a member of the famed Murderers Row 50 years ago, died yesterday at the age of 81. The cause of his death was not disclosed. He is survived by his wife and a daughter.

title: Futures Prices Mixed In Farm Commodities; Gold Contracts Decline
description: With soybeans and wheat in the forefront, farm commodities futures fought yesterday to reverse Monday's negative showing on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: Trial Off Again as Piazza Cites Illness
description: Justice George J. Balbach of State Supreme Court yesterday revoked bail for 65yearold Sam Piazza and ordered the defendant in a longdelayed arsonmurder case to be seized and brought into court as soon as he is released from the latest of a long series of hospital stays.

title: Dollar Shows Gain In Trading Abroad; Gold Moves Down
description: LONDON, Nov.29(AP)  The beleaguered American dollar scored gains against the Japanese yen and all major European currencies today in its best day in weeks in foreignexchange trading.

title: Chess:
description: The world champion, Anatoly Karpov, the 26yearold Soviet grandmaster, has this in common with his predecessor, Bobby Fischer: They both like playing end games.

title: Boycott at Meadowlands Looms Over Drug Use
description: Owners and trainers of horses stabled at the Meadowlands voted yesterday to boycott the track in East Rutherford, N. J., unless the State Racing Commission abandons its new rule on the use of a medication known as Lasix.

title: Hypertension Care at Work To Be Tested by Blue Cross
description: The Blue Cross Association said yesterday that it had taken a first step toward covering its subscribers for detection and treatment of high blood pressure at their place of work.

title: Dayan, in Bonn, Sees Egyptian Art
description: BONN, Nov. 29  Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel, on the third day of an official visit to West Germany, revised his crowded schedule today to visit an exhibition on Egyptian history here.

title: PHILIP KRAMER
description: WALTHAM, Mass., Nov. 29 (AP)Philip Kramer, retired international vice president of the International Ladies Garment Workers Union, died yesterday in Waltham Hospital. He was 80 years old.

title: Nat'l Basketball Ass'n
ACCOUNTING SHIFT VOIDS QUARTERLY SEGMENT RULE
description: The private sector's authority on accounting rules yesterday abandoned, as expected, a requirement that companies disclose data on such things as major customers in their interim, or quarterly, financial reports.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Sources: A List Of Stores
description: Following are the addresses and telephone numbers of the shops and department stores mentioned in the accompanying article. Most of the stores keep special hours between now and Christmas, so check first.

title: New York City Education Board Weighing Employee Residency
description: The New York City Board of Education is weighing a proposal to establish a residency requirement for rehired and newly hired employees and to make residence within the five boroughs a condition for the promotion of present personnel, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: The Party Lines: Handy Connections
description: Some people have a knack for throwing parties at the drop of a nap. For others, party giving is no breeze at all but a stormy ordeal to be avoided whenever possible.

title: Omelets: Flash in a Pan
description: THERE must be a longtime association between what is called a hasty pudding (I am told it is one of the oldest English puddings in the world) and the yearend holidays. Within recent days I have been asked to suggest a hasty, tasty dish that could he made on the spur of the moment by people who are otherwise obsessed with making ready for the forthcoming yearend celebrations.

title: REFUND SET FOR SOME IN AUTORISK POOL
description: New York State car owners in the assignedrisk pool who have been accidentfree for three years will be entitled to insurancepremium refunds after Jan. 1, the state's Acting Superintendent of Insurance, John F. Lennon, announced yesterday.

title: Ban on Licensing of Lay Midwives Is Upheld by U.S. Judge in Illinois
description: CHICAGOThe legal ban on the licensing of lay midwives by the state of Illinois was upheld today by the Federal District Court for the Northern Division of Illinois.

title: Retail Sales Buoyed
description: The year's Christmas shopping season got off to a strong spurt last week, swelling November business and giving New York City's largest retailers one of their better months of the year. Page D15.

title: Private Lives
description: ACCORDING TO William Blake: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship. Dmitri was happily surrounded by his favorite novelist, his favorite teacher, his favorite film writer, his favorite literary critic and his favorite folksinger. The teacher, of course came with the franchise. How the others had all managed to be together in the same room, Dinitri's cave, is a mystery, but one that he embraced. Dmitri and the literary critic were the only men, because this is New York. Only the literary critic wore shoes, because, as we know, literary critics are the vanguard of civilization. It is as if a living room, any living room, were the 17thcentury Peking court of K'ang Hsi and the critic a Portuguese Jesuit just come from Europe with the Word.

title: Moscow Snow Closes an Airport, Bringing Holiday Spirit to City
description: MOSCOW, Nov. 29 (A11)Aiovernight snow that closed Moscow's Sheremetyevo International Airport brought a holiday spirit to the city today toward the end of an unseasonably warm and rainy November.

title: Mesabi Strike. Is Unraveling Steel Industry Peace Hopes
description: How much life is left in the,, steel industry's pioneering experiment in longterm labor peace now that, the strike in the iron ore mines has dragged on longer than the. 116day industrywide steel strike of 1959, with twothirds of the miners still away from The their jobs? That question is Labor of national concern for reasons beyond the specific issues Scene in the fourmonth tieup that is keeping 10,000 members of the United Steelworkers of America idle on Minnesota's Mesabi Range.

title: Jacques Brel,
description: Elly Stone, who headed the original cast of Jacques Brel Is Alive and Well and Living in Paris 10 years ago, will return to the musical in an anniversary production at Town Hall on Jan. 19.

title: About Education
description: At the turn of the century only 3 percent of Americans were over 65 years of age: that figure is now more than 10 percent. The median age of Americans has increased from 20.0 to 29.4 in the last six years, and, according to the Federal Bureau of the Census, it will reach 32.5 by the year 2000.

title: Braves
description: ATLANTA, Nov. 29 (AP)The Atlanta Braves new manager, Bobby Cox, appointed three new coaches today, retaining only one member from this year's Braves staff. Chris Cannizzaro, 39, the bullpen and catching coach, is the lone returnee.

title: McClellan Services Today
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29 (UPI)President Carter is sending his wife Rosalynn and Vice President Mondale to represent him at the funeral tomorrow of Senator John L. McClellan, Democrat of Arkansas, who died Sunday. The White House press secretary, Jody Powell, said they would fly to Little Rock with Congressional leaders.

title: 10YearOld Pakistani Girl Waits OpenHeart Operation in Jersey
description: BROWNS MILLS, N.J., Nov. 29Children's World is a long way from Karachi for Shakila Razak, an emaciated 10yearold Pakistani girl awaiting openheart surgery for a debilitating heart disorder.

title: A Gala Preview of Divine Discards
description: There were a lot of things on display at Christies Monday night, animate and otherwise, anei anyone who wanted to know how many ways the word divine could be pronounced should have been there.

title: RAY J. CRAERIN
description: Ray G. Craerin, an Investment banker formerly with White, Weld & Co., and for the last three years president of Merchants Finance Ltd. of Bermuda, an affiliate of the Schroders banking group of London died Monday in Boca Raton, Fla., where he had been living. He was 73 years old.

title: Simulated Nuclear Plant Accident Runs Afoul of inclement Weather
description: FORKED RIVER, Nov. 29A simulated accident today at the nearby Oyster Creek nuclear generating plant triggered a multilevel government response and, despite a few communications problems, was pronounced a success by officials.

title: Trial That Doomed Foe of Marcos Ordered Reopened After Protests
description: MANILA, Nov. 29President Ferdinand E. Marcos ordered last night that the military court that had condemned his principal political rival, former Senator Benigno S. Aquino Jr., to death last Friday reopen the trial and allow the presentation of further evidence.

title: Political Feuds Dominate Efforts To Help Storm Survivors in India
description: NEW DELHI, Nov. 29Ten days after a tropical cyclone devastated a section of India's east coast and killed at least 10,000 people, the disaster has become a football of domestic party politics, with recriminations and countercharges proliferating.

title: Warriors 110, Nets 101
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Nov. 29 (AP)Robert Parish hit six straight field goals in the final quarter to lead the Golden State Warriors to a 110101 victory over the New Jersey Nets tonight.

title: ANNA BENEDETTO
description: Anna Benedetto, mother of Tony Bennett, the singer, died Sunday in Hackensack Hospital in New Jersey. She was 78 years old.

title: Recital: AllBeethoven CelloPiano Brilliance
description: IT IS A CONFIDENT CELLIST who chooses for his recital partner a pianist as strong technically and as interesting musically as Gilbert Kalish, and Michael Rudiakov is confident, with good reason. The Parisianborn, Israelireared and Americanschooled cellist teamed up with Mr. Kalish on Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall in the first of two allBeethoven programs. Mr. Rudiakov also has scheduled two additional recitals in the hall this season, so that a pretty well rounded picture of his talents should be available.

title: U.S. Amateur Boxers Top London Team by 8 to 3
description: LONDON, Nov. 29 (UPI)New York overpowered London, 83, last night in an intercity amateur boxing match. The Americans clinched the match quickly as the lighter weight boxers won the first six matches.

title: Muti Is Master of Baton
description: RICCARDO MITI, WHO, one suspects, is the heir presum ptive to Eugene Ormandy and the Philadelphia Orchestra, led tie Philadelphians last night in Carnegie Hall. In a way it was an impressive concert. Mr, Muti has plenty of glamour, plenty of talent, plenty of authority, and there never was any doubt who was in command. But not until the last piece on the program did conductor and music take the full measure of each other.

title: Mideast Split: Risks for U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The bold diplomacy of President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and the political turmoil it has caused among the Arabs have raised new risks for SovietAmerican relations.

title: BristolMyers Plans 56
description: The BristolMyers Compaby, a leading producer of pharmaceutical, toiletry, household specialty and hair care products, announced plans yesterday to enter the dental equipment field through the acquisition of the Unitek Corporation for stock valued at about $68.5 million.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of an editing error, police advice against pickpockets was misquoted in The Times yesterday. Capt. Robert J. Kelly suggested keeping hippocket wallet verticalnot horizontalwhen walking, saying it is harder to extract in that position.

title: Staring Male Models In the Cigaret Ads
description: It started with the Winston cigarette advertising and then spread to the Salem ads, and thence to Viceroy and Factthe closeup shot of the male model staring into the camera. What are those guys trying to pull? people asked. Is it mass hypnosis of what? _

title: Mideast Split: Risks for U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, Nov. 29The bold diplomacy of President Anwar elSadat of Egypt and the political turmoil it has caused among the Arabs have raised new risks for SovietAmerican relations.

title: Technology
description: A contract dispute that could influence the future shape of the world's waterdesalting industry has thrust the United States Bureau of Reclamation into the kind of advancedtechnology confrontation that more typically springs up in the space program.

title: The New York Times/Carl T. Gossett
description: A HELPING HAND: Eileen Howe of Maywood, feeding seagul]s and ducks and geese that winter over with them, at Van Satin Park in Bergen County during a light snow yesterday. Between one and two inches of snow fell in Eastern and Central New Jersey, and Route 31. was closed due to severe icing. The New Jersey Turnpike lowered the speed limit to 45 before snow turned to rain. Outlook for this morning was for continuing rain.

title: High Tides Around New York
The Trend Toward Sexual Equality: Depth of Transformation Uncertain,
description: NORTHAMPTON, Mass.As recently as 1955, Adlai E. Stevenson told the graduating women at Smith College that their role in life was to influence us, man and boy, their task to restore valid, meaningful purpose to life in your home, and to keep their husbands truly Purposeful.
